questions.question: Which of the following folk dances is performed by the fisherfolk of the Mithila region in Bihar?
questions.explanation: Kamala. Folk dances of Bihar : Karma, Kajri, Jhumar, Jharni, Jat Jatin, Jhumeri, Sohar Khelwana, Natua, Nachini, Jhijiya, Dhamar jogira, Krishi Nritya. Q.2. Chad Laho is a dance-festival, primarily celebrated by which of the following tribes of Meghalaya? SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Afternoon) (a) Khasi (b) Garo (c) Jaintia (d) Hojang Sol.2.(c) Jaintia. Chad Laho dance festival is celebrated as a thanksgiving festival to God after the harvesting season. Other folk dances of Meghalaya and their Tribes: Ka Shad Suk Mynsiem (Khasis tribe), Beh-dien-khlam (Jaintias), Wangala (Garos), Chad Sukra (Jaintia).

questions.question: Which of the following dances of Goa is performed to celebrate the victory of the Maratha warriors over the Portuguese ?
questions.explanation: Ghodemodni (Horse dance) celebrated in Thane, Sattari, and nearby villages, is a traditional event featuring warriors on decorated horses showing their skills in riding and martial arts. Other traditional dances of Goa include Monilem, Fugdi, Dhalo, Talgadi, Tonyamel, Bhandap, Zagor, Corredinho (Portuguese), Dhangar dance, and Veerbhadra.

questions.question: Which of the following war dances is performed in Ngada festival and is performed by the tribes of Nagaland?
questions.explanation: Rengma. Other popular dances of Nagaland include Modse, Aaluyattu. Jawara (Madhya Pradesh), Dalkhai (Odisha), Garadi (Puducherry). Q.5. In which of the following classical dance forms are the actors’ faces painted to symbolise the type of character they are playing? SSC MTS 22/10/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Bharatanatyam (b) Odissi (c) Kathakali (d) Kathak Sol.5.(c) Kathakali, which originated in 17th-century Travancore (Kerala), draws its foundation from Sage Bharata's Natya Shastra. Its characters are distinguished by makeup: Pacha (noble gods), Katti (anti-heroes), Thadi (bearded roles), Kari (evil), and Minukku (virtuous women /sages). Key instruments include Chenda, Maddalam, Chengila, and Elaththalam, with songs called Attakkatha.

questions.question: _________ dance is embedded in the stories from the epics Mahabharata, Ramayana and Puranas.
questions.explanation: Kathakali literally means "story play." It is a classical dance form from Kerala, known for its heavy and elaborate makeup, intricate costumes, and dramatic expressions.

questions.question: Which of the following Indian tribal dances is prevalent in the Araku Valley near Visakhapatnam?
questions.explanation: Dhimsa. Dances of Andhra Pradesh: Buttabommalu, Dappu Dance, Kolatam, Lambada, Veeranatyam, Koya Nrityam. Bagurumba is a folk dance of Assam's Bodo tribe. Bardo Chham is from Arunachal Pradesh, while Jhumur is performed by Assam's tea tribes.

questions.question: Which Indian classical dance form has composition in Meitei language?
questions.explanation: Manipuri, the classical dance of Manipur, combines Pre-Vaishnavite and Vaishnavite traditions. It includes Sankirtana, Rasalila, and the lively Pung drum dance.

questions.question: Which of the following dances is performed in Goa during the festival Ganesh Chaturthi?
questions.explanation: Fugdi. It is performed by women during festivals. Goa's folk dances include Tarangmel, performed during Dussehra and Holi, and Dhalo, performed by women during the Pausha moon festival by communities like Kunbis and Gaudis. The Dhangar community performs the Dhangar dance during their annual fair and Navratri. Q.10. Which of the following dance forms emotes a play through dancing in which the song is customarily in Manipravala language ? SSC MTS 14/11/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Kathak (b) Mohiniattam (c) Sattriya (d) Kuchipudi Sol.10.(b) Mohiniattam, a classical dance from Kerala, features graceful movements and expressions to narrate Hindu mythological stories, with songs in Manipravalam blending Sanskrit and Malayalam.

questions.question: Mohiniyattam is associated with which of the following traditional dance styles?
questions.explanation: Lasya style. Mohiniyattam : A graceful classical dance from Kerala, focusing on expressions and storytelling in the Lasya style. Samapadam : A steady, rhythmic movement in Bharatanatyam. Tribhanga : A pose in Odissi dance with three bends (head, waist, and knees). Chowk : A position imitating a square - a very masculine stance with the weight of the body equally balanced.

questions.question: Khuallam is a famous dance of:
questions.explanation: Mizoram. Khuallam (Dance of the Guests) is a dance usually performed in the ceremony called 'Khuangchawi'. Dances: Mizoram - Cheraw, Sarlamkai, Solakia, Chailam, Chawnglaizawn, Chheihlam, Tlanglam, Zangtalam.

questions.question: Tera Tali folk dance is primarily associated with which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Rajasthan. Terah Tali Dance : This dance is performed in praise of the folk God Ramdevji, primarily by the Kamar tribe. Rajasthani folk dances : Chari, Ghoomar, Kalbelia, Kathputli dance and Gair folk dance.

questions.question: Matki dance is the famous folk dance associated with which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh. The "Matki Dance," performed using a small pitcher, is particularly popular in the Malwa region of Madhya Pradesh. Other traditional dances of Madhya Pradesh include Jawara, Grida, Chaitra, Kaksar, Karma, Maanch, Tertali, Pardhoni, and Kanara. Q.15. Padayani’, a local dance form primarily performed in ________ to please Goddess Bhadrakali. SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Assam (b) Kerala (c) Odisha (d) West Bengal Sol.15.(b) Kerala. Padayani literally means “row of warriors” is a dance. It is regarded as a remnant of the Dravidian forms of worship that existed before the advent of Brahmanism. The percussion instruments used are padayani thappu, chenda, para and kumbham. Other dances of Kerala : Mudiyettu, Thiruvathirakali, Kolkali, Oppana, Kummattikali, Chavittu Natakam.

questions.question: In which of the following states of India is Hojagiri dance predominantly performed ?
questions.explanation: Tripura. The Hojagiri dance is performed during the Hojagiri Festival or Laxmi Puja, which occurs on the full moon night following Durga Puja, typically a few days after Dussehra.

questions.question: In which of the following states is the Chu-Faat dance performed?
questions.explanation: Sikkim. Chu-Faat, meaning "Snowy Range" (Chu) and "Worship" (Faat), is a folk dance of Sikkim performed in honor of Mount Khangchendzonga. Other folk dances of Sikkim - Sikmari, Singhi Chaam or the Snow Lion Dance, Yak Chaam, Khukuri Naach.

questions.question: ‘Kuki dance’ is a folk dance of India that is predominantly performed in _____.
questions.explanation: Nagaland. Kuki dance is performed by the Kuki tribe in India. Major folk dances : Nagaland - Modse, Agurshikukula, Butterfly Dance, Aaluyattu, War Dance and Zeliang Dance.

questions.question: Yakshagan is a folk dance of which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Yakshagana is a traditional folk dance form popular in Coastal districts. Some well-known folk dances of Karnataka include Dollu Kunitha, Hulivesha, Kamsale, Puja Kunitha, Suggi Kunitha, Veeragase, and Karaga.

questions.question: Langvir Nritya is a folk dance from the state of ________
questions.explanation: Uttarakhand. Langvir Nritya is a dance form practiced by only men. The dancers use a long bamboo pole. Folk dances of Uttarakhand: Jhora, Chholia, Barada Nati, Pandav Nritya, Chancheri, Chhapeli, Thali, Rasu Nritya, Jaguars.

questions.question: Which of the following dances developed in the monasteries of Assam?
questions.explanation: Sattriya originated in the Sattra (monastery) as part of the neo-Vaishnavite movement started by Srimanta Sankardev in the 15th century. He promoted “ek sharan naam dharma” (devotional chanting of one God’s name). In 2000, the Sangeet Natak Akademi recognized Sattriya as a classical dance.

questions.question: 'Chhau' is a popular dance of which of the following state ?
questions.explanation: Jharkhand. Chhau dance has martial and folk traditions. It is found in three styles named after the location where they are performed, i.e., the Purulia Chhau of West Bengal, the Seraikella Chhau of Jharkhand and the Mayurbhanj Chhau of Odisha. The Cultural Ministry of India has included Chhau in the list of classical dances making a total of 9 classical dance forms.

questions.question: Gugga is the famous ritualistic dance of ________, which is performed in the procession taken out in memory of Gugga Pir.
questions.explanation: Haryana. Gugga dance - It is a religious dance (in the month of Bhadon) performed by men. Dancers carry instruments such as Thali, Chimta, Deru. Folk dances of Haryana - Phalgun dance, Loor dance, Daph dance, Khoria dance, Saang dance, Dhamal dance, Jhumar dance.

questions.question: ‘Chang dance’ is popular in the state of:
questions.explanation: Rajasthan. The Chang dance, also known as Dhamal or Dhuff dance, is performed during the Hindu festival of Holi to celebrate the triumph of good over evil. It is popularly referred to as the Holi dance due to its association with the festival.

questions.question: Giddha dance is a folk dance of which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Punjab. Gidda is performed by women during social gatherings. Other folk dances of Punjab : Bhangra, Daff, Luddi, Jaago, Dhamal. Q.26. Which classical dance was introduced by the great Vaishnava saint and reformer of Assam? SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Kathak (b) Kuchipudi (c) Sattriya (d) Odissi Sol.26.(c) Sattriya. The Sattriya dance form was introduced in the 15th century A.D by Mahapurusha Sankaradeva. It became popular as a part of the Vaishnava Bhakti Movement in Sattra (Hindu monasteries). Q.27. Jagoi and Cholom are two divisions in the Indian classical dance form of ________. SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Kathak (b) Bharatanatyam (c) Manipuri (d) Kathakali Sol.27.(c) Manipuri. Jagoi refers to the gentle and graceful movements, often depicting devotion and love. Cholom refers to the fast-paced and energetic movements, often depicting heroic and martial themes. Other dances and their division: Kathakali (Kerala) - Satvika, rajasika and tamasika. Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu) - Nritta, Nritya and Natya.

questions.question: The Chau dancers of ___________ organise a festival named Chau-Jhumur Utsav, where an open stage is designed for the performance by Chau groups.
questions.explanation: West Bengal. Chhau is performed in three styles across eastern India: Purulia Chhau - West Bengal. Seraikela Chhau - Jharkhand. Mayurbhanj Chhau - Odisha.

questions.question: Which of the following states/UTs is Rauf a folk dance?
questions.explanation: Jammu and Kashmir. Rauf is a popular dance form performed by women during weddings and other celebrations. Q.30. Bhavai is a dance form that belongs to which of the following states? SSC CHSL 08/07/2024 (1st shift) (a) Bihar (b) Odisha (c) Rajasthan (d) Madhya Pradesh Sol.30.(c) Rajasthan. Bhavai is performed by both men and women belonging to Kalbelia, Jat, Meena, Bhil, or Kumhar tribal communities. The performers balance eight to nine brass pitchers or earthen pots on their heads as they dance. Other famous dances of Rajasthan: Ghoomar, Kathputli, Fire Dance, Bhopa, Chang, Teratali, Gair, and Kachchhighori.

questions.question: What is known to be ‘ekaharya’, where one dancer takes on many roles in a single performance ?
questions.explanation: Bharatanatyam: Features - The dance involves transitional movements of the leg, hip and arm. Expressive eye movements and hand gestures are used to convey emotions. It encompasses Bhav, Rag, Ras and Taal. The person who conducts the dance recitation is the Nattuvanar.

questions.question: Which of the following dances is listed in the UNESCO List of Intangible Cultural Heritage of India since 2010 ?
questions.explanation: Kalbelia : It has other names like 'Sapera Dance' or 'Snake Charmer Dance'. This dance is particularly performed by a Rajasthani tribe called 'Kalbelia'. Q.33. The Bhotia dance form is a folk-dance from which of the following Indian states? SSC CHSL 09/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Odisha (b) Goa (c) Tamil Nadu (d) Uttarakhand Sol.33.(d) Uttarakhand. The Bhotia dance performed by the Bhotia tribe of Uttarakhand. Other folk dances: Uttarakhand - Jhora, Chholia, Langvir Nritya, Barada Nati, Pandav Nritya, Chancheri, Chhapeli. Q.34. With reference to Saila dance consider the following statements and select the correct option. a) A group comprising of male performers. b) The dance is performed with bamboo sticks. c) It is performed after the cutting of crops. SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (4th shift) (a) a, b, c (b) Both b and c (c) Both a and c (d) Both a and b Sol.34.(a) a, b, c. Saila dance (Chattisgarh): This dance is performed only by boys after the harvest season in the Hindu month of Aghan (November -December). Other folk dances of Chattisgarh: Sua, Pandavani, Karma, Panthi, Jhirliti.

questions.question: Which of the following dances is NOT a part of the Odia culture?
questions.explanation: Kathakali, a "story play" from Kerala, features vibrant costumes and makeup of male dancers. Paika Dance welcomes esteemed guests or accompanies religious processions. Gotipua, from Odisha, praises Lord Krishna and Jagannath, while Dalkhai is a popular folk dance of western Odisha. Q.36. What are the two main parts corresponding to Lasya and Tandava elements in Manipuri dance? SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (1st shift) (a) Bhangi and Stri (b) Varnam and Paran (c) Vira and Toda (d) Jagoi and Cholom Sol.36.(d) Jagoi and Cholom. Manipuri is an ancient classical dance form from Manipur. It has two main styles : Jagoi, which is gentle, and Cholom, which is vigorous, reflecting the lasya and tandava elements described in Sanskrit literature. Q.37. How many types of makeup (vesham) are used for the performers of Kathakali dance? SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (3rd shift) (a) 9 (b) 7 (c) 5 (d) 11 Sol.37.(c) 5. The five major Veshams in Kathakali (Kerala), are Kathi (Knife), Pacha (Green), Thaadi (Beard), Minukku (Radiant), and Kari (Black). The Pacha Veshams represent noble and divine characters. Kathi represents characters that are arrogant and evil, although they possess a vein of gallantry. Q.38. Indian Classical Dance is an umbrella under which various performing arts whose theory and practice can be traced to the Sanskrit text, Natya-Shastra, the foundational treatise by: SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Panini (b) Bhasa (c) Patanjali (d) Bharata Muni Sol.38.(d) Bharata Muni. He was an ancient Indian dramatist and musicologist. Natya-Shastra is also known as the fifth veda. Author and book: Panini - Ashtadhyayi (Sanskrit treatise on grammar). Bhasa - Svapnavasavadutta (The dream of Vasavadatta). Patanjali - Mahabhasaya (Sanskrit grammar).

questions.question: Which of the following classical dance forms is usually concluded with Tarangam ?
questions.explanation: Kuchipudi (Andhra Pradesh). In this, the dancer usually stands on a brass plate locking the feet in position, shakatavadanam paada, and moves the plate rhythmically with great dexterity. The instruments used in Kuchipudi involve veena, flute, tambura, cymbals, and mridangam.

questions.question: Select the correct alternative on the basis of the statements given about ‘Rasa’. Statement I : It is the aesthetic experience that one derives while enjoying an artistic presentation. Statement II : It deals with the creation of human sentiments in the spectator or the aesthete.

options.b: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.d: Neither Statement I nor Statement II is true.

questions.explanation: Both Statement I and Statement II are true. Rasa relates to human senses and evokes emotions in the mind through Natya (drama). However, the concept extends beyond Natya to encompass dance, music, cinema, and literature. Rasa signifies aesthetic pleasure or the joy experienced during a skillful performance, enhanced by exquisite poetry, music, and action. Q.41. Alarippu, Jatiswaram, Shabdam, Varnam and Tillana are regular patterns of which of the following classical dance forms of India? Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 1) (a) Sattriya (b) Bharatanatyam (c) Manipuri (d) Kathak Sol.41.(b) Bharatanatyam, a classical dance form originating from Tamil Nadu, follows a structured pattern - Alarippu: Invocation, introducing the dancer and setting the tone. Jatiswaram: Pure dance, showcasing rhythmic patterns. Shabdam: Combination of music and dance, with emphasis on expression. Varnam: Central piece, highlighting the dancer's skill and technique. Tillana: Concluding piece, characterized by rapid movements.

questions.question: 'Lai Haraoba' is the earliest form of dance of which of the following classical dance forms of India?
questions.explanation: Manipuri (Manipur) classical dance is associated with rituals and traditional festivals; there are legendary references to the dances of Shiva and Parvati. The male dancers play the Pung and Kartal while dancing. It is an important festival of the Meitai tribe.

questions.question: Archaeological evidence of which of the following dance forms dating back to the 2nd century BC was found in the caves of Udayagiri and Khandagiri ?
questions.explanation: Odissi (Odisha). The two main body postures in this dance form include the Chowk and Tribhanga. Tribhanga (the body is deflected at the neck, torso and the knees) and Chowk (a position imitating a square).

questions.question: From which of the following epics did the Garadi folk dance of Puducherry originate ?
questions.explanation: Ramayana. Garadi dance is mainly performed at the time of the car festival of Lord Vishnu. Indian States and folk Dances: Kerala - Chavittukali, Kolkali or Kolkkali (also popular in Lakshadweep Islands), Kummattikkali. Goa - Dashavatara, Dekhni, Dhalo, Dhangar, Fugdi, Ghodemodni. Karnataka - Dollu Kunitha, Bayalata, Kamsale, Veeragase. Maharashtra - Dhangari Gaja, Lavani, Povada, and Koli dance.

questions.question: Cheraw dance belongs to which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Mizoram. Cheraw, also known as the Bamboo dance, is one of the oldest traditional dances. Other traditional dances of Mizoram include Khuallam, Sarlamkai, Chheihlam, and Mizo.

questions.question: Bharatanatyam of Tamil Nadu has grown out of the art of dancers dedicated to temples, and was earlier known:
questions.explanation: Sadir (or Dasi Attam). The dance of Bharatanatyam belongs to the Carnatic system of southern India. Jagoi and Cholom are the two main divisions in Manipur’s dance. The term gat refers to a stylized way of walking that is used to express scenes from daily life. It is also a type of rhythmic footwork that is usually performed at the end of a rendition. Q.47. Select the INCORRECT combination of folk dance and its respective state. Graduate Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 3) (a) Dhangari Gaja - Maharashtra (b) Dandiya Raas- Gujarat (c) Dollu Kunitha - Karnataka (d) Paika - Kerala Sol.47.(d) Paika - Kerala. The Paika Nritya is performed by the Munda tribe in the Mayurbhanj region of Jharkhand, where it stands out as a folk dance rooted in martial arts. This dance plays a significant role in weddings, Dussehra, and various other festivities. Other Dances of Jharkhand: Hunta, Barao, Karam, Lahasuya, Groha Naach, Seraikella Chhau.

questions.question: In which of the following dance forms is Mati-Akhora used as the basic exercise pattern that facilitates various dance poses?
questions.explanation: Sattriya is a classical dance of Assam. Mati-Akhora is a basic exercise pattern that facilitates various dance poses. Poses include body bending, body movements, foot movements, jumps, hand, head and neck movements and eye movements.

questions.question: Jaita is the main dance form of which state?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. Jaita is a traditional folk dance performed by the Jat community, especially in the Bundelkhand region, during weddings and festivals. Other folk dances of Uttar Pradesh include: Nautanki, Raslila, Kajri.

questions.question: When was Bharatanatyam banned by the British colonial government ?
questions.explanation: 1910. Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu): It traces its origins back to the Natyashastra, an ancient treatise on theatre written by the mythic priest Bharata. Features :- It encompasses Bhav, Rag, Ras and Taal. It consists of six portions: Alarippu (Invocation), Jathiswaram (Nritta part), Shabdam (Short compositions with word), Varnam (a story, that includes both Nritta and Nritya), Padam (Religious prayer, Bhajan, Keerthanam) and Tillana (Origin in the Tarana of Hindustani Music).

questions.question: What is a one act play of Sattriya called?
questions.explanation: Ankiya Nat: It is a form of Sattriya that involves musical drama or play. It was initially written in Brajavali, an Assamese-Maithili hybrid language. It's also known as 'Bhaona,' and it tells stories about Lord Krishna.

questions.question: Bhutia dance is performed in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Sikkim. Other dances: Sikkim - Singhi Chham, Tamang Selo, Sherpa Dance, Ghantu, Gayley-Yang Dance, Sangey Chham Dance and Chu Faat.

questions.question: Which of the following dances is based on Rasleela themes of Radha and Krishna?
questions.explanation: Manipuri dance. The themes used in Manipuri dance forms: Mostly influenced by Hindu Vaishnavism themes. It also includes themes related to Shaivism and Shaktism and regional deities. Tandav Manipuri depicts themes of Shiv, Shakti or Krishna as warrior. Q.54. In 2010, considering its outstanding value and vulnerability, UNESCO recognised 'Mudiyettu', an age - old ritual-drama of ______ as an 'intangible cultural heritage of humanity'. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening) (a) Kerala (b) Telangana (c) Karnataka (d) Tamil Nadu Sol.54.(a) Kerala. Mudiyettu - A ritual dance drama based on the mythological tale of a battle between the Goddess Kali and the demon Darika.

questions.question: Thullal dance originated in which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Kerala. There are three versions of this art form Seethankan Thullal, Parayan Thullal and Ottan Thullal. Other dances : Kerala - Theyyam, Thirvathirakali, Kolkali. Uttarakhand - Choliya, Pandav Nritya, Bhotia Dance, Jhora Dance.

questions.question: Maimata is a popular folk dance of which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Tripura. Mamita dance is a traditional dance associated with the Kaloi community of Tripura and is performed during the harvest festival. Other folk dances of Tripura: Garia, Lebang Boomani, Hozagiri, Bizu, Hai-Hak, Cheraw, Jhum.

questions.question: With which of the following dance forms is Thumri music associated?
questions.explanation: Kathak: It is a classical dance form of Uttar Pradesh. Thumri: It is a common genre of semi-classical Indian music originating in the eastern part of Uttar Pradesh. Kathakali (Kerala): It is a combination of 5 forms of fine art which are Literature (Sahithyam), Music (Sangeetham), Painting (Chithram), Acting (Natyam) and Dance (Nritham). . Q.58. The masculine aspect of the Manipuri classical dance is known as: SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening) (a) Choloms (b) Pareng (c) Maiba (d) Ras Sol.58.(a) Choloms. The Kirtan form of congregational singing accompanies the dance which is known as Sankirtana in Manipur. The male dancers play the Pung and Kartal while dancing. The masculine aspect of dance - the Choloms are a part of the Sankirtana tradition. Q.59. Which of the dance was immediately preceded by a practice session called sevakali and undertaken in the precincts of a temple ? SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift) (a) Kathakali (b) Kathak (c) Odissi (d) Kuchipudi Sol.59.(a) Kathakali (dance of Kerala). Its roots are in ancient ‘Kutiyattam’ (Classical Sanskrit Dance Drama) and ‘Krishnattam’ (Dance-Drama depicting Stories of Hindu God Krishna).

questions.question: Which of the abhinayas deals with the use of costumes, jewellery, facial make - up etc?
questions.explanation: Aharya Abhinaya involves dancers wearing costumes like dhoti, choli, and davani, paired with traditional jewelry such as "tal saman" and sun-moon diadems. Vachika Abhinaya focuses on speech through poems and dramas, while Saatwikam Abhinaya emphasizes the expression of sattvika emotions by skilled performers. Aangika Abhinaya uses body movements as the primary means of expression.

questions.question: The cultural heritage of Siddhis from _______ dates back to almost 300 years and their Siddhi Dhamal dance is an exquisite art form.
questions.explanation: Gujarat. Siddhis - They are descendants of East African people who came to India as slaves during the 14th and 17th century AD. Dhamal is one such dance form that reflects the Siddis’ passion for hunting. In the old days, also known as Mashira Nritya, this dance was performed by Siddis after returning from a successful hunting expedition.

questions.question: Which dance form is associated with Natwari Dance ?
questions.explanation: Kathak is famous for its spectacular footwork, amazing spins, Nazakat and Padhant. Natwari Nritya is also known as the dance of Krishna.

questions.question: Dandari (Dancing) troupes perform ________ during the festival of Diwali for a fortnight with participation from Kolam and Raj Gond tribes.
questions.explanation: Ghusadi (in the Adilabad district of Telangana). Baiga Pardhoni (Madhya Pradesh) dance is performed by the Baiga tribals. Raut Nacha (Chhattisgarh) is mainly performed by Yaduvanshis.

questions.question: Gaur Maria, a dance form from _________ state, is a famous art form of joy and invocation. It is a group dance and both men and women participate enthusiastically in this dance.
questions.explanation: Chhattisgarh. Gaur Maria Dance: It is performed on the occasion of marriage by the Gaur Madiya of Abujhmad plateau of Bastar in Chhattisgarh and is called Gaur after the bison. Other dances of Chattisgarh: Pandavani, Raut Nacha, Panthi and Soowa.

questions.question: Lebang Boomani dance is the harvest dance of _________.
questions.explanation: Tripura. Folk dance of Tripura and its related Community : Hozagiri dance - Reang community. Garia, Jhum, Maimita, Masak Sumani and Lebang Boomani - Tripuri community. Mamita' is a popular dance of the Kaloi community of Tripura.

questions.question: Mahari Dance and Gotipua Dance belong to which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Odisha. Mahari Dance - A ritualistic dance form from the eastern Indian state of Odisha that used to be performed at the temple of Lord Jagannatha at Puri by devadasi dancers called Maharis. Gotipua Dance - Performed in Orissa for centuries by young boys, who dress as women to praise Jagannath and Krishna.

questions.question: The Songi Mukhawate dance of ________ celebrates the victory of truth over falsehood. The name of the dance is derived from the two lion masks worn by two dancers who represent Narasimha, an aspect of Lord Vishnu.
questions.explanation: Maharashtra. It is customarily performed as an integral part of the worship of Devi (mother goddess) on the full moon night of the lunar month of Chaitra (March/April).

questions.question: Rikham pada dance belongs to which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Arunachal Pradesh. Rikham Pada Dance : Performed by the women of the Nishi tribe only to express their love for their husbands and to offer their reverence to the gods. Other dances of Arunachal Pradesh : Bhuiya dance, Chalo dance, Wancho dance, Pasi Kongki, Ponung dance and Popir dance.

questions.question: Which form of Indian dance is said to be 'soft and suitable for female presentation' ?
questions.explanation: Laasya. The Indian classical dances have two basic aspects: Tandava (movement and rhythm) and Lasya (grace, bhava and rasa). The nine rasas are - Shringaara, Haasya, Karuna, Rudra, Veera, Bhayaanaka, Bheebhatsya, Adbhutha and Shaantha.

questions.question: The Rathwas, who dwell in the state of___perform the Rathwa dance on the occasion of Holi (festival of colours).
questions.explanation: Gujarat. Rathwas - Tribe of Gujarat dwell in Rath-Vistar, the hilly area of the southeastern part of the state. Rathwa dance - The dance is performed for five days as part of Holi celebrations and the dancers observe a fast during this period. The male dancers are called gherriyas while the female dancers are called gheranis. Q.71. In the performance of _______ dance, on one side raasa dances are performed by women, whereas on the opposite side instrumentalist play the pung choloms (drums) and the karataala (cymbals). SSC MTS 08/09/2023 (3rd Shift) (a) Kathakali (b) Yakshagana (c) Odissi (d) Manipuri Sol.71.(d) Manipuri. There are two prominent manners or Choloms in Manipuri dance: Pung Cholom (roar of the drums) borrows elements from the Manipuri martial arts Thang Ta, Sarit Sarak and Maibi Jagoi dance. Kartal Cholom - This is a group dance, where dancers form a circle. Women dance in groups, called Mandilla Cholom.

questions.question: The Lambadi dance is a folk dance form of the_______tribe and originated in Andhra Pradesh.
questions.explanation: Banjara - A nomadic tribe of India. The community was denotified in the 1950s but was listed under the Habitual Offenders Act, 1952. Other names of Banjara : Lambani in Karnataka and Gwar or Gwaraiya in Rajasthan. Language of Banjara : ‘Gorboli’ ‘Gor mati Boli’ or ‘Brinjari’, an independent dialect. The dialect falls in the category of Indo-Aryan Language. Another Tribal dance of Andhra Pradesh - ‘Dhimsa’ (Performed by the Porja tribes).

questions.question: The Balti dance of _____ is distinct as it has its own costume, music and songs in the Balti language. The dance is only performed on rare occasions, such as feasts or celebrations.
questions.explanation: Ladakh. Other dances : Kathok Chenmo, Kompa Tsum-Tsag, Koshan, Shondol (Royal dance of Ladakh), Takshon or Shon. Uttarakhand: Bhotiya, Pandav Nritya, Chholiya, Jhumela, Jagar. Kashmir: Kud, Dumhal, Rouf, Bhand Pather, Bachha Nagma.

questions.question: Mundari dance is associated with the tribal community of which Indian state?
questions.explanation: Jharkhand. Mundari dance - Community - Munda Tribe. Time - During Harvest Season accompanied by musical Instrument Madal, Nagara and Bansi. Other Tribal Dances: Santhali Dance - Santhal (West Bengal, Jharkhand). Bamboo Dance - Mizoram. Kalbelia Dance - Kalbelia Community (Rajasthan). Bhagoria Dance - Bhils (Madhya Pradesh). Dhimsa Dance - Porja Tribe (Andhra Pradesh). Q.75. Which of the following dance forms is performed by the Adi tribe of Arunachal Pradesh? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Tapu (b) Karma (c) Sangphao (d) Kaksar Sol.75.(a) Tapu. Indian folk and tribal dances : Arunachal Pradesh - Buiya, Chalo, Wancho, Pasi Kongki Ponung, Popir, Bardo Chham, etc. Assam - Bihu, Bichhua, Bagurumba, Khel Gopal, Tabal Chongli, Jhumura Hobjanai etc. Nagaland - Chong, Nuralim, Temangnetin, Rangma, Zeliang, etc. Mizoram - Cheraw Dance (Bamboo dance), Khuallam, Chailam, Zangtalam, Khanatm, etc. Manipur - Thang Ta, Lai Haraoba, Pung Cholom, Nupa Dance, etc. Tripura - Hojagiri. Meghalaya - Laho, Shad Suk Mynsiem, Nongkrem.

questions.question: Chali, Jhumura and Nadu Bhangi are associated with which Indian classical dance form?
questions.explanation: Sattriya (Assam): Gayan -Bhayanar Nach, Kharmanar Nach are also associated with Sattriya dance. There were two dance forms prevalent in Assam before the neo-Vaishnava movement i.e Ojapali and Devadasi with many classical elements. Two varieties of Ojapali dances are still prevalent in Assam i.e. Sukananni or Maroi Goa Ojah and Vyah Goa Ojah. Sukananti Ojapali is of Shakti cult and Vyah Goa Oja paali is of Vaishnava cult . Q.77. Which of the following is a traditional dance form of Sri Lanka? SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Bihu (b) Kathak (c) Kandyan dance (d) Bharatanatyam Sol.77.(c) Kandyan Dance (Developed during the Kandyan kings' reign) - It is an ancient dance style narrating stories from the Indian epic Ramayana. Other dances of Sri Lanka: PahathaRata Netum, Sabaragamuwa.

questions.question: The traditional singing of 'Nat' is associated with _________Dance.
questions.explanation: Manipuri. Nat is the Manipuri classical style of singing, Pung or the Manipuri classical drum is the musical instrument used. Manipuri Dance Styles - Raas, Nata-Sankirtan, Pung Cholam (Dancers play the pung or drum while dancing), Dhola Cholam, Kartal Cholam, Thang ta (martial art form).

questions.question: The ‘Karma’ tribal dance form is associated with which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Chhattisgarh. Karma dance is performed during the autumnal festival of Karma Puja. The tribal group presents this folk dance in front of the Karam tree that symbolizes the KaramDevta. Other folk dances from: Chhattisgarh - Raut Nacha, Panthi, Pandavani, Saila, Suwa, Gendi, Cherchera.

questions.question: Laho is the dance form of which state?
questions.explanation: Meghalaya. Laho Dance : Performed during the Behdienkhlam festival by the Jaintia tribe. Other dances of Meghalaya : Nоngkrem, Shad Suk Mynsiem, Wangala and Dоrsegata.

questions.question: The folk dance of Chavittu Kali is associated with which of the following Indian states?
questions.explanation: Kerala. Other folk dances : Ottam Thulal, Kaikottikali, Tappatikali, Kali Auttam. Andhra Pradesh - Ottam Thedal, Kummi, Siddhi, Bhamakalpam, Veeranatyam, Dappu, Tappeta Gullu, Lambadi, Dhimsa, Kolattam, Butta Bommalu.

questions.question: Tevitichiyattam, Nangai Natakam and Dasiyattam are the forms of which of the following classical dances?
questions.explanation: Mohiniyattam dance(Classical dance form of Kerala in South India).

questions.question: Sarhul is a famous tribal festival of dance in which state ?
questions.explanation: Jharkhand. Sarhul - The festival of the Oraon tribe. It is the festival of the New Year and celebrated in the Hindu month of Chaitra, three days after the appearance of the new moon. It is also a celebration of the beginning of spring.

questions.question: Ghurehi is the folk dance of which of the following Indian states?
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh. Ghurehi Dance - Performed by Ladies of Chamba Region, during the annual fairs. It is a devotional dance form, dedicated to Lord Shiva and performed during Shivratri festival.

questions.question: Kamsale is the folk dance of which of the following Indian states ?
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Kamsale dance (Beesu Kamsale) - A unique folk art performed by the devotees of God Mahadeshwara. It also refers to a brass made musical instrument. It is a group dance form performed by the menfolk in villages in the Mysore, Nanjangud, Kollegala and Bangalore areas.

questions.question: Which of the following erstwhile Princely states was primarily associated with Kathak?
questions.explanation: Avadh. Kathak (Uttar Pradesh) - It was performed under the Mughal emperors. Exponents - Pandit Birju Maharaj, Shovna Narayan, Shambhu Maharaj, Lachhu Maharaj. Other dances of Uttar Pradesh: Charkula, Khyal, Raslila, Nautanki Dance, Kajri. Tripura - Hojagiri, Garia, Jhum, Bijhu, Sangrai, Lebang boomani. Q.87. The Pakhawaj syllables are primarily used to conclude which of the following Indian classical dances? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (4th shift) (a) Manipuri (b) Kathak (c) Odissi (d) Kathakali Sol.87.(c) Odissi. The "Mangalacharan," a concluding prayer or benediction, is often recited using Pakhawaj bols, creating a powerful and symbolic ending.

questions.question: Bharatanatyam expresses South Indian religious themes and spiritual ideas of ______.
questions.explanation: Shaivism - A Hindu tradition (which worships Shiva) that most accepts ascetic life and emphasises yoga. The followers of Shaivism are called Shaivas or Shaivites. Bharatnatyam (Tamil Nadu) : It traces its origins back to the Natyashastra, an ancient treatise on theatre written by the mythic priest Bharata.

questions.question: Daskathia of ________ is the tribal dance performed by two males depicting the historic and Puranic events.
questions.explanation: Odisha. Daskathia (Folk theatre form, associated with the worship of Lord Shiva). Some Folk theatre form:- Bhavai (Rajasthan), Garodas (Gujarat), Jatra (Odisha), Kariyila (Himachal Pradesh), Maach (Madhya Pradesh), Swang (Haryana), Ojapali (Assam), Powada (Maharashtra), Tamasha (Maharashtra), Bhand Pather (Jammu and Kashmir), Bhaona (Assam), Dashavatar (Konkan area), Naqal (Punjab).

questions.question: Which of the following dances is performed by the Santhal tribe of Jharkhand?
questions.explanation: Jhika Dashain. It is performed a few days before Dussehra. Folk dance - Jharkhand : Alkap, Karma, Agni, Jhumar, Paika, Phagua, Birhor.

questions.question: Changai dance is associated with which Indian state?
questions.explanation: Nagaland. Changai Dance: Performed by the Chang tribe during the Naknyulum festival, which lasts for three days. Folk Dances of Nagaland: Aaluyattu (Konyak tribe), Agurshikukula (war dance), Butterfly Dance (Zeliang tribe), Khamba Lim, Kuki Dance, Leshalaptu, Mayur Dance (Animal dance). Modse (Ao tribe), Monyu Asho, Sadal Kekai (Kuki tribe), Seecha & Kukui Kucho (Angami tribe), Rengma.

questions.question: Thabal Chongba is a folk dance of which Indian state ?
questions.explanation: Manipur. Folk dances : Manipur - Rasa lila, Gaura Lila, Pung Cholom. Goa - Ghode Modni, Dhangar Dance, Goff Talgadi, Shigmo and Mussel khel.

questions.question: The Raigarh Gharana is associated with which of the following dance forms?
questions.explanation: Kathak: Raigarh Gharana - Developed under the patronage of Raja Chakradhar Singh.

questions.question: 'Kalasam' is a dance sequence in which of the following classical dances of India ?
questions.explanation: Kathakali (Kerala). The text of Kathakali songs known as Attakkatha. Major instruments used in Kathakali music - Chenda, Maddalam, Chengila and Elathalam.

questions.question: 'Vazhuvoor ' is one of the styles in which Indian classical dance forms?
questions.explanation: Bharatanatyam. Other dance forms of Bharatanatyam: Melattur and Pandanallur. Kuchipudi - Pure dance (Nritta) and Expressive dance (Nritya), Storytelling through dance (Natya).

questions.question: Kathak is found in three distinct forms, called 'gharanas', named after the cities where the Kathak dance tradition evolved. Name those three cities.
questions.explanation: Jaipur, Benaras, Lucknow. Lucknow Gharana (Founded by Ishwari Prasad). Jaipur Gharana (founded by Bhanu Ji Maharaj). Banaras Gharana (Founded by Janakiprasad).

questions.question: The 'Joenpa Legso' is a welcome dance of___________.
questions.explanation: Bhutan. Other Dances of Bhutan - Drametse NgaCham Dance, Pa Cham Dance, Zhungdra Dance, Boedra Dance. Dance forms of other countries : Afghanistan - Atan, Ishala and Natsa. Sri Lanka - Kandyan dance. Q.98. The "Nalacharitham" play is associated with which Indian dance form? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Kathak (b) Kathakali (c) Sattriya (d) Odissi Sol.98.(b) Kathakali (Kerala). The story Nalacharitham is written by "Unnai Warrier". It is the romantic story of unlimited love between Nala and Damayanthi. There are 24 Basic Mudras (hand gestures) and a total of 470 different symbols used in this dance.

questions.question: Moksha is an item of which of the following classical dance forms of India?
questions.explanation: Odissi. A classical Odissi performance consists of five different types of items: "Mangalacharan", a praise to a particular Divinity, to the stage and to the audience; "Sthayee" or "Batu" that introduces the techniques of Odissi Dance; "Pallavi" that creates a particular sentiment through abstract forms; "Abhinaya" that enacts a traditional story about the deeds of a specific God/ Goddess; "Mokshya" that transcends all the participants to a higher spiritual level.

questions.question: Which of the following traditional dances is mainly performed during Navratri ?
questions.explanation: Garba (Gujarat). Other Navratri dances: Dandiya (Rajasthan and Gujarat). Gujarat :- Siddi Dhamal (hunting dance), Padhar Dance (rituals dance). Rajasthan : Ghoomar (weddings and Festivals dance), Kalbeliya Dance, Chari Dance. Nati (Himachal Pradesh), Dumhal (Jammu and Kashmir).

questions.question: Which of the following classical dance forms is related to the worship of Lord Jagannath?
questions.explanation: Odissi. Kathak : North Indian dance. Worship of Hindu god Krishna (or Shiva or Devi in ​some cases). Sattriya : Assam. Worship of Lord : Shiva Nataraja. Bharatanatyam (Oldest classical dance) : Tamil Nadu. Worship : Lord Shiva.

questions.question: Which of the following classical dance forms begins with a drum playing performance called 'Kelikottu'?
questions.explanation: Kathakali (Kerala, classical dance). The instruments used are - Chenda (Cylindrical drum), Madhalam (a long cylindrical drum), Chengila, Ilathalam (Resembles miniature pair of cymbals), Idakka (drum) and Sankhu (conch). Kathakali music follows the traditional Sopana sangeet of Kerala. Q.103. Karagam Folk Dance is associated with which state ? SSC MTS 02/05/2023 (Morning) (a) Tamil Nadu (b) Rajasthan (c) Assam (d) Haryana Sol.103.(a) Tamil Nadu. Karagam dance It is a folk dance with musical accompaniment, performed balancing a pot on the head. Dances of Tamil Nadu - Bharatanatyam, Kolattam, Karakattam, Kazhai Kothu, Devaraattam, Mayil Attam, Kummi, Oyilattam, Karagam.

questions.question: Bhoota Kola, a spirit worship ritual dance, is of which state?
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Andhra Pradesh - Kuchipudi (classical), Vilasini Natyam, Veera Natyam, Tappeta Gullu, Butta Bommalu. Kerala - Kathakali (classical), Mohiniyattam, Theyyam, Ottamthullal, Padayani.

questions.question: Suggi is a famous folk dance form of _________ state of India
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Suggi - A dance performed at the time of harvesting by the Halakki Vokkaliga tribe.

questions.question: Nati is a folk dance of which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh. Nati - It was listed in the Guinness Book of World Records as the largest folk dance in the world. It is known as Tandi in upper districts of Garhwal.

questions.question: Jhijhiya is a famous folk dance of Bihar and is performed in the mythological town of Mithila. This dance is performed by women only. The whole Navaratri "nine nights' festival is celebrated to worship the three forms of Lord ___________ .
questions.explanation: Lakshmi, Parvati, Saraswati. Jhijhiya is a cultural folk dance of Mithila regions of Bihar and Madhesh province of Nepal. It is performed in the Hindu month of Ashwin (September/October). It has its own types of songs either in Maithili or Bhojpuri language.

questions.question: Kathakali took shape in Southern India in the seventeenth century under the patronage of the______.
questions.explanation: Prince of Karnataka. Kathakali (Kerala) - A classical Indian dance that originated in Kerala. Most of the stories for the play are taken from Hindu epics like “Bhagavata Purana”, “Mahabharata” and “Ramayana’”. The term Kathakali is derived from Katha (conversation or traditional story) and Kali (performance). Q.109. Sangphao tribal dance is performed in which of the following states? SSC MTS 11/05/2023 (Evening) (a) Gujarat (b) Rajasthan (c) West Bengal (d) Nagaland Sol.109.(d) Nagaland (Naga tribe). Popular folk dances: Nagaland - Modse, Agurshikukula, Butterfly Dance, Aaluyattu, Sadal Kekai, Changai Dance, Kuki Dance, Leshalaptu, Khamba Lim.

questions.question: Which among the following is a dance performed by the devotees during the ceremonial worship of Murugan the Hindu God of war ?
questions.explanation: Kavadi attam (Burden Dance) - part of Thaipusam festival and is celebrated in Tamil Nadu. Yakshagana (song of the yaksha) - celebrated in Karnataka. It has originated as a product of the Vaishnava bhakti movement. Kummi - celebrated in Tamil Nadu and Kerala. Mayilattam - performed in the Hindu temples of Tamil Nadu in reverence to Lord Subrahmanya.

questions.question: _______ poses are depicted on the gopurams of the Chidambaram temple (Tamil Nadu).
questions.explanation: Bharatnatyam. It is a classical dance of Tamil Nadu. Chidambaram temple (Tamil Nadu): Dedicated to the Nataraja form of lord Shiva. It was Built in the Dravidian style of temple architecture in the 10th century during Chola's rule. Q.112. After recovering from an infectious illness, often smallpox, Brita dance is typically performed to thank the local deity. It is one of the most well - known dances of ________. SSC MTS 16/06/2023 (Afternoon) (a) West Bengal (b) Bihar (c) Uttar Pradesh (d) Jharkhand Sol.112.(a) West Bengal.

questions.question: The Zo - Mal - Lok folk dance is associated with which community?
questions.explanation: Lepcha community. Zo Mal Lok dance (Sikkim) - It portrays the sowing, reaping and harvesting of paddy. Dances performed by the Lepcha community - Chu Faat, Damsang-Lyang, Kinchum-Chu-Bomsa. Jamatias are fond of their traditional folk culture like Drama, Garia festival and other common dances of Kok - Borok speaking tribes. Lushai community (Tripura) - Cheraw Dance or Bamboo dance. Q.114. dance is introverted and restrained compared to most other dances of India - the artist never establishes eye contact with the audience. SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (1st Shift) (a) Kathakali (b) Manipuri (c) Kuchipudi (d) Bharatnatyam Sol.114.(b) Manipuri. The dance in Manipur is associated with rituals and traditional festivals, there are legendary references to the dances of Shiva and Parvati and other gods and goddesses who created the universe.

questions.question: Which of the following dance forms is associated with the state of Arunachal Pradesh ?
questions.explanation: Buiya performed by the Digaru Mishmi tribe. This dance is performed in multiple festivals like Tazampu, Duiya, and Tanuya. Other dances of Arunachal Pradesh include Chalo dance (Nocte tribe), Oriah Dance (Wancho tribe), Pasi Kongki (Adi Tribe), Ponung Dance (Adi Tribe), Popir Dance (Galo tribe), Bardo Chham (Sherdukpens community), etc.

questions.question: Which of the following dance forms is mentioned in the ancient text of Vyavahar Mala ?
questions.explanation: Mohiniyattam (Kerala) - Dance of Mohini (an incarnation of Lord Vishnu) mentioned in the ancient text of Vyavaharmala (written in by Mazhamagalam Narayanan Namputiri) and in Ghoshayathra (written later by poet Kunjan Nambiar). Odissi (Odisha) - it incorporates two major postures - Tribhanga & Chowk.

questions.question: ‘Nupa’ dance is associated with which Indian state?
questions.explanation: Manipur. Nupa Pala (Kartal Cholom or Cymbal Dance) is a ramification of the Manipuri style of dance and music. Q.118. The women of which tribe perform the traditional folk dance called Chakri? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (4th Shift) (a) Kaul (b) Kanjar (c) Gond (d) Bharia Sol.118.(b) Kanjar. It is performed exclusively by womenfolk in marriages and festivals. Kanjar tribe inhabited some parts of the Kota and Baran districts of Rajasthan. Gond tribe - Karma, Goncho Dance. Bharia tribe - Bharam, Setam, Saila, and Ahirai dance. Q.119. Ghoomar dance form was developed by which of the following tribes to worship Goddess Saraswati? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Evening) (a) Gujjar (b) Sahariya (c) Gond (d) Bhil Sol.119.(d) Bhil. It is the largest tribal group in India as per 2011 Census. Bhil tribes are found in the states of Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Tripura. Gond Tribe (Karma dance). Sahariya tribe (Lehngi dance). Gujjar Tribe (Chari dance).

questions.question: Which of the following is the main percussion instrument used in the performance of Mohiniyattam dance ?
questions.explanation: Edakka. The musical instruments used in Mohiniyattam:- Mridangam or Madhalam (barrel drum), Idakka (hourglass drum), flute, Veena, and Kuzhitalam (cymbals). Nagadas are used in Punjabi and Rajasthani folk music. Dhumsa used in 'Seraikella Chhau' dance of Orissa and 'Purulia Chhau' dance of West Bengal.

questions.question: Which folk dance represents a mock fight between Goddess Durga and Mahishasura?
questions.explanation: Dandiya Raas is a folk dance of Gujarat which is performed during the Navratri festival. Other folk dances of Gujarat are Garba, Gheriya, Dangi Nritya, Matukadi, Siddi Dhamal, Tippani and Hudo.

questions.question: _______is a traditional tribal dance performed mainly by the women of Jharkhand during the cultivation season.
questions.explanation: Jhumur (Kudmi community). Other famous dances of Jharkhand - Santhali (folk dance of Jharkhand), Mardana Jhumair, Janani Jhumair, Domkach, Fagua, Chhau dance. Yakshagana dance (Karnataka), Verdigao (Daman and Diu).

questions.question: Which is one of the most famous dance forms of Assam performed by the 'Kulis' (people who work in the tea gardens) during autumn?
questions.explanation: Jhumur Dance (folk dance). Dances of Assam: Folk dance (Bihu Dance, Ali Ai Ligang dance, Deodhani, Barpeta’s Bhortal Nritya, Dhuliya and Bhawariya, Bodo’s Bagurumba, Khamba Lim, Bhaona, Oja Pali).

questions.question: Which of the following dance forms depicts the anguish of women whose partners are gone from home ?
questions.explanation: Biraha is an Ahir ethnic Bhojpuri folk genre from Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, and Jharkhand.

questions.question: Gatka, a traditional fighting style of the Nihang Sikh warriors, used both for self- defence as well as a sport, has originated from which of the following states of India ?
questions.explanation: Punjab. Famous Martial Arts in India: Kalaripayattu (Oldest Martial Art in India; Kerala), Silambam (Tamil Nadu), Thang-ta, and Sarit Sarak (Manipur), Thoda (Himachal Pradesh), Lathi (Punjab and Bengal), Inbuan Wrestling (Mizoram), Musti Yuddha (Varanasi), and Pari - Khanda (Bihar).

questions.question: ‘Elelakkaradi’ is a tribal dance form of which Indian state?
questions.explanation: Kerala. Tribal Dances of India: Santhali Dance (West Bengal, Jharkhand & Odisha), Bamboo Dance (Mizoram), Kalbelia Dance (Rajasthan), Bhagoria Dance (Madhya Pradesh), Chhau Dance (West Bengal, Jharkhand & Odisha), Dhimsa Dance (Andhra Pradesh), Shad Suk Mynsiem (Meghalaya).

questions.question: Sangrai is a folk dance of which state of India?
questions.explanation: Tripura. Sangrai dance is performed by the Mog tribal community on the occasion of Sangrai festival during the month of Chaitra (in April) of the Bengali calendar year. Q.128. Which of the following is a traditional masked dance of West Bengal? SSC MTS 18/07/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Kavadi (b) Gidda (c) Gambhira (d) Jawara Sol.128.(c) Gambhira dance is performed during the festival of Chaitra Sankranti. The masks are made out of neem and fig trees by the local Sutradhar community. Gidda (Punjab); Kavadi (Tamil Nadu); Jawara Dance (Madhya Pradesh).

questions.question: ‘Ummatt-aat’ is a folk dance form performed in ______.
questions.explanation: Coorg. There are many other traditional dance forms of Karnataka which include Dollu Kunitha, Suggi Kunitha, Kamsale, Gorava Kunitha, Somana Kunitha, Bolak-aat, Komb-aat, Bhootha Aradhane, Yaksha Gana, Naga Mandala, Veeragase.

questions.question: ______ is a popular folk dance of Minicoy Island.
questions.explanation: Lava. Nagaland Famous folk dance - Leshalaptu, Aaluyattu, Moyashai, Modse, Bamboo Dance, Agurshikukula, Butterfly Dance, Sadal Kekai, Changai Dance, Kuki Dance, Khamba Lim, Mayur Dance, Monyoasho, Rengma, Seecha and Kukui Kucho, Shankai, War Dance and Zeliang Dance .

questions.question: ______ is a mask dance popular in South Malabar.
questions.explanation: Kummattikali. Dhangar - The Dhangar dance is performed by the shepherd community of Goa during Navratri. Parichakali (Lakshadweep). Other famous folk dances of south India are - Padayani or Paddeni (Kerala), Kummi and Kolattam (Tamil Nadu), Kargam and Puli Vesham (Tamil Nadu).

questions.question: In which of the following dances chairs on heads with lighted diyas are performed by women ?
questions.explanation: Chari Dance (Rajasthan). Chari dance describes the art of collecting water in a chari or pot by the Rajasthani Women.

questions.question: The ‘Veeragase’ dance, performed during the Dussehra festival holds a special place in the folk dances of the state of ______
questions.explanation: Karnataka. It is primarily performed during the Hindu months of Shravana and Karthika. Q.134. 'Ratvai' is a dance form associated with the ______ tribes of India. SSC MTS 11/10/2021 (Morning) (a) Mewati (b) Khasi (c) Jatapus (d) Bhil Sol.134.(a) Mewati. It is performed during the monsoons to the accompaniment of large drums. Dances of Haryana include the ‘chaupaia’, which is a devotional dance and is performed by men and women carrying ‘manjiras’.

questions.question: 'Chad Sukra', a popular traditional dance - festival of Meghalaya, is celebrated as a ______.
questions.explanation: Sowing festival. Folk Dance of Meghalaya: Behdienkhlam, Nоngkrem, Shad Suk Mynsiem, Wangala, Dоrsegata, Lahоо.

questions.question: In which of the following states is the ‘Mathuri’ folk dance practised?
questions.explanation: Telangana. The most popular folk dances of Telangana are Perini Sivatandavam, Dappu Dance, Lambadi, Oggu Katha, Chindu Bhagavatam, Gussadi Dance, Tholu Bommalata. Dances of Uttarakhand- Choliya, Jhumelo, Pandavart / Pandava Leela, Langvir, Chanchari, Chhapeli, Tandi, Chaunfula, Jhoda, Thadiya.

questions.question: ‘Ranapa’, a folk dance form of Odisha, consists of enacting chapters from the life of Lord ______.
questions.explanation: Krishna. Ranapa is performed on the stilt and accompanies by drum music, along with songs related to Lord Krishna childhood stories.

questions.question: Which of the following is a dance form of West Bengal where there is a confluence of dancing, singing, drama and recital?
questions.explanation: Alkap.

questions.question: ‘Bolak-aat’ is a ______ from the state of Karnataka.
questions.explanation: Dance form. This dance form is performed by Kodava men in the back of an oil lamp in an open field. The men hold chiavari (yak fur) in one hand and the Kodava short sword (odi-kathi) in the other while performing this dance.

questions.question: Hallisaka is a group dance native to ______.
questions.explanation: Gujarat. It is a type of group dance in which a young man stands in the middle of damsels who form a circular ring by joining hands. The time (tala) is kept by clapping and is accompanied by singing.

questions.question: Kadsa is a dance style performed by women in Jharkhand, carrying a ____.
questions.explanation: Kalasha (Earthen pot). This is a female dominated dance. Normally in this dance style, women perform carrying a ‘Kalash’ on their shoulders or heads.

questions.question: Which of the following dance forms is also known as the 'Royal Dance of Ladakh' ?
questions.explanation: Shondol dance. It is a famous dance which was earlier used to be performed by artists for the King of Ladakh on special occasions.

questions.question: ‘Raga Mala’ is an autobiography of who among the following musicians?
questions.explanation: Ravi Shankar (sitarist): Awards - Bharat Ratna (1999), Padma Vibhushan (1981), Padma Bhushan (1967). His Other Books: ‘My Music, My Life’; ‘Yours in Music’. Lata Mangeshkar (playback singer) biography name is Lata: A Life in Music (author - Yatindra Mishra). Q.144. Who among the following musicians plays Carnatic music and also known as 'God of Ghatam'? SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Evening) (a) RV Raghvan (b) Ram Narayan (c) TH Vinayakram (d) Asad Ali Khan Sol.144.(c) TH Vinayakram (popularly known as Vikku Vinayakram) is a renowned Indian percussionist and a master of playing the ghatam (a traditional South Indian clay pot instrument). His Awards: Padma Shri (2002), Padma Bhushan (2014), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1988), Grammy Award (1991).

questions.question: Kamala Lakshmi Narayanan is recognised all over the world as the foremost proponent of __________, a southern Indian classical dance form that combines artistic expression with rhythmic footwork.
questions.explanation: Bharatanatyam. Kamala Lakshmi Narayanan was invited to perform for Queen Elizabeth II during her coronation festivities in 1953. Awards: Kalaimamani (1967), Padma Bhushan (1970). She is a preeminent artist of the Vazhuvoor tradition of the dance. In 2010 she received a National Heritage Fellowship from the National Endowment for the Arts for her contributions to the arts.

questions.question: Who is revered as ‘Karnataka Sangeeta Pitamaha’ ?
questions.explanation: Purandara Dasa composed thousands of devotional songs, known as 'Devaranamas', in praise of Lord Vishnu. The original name of Purandara Das was Srinivasa Nayaka. Vyasatirtharu was the guru of Purandara Dasa.

questions.question: R Muthukannammal, who was awarded the Padma Shri in 2022, is a __________ dancer.
questions.explanation: Sadir. R Muthukannammal is a seventh generation veteran Sadir dancer from the Indian State of Tamil Nadu. She is the only surviving person among the 32 Devadasis who served the deity at the Viralimalai Murugan temple. Sadir, a traditional South Indian classical dance and precursor to Bharatanatyam, originated from Dasiattam over 2,000 years ago and was named in the 17th century. Q.148. Who among the following founded his Kuchipudi Art Academy at Madras in 1963 ? SSC MTS 23/10/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Kamalakar Kameshwar Rao (b) Lakshmi Narayan Shastri (c) Raja Reddy (d) Vempati Chinna Satyam Sol.148.(d) Vempati Chinna Satyam. Other Art/Dance academies in India: Darpana Academy of Performing Arts (1949), Ahmedabad - Mrinalini Sarabhai and Vikram Sarabhai. Kalakshetra Foundation (1936), Chennai - Rukmini Devi Arundale (Bharatanatyam). Bhatkhande Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya (1926), Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh - Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande.

questions.question: Which of the following Khayal artists is the founding father of Lalit Kala Kendra of the University of Pune?
questions.explanation: Bhimsen Joshi. His Awards: Bharat Ratna (2009), Padma Vibhushan (1999), Padma Shri (1985). Lalit Kala Kendra - Established in 1987.

questions.question: Lalita J Rao is associated with which of the following gharanas?
questions.explanation: Agra gharana. Awards of Lalita J Rao - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for her contribution to Hindustani vocal music. Sujan Singh founder of the Agra Gharana of music. Some Singers of the Agra Gharana: Ustad Vilayat Hussain Khan, Ustad Sharafat Hussain Khan, Khadim Hussain Khan Sahab, Ustad Faiyaz Khan, Dr Pournima Dhumale. Gharana and Founders: Kirana gharana - Abdul Wahid Khan, Jaipur Atrauli - Alladiya Khan, Benaras gharana - Janaki Prasad and Sukhdev Maharaj.

questions.question: Which of the following awards and recognitions was NOT received by Vempati Chinna Satyam?
questions.explanation: Padma Shri. Vempati Chinna was a Kuchipudi dancer and a guru. He was taught by Vedantam Lakshmi Narayana Sastry.

questions.question: Which of the following awards was won by Lata Mangeshkar in the year 2001?
questions.explanation: Bharat Ratna. Lata Mangeshkar was an Indian playback singer born in Indore. She received the Padma Bhushan in 1969, the Padma Vibhushan in 1999, the Dadasaheb Phalke Award in 1989, and the 'Officier de la Legion d'Honneur,' France's highest civilian award, in 2009. She is also renowned for singing the famous song 'Aye mere watan ke logo’. Q.153. Mohan Veena player, Pandit Vishwa Mohan Bhatt won the _________ Award in the year 1994. SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Sangita Kalanidhi (b) Oscar (c) Grammy (d) Sangeet Natak Akademi Sol.153.(c) Grammy. His music album with Ry Cooder, A Meeting by the River, won him a Grammy Award. He also received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1998, the Padma Shri in 2002, and the Padma Bhushan in 2017. Famous Mohan Veena players: Pandit Joydeep Mukherjee, Poly Varghese.

questions.question: In the year 1952, who among the following lent his voice for the film ‘Amar Bhupali’, which was being produced in two languages simultaneously and he sang in both Bengali and Marathi ?
questions.explanation: Manna Dey was a renowned Indian playback singer, music director, and musician. He had a classical music background, being part of the Bhendibazaar Gharana. He received Padma Shri in 1971, Padma Bhushan in 2005 and Dadasaheb Phalke award in 2007. Q.155. Which of the following personalities is a Padma Shri awardee folk singer from the state of Uttar Pradesh ? SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) Ila Arun (b) Ajita Srivastava (c) Gurmeet Bawa (d) Teejan Bai Sol.155.(b) Ajita Srivastava. She received Padma Shri in 2022 for promoting the Kajari folk songs. She has completed her Sangeet Prabhakar from Prayag Sangeet Samiti in Prayagraj. Ms. Gurmeet Bawa (Posthumous) - Padma Bhushan (2022). Teejan Bai - Padma Shri (1988), Padma Vibhushan (2019), Padma Bhushan (2003).

questions.question: Who among the following was the youngest instrumentalist to be awarded the Padma Bhushan, the third highest civilian award of India in 2002?
questions.explanation: Ustad Zakir Hussain (Tabla player). His Awards : Padma Vibhushan (2023); Padma bhusan (2002); Padma Shri (1988); Sangeet Natak Akademi (1991). Q.157. Madhuri Barthwal, a folk singer and Padma Shri 2022 awardee, belongs to which of the following states of India? SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) Uttarakhand (b) Himachal Pradesh (c) Uttar Pradesh (d) Maharashtra Sol.157.(a) Uttarakhand. Madhuri Barthwal is the first woman to be a music composer in All India Radio. On International Women's Day in 2019, she was awarded the Nari Shakti Puraskar by Ram Nath Kovind. Other folk singers of Uttarakhand: Narendra Singh Negi, Pritam Bhartwan, Basanti Devi Bisht.

questions.question: Gangu Bai Hangal and Prabha Atre were exponents of the____ Gharana.
questions.explanation: Kirana. Gangu Bai Hangal was an Indian singer of the khayal genre of Hindustani classical music from Karnataka. She received the Padma Shri in 1962, the Padma Bhushan in 1971, and the Padma Vibhushan in 2002.

questions.question: Chittani Ramachandra Hegde was associated with which of the following dances?
questions.explanation: Yakshagana dance. It is a traditional folk dance form popular in Coastal Karnataka districts. Chittani Ramachandra Hegde was awarded the Padma Shri award in 2012. Some exponents of Yakshagana : Kuriya Vithala Shastry, Soorikumeru Govinda Bhat, Narayana Hasyagar.

questions.question: Hariprasad Chaurasia, an Indian flutist in the Hindustani classical tradition, was awarded with which of the following awards in 2000?
questions.explanation: Padma Vibhushan. Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia belonged to the Senia gharana. Awards: Sangeet Natak Academy (1983), Konark Samman (1992), Padma Bhushan (1992). Other Flute Players: Devendra Murdeshwar, Raghunath Seth, Nityanand Haldipur, Ronu Majumdar, Pt. Rajendra Prasanna, and Chetan Joshi.

questions.question: Which state government honoured Vani Jairam with the MS Subbulakshmi Award for 2019 ?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu. Vani Jairam was an Indian playback singer, fondly referred to as the "Meera of Modern India." She received the Padma Bhushan award in 2023. M.S. Subbulakshmi Award is a tribute to the legendary Carnatic singer, M.S. Subbulakshmi. She was the first musician ever to be awarded the Bharat Ratna in 1998.

questions.question: Ranjana Gauhar was awarded the Padma Shri Award (2003) for her contribution to which of the following Indian dance forms ?
questions.explanation: Odissi. Ranjana Gauhar also received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2007. Other renowned Odissi dancers include Kelucharan Mohapatra, Mayadhar Raut, Sanjukta Panigrahi, Ratikant Mohapatra, Deba Prasad Das, Kumkum Mohanty, Pankaj Charan Das, and Aruna Mohanty.

questions.question: Which Indian singer wrote ‘Raag Sarita’ ?
questions.explanation: Chintaman Raghunath Vyas was an Indian classical singer, renowned for his khyal style. He was awarded the Padma Bhushan in 1992 and the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1987. He researched traditional ragas and bandishes, composing over bandishes in various ragas under the pen name Gunijaan. In tribute to his guru, Gunidas, he founded the Gunidas Sangeet Sammelan in 1977.

questions.question: Sangeet Natak Akademy Awardee Sulochana Chavan was a famous ________ singer.
questions.explanation: Lavani. Sulochana Chavan : Her Awards - Padma Shri (in 2022), Lata Mangeshkar Award (in 2010), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (in 2012). Other Lavani Singers : Bela Shende, Asha Bhosle, Usha Mangeshkar, Vaishali Samant. Q.165. Identify the Indian classical dancer associated with Kathak. SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Vedantam Satyanarayana Sarma (b) Kelucharan Mohapatra (c) Rohini Bhate (d) Sharodi Saikia Sol.165.(c) Rohini Bhate.She established Nritya Bharati Kathak Dance Academy in Pune. Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1979), Maharashtra Gaurav Puraskar (1990), Kalidas Samman (2001), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (2006).

questions.question: Bhupen Hazarika was one of the most well-known personalities from the state of ________.
questions.explanation: Assam. Bhupen Hazarika (Sudhakantha) was a singer known for his baritone voice. He received the National Film Award for Best Music Direction in 1975, the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1987), Bharat Ratna (2019), Padma Vibhushan (2012), Padma Bhushan (2001), and Padma Shri (1977), Dada Saheb Phalke Award (1992), Asom Ratna (2009).

questions.question: Indira PP Bora is a Padma Shri Awardee 2020 for her contribution to which Indian classical dance?
questions.explanation: Sattriya. Indira P. P. Bora has won Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1996. Dance and their exponents : Sattriya - Sharodi Saikia, Guru Jatin Goswami, Guru Ghanakanta Bora, Manik Barbayan, Pushpa Bhuyan.

questions.question: Who among the following is a Sarod player popularly known as 'Sarod Samrat' ?
questions.explanation: Ustad Amjad Ali Khan Bangash: Awards - Padma Shri (1975), Padma Bhushan (1991), Padma Vibhushan (2001). Amjad Ali Khan, along with his sons played ‘Raga for Peace’ in the year 2014 at the ‘Nobel Peace Prize Concert’. Other Sarod Players: Allauddin Khan, Hafiz Ali Khan, Ali Akbar Khan, Radhika Mohan Maitra, Sharan Rani Backliwal, Zarin Sharma, Buddhadev Das Gupta, Rajeev Taranath, Aashish Khan, Tejendra Majumdar etc.

questions.question: The Maharashtra Bhushan was conferred upon ________in the year 2002.
questions.explanation: Pandit Bhimsen Joshi. He belongs to the Kirana gharana tradition of Hindustani Classical Music. Awards - Bharat Ratna (2009), Padma Vibhushan (1999), Padma Bhushan (1985), Padma Shri (1972), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for Hindustani vocal music (1975), Aditya Vikram Birla Kalashikhar Puraskar (2000). Q.170. Indian classical violinist Annavarapu Rama Swamy was awarded with the _____________ in 2021. SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Padma Shri (b) Sangeet Natak Akademi (c) Padma Vibhushan (d) Padma Bhushan Sol.170.(a) Padma Shri (2021). Dr. Annavarapu Ramaswamy, a renowned Indian classical violinist from Andhra Pradesh, is noted for his contributions to music, including the invention of new Ragas and Talas such as Vandana Raga, Sri Durga Raga, Tinetradi Tala, and Vedadi Tala. Q.171. Which Indian musician from Maharashtra received the Padma Vibhushan 2023 ? SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Ramdas Palsule (b) Bharat Kamat (c) Zakir Hussain (d) Milind Date Sol.171.(c) Zakir Hussain (tabla player). Awards - Padma Shri (1988), Padma Bhushan (2002), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1991), Kalidas Samman (2006). Other Maestro Of Tabla: Pandit Ramdas Palsule, Bharat Kamat, AllaRakha Khan.

questions.question: The renowned ghazal singer Girija Devi was born in ________.
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. Girija Devi was a Thumri singer of the Senia and Banaras gharanas. She was dubbed as the 'Queen of Thumri' for her contribution in the genre. Awards : Padma Shri (1972), Padma Bhushan (1989), Padma Vibhushan (2016), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1977), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (2010).

questions.question: Pandit Omkar Nath Thakur was a student of ____________.
questions.explanation: Pandit Vishnu Digambar Paluskar. He was a Hindustani musician, known for singing the original version of the bhajan "Raghupati Raghava Raja Ram" and founded the Gandharva Mahavidyalaya in 1901. Pandit Omkarnath Thakur, a noted music teacher, musicologist, and Hindustani classical singer, was associated with the Gwalior Gharana, the oldest Khayal Gayaki style. Q.174. Who among the following classical dancers is NOT related to Odissi? SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Geetanjali Lal (b) Mayadhar Raut (c) Kiran Segal (d) Kumkum Mohanty Sol.174.(a) Geetanjali Lal. She is an Indian Kathak dancer and choreographer. Notable Odissi dancers include Kelucharan Mohapatra, Deba Prasad Das, Madhavi Mudgal, Sonal Mansingh, Pankaj Charan Das, Aruna Mohanty, and Ileana Citaristi.

questions.question: Which Indian musician and sitar player is the founder of the National Orchestra of India?
questions.explanation: Ravi Shankar. He was an Indian musician and player of the sitar, who was influential in stimulating Western appreciation of Indian music. His Awards: Bharat Ratna (1999), Padma Vibhushan (1981), Padma Bhushan (1967) and Grammy Award (1968) for Best Chamber Music Performance for his work "West Meets East".

questions.question: Who among the following was the youngest recipient of the Sangeetha Kalanidhi awarded by the Music Academy in 1947?
questions.explanation: Semmangudi Radhakrishna Srinivasa Iyer (Vocalist) : Awards - National Eminence Award (2002), Kalidas Samman (1980). Ariyakudi Ramanuja Iyengar : Awards - Sangeetha Kalanidhi award (1938), Padma Bhushan (1958).

questions.question: Ali Akbar Khan was associated with which of the following gharanas?
questions.explanation: Maihar gharana. Ali Akbar Khan (Sarod) : Awards - Padma Bhushan (1967), Padma Vibhushan (1989). Exponents of Maihar gharana : Allauddin Khan, Pandit Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee, Nityanand Haldipur. Agra gharana : Founders - Haji Sujan Khan; Ustad Gagghe Khuda Bakhsh. Gwalior Gharana : Founders - Ustad Hassu Khan, Ustad Haddu Khan and Ustad Nathu Khan. Kirana Gharana : Founders - Abdul Karim Khan and Abdul Wahid Khan.

questions.question: For which film did Asha Bhosle win the International Indian Film Academy (IIFA) Award in the Best Playback Singer Female category in 2002?
questions.explanation: Lagaan. Asha Bhosle: She was officially acknowledged as the most recorded artist in music history by the Guinness Book of World Records in 2011. Her Award: Dadasaheb Phalke Award (2000), Padma Vibhushan (2008), Banga Bibhushan (2018), Maharashtra Bhushan (2021), Filmfare Lifetime Achievement Award (2001).

questions.question: ____________ is often touted as the "Tansen of the 20th century," this musical genius blended the best of classical music and created a unique style of his own.
questions.explanation: Bade Ghulam Ali Khan. He was an Indian vocalist from the Kasur Patiala Gharana. His Award: Padma Bhushan (1962), and Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1962).

questions.question: Papanasam Ramayya Sivan was an Indian composer of which music style?
questions.explanation: Carnatic music. Paapanaasam Raamayya Sivan was awarded the Sangeetha Kalanidhi by the Madras Music Academy in 1971. He also composed film scores for Kannada and Tamil cinema in the 1930s and 1940s and was known as Tamil Thyagaraja. Amir Khusrow (1253-1325) is credited with creating qawwali, while Tukadoji Maharaj introduced the Bhajan and the Kanjiri Bhajan, performed with the Kanjiri instrument.

questions.question: The famous santoor player Pandit Shivkumar Sharma received the________ in the year 1986.
questions.explanation: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award. Also known as the Akademi Puraskar, this award honors excellence in the performing arts. The santoor, a trapezoid-shaped hammered dulcimer made of walnut, is popular in India.

questions.question: Classical Sarod player Amjad Ali Khan was awarded ________ in 2001 by the Government of India.
questions.explanation: Padma Vibhushan. Ustad Amjad Ali Khan (Sarod Samrat): He is an Indian classical sarod player, best known for his clear and fast ekhara taans. He was born in Gwalior. Awards: Padma Shri (1975), Padma Bhushan (1991), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1989), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (2011).

questions.question: Some of the talas invented by ________ include Trimukhi, Panchamukhi, Saptamukhi and Navamukhi.
questions.explanation: M Balamuralikrishna was a renowned Indian vocalist, composer, and innovator in Carnatic music. His Awards: Padma Shri (1971), Padma Vibhushan (1991), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1975), Mahatma Gandhi Silver Medal from UNESCO (1995). Q.184. Who among the following dancers was the first one from the state of Odisha to be conferred the Padma Vibhushan Award? SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Uday Shankar (b) Pandit Birju Maharaj (c) Kelucharan Mohapatra (d) Guru Bipin Singh Sol.184.(c) Kelucharan Mohapatra : Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1966), Padma Shri (1974), Padma Bhushan (1988), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1991), Padma Vibhushan (2000). Q.185. Harmonium player, Tulsidas Borkar, was awarded with the __ in 2016. SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Padma Shri (b) Padma Bhushan (c) Bharat Ratna (d) Padma Vibhushan Sol.185.(a) Padma Shri. Tulsidas Borkar received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2005. Other prominent harmonium players include Appa Jalgaonkar, Ustad Rafiuddin Ahmed, Ustad Nizamuddin, Shankar Mahadevan, and Bhishmadev Bedi. Q.186. Which of the following Rajiv Gandhi National Sadbhavana Awards was conferred on Ustad Amjad Ali Khan? SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) 20th (b) 19th (c) 21st (d) 18th Sol.186.(c) 21st. This award is presented every year to those who have devoted their life in understanding and promoting social harmony. It constitutes a citation and cash Prize of Rs. 10 Lakh.

questions.question: Ishwari Prasad is credited to have introduced the ______ Gharana of Kathak.
questions.explanation: Lucknow Gharana was established under the patronage of Wajid Ali Shah, the last Nawab of Oudh. This gharana is characterized by its emphasis on grace and elegance. Other Kathak Gharana and Founder: Jaipur Gharana - Bhanuji; Benaras Gharana - Janaki Prasad; Raigarh Gharana - Raja Chakradhar Singh.

questions.question: Which famous santoor player was honoured with the Ustad Hafiz Ali Khan Award in 1998?
questions.explanation: Shivkumar Sharma was an Indian classical musician and santoor player. His Other Awards: Padma Vibhushan (2001), Padma Shri (1991).

questions.question: Which of the following playback singers is the recipient of the Karnataka Ratna Award 2005?
questions.explanation: Bhimsen Joshi. He belongs to the Kirana gharana tradition of Hindustani Classical Music. Awards - Bharat Ratna (2008), Padma Bhushan (1985), Padma Vibhushan (1999).

questions.question: For which of the following tribal music and dance forms was Arjun Singh Dhurve conferred with Tulsi Samman?
questions.explanation: Baiga Dance Form: It is a traditional art form of the Baiga tribe, an indigenous community in Madhya Pradesh. Arjun Singh Dhurve: Awards - Tulsi Samman by Madhya Pradesh Govt (1993-94), Padma Shri (2022). Q.191. Which playback singer was honoured with the Nightingale of Asia Award in 1987? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Pulapaka Susheela (b) Asha Bhosle (c) Mubarak Begum (d) Kavita Krishnamurthy Sol.191.(b) Asha Bhosle. Her latest Awards :Yash Chopra Memorial Award (2018), Lata Dinanath Mangeshkar Award (2023), Banga Bibhushan Award (Highest West Bengal Civilian Award) (2018). Maharashtra Bhushan Award (2021).

questions.question: _______ was an Indian dancer and choreographer best known for creating a fusion style of dance adapting European theatrical techniques to Indian classical and folk - dance forms.
questions.explanation: Uday Shankar. He is known as the Father of Modern Dance in India. Awards - Padma Vibhushan (1971), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1962).

questions.question: Chhannulal Mishra is related to which Musical Lineage?
questions.explanation: Kirana Musical Family. It was founded by Abdul Karim Khan. Khayal gayaki and Dhrupad-Dhamar are combined to create the gayaki of the Agra Gharana. Chhannulal Mishra was awarded the Padma Bhushan in 2010, Padma Vibhushan in 2020.

questions.question: Sanjukta Panigrahi, a legendary dancer, is associated with which of the following dance forms?
questions.explanation: Odissi. Awards of Sanjukta Panigrahi: Padma Shri (1975) and Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1976). Odissi dance exponents: Kelucharan Mohapatra, Kumkum Mohanty, Protima Bedi, Sujata Mohapatra.

questions.question: Chitra Visweswaran is a famous dancer of which of the following dance genres?
questions.explanation: Bharatnatyam (Tamil Nadu). Awards of Chitra Visweswaran: Padma Shri (1992). Notable Bharatanatyam dancers include Rukmini Devi Arundale, Padma Subrahmanyam, Mallika Sarabhai, Yamini Krishnamurthy, Mrinalini Sarabhai, Alarmel Valli, Bala Saraswati, Anita Ratnam, Sonal Mansingh, and Sudha Chandran.

questions.question: Who among the following Indian musicians is known for his contribution to the field of Hindustani music for the classification of Ragas into ten Thatas?
questions.explanation: Pandit Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande. He was a prominent musician who wrote the first modern treatise on Hindustani classical music. In 1916, he reorganized the Baroda state music school. He set up Marris College of Music in Lucknow in 1926, which is now known as Bhatkhande Music Institute. He published books Swar Malika and Shri Mallakshaya Sangeetam (pen name Chatur Pandit).

questions.question: Vijay Kichlu belongs to the _____ .
questions.explanation: Agra Gharana. Vijay Kichlu was an Indian classical singer. Award - Padma Shri (2018). Agra Gharana was founded by Haji Sujan Khan and Ustad Gagghe Khuda Bakhsh. Other Exponents of Agra Gharana - Faiyaz Khan, Latafat Hussain Khan, Dinkar Kaikini and Lalith Rao.

questions.question: Thiyam Suryamukhi Devi who received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Awards 2003, is known for her contribution to the:
questions.explanation: Manipuri dance. Thiyam Suryamukhi Devi - She created her own solo composition such as Basanta Barnar Sakhi Ukti. Other Manipuri Exponents : Guru Bipin Singh, Maisnam Amubi Singh, Rajkumar Singhajit Singh, Sougaijam Thanil Singh, Thingbaijam Babu Singh, Darshana Jhaveri, etc.

questions.question: Who among the following Padma Vibhushan awardees belongs to Kalka - Bindadin gharana of Kathak ?
questions.explanation: Birju Maharaj. He is the direct descendant of Ishwari Prasad (the first known Kathak teacher). Birju Maharaj established an institution named ‘Kalashram’ for imparting training in dance and associated disciplines. Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1964), Padma Vibhushan (1986).

questions.question: Who among the following is a Padma Shri Awardee for her contribution to Manipuri Dance?
questions.explanation: Darshana Jhaveri, the youngest of the four Jhaveri sisters, is a disciple of Guru Bipin Singh. Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1996), Padma Shri (2002), Kalidas Samman Award (2018).

questions.question: Who among the following is a distinguished and experienced scion of the famous Kavungal family associated with 'Kathakali' for six generations?
