questions.explanation: Chathunni Panicker: Awards - Padma Shri (2006), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1973). Other exponents of Kathakali - Kanak Rele, Kottakkal Sivaraman, Guru Kunchu Kurup.

questions.question: Siyaram Tewari belongs to which of the following music Gharanas ?
questions.explanation: Darbhanga. Siyaram Tiwari was an esteemed Indian classical singer and a prominent exponent of the Dhrupad genre in Hindustani classical music. Award : Padma Shri (1971). Notable singers from this gharana include Ram Chatur Mallick, Pandit Vidur Mallick, Padmashri Pandit Ram Kumar Mallick, and Pt. Prem Kumar Mallik.

questions.question: Who among the following is NOT an Odissi dancer ?
questions.explanation: Anita Ratnam, a classically trained Bharatanatyam dancer, has also received formal training in Kathakali, Mohiniattam, tai chi, and Kalarippayattu. She combined these diverse influences to create her unique dance style, which she calls "Neo Bharatam."

questions.question: Pandit Acchan Maharaj was a Kathak legend of which of the following gharanas ?
questions.explanation: Lucknow. Acchan Maharaj is the father of Pandit Birju Maharaj. Exponents of Lucknow Gharana - Pandit Birju Maharaj, Shambhu Maharaj, Lachhu Maharaj (Pandit Bajinath Prasad), Pandit Ishwari Prasad, Kalika Prasad, Manjari Chaturvedi.

questions.question: Sitara Devi, a doyen of _________ Dance, was hailed as the Queen of Kathak by Rabindranath Tagore.
questions.explanation: Kathak. Sitara Devi (Dhanalakshmi): She was an Indian dancer of the classical Kathak style of dancing, a singer, and an actress. She was born at Cuttack, Odisha. Rabindranath Tagore described her as Nritya Samragni meaning the empress of dance. Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1969), the Padma Shri (1973).

questions.question: Mallika Sarabhai is famous for which of the following dances?
questions.explanation: Kuchipudi. Mallika Sarabhai : Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2000), Padma Bhushan (2010), French Palme D'or (1977, The highest Civilian award in France). Q.207. Who among the following belongs to Patiala Gharana? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Ali Baksh Khan (b) Nathu Khan (c) Abdul Wahid Khan (d) Chhaju Khan Sol.207.(a) Ali Baksh Khan : He was an Indian classical singer. Although the Patiala gharana was originally founded by Mian Kallu, Ali Baksh Khan and Fateh Ali Khan were instrumental in its development and prominence. Other exponents of Patiala Gharana : Bade Ghulam Ali Khan, Munawar Ali Khan, Raza Ali Khan, Ajoy Chakraborty, Dilshad Khan, Parveen Sultana, Begum Akhtar, Naina Devi, Nirmala Devi and Lakshmi Shankar. Q.208. Shovana Narayan has been honoured with the Padma Shri for her contribution to which Indian dance form? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Odissi (b) Kathak (c) Kathakali (d) Kuchipudi Sol.208.(b) Kathak. Shovana Narayan received the Padma Shri in 1992 and sangeet natak akademi award in 1999.

questions.question: Who among the following is the pioneer and founder of Kirana Gharana of Hindustani music?
questions.explanation: Abdul Karim Khan : He was an Indian classical singer. He introduced Hindustani Khayal singing and Indian classical music in Kirana gharana. Due to frequent visits to Mysore Palace, he was conferred the title Sangeet Ratna. He founded the Arya Sangeet Vidyalaya in Poona in 1913. Q.210. Who among the following is a famous personality of the dance form Mohiniyattam? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Sitara Devi (b) Sunanda Nair (c) Birju Maharaj (d) Damayanti Joshi Sol.210.(b) Sunanda Nair. Mohiniyattam is an Indian classical dance form originating from the state of Kerala. Other Mohiniyattam exponents - Gopika Varma, Neena Prasad, Mandakini Trivedi, Pallavi Krishnan. Q.211. Pt. Shiv Kumar Sharma, an accomplished Santoor player, originally hails from the State /UT of: SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Jammu and Kashmir (b) Himachal Pradesh (c) Assam (d) Lakshadweep Sol.211.(a) Jammu and Kashmir. Awards of Shiv Kumar Sharma : Padma Vibhushan (2001), Padma Shri (1991). Santoor players : Abhay Sopori, Bhajan Sopori, Tarun Bhattacharya.

questions.question: Indian musician, composer and singer Shubha Mudgal was awarded with the _______ in 2000.
questions.explanation: Padma Shri. Shubha Mudgal is known for her works in Hindustani classical music. Awards : Rajiv Gandhi National Sadbhavana Award (2016), Best Non-Feature Film Music Direction (1995) for Amrit Beej. Q.213. Sangeet Majumdar was felicitated by Casa De La, Spain for her contribution to which of the following Indian Classical Dances? SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Mohiniyattam (b) Kathak (c) Bharatanatyam (d) Kuchipudi Sol.213.(b) Kathak. Famous dancers : Kathak (Uttar Pradesh) - Birju Maharaj, Gopi Krishna, Sitara Devi, Uma Sharma, Deepa Kartha. Mohiniyattam (Kerala) - Jayaprabha Menon, Samitha Rajan, Pallavi Krishnan. Q.214. Who among the following Bharatnatyam dancers was bestowed with the title of Asthana Narthaki (Resident Dancer) by the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam temple? SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Padma Subramanyam (b) Yamini Krishnamurthy (c) Rita Ganguly (d) Indrani Rahman Sol.214.(b) Yamini Krishnamurthy. She was an exponent of Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi dance. She opened Yamini School of Dance in Delhi in 1990.Awards: Padma Shri (1968), Padma Vibhushan (2001), Padma Bhushan (2016), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1977). Q.215. Who among the following personalities was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (for her contribution to Manipuri Dance)? SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Urmila Nagar (b) Kalavati Devi (c) Mallika Sarabhai (d) Nirmala Ramachandran Sol.215.(b) Kalavati Devi. She received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2003. Other Manipuri dancers: Nirmala Mehta, Guru Bipin Singh, Charu Mathur, Savita Mehta, Bimbavati Devi. Other Sangeet Natak Akademi Awardee and year : Urmila Nagar (Kathak) - 2003, Mallika Sarabhai (Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi) - 1999-2000. Nirmala Ramachandran (Bharatnattayam) - 2004.

questions.question: Who among the following was the co-winner of Bharat Ratna with Lata Mangeskar in the year 2001?
questions.explanation: Bismillah Khan. He was a Hindustani classical shehnai player. His awards: Bharat Ratna (2001), Padma Vibhushan (1980), Padma Bhushan (1968), Padma Shri (1961). Sangeet Natak Akademi has decided to institute “Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar” from the year 2006. Awards of Lata Mangeskar: Padma Bhushan (1969), Padma Vibhushan (1999), Bharat Ratna (2001).

questions.question: Begum Akhtar a famous singer from India is known for which of the following genres?
questions.explanation: Ghazal music. Awards of Begum Akhtar (Mallika-e-Ghazal): Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1972), Padma Bhushan (1975), Padma Shri (1968). Famous Indian ghazal singers: Jagjit Singh, Hariharan, Bhupinder Singh. Sufi singers - Ali Azmat, Ali Baba Khan. Carnatic singers - Charulatha Chandrasekhar, Soorya Narayanan, Vishwas Hari. Q.218. Natya Sangeet is a form of musical play in classical music still prevalent in Maharashtra. Bal Gandharava is an exponent of this musical form. What is actual name of Balgandharva? Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 4) (a) Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande (b) Narayan Shripad Rajhans (c) Mallikarjun Mansur (d) Vishnu Digambar Paluskar Sol.218.(b) Narayan Shripad Rajhans. He was a renowned Marathi singer and stage actor, famous for portraying female characters in Marathi plays at a time when women were not permitted to act on stage. Natya Sangeet is a form of drama that combines prose and poetry through songs to convey the story, akin to musicals. The term "Dramatic Music" refers to Natya Sangeet, one of the two popular forms of vocal arts in Maharashtra and neighboring states, the other being Bhavageet.

questions.question: Which state of India does the musician Shyamamani Devi belong to ?
questions.explanation: Odisha. Shyamamani Devi was an Odissi classical music vocalist and composer. She received Padma Shri in 2022. Some famous Odissi musicians include Tarini Charan Patra, Pandit Ramhari Das, 'Suramani' Pandit Raghunath Panigrahi, and Singhari Shyamasundar Kar.

questions.question: Who was the founder of Jaipur - Atrauli gharana?
questions.explanation: Alladiya Khan. The Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana is a Hindustani music tradition renowned for its unique style of khayal singing. It stands out for its distinctive vocal aesthetics, raga repertoire, and technical skill. Gharana of Hindustani classical music and its Founders : Gwalior Gharana (Nanthan Khan), Agra Gharana (Hajisujan Khan), Rangeela Gharana (Faiyyaz Khan), Kirana Gharana (Abdul Wahid Khan).

questions.question: Ricky Kej, a globally acclaimed musician from India, won the 57th Grammy Award for which of the following albums ?
questions.explanation: Winds of Samsara. It reflects the concept of rebirth and the cyclicality of life, a key belief in Indian religions. Ricky Kej won his third Grammy in 2023 for "Divine Tides" in the Best Immersive Audio Album category. He won his second Grammy Award for "Ballad of Maya" in 2019.

questions.question: The first musician to be awarded with the highest civilian award of India, the ‘Bharat Ratna’ was __________.
questions.explanation: MS Subbulakshmi. She was an acclaimed Indian Carnatic singer hailing from Madurai, Tamil Nadu. Her notable awards include the Bharat Ratna (1998), Padma Vibhushan (1975), Padma Bhushan (1954), Ramon Magsaysay Award (1974), and Kalidas Samman (1988).

questions.question: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award winner Deepak Mazumdar is an exponent of_______.
questions.explanation: Bharatanatyam. Sri Deepak Mazumdar received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 2018.

questions.question: Vedantam Satyanarayana Sarma is associated with which of these dances?
questions.explanation: Kuchipudi. Vedantam Satyanarayana Sarma, popularly known as Satyam, was an Indian classical dancer and choreographer. He was known for his portrayal of female characters such as Usha (Usha Parinayam), Deva Devi (Vipra Narayana), and Mohini (Mohini Rukmangada). His award: Padma Shri (1970).

questions.question: Who among the following was awarded the Pandit Bhimsen Joshi Lifetime Achievement Award, 2014 ?
questions.explanation: Prabha Atre (vocalist). Her Awards : Padma Shri (1990), Padma Bhushan (2002), Padma Vibhushan (2022), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1991) for her contribution to Hindustani vocal music. Q.226. Who among the following is conferred upon Padma Shri 2021 for his/her contribution to Panthi folk dance Graduate Level 21/06/2024 (Shift - 3) (a) Satyaram Reang (b) Radhe Devi (c) Dulari Devi (d) Radhe Shyam Barle Sol.226.(d) Radhe Shyam Barle. She is a Panthi folk dancer and artist. Panthi is a folk dance of the Satnami community of Chhattisgarh. The songs convey the spirit of renunciation of their gurus and teachings of Saints such as Kabir, Ravidas and Dadu. Satyaram Reang (Tripura) was an Indian folk Hojagiri dancer who received Padma Shri in 2021. Dulari Devi (Bihar) is an artist working in the Mithila art tradition and received Padma Shri in 2021. Q.227. Akham Lakshmi Devi was honoured with Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for the year for her contribution to ______dance. Graduate Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 3) (a) Sattriya (b) Mohiniyattam (c) Manipuri (d) Odissi Sol.227.(c) Manipuri. Akham Lakshmi Devi received the Manipur State Kala Akademi Award in 2010 and the Nritya Bhusan in 2014.

questions.question: Rani Karnaa was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi (1996) for her contribution to_____
questions.explanation: Kathak. Rani Karnaa also received the Padma Shri Award in 2014. She was trained by Pandit Narayan Prasad and Sunder Prasad of the Jaipur gharana and Pandit Shambhu Maharaj and Birju Maharaj of Lucknow gharanas.

questions.question: Who was one of the 20th century's foremost exponents of the Bharatanatyam style of classical dance?
questions.explanation: T Balasaraswati. Awards: Sangeet Natak Academy Award (1955), Padma Vibhushan (1977), Sangita Kalanidhi (1973). Q.230. Who among the following musicians is given credit for collaborating with the famous band ‘The Beatles’ ? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Morning) (a) Pandit Kumar Gandharva (b) Pandit Bhimsen Joshi (c) Pandit Ravi Shankar (d) Pandit Shiv Kumar Sharma Sol.230.(c) Pandit Ravi Shankar (Founder of the National Orchestra of India) : Indian musician and composer, and known for popularising the Indian classical instrument Sitar all over the world. Awards - Bharat Ratna (1999), Padma Vibhushan (1981), Padma Bhushan (1967), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1962), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1975), Kalidas Samman (1987–88). He was the first Indian to win the Grammy Award. The Beatles - English Rock band formed in Liverpool in 1960. Q.231. ‘The Unforgettables’ was the collection of semi-classical music of which Ghazal singer? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon) (a) Mehdi Hassan (b) Jagjit Singh (c) Mallika Pukhraj (d) Talat Mahmood Sol.231.(b) Jagjit singh: Popularly known as the ‘King of Ghazal’. Ghazal is one of the styles of singing in Hindustani music. Tradition of singing ghazals was established by Hazrat Amir Khusrau. Q.232. Dr.Teejan Bai, a Padma Shri, Padma Bhushan and Padma Vibhushan awardee is globally recognised for her contribution to which of the following art forms? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning) (a) Pandavani (b) Raut Nacha (c) Jhirliti (d) Gendi Sol.232.(a) Pandavani (a traditional performing art form of Chattisgarh). Dr.Teejan Bai (Chhattisgarh) awarded: Padma Vibhushan Award (2019), Padma Bhushan (2003), Padma Shri (1988), and M. S. Subbulakshmi Centenary Award (2016). Q.233. Who among the following founded the Kalakshetra Foundation in Chennai that is an important center for the study and performance of fine arts? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning) (a) Alarmel Valli (b) Mrinalini Sarabhai (c) Yamini Krishnamurthy (d) Rukmini Devi Arundale Sol.233.(d) Rukmini Devi Arundale founded the Kalakshetra Foundation in Chennai in 1936. The foundation was declared as an institution of national importance by an Act of Parliament in 1993. It is an important centre for the study and performance of fine arts, especially Bharatanatyam dance and Carnatic music.

questions.question: In 2015, the eminent danseuse and ____________ exponent, Padma Subrahmanyam was selected for Kerala's prestigious choreography award 'Nishagandhi Puraskaram' instituted by the state tourism department.
questions.explanation: Bharatanatyam. Her Awards: Padma Vibhushan (2024), Padma Bhushan (2003), Padma Shri (1981), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1983). Q.235. Gopika Varma has won the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2019 in which of the following dance forms ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Afternoon) (a) Bharatanatyam (b) Mohiniyattam (c) Kathak (d) Kuchipudi Sol.235.(b) Mohiniyattam - Gopika Varma was the first Mohiniyattam dancer to receive the ‘Kalaimamani’. Q.236. Haripriya Namboodiri is an exponent of which Indian classical dance form ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Afternoon) (a) Kuchipudi (b) Odissi (c) Bharatanatyam (d) Kathakali Sol.236.(d) Kathakali. She was winner of Stree Ratnam and Devdasi National Award. Other Dancers: Kavungal Chathunni Panicker, Kalamandalam Gopi, Kottakkal Sivaraman, Kalanilayam Balakrishnan, Kottakal Sivaraman, Rita Ganguly.

questions.question: The Wadali Brothers are__singers.
questions.explanation: Sufi. Wadali Brothers: Puranchand Wadali and Pyarelal Wadali. They are famous for various styles of singing including Kaafian, ghazal and bhajan. Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1991), Padma shri (2005). Q.238. Which Manipuri dance expert founded Govindji Nartanalaya dance school for women in Imphal ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Evening) (a) Guru Bipin Singh (b) Guru Amubi (c) Rajkumar Singhajit Singh (d) Phanjoubam Iboton Singh Sol.238.(a) Guru Bipin Singh. He is known as the Father of Manipuri Dance. Manipuri dancers - Darshana Jhaveri, Guru Amubi, Rajkumar Singhajit Singh, Yumlembam Gambhini Devi, Nirmala Mehta, Charu Mathur.

questions.question: Ammanur Madhava Chakkiar was awarded the Padma Shri for his contribution to which of the following dance forms ?
questions.explanation: Kutiyattam (Kerala) - Its stylized and codified theatrical language, neta abhinaya (eye expression) and hasta abhinaya (the language of gestures) are prominent. Ammanur Madhava Chakkiar: Award - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1979), Padma Shri (1982), Padam Bhushan (2003) etc.

questions.question: Aluna Kabuini is associated with which of the following dances ?
questions.explanation: Manipuri. She is a Ras exponent. She was the recipient of the Manipur State Kala Academy Award in 2001 for her contribution in the field of Tribal Kabui dance.

questions.question: The Madhya Pradesh government conferred the Dhananjayans, a celebrated_________couple from Chennai, with the prestigious Rashtriya Kalidas Samman for 2019 - 2020.
questions.explanation: Bharatanatyam. Dancing couple - Vannadil Pudiyaveettil Dhananjayan and Shanta Dhananjayan (together known as Dhananjayans).

questions.question: Ustad Asad Ali Khan is famous for which of the following schools of Dhrupad as an instrumentalist ?
questions.explanation: Khandarbani. Awards : Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1977), and Padma Bhushan (2008). Famous Dhrupad singers - Ustad Rahim Fahimuddin Dagar, Nasir Aminuddin Dagar, Zia Fariduddin Dagar, Zia Mohiuddin Dagar. Four schools of Dhrupad: the Gauri (Gauhar), Khandar, Nauhar, and Dagar.

questions.question: Rani Machaiah is a___folk dancer who was awarded Padma Shri in 2023.
questions.explanation: Ummathat - The traditional dance form of Coorg (Karnataka) performed by the Kodava women.

questions.question: Indian classical vocalist Pandit Jasraj belonged to which of the following musical gharanas?
questions.explanation: Mewati Gharana. Pandit Jasraj : Awards - Padma Bhushan (1990), Padma Vibhushan (2000), Padma Shri (1975), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1987). Gharanas and Artists : Mewati Gharana - Ghagge Nazir Khan. Patiala gharana - Ali Baksh Jarnail Khan, Bade Ghulam Ali Khan. Dagari - Gundecha Brothers, Zia Mohiuddin Dagar. Gwalior Gharana - Nanthan Khan, Meeta Pandit.

questions.question: Who among the following was the director of Kathak Kendra and also opened his own dance school named ‘Kalashram'?
questions.explanation: Pandit Birju Maharaj. He belongs to the Kalka-Bindadin Gharana of Lucknow. Awards : Padma Vibhushan (1986), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1964), Kalidas Samman (1987). National Institute of Kathak Dance (also Kathak Kendra) - Founded in 1964. Headquartered at New Delhi. Q.246. Shambhu Maharaj was a renowned guru of which of the following Gharanas of Kathak? SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (2nd Shift) (a) Lucknow (b) Jaipur (c) Raigarh (d) Banaras Sol.246.(a) Lucknow. Pandit Shambhu Maharaj awards : Sangeet Natak Akademi award (1955), the Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1967), Padma Shri (1958). Famous Dancers from Lucknow Gharana: Birju Maharaj, Maharaj Bindadin, Kalika Prashad. Jaipur Gharana: Sunder Prasad, Durga Lal. Banaras Gharana: Rudra Shankar Mishra, Sneha Bajaj, Kamalini Asthana and Nalini Asthana.

questions.question: Famous Bollywood actress Hema Malini is a trained________dancer.
questions.explanation: Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu). Hema Malini: Awards - Padma Shri (2000).

questions.question: Which of the following musicians is popularly known as ‘ Panchamda’?
questions.explanation: RD Burman : Indian music director, composer, and singer. Indian musicians and their nicknames : A.R. Rahmaan - The Mozart of Madras. Asha Bhoshle - The Queen of Indipop. Lata Mangeshkar - Queen of Melody, Voice of the Millennium. Mohammed Rafi - Pheeko.

questions.question: Which Indian musical legend is credited with composing Talas such as Trimukhi, Panchamukhi, Saptamukhi and Navamukhi ?
questions.explanation: M Balamuralikrishna was an Indian Carnatic vocalist. His Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1975), Padma Vibhushan (1991), Padma Shri (1971), Mahatma Gandhi Silver Medal (1995) - UNESCO. Famous Carnatic vocalist: Dandapani Desikar, T. Brinda, B.S. Raja Iyengar, Maharajapuram Vishwanatha Iyer, Semmangudi R. Srinivasa Iyer. Q.250. Pandit Janki Prasad was associated with which of the following Gharanas of Kathak? SSC MTS 08/09/2023 (1st Shift) (a) Banaras (b) Raigarh (c) Jaipur (d) Lucknow Sol.250.(a) Banaras. Gharanas of Kathak: Lucknow Gharana (Founded by Ishwari Prasad) - Wajid Ali Shah, Lachhu Maharaj, Shambhu Maharaj. Jaipur Gharana (founded by Bhanu Ji Maharaj) - Sunder Prasad, Puru Dadheech, Mangala Bhatt. Banaras Gharana (Founded by Janakiprasad) - Sitara Devi, Jitendra Maharaj, Kamalini Asthana and Nalini Asthana. Raigarh Gharana (Founder - Raja Chakradhar Singh): Exponents - Kartik Ram, Pt. Kalyan Das Mahant, Shree Firtu Maharaj and Pt. Barman Lal.

questions.question: In which Indian musician's name did the state of Massachusetts in the USA declare April 20th in 1984 as a day in his name?
questions.explanation: Amjad Ali Khan (sarod player). His Awards : Padma Shri (1975), Padma Bhushan (1991), Padma Vibhushan (2001).

questions.question: Who among the following singers is from Andhra Pradesh ?
questions.explanation: S Janaki. Famous singers of Andhra Pradesh: Puvvula Suri Babu, M. Balamuralikrishna, R. Balasaraswathi Devi, S. P. Balasubrahmanyam, G. Anand, Mohana Bhogaraju. Usha Uthup (Chennai, Tamil Nadu), Asha Bhosle (Maharashtra), Alka Yagnik (Kolkata, West Bengal).

questions.question: Which of the following playback singers of India received the Padma Shri in 2009 and Padma Bhushan in 2016 ?
questions.explanation: Udit Narayan Jha. Other Playback Singers and their Awards: Sonu Nigam (Padma Shri, 2022). Kumar Sanu Bhattacharjee: Padma Shri (2009).

questions.question: The Padma Shri awardee (2016) Gulabo Sapera is known as the Queen of ________ dance.
questions.explanation: Kalbelia (‘Sapera Dance’ or ‘Snake Charmer Dance’). This dance is particularly performed by a Rajasthani tribe called 'Kalbelia'. Songs and dances are an expression of the Kalbelia community’s traditional way of life. It was included in UNESCO’s List of Intangible Cultural Heritage in 2010.

questions.question: Who among the following is the Indian classical dancer who masters both Bharatanatyam and Odissi dancing style?
questions.explanation: Sonal Mansingh received Padma Bhushan (1992), Padma Vibhushan (2003).

questions.question: Deba Prasad Das, Pankaj Charan Das and Gangadhar Pradhan are associated with which of the following dance forms ?
questions.explanation: Odissi - Classical dance forms of Odisha. Its dance theoretical base traces back to ‘Natya Shastra’ of Bharatamuni.

questions.question: Bhanu Ji is associated with which of the following Gharanas of Kathak?
questions.explanation: Jaipur Gharana of Kathak was conceived by Bhanu Ji Maharaj. Exponents of Jaipur gharana: Chunnilal Prasad, Kundan Lal Gangani, Sunder Prasad, Mangala Bhat.

questions.question: Who is the first female classical dancer in Indian history to be nominated as a Member of Rajya Sabha, the upper house of the Parliament of India?
questions.explanation: Rukmani Devi Arundale was an Indian classical dancer of ‘Bharatnatyam’ and founded the Kalakshetra Foundation in Madras. She was awarded with Padma Bhushan in 1956, Kalidas Samman (1984), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1957) and Prani Mitra Award in 1968.

questions.question: Which of the following music directors is known as 'Mozart of Madras'?
questions.explanation: AR Rahman was born in in Madras (Tamil Nadu). His Awards: Padma Bhushan (2010), Padma Shri (2000); Two Oscar Awards (2009), BAFTA Awards (2009), Golden Globe (2009) and Two Grammy Awards (2010). Q.260. The four Nattuvanars namely Ponaiyah, Vadivelu, Sivanandam and Chinnaiya, who are renowned as Tanjaore Bandhu shaped up the modern day _________. SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (2nd Shift) (a) Bharatanatyam (b) Kuchipudi (c) Kodiattam (d) Kathakali Sol.260.(a) Bharatanatyam. The term ‘Nattuvanar’ means dance teacher.

questions.question: The efforts of Malayalam poet Vallathol Narayana Menon and dancer and guru Kalyanikutty Amma brought back and gave a new life to the dance form ________ .
questions.explanation: Mohiniyattam. Dance and their Exponents : Mohiniyattam (Kerala) - Sunanda Nair, Jayaprabha Menon, Pallavi Krishnan. Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu) - Mrinalini Sarabhai, Rukmini Devi Arundale, Padma Subrahmanyam, Yamini Krishnamurthy.

questions.question: Who was the music director of the famous song "Aye Mere Watan Ke Logon" sung by Lata Mangeshkar?
questions.explanation: C Ramchandra. Deshbhaki songs and their singers : Aisa Desh hai mera (Lata Mangeskar), Mera Rang De Basanti Chola (Udit Narayan), Yeh Desh hai veer jawano ka (Mohammad Rafi), Teri Mitti (B Praak), Sandese Aate hain (Sonu Nigam), I Love my India (Hariharan), Mera Mulk Mera Desh (Aditya Narayan and Kumar Sanu), Mere Desh ki Dharti (Mahendra Kapoor).

questions.question: Which actress-cum dancer was honoured with the Padma Bhushan award in 2011 ?
questions.explanation: Waheeda Rehman. Other Awards : Filmfare Award for Best Actress (1969), Filmfare Lifetime Achievement Award (1995), Madhya Pradesh government's National Kishore Kumar Samman (2020).

questions.question: Sutapa Talukdar is associated with which Indian Classical dance form ?
questions.explanation: Odissi. Sutapa Talukdar Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Awards (2019).

questions.question: Who among the following is a famous music director?
questions.explanation: Khayyam (Mohammed Zahur Khayyam Hashmi) was a famous music director in Hindi cinema. Award - Padma Bhushan (2011). Sameer was a lyricist. Anjaan was an Indian lyricist. Kaifi Azmi was a poet.

questions.question: Talat Aziz is primarily a____singer.
questions.explanation: Ghazal. Musical genres and singers: Ghazal - Jagjit Singh (King of Ghazals), Hariharan, Pankaj Udhas, Bhupinder Singh; Hindustani Classical - Ananda Shankar, Tansen. Carnatic Classical - M. S. Subbulakshmi, Aruna Sairam, M. Balamuralikrishna. Folk - Swaroop Khan, Sharda Sinha, Kailash Kher. Q.267. Who among the following personalities is an award winning Bhojpuri folk singer? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (2nd shift) (a) Ila Arun (b) Rabbi Shergill (c) Malini Awasthi (d) Papon Sol.267.(c) Malini Awasthi - An Indian folk singer who sings in Bhojpuri, Awadhi/Audhi, and Hindi languages. Award - Padma Shri (2016). Ila Arun is an Indian film actress, music composer and singer. Rabbi Shergill is a Punjabi folk singer. Papon is an Assamese folk singer.

questions.question: Kottakkal Nandakumaran Nair is a Sangeet Natak Akademi 2019 Awardee for his contribution to ________.
questions.explanation: Kathakali (Classical Indian dance of Kerala). Kottakal Nandakumaran Nair - He is famous for his ‘Kathi’ Veshas and has skill in enacting ‘Pacha’ and ‘Minukku’ veshas. Q.269. Who among the following personalities won the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award 2021 for contribution to Manipuri Dance? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (1st shift) (a) Bhuvan Kumar (b) Thokchom Ibemubi Devi (c) Sruti Bandopadhyay (d) Kumkum Dhar Sol.269.(b) Thokchom Ibemubi Devi. The Manipuri Dance, also referred to as the Manipuri Raas Leela, is anchored in the Vaishnava faith of the Meiteis. The four Jhaveri sisters (Nayana, Ranjana, Suverna and Darshana) are classical Manipuri dancers. Bhuvan Kumar (Chhau Dancer) Q.270. Asghari Bai is primarily remembered for her contribution to which of the following genres of music? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (2nd shift) (a) Folk (b) Carnatic (c) Dhrupad (d) Ghazal Sol.270.(c) Dhrupad. Awards of Asghari Bai - Padma Shri (1990), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1986). Other Dhrupad Artists: Ramakant Gundecha, Umakant Gundecha, Zia Fariddudin Dagar, Pelva Naik, Pandit Ram Kumar Mallick, Mukund Dev Sahoo, Uday Bhawalkar. Q.271. Who among the following personalities was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award 2020 for his/her contribution to contemporary dance? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Bhushan Lakandri (b) Sruti Bandopadhyay (c) Bickram Ghosh (d) Sumitra Guha Sol.271.(a) Bhushan Lakandri. Sangeet Natak Akademi Award: First Awarded - 1952. Awarded for - Performing arts in India. Organiser - Ministry of Culture, Government of India. Headquarters - New Delhi. Q.272. Who among the following personalities is associated with synthesising classical and modern Indian dance through a theatre group called Ranga Sri Little Ballet Troupe ? SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Guru Bipin Singh (b) Pandit Birju Maharaj (c) Shanti Bardhan (d) Remo Fernandes Sol.272.(c) Shanti Bardhan - A junior colleague of Uday Shankar, produced some of the most imaginative dance -dramas of the 20th century. He produced Ramayana, in which the actors moved and danced like puppets. Q.273. Who among the following personalities coined the term 'Odissi' for Odisha's classical dance? SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (4th shift) (a) Kabichandra Kalicharan Patnaik (b) Kelucharan Mohapatra (c) Raja Rammohan Roy (d) Rabindranath Tagore Sol.273.(a) Kabichandra Kalicharan Patnaik. His Contribution was in the field of Odissi music, Odissi dance and Odia theatre. Some of his major published works: Kalanka Bhanjana, Milana Madhuri, Daridrya Bhanjana. Q.274. Who among the following personalities is a professional Kuchipudi Dancer ? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (4th shift) (a) Radha Sridhar (b) Surupa Sen (c) Anupama Hoskere (d) Kaushalya Reddy Sol.274.(d) Kaushalya Reddy. Famous Kuchipudi Dancers: Bhavana Reddy, Yamini Reddy, Vempati Chinna Satyam, Manju Bhargavi.

questions.question: In 2018, Google Doodle celebrated the 100th birthday of Mrinalini Sarabhai. She is an exponent of which of the following dance forms?
questions.explanation: Bharatanatyam and Kathakali. Awards of Mrinalini Sarabhai - Padma Shri (1965), Padma Bhushan (1992), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1970), Dhirubhai Thakar Savyasachi Saraswat Award (2014), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1994). She was the founder of Darpana Academy of Performing Arts (1949).

questions.question: Guru Bipin Singh, a Nrityacharya awardee, Sangeet Natak Akademi awardee and Kalidas Samman awardee, was renowned for promoting which classical dance form?
questions.explanation: Manipuri. Awards of Guru Bipin Singh - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1966), Kalidas Samman (1989), Title of Hanjaba by the Maharaja of Manipur. Q.277. Urmila Satyanarayanan is an exponent of which Indian classical dance form ? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Bharatanatyam (b) Kathak (c) Manipuri (d) Sattriya Sol.277.(a) Bharatanatyam. Urmila Satyanarayanan (Tamil Nadu) - Awards: Kalaimamani award (1997), Nritya Choodamani (2001). Q.278. Satyaram Reang received the Padma Shri for promoting the Hojagiri dance form. He belongs to which of the following states? SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Sikkim (b) Manipur (c) Assam (d) Tripura Sol.278.(d) Tripura. His Awards - Padma Shri (2021), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1986), Hojagiri dance (Reang community).

questions.question: Who among the following Indian classical tabla players was called 'Abbaji'? He collaborated with American jazz drummer Buddy Rich to create a music album in 1968 ?
questions.explanation: Alla Rakha. He belongs to Punjab Gharana. Awards: Padma Shri (1977) and Sangeet Natak Academy Award (1982).

questions.question: Shivaputra Siddaramaiah Komkali math is the original name of which of the following Indian classical singers?
questions.explanation: Pandit Kumar Gandharva. Awards - Padma Vibhushan (1990). Pandit Jasraj (Rasraj) - Mewati Gharana.

questions.question: Pandit Kishan Maharaj of Benaras Gharana was a __________ player.
questions.explanation: Tabla. Awards of Kishan Maharaj - Padma Shri (1973), Padma Vibhushan (2002).

questions.question: Ustad Hassu Khan was one of the founders of which of the following Gharanas of music?
questions.explanation: Gwalior Gharana: Oldest khayal gharana. Singers - Vishnu Digambar Paluskar, Nisaar Husain Khan, Ulhas Kashaalkar. Gharanas and their founders: Rampur - Ustad Inayat Hussain Khan, Agra - Hajisujan Khan, Kirana - Abdul Karim Khan.

questions.question: Ramkrishna Talukdar received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2018 for his contribution to the Sattriya dance form. To which state does this dance form belong?
questions.explanation: Assam. Ramkrishna Talukdar : Awards - Asom Gaurav, Sangeet Jyoti Award, Nritya Ratna, Kala Gaurav. It was given the status of a classical dance in 2000 by the Sangeet Natak Akademi.

questions.question: Who was the founder of Benaras Gharana of Kathak?
questions.explanation: Janaki Prasad. Notable dancers - Sitara Devi, Kamalini Asthana and Nalini Asthana. Ishwari Prasad - Founder of the Lucknow Gharana; Notable dancer - Pandit Birju Maharaj. Shambhu Maharaj - Celebrated Guru of the Lucknow Gharana. Q.285. Which danseuse among the following was called to perform for Queen Elizabeth-ll's coronation festivities in 1953 ? Graduate Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 3) (a) Mrinalini Sarabhai (b) Sitara Devi (c) Rukmini Devi Arundale (d) Kamala Lakshmi Narayanan Sol.285.(d) Kamala Lakshmi Narayanan (Bharatanatyam). Awards - Padma Bhushan (1970), Lifetime Achievement Award (2004), Natya Padmam (2007), Platinum Jubilee Award (2002). Q.286. Vasundhara Doraswamy was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (Akademi Puraskar) for the year 2019 for her contribution to which of the following ? Graduate Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 1) (a) Bharatanatyam (b) Kuchipudi (c) Odissi (d) Kathak Sol.286.(a) Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu). She is the only Bharatanatyam danseuse to have been invited from India to perform for ‘WORLD PEACE’ conference in Paris under the aegis of UNESCO. She was honoured with "Shantala Natya Sri Award" - The highest State Award for Dance by the Karnataka State Government and the Rajyotsava Award (Karnataka State).

questions.question: Which dancer was the first person from Odisha to get Padma Vibhushan in 2000 ?
questions.explanation: Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra. Awards - Padma Bhushan (1988), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1966), Kalidas Samman (1987).

questions.question: Jyoti Prasad Agarwala was a music composer popularly called 'Rupkonwar' in the state of _________
questions.explanation: Assam. Jyoti Prasad Agarwal - First filmmaker of Assam. He made the first Assamese Movie - ‘Joymoti’ (1935). His Famous Play - ‘Sonit - Konwari’, ‘Rupalim’, ‘Karengar Ligiri’, ‘Lobhita’ and 'Joymoti’. His death anniversary (17 January) is observed as ‘Silpi Divas’ in Assam. Q.289. The noted danseuse Yamini Krishnamurthy opened Yamini School of Dance in_________, in the year 1990. Higher Secondary 28/06/2023 (Shift - 2) (a) Mumbai (b) Delhi (c) Chenna (d) Hyderabad Sol.289.(b) Delhi. Yamini Krishnamurthy - Awards - Padma Shri (1968), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1997), Padma Bhushan (2001), Padma Vibhushan (2016), "Natya Shastra" award (2014). Autobiography - "A Passion For Dance". Q.290. Who among the following personalities has received both Grammy and Oscar awards? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 1) (a) Javed Akhtar (b) Jagjit Singh (c) Gulzar (d) Amitabh Bhattacharya Sol.290.(c) Gulzar (Sampooran Singh Kalra) is a famous lyricist of Hindi films. Awards - National Film Award (1991, 1988). Filmfare Award (2021, 2019, 2013). Academy Award (2009). Padma Bhushan (2004). Jawed Akhtar : Poet and lyricist and screenwriter of Hindi films. Award : Padma Shri (1999), Padma Bhushan (2007).

questions.question: Ratikant Mohapatra, an awardee of 'Sangeet Natak Akademi Award', is known for which of the following classical dances of India?
questions.explanation: Odissi (2016). Other Awards : Bhumiputra Samman (2016), Nritya Choodamani (2014). Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (Odissi) - Pankaj Charan Das (1970), Deba Prasad Das (1970), Mayadhar Raut (1985), Sonal Mansingh (1987), Kumkum Mohanty (1994), Gangadhar Pradhan (1997), Gita Mahalik (2009), Aruna Mohanty (2010), Sujata Mohapatra (2017), Surupa Sen (2018), Sutapa Talukdar (2019), Rabindra Atibudhi (2020).

questions.question: Kamalini and Nalini Asthana, the dancer duo have been conferred with the Padma Shri in 2022. They are renowned for which of the following dance forms?
questions.explanation: Kathak. Kamalini Asthana and Nalini Asthana (Agra, Uttar Pradesh) known for their performances of the Benaras Gharana style of Kathak.

questions.question: Surupa Sen is a famous _________ dancer
questions.explanation: Odissi. Awards of Surupa Sen: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2018), Raza Foundation Award (2006).

questions.question: Who was the recipient of Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar 2017 for Kathak ?
questions.explanation: Vidha Lal. She is a disciple of Kathak dancer Geetanjali Lal of Jaipur Gharana. Awards: ‘Sri Krishna gana sabha endowment award (2010) and Guinness world record for the most number of spins (103) in one minute (2011).

questions.question: Papanasam Sivan was related to the following music?
questions.explanation: Carnatic. Papanasam Sivan Awards: Padma Bhushan (1972), Sangeet Natak Academy Fellow (1962), President Award (1962). Q.296. Who among the following musicians was awarded a Grammy in the Music Album category for his collaborative album ‘Global Drum Project’ along with Mickey Hart, Sikiru Adepoju and Giovanni Hidalgo ? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 4) (a) Ricky Kej (b) Vikku Vinayakram (c) Zakir Hussain (d) A R Rahman Sol.296.(c) Zakir Hussain. He is the son of Ustad Alla Rakha. Awards - Padma Shri (1988), Padma Bhushan (2002), Padma vibhushan (2023) National Heritage Fellowship (1999), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1990), Kalidas Samman (2006), Guru Gangadhar Pradhan Lifetime Achievement Award (In 2012 at Konark Dance & Music Festival), Grammy Award (1992 and 2009).

questions.question: Ilyas Khan was born in Lucknow to a family of musicians. He was famous for playing
questions.explanation: Sitar. Ilyas Khan (1924-1989) - He was a disciple of Abdul Ghani Khan (a dhrupad singer from Kalpi). His father belonged to the Shahjahanpur gharana of sarod players while his mother came from the Lucknow gharana of sarod players.

questions.question: Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan was best known for which of the following instruments?
questions.explanation: Tabla. Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan (Delhi gharana). Awards - Padma Shri Award in 2003. Famous Tabla players - Zakir Hussain, Trilok Gurtu, Kishan Maharaj, Alla Rakha, Aban Mistry.

questions.question: Who among the following was awarded the Bharat Ratna in 2001 and has been credited with taking the shehnai from the marriage mandap to the concert hall ?
questions.explanation: Bismillah Khan (Ustad). Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1956), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1994), Swathi Sangeetha Puraskaram (1998) by Government of Kerala, T Choudayya National Award (1995) by Government of Karnataka, Tahar Mausique from the Republic of Iran (1992), Tansen Award by Govt. of Madhya Pradesh.

questions.question: Ustaad Allauddin Khan, a famous Indian musician is associated with __________ musical instrument.
questions.explanation: Sarod. Awards - Padma Bhusan (1958), Padma Vibhushan (1971), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1954).

questions.question: Saswati Sen is the proud recipient of the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 2004-2005. She is recognized for which dance form?
questions.explanation: Kathak. Saswati Sen was a senior disciple of Pandit Birju Maharaj. Q.302. Saroja Vaidyanathan received Kalidas Samman for classical dance in________. SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Evening) (a) 2009 - 10 (b) 2020 - 21 (c) 2001 - 02 (d) 2002 - 03 Sol.302.(a) - 10. Saroja Vaidyanathan (Bharatanatyam). Her awards: Padma Bhushan (2013), Padma Shri (2002). Bharat Kala Sunder (2006). Book by her :- “The Science of Bharatanatyam”. The first recipients (1980) of the Kalidas Samman - Semmangudi Srinivasa Iyer (Classical music) and Mallikarjun Mansur (Classical Music).

questions.question: Lata Mangeshkar recorded her first playback song for a _________ film.
questions.explanation: Marathi. Lata Mangeshkar - She recorded her first song “Naachu Ya Gade, Khelu Saari Mani Haus Bhaari” in at age of 13 for Marathi film Kiti Hasaal and recorded her last song ‘Saugandh Mujhe Is Mitti Ki’ in 2019.

questions.question: Alla Rakha left home at age 12 to learn a musical instrument under the great master (ustad) Mian Qadir Baksh. He became a renowned player of ________.
questions.explanation: Tabla. Alla Rakha specialized in Hindustani classical music. He was born in Ghagwal (Jammu and Kashmir). He is a player of Tabla and Pakhawaj. Awards: Padma Shri (1977) and Sangeet Natak Akademi (1982).

questions.question: Who popularised the ‘Pandanallur Style’ in Bharatanatyam and received Padma Bhusan in 2004?
questions.explanation: Alarmel Valli. She was the second youngest dancer to be conferred the Padma Shri (in 1991) from the Government of India, after Vyjayanthimala .

questions.question: Who among the following is a celebrated sarod maestro?
questions.explanation: Zarin Sharma - She was a famous Sarod player of Khayal (Agra gharana). AwardS - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1988), Maharashtra Gaurav Puraskar (1990), Dadasaheb Phalke Academy award (2007).

questions.question: Vidushi Sharan Rani is famous for playing which musical instrument?
questions.explanation: Sarod. She is the first woman sarod player in India. She was awarded Padma Bhushan in 2000. Q.308. "Bombay" Ramnath is a famous____singer of India. SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Morning) (a) Carnatic (b) Folk (c) Jazz (d) Hip-hop Sol.308.(a) Carnatic. Bombay Jayashri Ramnath (Padma Shri in 2021) has sung in multiple languages including Tamil, Telugu, Kannada. Famous Carnatic singer - M. S. Subbulakshmi, S. Sowmya, M Balamuralikrishna, Nithyasree Mahadevan. Famous folk singers: Mame Khan, Swaroop Khan, Ila Arun, Nooran Sisters, The Wadali Brothers, Malini Awasthi, Dipali Borthakur, Kollangudi Karuppayee. Famous jazz singers: Shankar-Jaikishan, Trilok Gurtu, Louiz Banks. Famous hip-hop singers: Divine, Naezy, Raja Kumari, Brodha V.

questions.question: Who among the following was awarded the prestigious title of "Nrityacharya' conferred by the Maharaja of Manipur?
questions.explanation: Guru Bipin Singh.

questions.question: Who is noted as a pristine Indian Classical Dancer to perform at Salzburg Festival in 2015?
questions.explanation: Alarmel Valli : An exponent of the Pandanallur style of Bharatanatyam. Awards - Padma Bhushan (2004), Chevalier of Arts and Letters award (2004), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2001).

questions.question: Jayanthi Kumaresh is one of the foremost exponents of ________.
questions.explanation: Veena. Jayanthi Kumaresh is known for her mastery of the Saraswati veena, a plucked string instrument that is one of the most important instruments in Carnatic music. Awards - Sangeet shikhar samman award (2019); Music academy award (2015).

questions.question: In 2019, the Government of India honoured Milena Salvini, an Italian-born Kathakali dancer, with which of the following awards?
questions.explanation: Padma Shri. Milena Salvini - Obtained a two-year scholarship to train in Kathakali at the Kerala Kalamandalam in 1962. Q.313. Nahid Siddiqui was awarded Milapfest's Lifetime Achievement Award in October 2017. She is recognized for which dance form? SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Morning) (a) Odissi (b) Sattriya (c) Kuchipudi (d) Kathak Sol.313.(d) Kathak. Nahid Siddiqui (born in Pakistan), A disciple of two great teachers: Maharaj Kathak (Pakistan) and Birju Maharaj. Other Awards - Pride of Performance (1994), Time Out Award (1991), British Cultural Award, International Dance Award.

questions.question: Which famous female personality received the Padma Shri award for Manipuri classical dance?
questions.explanation: Elam Endira Devi (Manipur). She is an Indian classical dancer and teacher. She performed in the film ‘Matamgi Manipur’, which won the National Film Award (1972). Other awards - Excellence Award, Nritya Rani Upadhi, Best Actress Award.

questions.question: Indore gharana is one of the vocal gharanas of Indian classical music. It was founded by _______.
questions.explanation: Ustad Amir Khan. Other disciples of Indore gharana - Pandit Amarnath, Shankar Lal Mishra, Kankana Banerjee, Purvi Mukherjee. Other gharana and its founder - Gwalior Khayal style (Ustad Nathan Pir Baksh), Agra (Hajisujan Khan), Rangeela (Faiyyaz Khan), Jaipur (Alladiya Khan).

questions.question: Who among the following is a sitar maestro of global acclaim?
questions.explanation: Shahid Parvez Khan. Awards - Kalajyothi Lifetime Achievement Award (2020), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2006), Padma Shri Award (2012).

questions.question: Which former Miss India, also the recipient of the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award, popularised Indian classical dance in the west?
questions.explanation: Indrani Rahman. She was the first South Asian to compete in the Miss Universe pageant (1952). Indrani was a successful classical dancer in Bharatanatyam, Kuchipudi, Kathakali and Odissi. In 1961, she became the first dancer to be a part of the Asia Society tour. Awards - Femina Miss India (1952), Padma Shri (1969), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1981).

questions.question: M.S. Gopalakrishnan mastered both Carnatic and Hindustani classical music. He was the master of _______.
questions.explanation: Violin. Awards and Honours:- Padma Bhushan (2012), Padma Shri (1975), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1982), Sangeet Natak Akademi Tagore Ratna (2012), Kalaimamani (Tamil Nadu) - 1978. Q.319. Budhaditya Mukherjee is associated with which of the following musical instruments? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Evening) (a) Veena (b) Sitar (c) Violin (d) Sarangi Sol.319.(b) Sitar. Budhaditya Mukherjee : First-ever musician to perform at the House of Commons, London.

questions.question: Shri Mani Prasad is associated with which form of music?
questions.explanation: Hindustani vocal music. Pandit Mani Prasad was an Indian classical vocalist from the Kirana gharana (singing style). He was awarded Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2019. Hindustani music is the classical music of the Northern parts of the Indian subcontinent. Carnatic Music originated from Southern India, the city of Hyderabad and other Dravidian-speaking regions of India. Q.321. Shri Jatin Goswami received several honours for his contribution to SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (3rd Shift) (a) Bharatnatyam Dance (b) Kathak Dance (c) Sattriya Dance (d) Manipuri Dance Sol.321.(c) Sattriya dance (Assam): Awards and Honours:- Padma Shri (2008), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2004), Silpi Divas Award (1994), Sangeet Jyoti Award (2004), Assam Natya Sanmilon Award (1997), Hiraprova - Chandrakanta Award (2006). Q.322. With which of the following classical dance forms is Deepika Reddy associated ? SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (3rd Shift) (a) Manipuri (b) Kuchipudi (c) Kathak (d) Sattriya Sol.322.(b) Kuchipudi (Classical dance of Andhra Pradesh): Guru Smt. Vijaya Prasad, Shri Vedantam Lakshmi Narayana Sastry, Dr. Vempati Chinna Satyam, Yamini Krishnamurthy, Shobha Naidu, Raja and Radha Reddy, Kaushalya Reddy, Yamini Reddy, Bhavana Reddy, Atisha Pratap Singh, Arunima Kumar.

questions.question: The poet saint Kabir Das was born in sometime in the 15th century.
questions.explanation: Kashi (Uttar Pradesh). Kabir was a 15th century mystic poet, saint of the Bhakti Movement. Books - Bijak, Kabir Parachai, Sakhi Granth, and Kabir Granthawali. His verses are found in Sikhism's scripture Guru Granth Sahib. Saint Kabir was the contemporary of Guru Nanak and Delhi Sultan Sikandar Lodhi.

questions.question: Aditi Mangaldas is a leading dancer & Choreographer in the classical Indian dance form of_________.
questions.explanation: Kathak. Awards Received by Aditi Mangaldas - National Sangeet Natak Akademi award in 2013.

questions.question: Who among the following was the guru of Pandit Ravi Shankar ?
questions.explanation: Allauddin Khan (Sarod player) was the guru of Pandit Ravi Shankar. He was awarded the Padma Bhushan (1958) and the Padma Vibhushan (1971), Sangeet Natak Akademi award and Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1954).

questions.question: In which state is the Maihar court where Baba Allauddin Khan was a musician?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh. Baba Allauddin Khan (Sarod player) laid the foundation of Maihar Gharana and became the court musician for the Maharaja of Maihar. Q.327. Who among the following is known as a pioneering dance educationist and a prominent Mohiniyattam exponent ? SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (3rd Shift) (a) Madhavi Mudgal (b) Shagun Butani (c) Mohanrao Kallianpurkar (d) Dr Kanak Rele Sol.327.(d) Dr. Kanak Rele. She is the founder-director of the Nalanda Dance Research Centre (1967) and the founder-principal of the Nalanda Nritya Kala Mahavidyalaya in Mumbai. Awards and Honors: Padma Shri (1990), Kalidas Samman (Madhya Pradesh, 2006), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1994), Padma Bhushan (2013).

questions.question: Rajashree Shirke was given which of the following prestigious dance awards of 2013 for her excellence in Kathak?
questions.explanation: Sangeet Natak Academy Award. Awards and Honors: Mumbai Mayor's Award for Women Achievers of the Year, Best Shikshak for the year 2007, and Title "Khosrovani" by Halim Academy of Sitar. Shambhu Maharaj was the first Kathak dancer to win Sangeet Natak Academy Award in 1955.

questions.question: Who among the following Indian classical musicians has an auditorium named after it in Tehran, Iran?
questions.explanation: Ustad Bismillah Khan (shehnai) - Become the third classical musician of India after M. S. Subbalakshmi and Ravi Shankar to be awarded the Bharat Ratna (2001).

questions.question: Who among the following was the first recipient of the State annual award Nishagandhi Puraskaram from the Government of Kerala in 2013?
questions.explanation: Mrinalini Sarabhai was the founder and director of Darpana Academy of Performing Arts in Ahmedabad.

questions.question: Shovana Narayan was awarded which of the following awards in 2013 ?
questions.explanation: Guru Deba Prasad. Awards and Honors: Oisca Award (Japan) (1990–91), Dadabhai Naoroji Award (1993), Bihar Gaurav Puraskar (1985), Guru ML Koser Award (2013), Art Karat Award (2014), Bharat Nirman’s Social Responsibility Award (2014) etc.

questions.question: Who among the following is a famous performer of the Kathakali classical dance?
questions.explanation: Gopinath. Awards and Honors: Sangeet Natak Akademi's award (1965), 'Kala Tilakam' by the Guruvayur Devaswom (1968), 'Kala RatIn’ title by the Travancore Devaswom Board (1973), etc. Q.333. Rajkumar Singhajit Singh, a leading exponent and guru of Indian classical Manipuri dance form, was awarded which of the following Indian civilian honours in 1986? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (1st Shift) (a) PadmaBhushan (b) Padma Shri (c) BharatRatna (d) Padma Vibhushan Sol.333.(b) Padma Shri. Rajkumar Singhajit Singh (Manipuri dancer). Awards and Honors - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1984), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (2011), Tagore Award (2014), Delhi Sahitya Kala Parishad Award (1975), Manipur Sahitya Parishad Nritya Award (1975), etc.

questions.question: Which of the following Gharanas does Padma Bhushan Kishori Amonkar belong to?
questions.explanation: Jaipur - Atrauli. Kishori Amonkar - She was a performer of the classical genre khyal and the light classical genres thumri and bhajan. Awards and Honors: Padma Bhushan (1987), and Padma Vibhushan (2002), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1985) and the Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (2009). Q.335. Who among the following personalities is an exponent of Kathak dance in India? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (1st Shift) (a) Prerna Shrimali (b) Usha Uthup (c) Suman Kalyanpur (d) Monali Thakur Sol.335.(a) Prerana Shrimali. She is a senior dancer of Jaipur Gharana of Kathak. Honours - 2001 Rashtriya Ekta Award (57th Birth Anniversary of Rajiv Gandhi).

questions.question: Guru Nileshwar Mukherjee is the exponent of which of the following Indian classical dance forms?
questions.explanation: Manipuri.

questions.question: With which instrument do the sisters Lalita and Nandini identify?
questions.explanation: Violin. Awards and Honors: `Kalaimamani’ (Tamil Nadu), Title of `Haratha Violin Vadya Thilakangal’, Best senior violinist (Madras music academy, and Indian fine arts society). Violinist in India: Mysore brothers – Mysore Nagaraj and Mysore Manjunath, Abhijith P. S. Nair, Ambi Subramaniam, B. Sasikumar, Balabhaskar Chandran, Embar Kannan, H. K. Narasimhamurthy, Lalgudi Vijayalakshmi, etc.

questions.question: Who was the recipient of the National Devdasi Award in 2016?
questions.explanation: Prerana Deshpande (Kathak). Gaurav Puruskar at the hands of Pt. Birju Maharaj, Singar Mani title, by the Sur Singar Samsad of Mumbai, Nrityashree title, Kiran, Katan (1994). R MuthuKannammal (Sadir dancer) - Padma Shri (2022).

questions.question: Name the classical dancer who was given the Prani Mitra Award in 1968.
questions.explanation: Rukmini Devi Arundale (Bharatanatyam). Awards: Padma Bhushan (1956), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1957).

questions.question: Who among the following is NOT an exponent of Mohiniyattam classical dance form?
questions.explanation: Prateeksha Kashi (Kuchipudi dancer). Awards and honours: Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar (2014), Aditya Vikram Birla Kalakiran Puraskar (2014), Aryabhata International Award (2011), Kalabharathi National Young Talent Award (2014), Natyaveda Award (2014). Kalamandalam Kalyanikutty Amma: Mother of Mohiniyattam.

questions.question: Surekha Punekar is a _________ dancer from the Indian state of Maharashtra.
questions.explanation: Lavani. Vithabai Narayangaonkar, Kantabai Satarkar, Mangala Bansode, Sandhya Mane, Roshan Satarkar are well known artists presenting Lavani on stage. Q.342. Which of the following was awarded to Bharatnatyam dancer Priyadarshini Govind in 1998 ? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (1st Shift) (a) Tagore Ratna (b) Kalaimamani (c) Nritya Choodamani (d) Kalidas Samman Sol.342.(b) Kalaimamani. Other Awards - ‘Nritya Kalanidhi' title by The Music Academy in 2019, Sangeet Natak Akademi award (2012). Q.343. Kumkum Mohanty, an Odissi dancer received which of the following awards in 2005? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (2nd Shift) (a) Padma Bhushan (b) Kalidas Samman (c) Padma Shri (d) Padma Vibhushan Sol.343.(c) Padma Shri. Guru Kelucharan Mahapatra Award (2011), Odisha Sangeet Natak Akademi (1993). Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1994). Q.344. Sharmila Biswas, who was awarded the 'Best Choreography Award' in 1998 by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, represents which of the following classical dance forms? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (4th Shift) (a) Manipuri (b) Odissi (c) Kathakali (d) Kathak Sol.344.(b) Sharmila Biswas (Odissi dancer and choreographer) established Odissi Vision and Movement Center (1995, Kolkata). Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2012), Uday Shankar Award for Best Choreography (1998), Mahari Award (2010).

questions.question: With which instrument is Ustad Sultan Khan associated?
questions.explanation: Sarangi. He was one of the founding members of the Tabla Beat Science (Indian Fusion group) with Zakir Hussain and Bill Laswell. Awards: Padma Bhushan (2010), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1992), American Academy of Artists (1998).

questions.question: Who among the following teamed up with flautist Hariprasad Chaurasia and guitarist Brij Bhushan Kabra and produced a concept album, 'Call of the Valley' (1967)?
questions.explanation: Pandit Shivkumar Sharma (santoor player). Q.347. Who among the following is Telangana’s first Sangeet Natak Akademi Award winner ? SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (3rd Shift) (a) Padmaja Reddy (b) Yamini Reddy (c) Deepa Sashindran (d) Shantala Shivalingappa Sol.347.(a) Padmaja Reddy (Kuchipudi). She developed Kakatiyam (a two-part Kuchipudi classical visual dance form). Awards: Kala Ratna (2006), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2015), and Padma Shri (2022). Sangeet Natak Academy: Founded (1953), Headquarters (New Delhi).

questions.question: Who among the following was popularly called the ‘Australian Mother of Kathakali’?
questions.explanation: Louise Lightfoot was popularly called the Australian Mother of Kathakali by Vallathol Narayana Menon (the founder of Kerala Kalamandalam). Kathakali is known as the ballad of the East. It is performed on the Sopana sangeet.

questions.question: Who among the following has the credit to invent and create a new style of ‘Bharatanatyam’ ?
questions.explanation: Dr. Padma Subrahmanyam: Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1983), Padma Bhushan (2003) Padma Shri (1981).

questions.question: Which Gharana was propounded by Bade Fateh Ali Khan and Ali Baksh Jarnail Khan?
questions.explanation: Patiala Gharana. Malika Pukhraj, Gauhar Jan, Ghulam Ali are all related to Patiala Gharana. Gwalior Gharana : Ghulam Hassan Shaggan, Vasundhara Komkali, Narayanrao Bodas, Sunanda Patnaik. Agra Gharana : Yaqoob Hussain Khan, Yusuf Hussain Khan, Khurshid Hussain Khan, Shamim Ahmed Khan, Ghulam Rasool Khan. Bhendi Bazaar Gharana : Pandit Shivkumar Shukla, Ramesh Nadkarni, T.D. Janorikar. Tansen belonged to Gwalior Gharana.

questions.question: Violin virtuoso L Subramaniam is famous for which of the following genres of music globally?
questions.explanation: Carnatic music. Padma Shri (1988), Padma Bhushan (2001), Manaviyam (Millennium) Award, Kerala (2001). Popular Violists : Abhijith P. S. Nair, Ambi Subramaniam, Arrol Carelli, Avaneeswaram S R Vinu, B. Sasikumar, Ragini Shankar. Q.352. The famous musician, Appa Jalgaonkar is associated with which musical instrument? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Harmonium (b) Tabla (c) Sarod (d) Violin Sol.352.(a) Harmonium - Appa Jalgaonkar (Sangeet Natak Akademi Award - 2000). It is also called Reed Organ, a free-reed keyboard instrument. Famous Harmonium players - Mehmood Dhaulpuri, R. K. Bijapure, Sudhir Nayak, Tulsidas Borkar.

questions.question: Hari Prasad Chaurasia, an Indian flutist, is associated with which of the following music gharanas?
questions.explanation: Senia gharana (Founder - Bilas Khan and Naubat Khan). Official Biography of Hari Prasad Chaurasia - 'Breath of Gold' (2019) by Sathya Saran. Other famous flutists - Ronu Majumdar, Pravin Godkhindi, Raghunath Seth. Other Gharana - Agra (Hajisujan Khan), Lucknow (Bindadin Maharaj), Banaras (Pandit Ram Sahai), Jaipur (Ustad Alladiya Khan).

questions.question: Which extraordinary scholar and artist of the 17th century AD composed Bhaamaakalaapam, a dance drama based on Kuchipudi?
questions.explanation: Siddhendra Yogi. Bhama Kalapam (story of Satyabhama, wife of the god Krishna). Most popular classical dance-dramas, Kathakali (sage Bharata).

questions.question: The famous musician Satyadev Pawar is associated with which musical instrument?
questions.explanation: Violin. Other Violin Players - Lalgudi Jayaraman - Padma Shri (1963), Padam Bhushan (1994), Sangeet Natak Akademi (2010); L. Subramaniam {Padma Shri (1998) Padma Bhushan (2001); M. S Gopalakrishnan {Padma Shri (1975), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1982), Padma Bhushan (2012)}.

questions.question: Mallika Sarabhai was honoured by the________government with Chevalier des Palmes Academiques 2005.
questions.explanation: French. Mallika Sarabhai (Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi dancer ) - Padma Bhushan (2010). Book - In Free Fall: My Experiments With Living. Founder of Darpana dance Academy.

questions.question: The Sabri brothers, Aziz Warsi and Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan are associated with which singing style?
questions.explanation: Qawwali. Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan (President of Pakistan Award for Pride of Performance by the Government of Pakistan). Indian folk music - Bhavageethe (Karnataka and Maharashtra), Bhangra and Giddha (Punjab), Lavani (Maharashtra). Alha (Madhya Pradesh) and Panihari, Pankhida and Maand (Rajasthan).

questions.question: Who among the following was a famous sitar player ?
questions.explanation: Nikhil Banerjee (Maihar Gharana). Awards - Padma Shri (1968), Padma Bhushan (1987). Hari Prasad Chaurasia (Flute Player), Zakir Hussain (Tabla Player). The Sangeet Sudarshana states that the sitar was invented during the 18th century by a fakir named Amir Khusru. Q.359. Laxmipriya Mohapatra was associated with which of the following classical dances of India ? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Sattriya (b) Kathakali (c) Odissi (d) Kuchipudi Sol.359.(c) Odissi. Laxmipriya Mohapatra is said to be the first woman to perform Gotipua (folk dance of Odisha) on stage, and the first dancer to perform Odissi on stage. Q.360. Ileana Citaristi is the first classical dancer of foreign origin who was conferred the Padma Shri Award in 2006 for her contributions to ________. SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Evening) (a) Kathakali (b) Kathak (c) Bharatanatyam (d) Odissi Sol.360.(d) Odissi. Ileana Citaristi is an Indian Odissi and Chhau dancer. Awards: 43rd National Film Awards (1996), Padma Shri (2006), Leonide Massine for the Art of Dance (Italy, 1992), Sanskriti Siromani (2006), Lalithakala award (2007), Pandit Jasraj Award (2009), Prananath Patnaik Award (2005).

questions.question: Who was hailed as the ‘Tansen of the 20th century’?
questions.explanation: Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan (Patiala gharana). Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1962), Sangeet Natak Akademi fellow (1967), Padma Bhushan Award (1962). Ustad Abdul Karim Khan (founder of the Kairana gharana of classical music). Ustad Faiyaz Khan (exponent of the Agra gharana). Ustad Amir Khan (founder of the Indore gharana of Classical Music). Q.362. Who among the following dancers was awarded the Queen Victoria Silver Medal of the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, London in 1958 ? Graduate Level 01/08/2022 (Shift - 4 ) (a) Sitara Devi (b) Sonal Mansingh (c) Sanjukta Panigrahi (d) Rukmini Devi Arundale Sol.362.(d) Rukmini Devi Arundale (Bharatanatyam). Awards: Padma Bhushan (1956), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1957), Prani Mitra Award (1968).

questions.question: Who achieved fame for the Pandanallur school of Bharatanatyam?
questions.explanation: Meenakshi Pillai. Other two prominent styles of Bharatanatyam (classical dance, Tamil Nadu) are Vazhuvoor Dance Form (Vazhuvoor B. Ramiah Pillai and his ancestors) and Melattur Dance form (Guru Mangudi Dorairaj). Q.364. Tankeswar Hazarika Borbayan received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for the year for his contribution to which classical dance of India? SSC MTS 05/07/2022 (Morning) (a) Kuchipudi (b) Bharatanatyam (c) Sattriya (d) Kathak Sol.364.(c) Sattriya dance (Assam).

questions.question: Madhavi Mudgal is associated with which classical dance of India?
questions.explanation: Odissi. Awards : Sanskriti Award (1984), Padma Shri (1990), Orissa State Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1996), Grande Medaille de la Ville by Govt. of France (1997), Central Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2000), Delhi State Parishad Samman (2002) and the title of Nritya Choodamani in 2004.

questions.question: With which of the following was Kadri Gopalnath associated ?
questions.explanation: Saxophone. Famous Saxophone players in India - Manohari Singh, Allah Rakha Rahman, Braz Gonsalves, Adnan Sami Khan, George Brooks, etc. The saxophone is a type of single-reed woodwind instrument with a conical shape, usually made of brass. Q.367. Radha Sridhar received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for the year 2018 for her contribution to which classical dance of India? SSC MTS 08/07/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Kathak dance (b) Kuchipudi (c) Sattriya (d) Bharatanatyam Sol.367.(d) Bharatnatyam. She established Venkatesha Natya Mandira in 1969. She choreographed her first dance-drama based on the Ramayana, followed by Hanumadvilasa.

questions.question: Dr N Rajam is known for playing the ________.
questions.explanation: Violin. Popular Violinist in India: Abhijith P. S. Nair, B. Sasikumar, Harikumar Sivan, Embar Kannan, Kala Ramnath, Sunita Bhuyan, Akkarai Subbalakshmi, Vittal Ramamurthy, Ragini Shankar, Manoj George, Gagan Chandra Chatterjee, Sangeeta Shanka etc

questions.question: Who is the first trans woman to win a Padma Shri award for Bharatanatyam?
questions.explanation: Narthaki Nataraj. Kalaimamani Award of Tamil Nadu Government in 2007, Nritya Choodamani Award from Krishna Gana Sabha in 2009, Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2011, Vetri Award from University of Madras in 2013. Honorary Doctorate from Periyar Maniammai University 2016, ICCR Empanelled Dance Artist in Outstanding Category 2017. Q.370. Pandit Rajendra Gangani is associated with which classical dance of India? SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Morning) (a) Manipuri dance (b) Kathak dance (c) Odissi dance (d) Sattriya dance Sol.370.(b) Kathak Dance. Pandit Rajendra Gangani: Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2003). He is one of the leading exponents of the Jaipur Gharana style of Kathak. Q.371. His compositions for blockbusters such as Silsila and Chandni are a manifestation of his musical brilliance. Who is he? SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Ustad Bismillah Khan (b) Pandit Shivkumar Sharma (c) Ustad Zakir Hussain (d) Jagjit Singh Sol.371.(b) Pandit Shivkumar Sharma. He was awarded Platinum Disc for music of film Silsila, Gold Disc for music of film Faasle, Platinum Disc for music of film Chandni.

questions.question: Minati Mishra was associated with which classical dance of India?
questions.explanation: Odissi. Minati Mishra was a recipient of the 1975 Orissa Sangeet Natak Akademi Award. She also received the Kalinga Shastriya Sangeet Parishad Award and in 2000, she received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award. In 2012, the Government of India awarded her the Padma Shri, the fourth-highest civilian award of India.

questions.question: Chitti Babu is associated with which musical instrument?
questions.explanation: Veena. Famous Veena players in India - Zia Mohiuddin Dagar, Ayyagari Syamasundaram, Doraiswamy Iyengar, Emani Sankara Shastri, Dhanammal, KR Kumaraswamy, Sundaram Balachandrer, etc.

questions.question: Yog Sunder Desai, a pioneer who ventured into the world of Indian Dance in the pre-independence era, was born on July 16, 1921 in __________.
questions.explanation: Gujarat. Yog Sunder Desai directed the 'Ram Lila' for Shriram Bharatiya Kala Kendra in 1966. Yog Sunder founded his dance ensemble in 1948 in Calcutta and called it the Indian Revival Group in the spirit of revivalism that was sweeping the country. Q.375.________ along with his wife, herself a dancer, and their son built Srjan in 1993. SSC CHSL 24/05/ 2022 (Morning) (a) Pankaj Charan Das (b) Kelucharan Mohapatra (c) Raghunath Dutta (d) Deba Prasad Das Sol.375.(b) Kelucharan Mohapatra. He is an exponent of Odissi Dance. he choreographed a number of dance - dramas in Odissi style, including "Panchapuspa", "Krushna Gatha", "Geeta Govinda", "Urbashi", "Krushna Leela", "Sakhigopal", "Konark" and "Sri Kshetra".

questions.question: The Nooran Sisters are renowned for which of the following genres of Indian Music?
questions.explanation: Sufi. The Nooran Sisters (Jyoti Nooran and Sultana Nooran) are a Sufi singing duo from Jalandhar, India. They perform Sham Chaurasia gharana classical music.

questions.question: Which of the following Hindustani vocalists from Allahabad, along with her famed contemporary Gauhar Jaan, had the privilege of performing for Emperor George V at the Delhi Darbar in 1911 ?
questions.explanation: Janki Bai. She was popularly known as “Chhappan chhuri” or the 'woman with 56 stab wounds'. Shobha Abhyankar (Pune) - Mewati Gharana. Annupamaa (Chennai)- Carnatic Music, Allah Jilai Bai (Rajasthan) - Folk Music. Q.378. Padma Shri awardee Gopal Prasad Dubey was awarded for his contribution to which of the following dances? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Sattriya (b) Panthi (c) Chhau (d) Mohiniyattam Sol.378.(c) Chhau. Awards: Padma Shri (2012), Suvarna Shankhu (2010), Natya Shri title from Nataraj Music Academy (2010).

questions.question: Who is the first Indian musician to win the Oscar award for Best Original Score?
questions.explanation: AR Rahman. Resul Pookutty won an oscar award for best sound mixing. Bhanu Athaiya won an Oscar for costume design for her work on “Gandhi”. Mehboob Khan was the Director of the movie Mother India which was nominated in the best foreign film category.

questions.question: Shamshad Begum, one of the first women to sing playback for Hindi movies, was conferred with the prestigious OP Nayyar Award for her contribution to Hindi film Music in the year _____.
questions.explanation: 2009. Award: Padma Bhushan (2009).

questions.question: Meenakshi Srinivasan received the Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar 2011 for which of the following dance forms?
questions.explanation: Bharatanatyam. In (Last Awarded) - Durgesh Gangani (Kathak), Dr Manju Elangbam (Manipuri), Madhulita Mohapatra (Odissi) .

questions.question: Which of the following dancers of Mohiniyattam form of Indian classical dance was given the Devadasi National Award in 2013?
questions.explanation: Jayaprabha Menon. Prerana Deshpande, a kathak dancer, has been awarded the Devadasi National Award for her contribution to Kathak dance in 2016.

questions.question: Padma Shri awardee Guru Amubi Singh was conferred the award for his significant contributions in which of the following dance forms ?
questions.explanation: Manipuri. Padma Shri (1970), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1956).

questions.question: Due to the service done by the poet ___________, the Kathakali dance form received a new impetus and today, many innovations are also being made to suit the needs of a changing society.
questions.explanation: Vallathol Narayana Menon was a poet in the Malayalam Language. His famous poem is "Ente Gurunathan" ("My Great Teacher"). He was one of the triumvirate poets of modern Malayalam, along with Kumaran Asan and Ulloor S. Parameswara Iyer. Q.385. Padma Shri awardee Guru Gangadhar Pradhan is an accomplished dancer of which of the following dance forms ? SSC CHSL 25/05/2022 (Evening) (a) Manipuri (b) Kathakali (c) Odissi (d) Kathak Sol.385.(c) Odissi. He was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1998 and the Padma Shri (India's fourth highest civilian award) in 2008. Q.386. Who among the following versatile musicians of India won the Best Music Director National Award for the Hindi movie ‘Rudaali’ and was also known as the ‘Bard of Brahmaputra’? SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (Evening) (a) Bhupen Hazarika (b) Manas Robin (c) Joi Barua (d) Jayanta Hazarika Sol.386.(a) Bhupen Hazarika. He received Bharat Ratna Award in 2019. He is from Assam. Q.387. Ashish Sankrityayan is an exponent of _________ music. SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (Evening) (a) Odissi (b) Dhrupad (c) Thumri (d) Kajari Sol.387.(b) Dhrupad. In Hindustani music, there are ten main singing styles: Dhrupad, Tappa, Chaturang, Ragasagar, Dhamar, Hori, Khayal, Tarana, Sargam, and Thumri. Every composition in the Carnatic style is made up of several parts: Pallavi, Anu Pallavi, Varnam and Ragamalika.

questions.question: The nineteenth century saw the golden age of Kathak under the patronage of Wajid Ali Shah, the last Nawab of __________.
questions.explanation: Oudh. He patronised the Lucknow Gharana of Kathak. Q.389. Shobana Chandrakumar, a recipient of Padma Shri, is a dancer of which of the following Indian classical dance forms? SSC CHSL 27/05/2022 (Morning) (a) Manipuri (b) Bharatanatyam (c) Kathak (d) Odissi Sol.389.(b) Bharatnatyam. Padma Shri (2006). She won the Kalaimamani (Tamil Nadu) award in 2011. She won the Kalarathna (Kerala) award in 2013.

questions.question: The first recipient of the National Award for Best Music Direction was _______ who was honoured for his composition in the Tamil film Kandan Karunai.
questions.explanation: K. V. Mahadevan. He was again awarded the same in 1979 for Sankarabharanam (Telugu film). National Award for Best Music Direction 2019: D. Imman was awarded for Viswasam (Tamil film).

questions.question: In which of the following years did Pandit Bhimsen Gururaj Joshi give his first ever live performance?
questions.explanation: 1941. Pandit Bhimsen Gururaj Joshi was one of the greatest Indian vocalists from Karnataka and belongs to the Kirana gharana tradition of the Hindustani classical tradition. He gave his first live performance in 1941 at the age of 19.

questions.question: Who among the following Khayal singers of the 19th century was given the title of ‘Tanras” by Bahadur Shah Jaffar, the last Mughal Emperor of India?
questions.explanation: Meer Qutub Baksh. He was also a member of the Qawwal Bachchon Ka Delhi Gharana. His tomb in Hyderabad is near Khamas Shah Dargah. Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan (vocalist, from Patiala Gharana), Ustad Amir Khan (founder of the Indore gharana) and Sadarang (Khayal Gharana).

questions.question: Who among the following Indian Playback Singers holds the Guinness world record for singing the highest number of songs in one day?
questions.explanation: Kumar Sanu holds the Guinness world record for singing the highest number of 28 songs in one day in 1993. Honours- Maharashtra Ratna Awards (2014), Mahanayak Samman Lifetime Achievement: as Bengali Playback Singer (2014), Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Nobel Award (2017), Bishesh Sangeet Mahasanman (2019). Q.394. Padma Shri Guru Mayadhar Raut’s pioneering spirit revived which of the following dances in the 1950s and redefined the grammar and Abhinaya vocabulary of the dance form? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Morning) (a) Bharatanatyam (b) Odissi (c) Manipuri (d) Kuchipudi Sol.394.(b) Odissi. Guru Mayadhar Raut: Awards- Sangeet Natak Akademi Tagore Ratna (2011), Sahitya Kala Parishad Award (1984). Q.395. Who among the following Hindustani classical vocalists was awarded the Padma Bhushan by the Government of India and the title of ‘Rajya Gayika’ by the Government of Maharashtra in 1969? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Morning) (a) Gangubai Hangel (b) Sundari Dasi (c) Kesarbai Kerkar (d) Nagarathnamma Sol.395.(c) Kesarbai Kerkar was an Indian classical vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana. She was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1953, followed by Padma Bhushan, in 1969. The Maharashtra Government awarded her the title Maharashtra Rajya Gayika. Gangubai Hangal (Khyal, Kirana Gharana, Karnataka). Nagarathnamma (Carnatic Singer, Bangalore).

questions.question: Who among the following Indian Carnatic musicians received the Padma Vibhushan award in 1991 and established the Academy of Performing Arts and Research in Switzerland ?
questions.explanation: Dr. Mangalampalli Balamurali Krishna (Andhra Pradesh) was an Indian Carnatic vocalist, he also played the kanjira, mridangam, viola, and violin. He was conferred with many prestigious awards Padma Shri (1971), Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan (1991), Chevalier of the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres (2005), National Film Awards (1976, 1987), and the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1975).

questions.question: Which artist’s musical album is titled ‘Land of Gold’ ?
questions.explanation: Anoushka Shankar (British- Indian American Sitar player) won a Grammy nomination for her album, “Land of Gold”. Her other notable albums are RISE, Traveller, Traces of You, Home, and Love Letters. Anupama Bhagwat (Sitarist; ‘Confluence’, ‘Ether’, ‘Epiphany’, ‘Colours of Sunset’, ‘Sanjh’), Rajna Swaminathan (acclaimed mridangam artist), and Mita Nag (Sitarist from Bishnupur Gharana). Q.398. Famous classical dancer Vidyagauri Adkar is recognised with ______ Gharana of Indian classical dance form. SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Morning) (a) Alwar (b) Gwalior (c) Banaras (d) Jaipur Sol.398.(d) Jaipur Gharana. Vidyagauri Adkar (Mumbai) is a Kathak dance exponent in India. Other Kathak dancers of Jaipur Gharana are Sunder Prasad (Sundar Chunnilal Prasad), Puru Dadheech, and Mangala Bhatt.

questions.question: Guru Shyama Charan Pati, was conferred the Padma Shri for his contributions to mainly which of the following dance forms?
questions.explanation: Chhau nritya, a martial dance form of India. He was awarded the Padma Shri, in 2006, for his contributions to Indian dance.

questions.question: Pandit Sunder Prasad who was awarded with the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1959 was a ______ dancer.
questions.explanation: Kathak. Pandit Sunder Prasad was a guru (teacher) of Jaipur Gharana. He was honoured by Natak Academy of Delhi in 1958.

questions.question: Who among the following won the first National Film Award for Best Choreography in 1992?
questions.explanation: Laxmibai Kolhapurkar. Raju Sundaram won 67th National Award in choreography for Movie Maharshi. Q.402. Sartaj Khan, Sarwar Khan, Swaroop Khan and Mame Khan are famous for which of the following? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Evening) (a) Rajasthani folk music (b) Hindustani classical vocal (c) Playing percussion instruments (d) Playing string instruments Sol.402.(a) Rajasthani folk music. The most famous Rajasthani Maand singer is Allah Jilai Bai (Bikaner Gharana). Other Rajasthani folk singers are Ila Arun, Rapperiya Baalam, and Rajnigandha Shekhawat.

questions.question: Which of the following Hindustani musical Gharanas is the oldest among all the Khayal Gayaki styles?
questions.explanation: Gwalior vocal Gharana is widely regarded as the oldest Gharana founded by Nathan Pir Bakhsh and Utsad Nathu khan. Famous artists include Dr. Meeta Pandit, Ustad Bade Inayat Hussain Khan, Krishnarao Shankar Pandit, Narayanrao Bodas, etc. Founders of Agra Gharana (Hajisujan Khan), Kirana (Abdul Wahid Khan) and Atrauli (Alladiya Khan). Q.404. The important singers of _________Gharana are Faiyyaz Khan, Latafat Hussein Khan and Dinkar Kakini. SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Evening) (a) Patiala (b) Mewati (c) Agra (d) Benaras Sol.404.(c) Agra Gharana is a tradition of Hindustani classical vocal music descended from the Nauhar Bani (during the reign of Emperor Alauddin Khilji of Delhi). Some prominent exponents are Faiyaz Khan “Prempiya", Vilayat Hussain Khan "Pran Piya", Khadim Hussain Khan "Sajan Piya", Sharafat Hussain Khan "Prem Rang", Shrikrishna Narayan Ratanjankar "Sujan", Babanrao Haldankar "Raspiya'', Zohrabai, etc. Q.405. Who among the following is known as a vocalist in Carnatic Music? SSC CHSL 01/06/2022 (Morning) (a) Gangubai Hangal (b) GN Balasubramaniam (c) Kaushiki Chakraborty (d) Girija Devi Sol.405.(b) GN Balasubramaniam- Carnatic Vocalist. Five famous Carnatic Singers - Aruna Sairam, M. Balamuralikrishna, M. S. Subbulakshmi, Nithyasree Mahadevan, Semmangudi Srinivasa Iyer etc.

questions.question: In India, the tradition of singing ghazal was established by _________.
questions.explanation: Hazrat Amir Khusrau. He is called the father of qawwali. He is known as the Parrot of India. Famous Books written by him are Tughlaqnama, Nuh - sipihr and Khaizan-ul-futuh.

questions.question: Manjamma Jogati became India’s first transgender folk dancer to receive a Padma Shri honour for her contribution to art in the year ____.
questions.explanation: 2021. She was awarded Padma Shri for her contribution to the field of folk arts. First transgender Padma Shri Awardee (Narthaki Nataraj; Bharatnatyam dancer; 2019)

questions.question: Who among the following wrote two books on the history and dance structure of Mohiniyattam?
questions.explanation: Kalamandalam Kalyanikutty Amma. She got several titles and awards which are "Kavayithri' title given by Vallathol (1940), Sangeet Natak Akademi fellowship (1974), Kerala Sangeet Natak Akademi fellowship (1974), 'Keerthi Shanku' title given by Kerala Kalamandalam (1980), 'Nrittapraveena' title by Kerala Fine Arts Society (1984), Kerala Sahitya Academy award (1985).

questions.question: Malka Jaan of Agra Gharana was the court musician at the durbar of which of the following Nawabs of Calcutta?

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a stringed instrument ?
