questions.question: Bharat Muni, in his Natya Shastra, categorises musical instruments into four different parts. What is the categorisation of musical instruments by Bharat Muni based on?

options.a: Different sounds of the musical instruments
options.b: The shape of the musical instruments
options.c: Different materials used in the musical instruments
options.d: The uses of the musical instruments in different occasions, such as wedding, festivals and public gathering

questions.explanation: Different sounds of the musical instruments. Musical Instruments were categorised into four groups in Bharat Muni's Natya Shastra (written between 200 BC and 200 AD): Avanaddha Vadya (membranophones or percussion instruments), Ghan Vadya (idiophones or solid instruments), Sushir Vadya (aerophones or wind instruments), and Tat Vadya (chordophones or stringed instruments).

Other famous players: Guitar - Susmit Sen, Amyt Datta, Kapil Srivastava.

questions.question: Bundu Khan was a _________ player of Delhi gharana.
questions.explanation: sarangi. Bundu Khan was trained by his grandfather Saungi Khan. Some sarangi players from the Delhi gharana: Shahnawaz Khan, Nabeel Khan, Sabri Khan, Abdul Latif Khan.

questions.question: Anantha R Krishnan is associated with which musical instrument ?
questions.explanation: Mridangam - Percussion instrument. Mridangam - KV Prasad, SV Rajarao, Umalayapuram Sivaraman, Palghat Mani Iyer. Q.477. The famous musician Vishnu Govind Jog is primarily associated with which of the following musical instruments? Higher Secondary 21/06/2024 (Shift - 2) (a) Violin (b) Flute (c) Tabla (d) Veena Sol.477.(a) Violin. Violin - M.S. Gopalakrishnan, N.R. Muralidharan, M. Chandrasekharan, Lalgudi Jayaraman. Q.478. Mohan Shyam Sharma is a famous musician associated with the : Higher Secondary 24/06/2024 (Shift - 2) (a) Tabla (b) Sarod (c) Pakhawaj (d) Drums Sol.478.(c) Pakhawaj. It is a two-headed drum descended from the much older mridangam, which produces a deeper tone than the more popular tabla. Some notable Pakhawaj Players: Shankarrao Ghorpadkar; Dr. Anil Chaudhury. Q.479. The famous musician Aban Mistry is associated with which instrument ? Higher Secondary 25/06/2024 (Shift - 2) (a) Flute (b) Tabla (c) Shehnai (d) Drums Sol.479.(b) Tabla (Percussion instrument). Aban Mistry known as the first woman solo tabla player in India. Instruments and their exponents - Tabla: Zakir Hussain, Allah Rakha, Pt. Kishan Maharaj. Flute: Hari Prasad Chaurasia, Pannalal Ghosh. Shehnai: Bismillah Khan, Krishna Ram Chaudhary. Guitar: Braj Bhushan Kabra.

questions.question: Padma Shri Awardee Gosaveedu Shaik Hassan is known for playing:
questions.explanation: Nadaswaram is a double reed wind instrument from South India. Gosaveedu Shaik Hassan received Padma Shri Award in 2022. Musical Instruments and Exponents: Nadaswaram - Umapathy Kandasamy, Karukurichi Arunachalam, Namagiripettai Krishnan. Ghatam - T. H. Vinayakram, Giridhar Udupa. Violin - Gajananrao Joshi, Sangeeta Shankar, N. Rajam. Veena - Jayanthi Kumaresh, Sundaram Balchander, Veenai Dhanammal. Q.481. Who among the following musicians played Carnatic music with Ghatam? Higher Secondary 26/06/2024 (Shift - 2) (a) Ramnad Raghavan (b) TH Vinayakram (c) Ali Akbar Khan (d) KV Prasad Sol.481.(b) TH Vinayakram. He is also known as Vikku Vinayakram, is an Indian percussionist revered as the "God of Ghatam." The ghatam is a clay pot used in various musical repertoires, particularly in South India. Q.482. Uppalapu Shrinivas was a _________ player who was awarded with the Padma Shri in 1998. Graduate Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 3) (a) veena (b) violin (c) mandolin (d) tabla Sol.482.(c) mandolin - stringed musical instrument. Uppalapu Srinivas: Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2009). Some other musicians and instruments: Veena - D. Balakrishna, Raghunath Manet, Mangalam Muthuswamy. Violin - Abhijith P. S. Nair, Ambi Subramaniam, Arrol Carelli. Tabla - Ustad Zakir Hussain, Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri.

questions.question: Pandit Ram Narayan, who was awarded the Pandit Bhimsen Joshi Lifetime Achievement Award for 2015–2016, is a _______ player
questions.explanation: Sol.483. (c) sarangi. Ram Narayan awards - Padma Shri (1976), Padma Bhushan (1991) and Padma Vibhushan (2005). Other famous Sarangi Players: Shakoor Khan, Ramesh Mishra, Sultan Khan.

questions.question: Prabhat Sarma, a recipient of Sangeet Natak Akademi Award, was a _______ player from Assam.
questions.explanation: Flute. Prabhat Sarma’s awards:- Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2003), Asom Shilpi Diwas Award by the Assam government (2001). Flute is the part of the woodwind family group.

questions.question: Famous musician Talvin Singh is associated with playing the____.
questions.explanation: Tabla. Other tabla players: Zakir Hussain, Ustad Allah Rakha, Pandit Shankar Ghosh, Pandit Udhai Mazumdar, Pandit Vijay Ghate. Q.486. Neeruswamy Pillai and Rajaratanam Pillai are exponents of which musical instrument? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening) (a) Mridangam (b) Mandolin (c) Nadaswaram (d) Sarangi Sol.486.(c) Nadaswaram. It is a double reed wind instrument from South India. Other Exponents - Sheik Chinna Moulana, Karukurichi Arunachalam, Thiruvizha Jayashankar, and Namagiripettai Krishnan.

questions.question: Who among the following Indian musicians is the inventor of Mohan Veena?
questions.explanation: Pandit Vishwa Mohan Bhatt. Awards - Grammy Award (1994) for Best Global Music Album (A Meeting by the River), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1998), Padma Shri (2002), Padma Bhushan (2017). Other Mohan veena players - Harry Manx, Matt Malley. Totaram Sharma (pakhawaj player). Brij Bhushan Kabra (guitar player). Sandeep Das (tabla player). Q.488. Ustad Akbar Ali Khan is remembered for his contribution to which of the following musical instruments? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (2nd shift) (a) Tabla (b) Santoor (c) Sitar (d) Sarod Sol.488.(d) Sarod. Akbar Ali Khan (Maihar gharana). Awards- Padma Bhushan (1967), Padma Vibhushan (1989). Famous Players (Sarod): Amjad Ali Khan, Buddhadev Das Gupta, Tejendra Majumdar, Allauddin Khan.

questions.question: RK Bijapure played which of the following musical instruments?
questions.explanation: Harmonium. R K Bijapure (1985 - "Karnataka Kala Tilak" by Sangeet Nritya Academy). Harmonium - Purushottam Walawalkar, Appa Jalgaonkar. Ravanahatha - Dinesh Subasinghe.

questions.question: Which musical instrument Dr A P J Abdul Kalam, former President of India, used to play ?
questions.explanation: Veena (Stringed instrument). APJ Abdul Kalam : He served as the 11th president of India and known as the Missile Man of India. Exponents of Veena : Rajhesh Vaidhya, Jayanthi Kumaresh, Veena E. Gayathri, Emani Sankara Sastry. Q.491. Ramnad V Raghavan is associated with which of the following musical instruments? SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (1st shift) (a) Mridangam (b) Flute (c) Sitar (d) Sarod Sol.491.(a) Mridangam. Famous Mridangam Players: A.V. Anand, Muthiah Bhagavatar, Guruvayur Dorai, Palghat Mani Iyer Karaikudi Mani, T. K. Murthy.

questions.question: Totaram Sharma is associated with which of the following instruments?
questions.explanation: Pakhawaj is a barrel-shaped, two-headed drum, originating from the Indian subcontinent. Totaram Sharma received Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2011). Famous Pakhawaj Players: Pandit Purushottam Das, Mohan Shyam Sharma, Bhavani Shankar, Pandit Prem Vallabh. Q.493. The musician Sivamani is associated with which musical instrument? SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (4th shift) (a) Drums (b) Violin (c) Shehnai (d) Sarod Sol.493.(a) Drums. Awards - Kalaimamani (2009), Padma Shri (2019).

questions.question: Select the correct sequence of the musical instruments according to the given sequence of their associated personalities : Ustad Allah Rakha, Totaram Sharma, TH Vinayakam.
questions.explanation: Tabla, Pakhawaj, Ghatam. Tabla is the most famous percussion instrument of North India. Pakhawaj is an ancient drum, it is the preferred percussion instrument of the ancient singing style called Dhrupad. A Ghatam is a large, narrow-mouthed earthenware pot used as a percussion instrument.

questions.question: Tansen, who was included in the Navaratnas of Akbar, was an expert in playing which of the following musical instruments?
questions.explanation: Rabab (String instrument). Tansen (Ramtanu Pandey) - A Hindustani classical musician also known as Sangeeth Samrat or Mian (Learned One). Tansen Samaroh is celebrated every year in the month of December in Gwalior district. Q.496. The famous musician, Faiyaz Khan is associated with which musical instrument? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Shehnai (b) Veena (c) Tabla (d) Sitar Sol.496.(c) Tabla (Membranophone percussion instrument). The Maharaja of Mysore awarded him the title "Aftab - e - Mausiqi" (the Sun of Music) in 1908.

questions.question: Select the Indian musician who is associated with percussion instruments (played by striking).
questions.explanation: Pandit Ayodhya Prasad. Percussion Instruments:- Ghatam - TH Vinayakram, EM Subramaniam, Mridangam- Dakshinamurthy Pillai, Rajna Swaminathan. String Instruments :- Guitar - Braj Bhushan Kabra. Q.498. Which of the following instruments is performed by Nandini and Ragini Shankar ? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 2) (a) Veena (b) Sitar (c) Violin (d) Mridangam Sol.498.(c) Violin. Other Exponents - Jyotsna Srikanth, Abhijith P.S. Nair, L. Subramaniam, K. Vaidyanathan, Nagai R Muralidharan, Mohanan Chandrasekaran.

questions.question: Which of the following music instruments are solid instruments?
questions.explanation: Ghana Vadya. Solid instruments are usually played with a striker or hammer. These instruments are not capable of producing definite pitches that are required for creating a melody. That is why their use is limited in classical music. Tata Vadya - These are Stringed instruments. Avanaddha Vadya - These are percussion instruments. Sushira Vadya - These are wind instruments. The Shehnai is a popular wind instrument in India.

questions.question: The shehnai is a reed instrument with how many holes along the tubes?
questions.explanation: Seven. Shehnai - It is a reed instrument in which there are seven holes along the tube which are used for playing the melody by opening and closing them with the fingers. It is known as Mangal Vadya. It is considered to have come to India from West Asia. In the early fifties of this century, Ustad Bismillah Khan is credited for popularising this instrument. Pt. Anant Lal and Pt. Daya Shankar is also a noted Shehnai player.

questions.question: What is Tat Vadya ?
questions.explanation: Stringed instruments. Tata Vadya - Sound produced by vibration of a string or chord. Example - Veena, Sitar, Sarangi etc. The Percussion Instruments - Congo, Bongo, Djembe, Darbukas, Hand Drums and Tongue Drums. Idiophones or Ghana Vadya are solid instruments that do not need any further tuning. Examples - Piccolo, Manjira, Jaltarang, Jhanj and Chimta. Wind instruments - woodwinds, such as the flute, clarinet, oboe, and bassoon, also include brass instruments like horn and trumpet.

questions.question: Flute instruments come under which type of instrument category ?
questions.explanation: Sushira Vadya (Wind instrument). Example - Flute, Shehnai, Nadaswaram. Ghana Vadya - Considered to be the world's first instrument. It does not require tuning. Example - Manjira, Khartal, Chimta, Ghatam, Jaltarang etc. Avanaddha Vadya - Sound produced by striking on animal skin. Example - Tabla, Mridangam, Dhol, Damru etc.

questions.question: Bickram Ghosh, a recipient of Global Indian Music Award, is a music composer and an Indian classical _________ player.
questions.explanation: Tabla. On 1 October 2012, Ghosh won the 2012 Global Indian Music Academy (GIMA) Awards in the Best Pop/Rock Single category for his composition, Vande Mataram.

questions.question: Rajeev Taranath, a disciple of Ali Akbar Khan, is a ________ player.
questions.explanation: Sarod. He is conferred with many awards such as the Padma Shri (2019), Sangeet Vidhwan Award (2018), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1999-2000), Sangeet Nritya Akademi Award (1993), Karnataka Rajya Prashasti (1996). Q.505. Pandit Ananda Gopal Bandopadhyay was a _________ player of the Banaras gharana. SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Evening) (a) sarangi (b) sarod (c) sitar (d) tabla Sol.505.(d) Tabla. In 1965, he won the first prize in The All India Radio music competition, and was awarded the President's Gold Medal. In 2012, he was awarded the Sangeet Ratna Award by the Salt Lake Music Association. Q.506. Who among the following is India’s only publicly well-known woman shehnai player? SSC CHSL 06/06/2022 (Morning) (a) Gauhar Jaan (b) Binodini Dasi (c) Bageshwari Qamar (d) Rasoolan Bai Sol.506.(c) Bageshwari Qamar. Gauhar Jaan was an Indian singer (thumri, Dadra, kajri, and Tarana) and dancer from Kolkata. Binodini Dasi was an Indian Bengali actress and thespian. Rasoolan Hussain was a leading Indian Hindustani classical music vocalist, belonging to the Benaras Gharana.

questions.question: Padma Bhushan awardee Pandit Nikhil Jyoti Ghosh was a _________ player.
questions.explanation: Tabla. Pandit Nikhil Jyoti Ghosh was an Indian musician known for his proficiency on the percussion instrument tabla. He was awarded the Padma Bhushan (1990) and the Ustad Hafiz Ali Khan Award (1995).

questions.question: Who among the following is an outstanding player to have mastered the surbahar instrument ?
questions.explanation: Ustad Imrat Khan. He was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1988), and the Padma Shri award (2017).

questions.question: Lalgudi Gopala Iyer Jayaraman used to play which of the following instruments?
questions.explanation: Violin. Lalgudi Gopala Iyer Jayaraman was an Indian Carnatic violinist, vocalist and composer. He was awarded the Padma Shri (1972), Padma Bhushan (2001) and National Film Award (Best Music Direction; Sringaram; 2006). Q.510. Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri is associated with _________ instrument. SSC CHSL 10/06/2022 (Morning) (a) veena (b) harmonium (c) tabla (d) bansuri Sol.510.(c) Tabla. Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri: Awards - Sangeet Natak Academy Award (1996), Padma Shri (2019).

questions.question: Which of the following musical instruments did Dwaram Venkataswamy Naidu play?
questions.explanation: Violin. His Awards - Padma Shri (1957), Sangeeta Kalanidhi (1941), Kalaprapoorna (1950), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1953), Raja - Lakshmi Award (1992).

questions.question: Which of the following is not a percussion instrument?
questions.explanation: Sarod. The percussion family of musical instruments consists of membranophones and idiophones. Examples- Ghatam, Tabla, Mridangam, timpani, xylophone, cymbals, snare drum, bass drum, tambourine, maracas, gongs, chimes, celesta, and piano. Sarod, stringed musical instrument of the lute family.

questions.question: Which of the following musical instruments is also known as a ‘Mangal Vadya’ ?
questions.explanation: Shehnai. Ustad Bismillah Khan is a famous Shehnai Player. Shehnai is a wind instrument made of wood and metal. Q.514. A distinct ‘Dhrupad style’ is associated with the ______ gharana. SSC CGL 21/04/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Ajrada (b) Nathdwara (c) Jafferkhani (d) Bishnupur Sol.514.(d) Bishnupur. Tansen was a famous Dhrupad instrument player. It is the oldest known style of major vocal styles associated with Hindustani classical music, Haveli Sangeet of Pushtimarg Sampraday and also related to the South Indian Carnatic tradition. Q.515. Which of the following instruments is normally played in a vertical position and with an arched bow? SSC MTS 08/10/2021 (Evening) (a) Sitar (b) Sarangi (c) Shehnai (d) Veena Sol.515.(b) Sarangi. The Sarangi is a fretless, bowed string instrument used in Hindustani classical music and folk traditions of north India. Q.516. 'Ponu Yoksi', a sword like instrument used during ceremonial dances performed by the priests, belongs to: SSC MTS 26/10/2021 (Morning) (a) Himachal Pradesh (b) Madhya Pradesh (c) Uttar Pradesh (d) Arunachal Pradesh Sol.516.(d) Arunachal Pradesh. Some popular instruments (Arunachal Pradesh) include drums, cymbals, Ujuk Tapu, Ame Bali, Emul, Pui, Kiring, Guga etc.

questions.question: 'Chinkara' is a ______ musical instrument popular in the state of Madhya Pradesh.
questions.explanation: Stringed. It is made of parchment, wood and steel. This instrument is used by the ‘Pradhan’ community of Madhya Pradesh and the ‘Meo’ community of Rajasthan.

questions.question: The traditional binding instrument called "Pena" is related to which of the following state ?
questions.explanation: Manipur. Pena is also known as Tingtelia is a mono string instrument falling in the lute category, similar to some of the traditional Indian stringed musical instruments such as Ravanahatha, Ubo or the Kenda, found in various parts of the country.

questions.question: The musical instrument 'Kartal' from the state of Rajasthan comes under the category of ______.
questions.explanation: Idiophone is a percussion instrument. It is classified as an idiophone because the entire instrument vibrates to produce a sound on its own.

questions.question: The ______ is a single string musical instrument made using bamboo and a gourd, mostly used by traditional folk singers in Maharashtra.
questions.explanation: Ektara is a drone flute consisting of a gourd resonator covered with skin, through which a bamboo neck is inserted. Ektara means “one string”.

questions.question: 'Khuang' is a traditional musical instrument of which state?
questions.explanation: Mizoram. It is made up of a hollow tree, wrapped on both sides with animal skin. Q.522. The wood of which of the following trees is used to make the large plucked string instrument used in Carnatic classical music known as Bobbili Veena/Saraswathi Veena? SSC CGL 09/03/2020 (Morning) (a) Teak wood (b) Jackfruit wood (c) Walnut wood (d) Sandal wood Sol.522.(b) Jackfruit wood. Bobbili Veena is carved from a single piece of jackfruit wood.

questions.question: The birth anniversary of Lord Jhulelal of the Sindhi community is also known as_________.
questions.explanation: Cheti Chand marks the beginning of the Lunar Hindu New Year for Sindhi Hindus. Celebrated on the first day of the Sindhi month of Chet (Chaitra) as per the lunisolar Hindu calendar. This festival symbolizes new beginnings and holds deep spiritual significance for the Sindhi community. Q.524. Kharchi Puja of Tripura is celebrated in the month of __________. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Afternoon) (a) September-October (b) April-May (c) January-February (d) July-August Sol.524.(d) July - August. Kharchi Puja occurs during the month of ‘Ashad’ on the ‘Shukla Ashtami’ day. It is also known as the 'Festival of Gods,' this traditional event centers around the worship of Chaturdasa Devata, housed in the ancient Ujjayanta Palace, the ancestral deity of the Tripuri people. Other Festivals of Tripura: Pilak, Garia Puja, Bijhu, Owa.

questions.question: Where is the Kala Ghoda Arts Festival organised every year?
questions.explanation: Mumbai. The Kala Ghoda Arts Festival, initiated in 1999, is a nine-day annual celebration of arts organized by the Kala Ghoda Association. Other festivals in Mumbai: Dahi Handi Festival, Ganesh Chaturthi/Ganeshotsav, Banganga Festival, Elephanta Festival.

questions.question: Losoong festival is predominantly celebrated in Sikkim by which of the following tribes?
questions.explanation: Bhutia. Losoong, also called Namsoong by the Lepchas in the Sikkimese, is usually the time when the farmers rejoice and celebrate their harvest. Festivals of Sikkim and Community: Barahimizong (Mangar), Sonam Lochar (Tamang), Tamu Lochar (Gurung), Teyongsi Srijunga Sawan Tongnam (Limboo).

questions.question: ‘Dashain’ and ‘Tihar’ are popular festivals of which neighbouring country of India?
questions.explanation: Nepal. Dashain Festival, also known as Vijaya Dashami, is celebrated by Hindus. Tihar, also known as Deepawali or Yamapanchak. Festivals of Nepal: Biska Jatra, Gai Jatra, Indra Jatra, Maghe Sankranti, Pahan Charhe, Chhechu. Sri Lanka - Kandy Esala Perahera, Poson Poya, Vel Festival. Bangladesh - Shakrain, Pahela Baishakh. Pakistan - Shandur Polo Festival, Mela Chiraghan, Urs of Data Ganj Bakhsh. Q.528. In which of the following states is Aoleang Monyü celebrated, which is an ancient spring festival celebrated by all Konyaks in the month of April? SSC MTS 23/10/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Bihar (b) Telangana (c) Odisha (d) Nagaland Sol.528.(d) Nagaland. Aoleang is observed to mark the end of the old year and to welcome the new-year beginning with spring. This festival is celebrated annually as part of the Mini Hornbill Tribal Festival. Festivals of Nagaland: Hornbill, Sekrenyi, Moatsu Mong, Suhkruhnye, Bushu, Yemshe, Metumniu, Metemneo, Ngada, Tokhu Emong.

questions.question: Vangpui Kut festival is organised for _______ days in Mizoram to celebrate the glory of Mizo culture and traditions.
questions.explanation: 2. Vangpui Kut has been celebrated at Dungtlang village in Champai District since 1984. Festivals of Mizoram: Pawl Kut - It is a thanksgiving festival celebrated for 2 days after the harvest. Chapchar Kut - It is a thanksgiving festival celebrated after clearing the jungles for Jhum cultivation. Mim Kut - It is celebrated to pay respects to the departed souls of the previous year by offering them bread, maize, vegetables and other items. Khuado Kut - It is a thanksgiving ceremony observed on a full moon nights after the harvest.

questions.question: ‘Attolu Eidu' is the cultural festival of which of the following union territories?
questions.explanation: Lakshadweep. Attolu Eidu festival was conducted across Lakshadweep Island, at locations such as Minicoy, Kalpeni, Amini, Kiltanam and Kavaratt. Q.531. Which of the following folk dances is conducted during the Bwisagu Festival? SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Bhortal (b) Jhumur (c) Bagurumba (d) Bihu dance Sol.531.(c) Bagurumba. Bwisagu is the springtime festival of the Bodo community that marks the beginning of the New Year in the month of Baisakh (mid-April). The Bagurumba dance or 'Butterfly Dance,' is performed by Bodo women. The Bagurumba dance is a celebration of life, nature, and the vibrant culture of the Bodo tribe. Bhortal Nritya (Assam) - Performed by Barpeta tribe , Jhumur dance (Assam) - Performed by the Kulis (tea tribe). Q.532. Lathmar Holi is primarily celebrated in the state of: SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Karnataka (b) Arunachal Pradesh (c) Uttar Pradesh (d) Himachal Pradesh Sol.532.(c) Uttar Pradesh. Lathmar Holi is celebrated in the twin towns of Barsana and Nandgaon, also known as the towns of Radha and Krishna respectively. Famous festivals of Uttar Pradesh - Gaurav Mahotsav, Ramotsav, Taj Mahotsav, Ayodhya Deepotsav, Ganga Mahotsav. Arunachal Pradesh - Sangken, Mopin, Pongtu. Himachal Pradesh - Halda, Doongri, Chet Festival, Kullu Dussehra. Karnataka - Ugadi, Mysuru Dasara, Kambala, Gowri Habba. Q.533. Which of the following celebrations is dedicated to Sun God and his wife Usha to thank them for sustaining life on earth and for granting wishes? SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Madai Festival (b) Chhath Puja (c) Vishwakarma Puja (d) Sorath Sabha Sol.533.(b) Chhath Puja (main festival of Bihar) is a four-day long strict and spiritual observance. The first day of the Chhath Puja includes taking a dip in the holy river/any water body. The second day of Chhath, also known as Kharna, involves devotees observing a day-long fast. The third day of Chhath goes in the preparation of the prasad (offerings) for the evening offerings, also known as Sanjhiya Arghya. On the fourth and final day of Chhath, family members and friends go to the banks of rivers before sunrise and make offerings (Arghya) to the rising sun.

questions.question: ‘Nuakhai’ is the state festival of:
questions.explanation: Odisha. Nuakhai is an annual harvest, marking the arrival of the new rice season. It is observed on Panchami Tithi (fifth day) of the lunar fortnight of Bhadrava (August-September), the day after Ganesh Chaturthi. Other festivals: Odisha - Ratha Yatra, Raja Parba, Chandan Yatra, Bali Jatra.

questions.question: Which of the following festivals is celebrated as the birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev?
questions.explanation: Gurpurab. Guru Nanak Jayanti, also known as Gurpurab, celebrates the birth anniversary of the first Sikh Guru, Guru Nanak Dev. This festival occurs on Kartik Poornima, the fifteenth lunar day of the month of Kartik, typically in November on the Gregorian calendar. Hola Mohalla, or Hola, is a three-day Sikh festival that usually takes place in March. Vaisakhi, celebrated on April 13 or sometimes April 14, marks the first day of the month of Vaisakh. Chhapar Mela, a popular Punjabi fair, occurs annually in September in the village of Chhapar in the Ludhiana district of Punjab.

questions.question: Harela is a festival of greenery, peace, prosperity, and environmental conservation, primarily celebrated in which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Uttarakhand. Harela, meaning "Day of Green," marks the new harvest brought by the rainy season and is celebrated annually during the Shravan month in the Kumaon region. Important Indian Festivals - Uttarakhand : Phool Dei, Olgia/Ghee Sankranti, Bat Savitri, Ganga Dussehra/Dasar, Nanda Devi Rajjaat. Assam : Ambubachi festival, Bihu, Majuli festival. Madhya Pradesh : Khajuraho festival, Lokrang Festival, Bhagoria Haat Festival.

questions.question: ‘Sangken’ is a festival celebrated in Arunachal Pradesh by people of which of the following religions?
questions.explanation: Buddhism. Sangken (festival of water) is an annual three-day long festival. The Khampti and Singpho tribes of the Lohit district in Arunachal Pradesh celebrate it. It is celebrated by the Theravada Buddhist Communities. It is celebrated as Songkran in other Southeast Asian countries. Songkran is the Thai New Year’s national holiday. More Buddhists festivals include Buddha Purnima, Hemis Festival, Losar Festival, Lumbini Festival, Parinirvana Day, Rumtek Chaam Festival and Mani Rimdu Festival. Q.538. Shab-e-Barat is celebrated by which religious group? SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Muslim (b) Buddhist (c) Jain (d) Parsi Sol.538.(a) Muslim. Shab-e-Barat, also known as Mid-Sha'ban, is observed on the 15th night of Sha'ban in the Islamic calendar. Festivals celebrated by : Muslim - Eid al-Fitr, Eid al-Adha etc; Buddhist - Buddha Purnima, Vesak etc; Jain - Mahavir Jayanti, Paryushana etc; Parsi - Navroz, Jamshedi Navroz etc.

questions.question: In which state/UT is the Hemis festival celebrated?
questions.explanation: Ladakh. Festivals in India: Ladakh: Sindhu Darshan Festival, Losar Festival, Tak-Thok, Matho Nagrang.

questions.question: Thrissur Pooram is one of the famous temple festivals celebrated in _______.
questions.explanation: Kerala. Thrissur Pooram is celebrated in the Malayalam month of Medam (April-May). Other festivals: Kerala - Onam, Vishu, Attukal Pongala.

questions.question: The festival of ‘Rath Yatra’ of Puri in Odisha is dedicated to which deity?
questions.explanation: Lord Jagannath. Rath Yatra Festival : Celebrated on the second day of the bright fortnight in the month of Ashadha, this festival features a public procession with three large chariots carrying the deities Jagannath, Balabhadra, Subhadra. Q.542 Paryushana festival is celebrated by the people of which of the following communities? SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Jain (b) Muslim (c) Hindu (d) Sikh Sol.542.(a) Jain. This 8-10 days festival inspires Jains worldwide to remember the roots and philosophies of Jainism. Celebrating paryushan also brings a social purpose as well. Other Religious festivals : Jain - Mahavir Jayanti, Rohini Vrat, Samvatsari, Meru Trayodashi etc. Muslim - Eid ul Fitr, Eid ul Adha, Ramadan, Muharram etc. Sikh - Hola Mohalla, Vaisakhi, Maghi etc. Hindu - Holi, Diwali, Rakshabndahn etc.

questions.question: Which of the following festivals is celebrated in Madhya Pradesh?
questions.explanation: Khajuraho Dance Festival - Organized by the Kala Parishad of the Madhya Pradesh government. It is a seven-day long festival which usually takes place from the 20th of February to the 26th of February. It is held at Khajuraho temples. It was started in 1975. Some festivals which have been organized in Madhya Pradesh are Jal Mahotsav, Mandu Mahotsav, Orchha Mahotsav, Satpura Cycle Safari, Heritage Run. Q.544. Kajari Mahotsav is primarily celebrated in which of the following districts of Uttar Pradesh? SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) Mirzapur (b) Gorakhpur (c) Kushi Nagar (d) Jhansi Sol.544.(a) Mirzapur. The festival is celebrated in honor of King Kantit Naresh's daughter, Kajali, renowned for her melodious love songs. Other major festivals in Uttar Pradesh include Ganga Mahotsav in Varanasi and Taj Mahotsav in Agra. Q.545. The chariot festival is dedicated to Lord Jagannath along with Subhadra and _________ . SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Balabhadra (b) Sudama (c) Hanuman (d) Arjuna Sol.545.(a) Balabhadra. Lord Jagannath, his brother Balabhadra, and his sister Subhadra are a trio of deities worshiped at the Jagannath temple (Puri, Odisha). It is one of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites. The temple was built on the basis of Kalinga architecture. Q.546. Navratri festival is dedicated to which of the following Goddesses? SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Jawala (b) Laxmi (c) Durga (d) Saraswati Sol.546.(c) Durga. Navratri, meaning ‘nine nights’ in Sanskrit, is a festival where people fast and pray to the nine forms of Goddess Durga, an incarnation of Parvati, who defeated Mahishasura. The two popular folk dances of Gujarat, the Garba and Dandia are performed by both men and women during this occasion on every night.

questions.question: In which of the following states is Me - dam - me - phi festival primarily celebrated?
questions.explanation: Assam. Me-Dam-Me-Phi is a community festival celebrated by the Ahom people in memory of their dearly departed. ‘Me’ means offering, ‘Dam’ means ancestors and ‘Phi’ means god. The major festivals celebrated in Assam are Bihu, Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Bohaggiyo Bishu, and Ambubashi Mela. Q.548. ‘Atla Taddi’ is the widely celebrated festival of which Indian state? SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) West Bengal (b) Punjab (c) Bihar (d) Andhra Pradesh Sol.548.(d) Andhra Pradesh. Atla Taddi, a traditional Hindu festival where women pray to Goddess Gauri for marital blessings. It occurs on the third night after the full moon in the Aswiyuja month, usually in September or October. Other festivals of Andhra Pradesh: Ugadi, Ratha Saptami, Tirupati Ganga Jatara, Pyditthallamma utsavam, Rottela Panduga (Rotiyaan ki Eid), Visakha Utsav, Lumbini festival.

questions.question: Kati Bihu is celebrated in which of the following months in Assam?
questions.explanation: October. Kati Bihu is one of the three Bihu festivals celebrated in Assam. Kati means to cut and this day marks the time of relocation of rice saplings. It is also known as Kongali Bihu. There are another two Bihu festivals celebrated in Assam - Bhogali (Magh Bihu) is observed in January and Rongali (Bohag Bihu) is observed in April. Other festivals of Assam: Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Bohaggiyo Bishu, Ambubashi Mela and Jonbill Mela. Q.550. Which of the following is a festival primarily celebrated in the state of Odisha? SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) Baishagu (b) Chhath (c) Raja Parba (d) Me-Dam-Me-Phi Sol.550.(c) Raja Parba. It is a unique festival celebrating the onset of the monsoon and the earth’s womanhood. It is held for three days in the month of June. Odisha's famous festivals include Konark Dance Festival, Kalinga Mahotsava, Durga Puja, Chhau Festival, Puri Beach Festival, Nuakhai, Pakhala Dibasa, and Laxmi Puja.

questions.question: By what name is the festival of Makar Sankranti celebrated in Assam?
questions.explanation: Magh Bihu. Makar Sankranti is celebrated in January and marks the transition of the sun into the zodiac sign Capricorn (Makar). This event symbolizes the end of winter and the beginning of longer days, as the sun starts moving northward (known as Uttarayana). The festival is celebrated under various names in different parts of India -Makar Sankranti: Kerala, Odisha, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Goa, and West Bengal. Maghi Saaji: Himachal Pradesh. Sakrat: Haryana and Rajasthan. Thai Pongal: Tamil Nadu (celebrated as a harvest festival). Ghughuti: Uttarakhand. Dahi Chura: Bihar (the traditional dish eaten during this festival). Khichdi Parv: Uttar Pradesh (where khichdi is prepared as part of the celebrations). Uttarayan: Gujarat (popular for the kite-flying tradition).

questions.question: Which of the following festivals observed in Assam is majorly celebrated by Vaishnavites?
questions.explanation: Doljatra (Dol Purnima) is a Hindu festival that celebrates the love between Radha and Krishna, observed on the full moon day of the Falgun month. Bihu consists of three festivals - Rongali, Kongali, and Bhogali - celebrated by all Assamese people, regardless of religion. Ambubachi Mela is held at the Kamakhya Temple in Guwahati, dedicated to Goddess Kamakhya, a Shakti deity.

questions.question: Makar Sankranti is the festival dedicated to which of the following Lords?
questions.explanation: Surya. Makar Sankranti signifies the entry of the Sun into the zodiac sign of Makara or Capricorn. Festivals related to Lord Surya: Ratha Saptami, Chhath, Pongal, Mitrotsavam. The festival dedicated to Lord Ganesha is Ganesh Chaturthi. Indra Jatra is a festival in Sikkim that celebrates Lord Indra. The festivals related to the moon are Eid, Guru Purnima, Karwachauth.

questions.question: Bihu festival is the main festival of which state?
questions.explanation: Assam. Bihu occurs three times a year: Bhogali Bihu (January) marks the harvest's end, Rongali Bihu (April) celebrates the Assamese New Year and the harvest's start, and Kangali Bihu (October) involves lighting lamps by a Tulsi plant during the lean season. Q.555. Hola Mohalla is a festival associated with which religion/belief? SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) Jainism (b) Islam (c) Buddhism (d) Sikhism Sol.555.(d) Sikhism. Hola Mohalla : This festival is a vibrant three-day Sikh festival celebrated in spring on the second day of the lunar month of Chett, the first month of the Nanakshahi calendar. The main procession occurs at Takht Sri Keshgarh Sahib in Anandpur, Punjab, a site of historical significance as the birthplace of the Khalsa Panth in 1699, where Guru Gobind Singh founded the Khalsa Panth. Other Sikh festivals: Baisakhi, Maghi, Bandi Chhor Divas, Guru Nanak Jayanti. Q.556. The ‘Lokranjan’ festival celebrates the folk and tribal culture of which Indian state? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Madhya Pradesh (b) Jharkhand (c) Manipur (d) Meghalaya Sol.556.(a) Madhya Pradesh. Lokranjan is a vibrant tribal dance festival held annually in Khajuraho, Madhya Pradesh, organized by the Adivasi Lok Kala Academy in association with the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation. Celebrated from 8th to 12th December. Some popular folk dances of Madhya Pradesh include Jawara, Matki, Aada, Khada Nach, Phulpati, Grida Dance, Selalarki, Selabhadoni, and Maanch. Q.557. Rottela Panduga or the Roti Festival is celebrated in which Indian state? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Karnataka (b) Maharashtra (c) Andhra Pradesh (d) Tamil Nadu Sol.557.(c) Andhra Pradesh. Rotiyaan Ki Eid, or Rottela Panduga, is an annual three-day festival held at Bara Shaheed Dargah in Nellore, Andhra Pradesh. This event is observed in Muharram to commemorate the urs (death anniversary) of the 12 martyrs buried in the shrine. Women visiting the shrine exchange rotis at Nellore Tank. Other notable festivals celebrated in Andhra Pradesh include Pongal, Ugadi, Sri Rama Navami, Ratha Saptami, Tirupati Ganga Jatara, and Visakha Utsav.

questions.question: Vishu festival is celebrated in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Kerala And Tamil Nadu. Vishu is a Hindu festival celebrated on the first day of the Malayali month of Medam (Malayalam New Year). New year festivals : Ugadi (Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Telangana), Gudi Padwa (Maharashtra), Baisakhi (Punjab, Haryana), Pohela Boishakh (West Bengal, Tripura), Puthandu (Tamil Nadu), Bohag Bihu (Assam), Cheti Chand (Sindhi community), Losoong (Sikkim), Navreh (Kashmir), Chaitra Sukladi (North India).

questions.question: Sakewa is a religious festival celebrated by the Kirat Khambu Rai community of
questions.explanation: Sikkim. 'Sakewa' is an annual festival and is celebrated as a tribute to mother nature. The rituals for this particular festival are performed in an open space, which is also known as Bhoomi Puja or Chandi Puja. Other important festivals of Sikkim: Losung, Drupka Tesh, Bumchu, Saga Dawa, Dasin and Phang Lhabsol . Q.560. ‘Hampi Utsava,’ which is celebrated in Karnataka, is also called ____________. The festival that captures the pomp, splendour and glory of the historical period of Karnataka is celebrated over a week. SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Vijaya Utsava (b) Sarhul Mahotsava (c) Rajasi Utsava (d) Nritya Mahotsav Sol.560.(a) Vijaya Utsava celebrates the grandeur of the Vijayanagara Empire and is held over a week in Karnataka. Festivals of Karnataka: Vairamudi Festival, Kambala Festival, Karaga Festival, Ugadi. The Sarhul festival marks the beginning of the New Year and is celebrated by the Oraon, Munda, and Ho tribes of Jharkhand.

questions.question: The Indian festival of Holi comes every year in the season of:
questions.explanation: Spring. Holi, also known as the Festival of Colors, is celebrated on the full moon day of the Phalguna month in the Hindu calendar. Other notable festivals and their seasons include: Diwali, celebrated in autumn (usually October or November); Makar Sankranti, observed in winter (January); Pongal, also in winter (January); and Ganesh Chaturthi, celebrated during the monsoon season (August or September). Q.562. Mewar festival is celebrated during the _______ festival at Udaipur. SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (4th shift) (a) Gangaur (b) Teej (c) Dussehra (d) Holi Sol.562.(a) Gangaur - A festival devoted to Goddess Parvati. It is celebrated in March. Festivals of Rajasthan : Camel Festival (Bikaner), Kumbhalgarh Festival, Desert Festival (Jaisalmer), Kajli Teej (Bundi), Abhaneri (Dausa), Ranakpur (Pali), Matsya Festival (Alwar) and Bundi Festival (Bundi).

questions.question: In which country is the ‘Kachin Manaw Festival’ celebrated ?
questions.explanation: Myanmar. In the Kachin Manaw Festival, the Kachins perform the Manaw dance - a dance that was part of the Nat (spirit worship) many years ago. Famous festivals of Myanmar : Thingyan, Ananda Pagoda Festival, Kyaukse elephant dance festival.

questions.question: _________ is a significant festival of the Parsi people who practice Zoroastrianism as it marks the birth anniversary of Zoroaster.
questions.explanation: Khordad Sal. The Gahambars were established as a means of celebrating the six primordial elements of creation: sky, water, earth, plants, animals, and humans. Papeti (Navroz or Parsi New Year) is a festival celebrated by the Parsi community. It marks the start of the Iranian calendar and is an auspicious occasion for the Zoroastrian community.

questions.question: Which of the following is the festival of Kerala that heralds the harvest season, lasts for 10 days, and has snake boat races etc?
questions.explanation: Onam. Onam is the biggest festival in the Indian state of Kerala. Onam Festival falls during the Malayali month of Chingam (Aug - Sep) and marks the homecoming of legendary King Mahabali. Kumarakom boat race is the most admired boat race to take place on the Vembanad Lake in September during Onam. Other Festivals of Kerala : Thrissur Pooram Festival, Attukal Pongala Festival, Navarathri Festival, Makaravilakku Festival, Kerala Village Fair, Aluva Sivarathri Festival, Vishu Festival.

questions.question: Muharram is the _______ month of the Islamic Calendar and is considered a holy month.
questions.explanation: first. Muharram : It is a sacred festival that commemorates the martyrdom of Hazrat Imam Hussein. During this occasion, a relic called Alam is taken out as a procession. This festival is known as Peerla Panduga in Telangana. Other festivals of Muslims : Id-ul-Zuha, Shab-e-Barat, Milad-un-Nabi, Ramadan, Eid al-Adha.

questions.question: Bali Yatra, is a traditional cultural festival of which state ?
questions.explanation: Odisha. Bali Jatra is the major Boita Bandana festival held at Cuttack on Kartik Purnima and lasts for 7 days or more. It is considered to be one of Asia's largest open trade fair. Other Festivals of Odisha: Kalipuja, Dola Purnima (Holi), Chandan Yatra, Snana Yatra, Ratha Yatra, Kalinga Mahotsav, Konark Dance Festival, Ekamra Utsav, etc.

questions.question: Jamshedi Navroz is a festival of _________ community.
questions.explanation: Parsi. Navroz has links with the legend of King Jamshid of Iran, also called Jamshedi Navroz. It is celebrated on the first day of the first month of the Fasli calendar, which usually falls on August 18 or August 19.

questions.question: Dussehra festival is celebrated in which of the following Hindu months ?
questions.explanation: Ashwin. Other Hindu festivals according to the Hindu calendar : Holi is celebrated in the Phalguna month (February - March). Makar Sankranti is celebrated in the month of Magh (January). Raksha Bandhan is celebrated on the full moon day (Purnima) of the Shravana month (July - August). Deepawali is celebrated every year on the 15th lunar day of the Kartik month (October - November).

questions.question: The Braj festival in ________ is held every year for two days in the Shukla Paksha of the Phalgun month, a few days before Holi.
questions.explanation: Rajasthan. Braj festival is dedicated to Lord Krishna who is believed to have spent a considerable amount of time in this region. Other festivals of the state with districts: Kajli Teej - Bundi, Abhaneri festival’ - Dausa, Marwar Festival - Jodhpur. Momasar - Bikaner, Chandrabhaga - Jhalawar, Matsya - Alwar, Kolayat - Bikaner, Kumbhalgarh fort festival - Udaipur, Ranakpur pali. Q.571. Pinjore heritage festival is organised by the state of ________. SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (1st shift) (a) Uttarakhand (b) Sikkim (c) Haryana (d) Jharkhand Sol.571.(c) Haryana. The Pinjore Heritage Festival is held annually in December at the historic Yadavindra Gardens in Pinjore, Panchkula, Haryana. This event is organized to celebrate and honor the unique heritage of Pinjore and its renowned Mughal Gardens. The festival was first introduced in 2006.

questions.question: In Gujarat, the festival Makar Sankranti is celebrated as:
questions.explanation: Uttarayan. Makar Sankranti denotes the entry of the sun into the zodiac sign of Makara (Capricorn) as it travels on its celestial path. As part of the official celebration of 'Uttarayan', the Gujarat government has been hosting the International Kite Festival since 1989.

questions.question: The Kutch festival is held at _____.
questions.explanation: Bhuj. It is a carnival of music, dance, and natural beauty in White Rann. Other important festivals of Gujarat: International Kite Festival (known as Makar Sankranti or Uttarayan) - Celebrates Makar Sankranti or Uttarayan in Ahmedabad. Tarnetar fair - Based on the legend of Draupadi's swayamvara. Megh Malhar Parv -an annual celebration that takes place in the Saputara region every monsoon. Navratri - : Festival celebrating feminine divinity, Shakti.

questions.question: Easter is a religious festival of:
questions.explanation: Christians. Easter celebrates the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.It is observed on the first Sunday following the full Moon after the spring equinox. The custom of decorating eggs is practiced during Easter. The holiday concludes the “Passion of Christ,” a series of events and holidays that begins with Lent (a 40-day period of fasting, prayer and sacrifice) and ends with Holy Week, which includes Holy Thursday, Good Friday, and Easter Sunday. Q.575. 'Tamu Lochar' is one of the traditional festivals of the_________of Sikkim. It is celebrated to mark the beginning of their new year, which falls on the 15th day of Pusa, according to the Hindu calendar Vikram Samvat and 30th December in the English calendar. SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Gurung community (b) Bhutia community (c) Mangar community (d) Lepcha community Sol.575.(a) Gurung community. Festivals celebrated in Sikkim: Maghe Sankranti, Sonam Lochar, Losar, Ramnawami (Chaite Dasain), Sakewa, Saga Dawa, Eid Ul Fitr, Bhanu Jayanti, Drukpa Tshechi, Tendong Lho Rum Faat, Indrajatra, Pang Lhabsol, Barahimizong, Kagyed Dance. Vikram Samvat was started in 57 B.C. when the emperor Vikramaditya defeated Sakas.

questions.question: International Kite Festival is a popular cultural festival of which state?
questions.explanation: Gujarat. The International Kite Festival marks the days in the Hindu calendar when winter begins turning to summer, known as Makar Sankranti or Uttarayan. Other Festivals of Gujarat: Rann Utsav, Dang Darbar, Modhera Dance Festival, Madhavrai Festival, and Bhadra Purnima Fair. Q.577. With reference to Chethiagiri Vihar festival consider the following statements and select the correct option. i) It is a Buddhist festival. ii) It is held at Sanchi, Madhya Pradesh. iii) Relics of SariPutta and Maha Moggallana are worshiped SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Both ii and iii (b) Both i and iii (c) Both i and ii (d) i, ii, iii Sol.577.(d) i, ii, iii. Other Buddhist festivals include Buddha Purnima, Hemis Festival, Losar Festival, Lumbini Festival, Parinirvana Day, Rumtek Chaam Festival and Mani Rimdu Festival. Q.578. Every year in the month of February, this camel festival is organised by Rajasthan Tourism Development Corporation in __________. SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (4th shift) (a) Jaisalmer (b) Jodhpur (c) Bikaner (d) Barmer Sol.578.(c) Bikaner. Bikaner Camel Festival happens in January month which Bikaner celebrates in honor of the 'Ship of the Desert', the Camel. Festivals of Rajasthan: Desert Festival, Pushkar Fair, Jaipur Literature Festival, Nagaur Fair, Kite Festival, Mewar Festival, Urs Festival, Brij Holi, Elephant Festival, Chandrabhaga Fair, Bundi Utsav, Kumbhalgarh festival, Baneshwar festival, Kolayat Fair, etc. Q.579. According to Hindu calendar, Diwali falls in which of the following months? SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (1st shift) (a) Ashwin (b) Magha (c) Chaitra (d) Kartika Sol.579.(d) Kartika. Diwali, the Hindu festival of lights. Diwali marks the day when lord Ram returned to Ayodhya after 14 years of exile after defeating King Ravan. The months of the Hindu calendar in order are : Chaitra, Vaisakha, Jyaistha, Asadha, Shravana, Bhadra, Asvina, Kartika, Agrahayana, Pausa, Magha, and Phalguna.

questions.question: Goga Navami, which is primarily celebrated in the Indian state of_______is dedicated to the snake God, Gogaji.
questions.explanation: Rajasthan. Other festivals of state: Gangaur Festival (Jaipur), Desert Festival (Jaisalmer), Summer Festival (Mount Abu), Pushkar Fair (Pushkar), Mewar Festival (Udaipur). Andhra Pradesh - Ratha Saptami, Ugadi. Odisha - Ratha Yatra, Bali Jatra. Karnataka - Pattadakal, Ugadi.

questions.question: Which festival is celebrated after the month of Ramzan ?
questions.explanation: Eid ul Fitr. It is a religious festival celebrated by Muslims at the end of the holy month of Ramzan. It is celebrated on the first day of Shawwal, the tenth month of the Islamic calendar. Everyone celebrates this festival together and prays to God for happiness, peace, and prosperity.

questions.question: Kojagiri Poornima is a festival celebrated primarily in _______ on the full moon day of Ashwin month.
questions.explanation: Maharashtra. Sharad Purnima is also known as Kojagiri or Raas Purnima. It is a harvest festival. Other festivals of Maharashtra : Gudi Padwa or Chaitra Pratipada, Pola, Narali Purnima, Ratha Saptami, Marabats and Badgyas, etc,.

questions.question: Which festival is celebrated by Christians as the birth of Jesus Christ?
questions.explanation: Christmas : It is observed on December 25. It corresponds to the traditional date of the winter solstice on the Roman calendar. Good Friday is a Christian holiday commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus and his death at Calvary. It is observed during Holy week as part of the Paschal Triduum. Easter (Pascha) celebrates the Resurrection of Jesus Christ on the third day after his Crucifixion. Eid ul-Fitr is a Muslim festival ending Ramadan, observed with prayers, feasts, and charity.

questions.question: Ugadi is celebrated primarily in which of the following states on the first day of the Chaitra month of the Hindu calendar?
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Ugadi festival represents the beginning of the New Year. Other festivals of Karnataka - Hampi Festival, Karnataka Rajyotsava, Vairamundi Festival. Other states and their festivals : Odisha - Ratha Yatra, Raja Parba, Bali Jatra. Assam - Ambubachi Mela, Dehing Patkai, Bihu. Uttarakhand - Uttarayani, Phool Dei.

questions.question: Which festival is celebrated as the birth of Lord Krishna?
questions.explanation: Janmashtami. It falls on the 8th day of the dark half of the month of Bhadrapada. The activity of making a human pyramid and putting efforts to break an earthen pot filled with buttermilk is associated with this festival.

questions.question: Which of the following states is associated with the Bonalu festival?
questions.explanation: Telangana. Bonalu is a traditional Hindu festival, dedicated to Goddess Mahankali, and its name "Bonalu" derives from the Telugu word "Bona" meaning "food" or "offering." It is celebrated in Ashada month (June-July). Other states and their festivals : Tamil Nadu - Pongal, Thaipusam, Natyanjali Festival. Karnataka - Mysore Dasara, Ugadi. Kerala - Onam, Vishu.

questions.question: The festival of Eid Milad-un-Nabi is celebrated in which of the following Islamic months?
questions.explanation: Rabi' al-Awwal. Milad un-Nabi (Barawafat), also known as Nabi Day, Mawlid, is a gazetted holiday in India. This festival celebrates the birth anniversary of Prophet Muhammad and is observed by Muslims worldwide. Prophet Muhammad, an Arab religious and political leader, was born in Mecca and is regarded as the founder of Islam.

questions.question: The festival of Ram Navami is celebrated in which of the following Hindu months?
questions.explanation: Chaitra. Ram Navami is celebrated on the ninth day of Chaitra Navaratri, usually in April, marking the birth of Lord Rama, the seventh incarnation of Lord Vishnu, born to King Dasaratha and Queen Kaushalya of Ayodhya. Other important festivals: Holi in Falgun, Diwali in Kartik, and Rakshabandhan in Sravana.

questions.question: According to Hindu calendar, on which day does Holika Dahan take place?
questions.explanation: Phalgun Poornima. Holika Dahan is celebrated on the eve of Holi, the festival of colors. According to the Hindu calendar, Holi takes place on the full moon day (Poornima) of the month of Phalgun. Different names in the different regions - Rang Panchami (Maharashtra, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh), Lathmar Holi (Uttar Pradesh), Holla Mohalla (Punjab), Shigmo (Goa), Royal Holi (Udaipur), Kumaoni Holi and Khadi Holi (Uttarakhand), Manjal Kuli (Kerala), Dol Jatra (West Bengal), Yaosang (Manipur), Phaguwa (Bihar).

questions.question: In which of the following states is the Behdienkhlam festival celebrated in the month of July ?
questions.explanation: Meghalaya. Behdienkhlam (chasing away the Demon of Cholera) is celebrated annually in July after the sowing period, the most important dance festival of the Jaintia tribes. Other famous Festivals : Meghalaya - Wangala, Nongkrem, Shad Suk Mynsiem, Shad Sukra. Haryana - Guga Navmi, Gita Jayanti. West Bengal - Shiber Gajan, Disum sendra, Rohini Utsav. Bihar - Chhath Puja, Bihula, Karama.

questions.question: Which of the following holy days in Christianity is a mourning day ?
questions.explanation: Good Friday is a solemn holy day in Christianity, observed to commemorate the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ. It is traditionally a day of mourning, reflection, and fasting. Christmas celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ, while Easter commemorates his resurrection. Maundy Thursday honors the Last Supper of Jesus Christ with his disciples.

questions.question: The Myoko festival is celebrated in which of the following North-Eastern states of India?
questions.explanation: Arunachal Pradesh. The Myoko Festival is a month-long traditional celebration of the Apatani tribe. It's one of their most important festivals, aimed at strengthening family and clan bonds, as well as ensuring fertility in both fields and people. Other festivals of Arunachal Pradesh : The Mopin Festival, Losar Festival, Dree Festival of the Apatani, Chalo-Loku of the Nocte, Solung of the Adis, Ziro Festival of Music, Pangsau Pass Winter Festival, and Siang River Festival.

questions.question: The Karbi tribe, which celebrates the cultural festival ‘Rongker’, belongs to the Indian state of _________.
questions.explanation: Assam. Rongker, winter post-harvest festival, is celebrated either on 5th January or 5th February as per the convenience of the villagers. Festival and their tribes : Kherai Puja of the Bodos; the Baikhu and Pharkantis of the Rabhas; the Ali-ai-ligang and Parag of the Mishing tribe; and the Sagra-misawa, wansawa, and laghun of the Tiwas.

questions.question: In which of the following cities is the Agera festival celebrated ?
questions.explanation: Mumbai. Agera is celebrated by the Christian farming community, and it takes place in October. It is a harvest festival. Other cities and their festivals : Kolkata - Durga Puja, Mumbai - Ganesh Chaturthi, Chennai - Pongal.

questions.question: In which of the following states of India is the Chethiyagiri Vihara festival celebrated ?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh. The Chethiyagiri Vihara Festival, celebrated in November, attracts hundreds of pilgrims to Sanchi in the Raisen District to view the relics of Buddha’s two great disciples, Sariputta and Mahamogallena. Other festivals of Madhya Pradesh: Lokrang, Akhil Bhartiya Kalidas Samaroh, Khajuraho Festival, Bhagoria Haat, Ujjain Kumbh Mela, and Malwa Utsav.

questions.question: Which of the following festivals is also known as the ‘100 drums festival’?
questions.explanation: Wangala. This festival is celebrated after harvest to thank Misi Saljong, the ‘Sun God’ and Mini-ma Kiri Rokime, the ‘Goddess of Grains’. This festival is usually celebrated in the month of October or November. Festivals of Meghalaya: Shad Suk Mynsiem, Nongkrem Festival, Behdienkhlam Festival, Shad Sukra, Strawberry Festival.

questions.question: In which of the following festivals is Kolam drawn?
questions.explanation: Pongal. It is a harvest festival celebrated by the Tamil community. It is primarily celebrated in Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and Puducherry. Other harvesting festivals: Karma (Jharkhand), Bhogali Bihu (Assam), Hareli (Chhattisgarh), Onam (Kerala), Nuakhai (Odisha), Gudi Padwa (Maharashtra).

questions.question: 'Moatsu' is a religious festival celebrated in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Nagaland. The Moatsu Festival is celebrated by the Ao tribes of Nagaland during the first week of May every year for three days. Other festivals celebrated in Nagaland: Nazu Festival, Amongmong Festival, and Hornbill Festival. States and their festivals: Chhattisgarh - Bastar Dussehra, Madai Festival, Hareli Festival, and Kajari Festival. Himachal Pradesh - Losar, Doongri, and Halda. Mizoram - Khuado Kut, Mim Kut, and Chapchar Kut. Q.599. ‘Gugga Naumi’ – the festival celebrated in Haryana and some parts of Punjab, Rajasthan, UP and Himachal Pradesh______is known as the festival of: SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Morning) (a) camel-worshiping (b) cow-worshiping (c) snake-worshiping (d) owl-worshiping Sol.599.(c) Snake-worshiping. Gugga Naumi festival celebrated in the honour of Gugga Pir. It is observed on the 9th day of the Krishna Paksha (waning phase of moon) in Bhadon month (August and September).

questions.question: Doul Utsav is majorly celebrated in which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Assam. Doul Utsav is also called ‘holi’ or ‘rang. Other festivals celebrated in Assam - Bihu, Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Rajini Gabra, Harni Gabra, Bohaggiyo Bishu, Ambubachi Mela and Jonbill Mela. Festivals in other states: Bihar - Chhath Puja, Bihula, Sama chakeva. Chhattisgarh - Pola, Madai Festival, Hareli, Bhoramdeo Mahotsav. Maharashtra - Ganesh Utsav, Gudi Padva.

questions.question: Bhagoria is a festival associated with which of the following festivals ?
questions.explanation: Holi: A Hindu festival that is celebrated in the spring season. Bhagoria is a tribal festival that is celebrated in Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra. Tribal Festivals - Hornbill Festival (Nagaland), Tusu Parab (Jharkhand), Bastar Dussehra (Chhattisgarh), Nagoba Jatara (Telangana).

questions.question: For how many days is the Tirupati Tirumala Brahmotsavam organised?
questions.explanation: 9. Tirupati Tirumala Brahmotsavam - It is annually celebrated at the Venkateswara Temple in Tirupati district in Andhra Pradesh. Other Temple Festivals: Thrissur Pooram (Vadakkumnathan Temple, Kerala), Arattu festival (Sree PadmanabhaSwamy Temple, Kerala), Vaikunth Chaturdashi Mela (Kamleshwar Mahadev Temple, Uttarakhand), Buddha Purnima (Mahabodhi Temple, Bodhgaya, Bihar), Ambubachii Mela (Kamakhya Devi Temple, Assam).

questions.question: In which month, as per the Hindu calendar, is the birth anniversary of Lord Mahavir Swami celebrated ?
questions.explanation: Chaitra. Hindu calendar and their festival/jayanti: Chaitra - Ugadi, Gudi Padwa, Rama Navami, Hanuman Jayanti. Vaishakha - Parshuram jayanti, Akshaya Tritiya. Jyeshtha - Gayatri Jayanti, Ganga Dussehra. Ashadha - Guru Purnima, Jagannath Rathyatra. Shravana - Nag Panchami, Raksha Bandhan. Bhadrapada - Krishna Janmashtami, Ganesh Chaturthi, Hartalika teej. Ashwin - Durga Ashtami. Kartik - Karwa Chauth, Dhanteras, Diwali, Bhaiya Dooj, Chhath Puja.

questions.question: What does Gudi signify in Gudi Padwa festival as per Hindu mythology?
questions.explanation: Symbol of victory. Gudi Padwa: It is marathi new year. Gudi is made by tying a piece of fresh cloth around a bamboo stick of about 5 feet long and Marathis place neem leaves along with sugar candy garland on it. The stick is then placed in a silver or bronze pot. In Karnataka, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh this festival is also known as Ugadi. It is celebrated in the first month of Chaitra. Q.605. Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding the Hornbill Festival? A. The Hornbill Festival is celebrated in the North-eastern state of Nagaland. B.The festival takes place in the month of January. C. The name of the festival is derived from the Indian Hornbill, a bird that is an essential character of the folk tales of the state. SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon) (a) Both A and B (b) Both B and C (c) A, B and C (d) Both A and C Sol.605.(d) Both A and C. Hornbill Festival is celebrated from 1 to 10 December in Nagaland. It is also called festivals of festivals. Q.606. Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding Bathukamma Festival? A. This festival is celebrated in the state of Telangana. B. Bathukamma which means ‘Mother Goddess come and live’ is a colourful floral festival. C. This festival is celebrated for 9 days mostly during September or October (mostly before Dussehra). D. During this festival, men will sing songs and dance around the flower bunches. SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Evening) (a) Only A, B and C (b) Only B, C and D (c) A, B, C and D (d) Only A, C and D Sol.606.(a) Only A, B and C.

questions.question: Ker and Garia Puja are traditional tribal festivals of which state?
questions.explanation: Tripura. Other festivals (Tripura) : kharchi Puja, Bizu Festival, Ashokastami, Lampra Puja, Wah festival etc. Manipur (Gang-Ngai, Lui-Ngai-Ni, Yaosang, Cheiraoba, Kang). Jharkhand (Karam, Sarhul, Rohini, Sohrai, Makar). Odisha (Ratha Yatra, Raja Parba, Naukhai, Kalinga Mahotsav). Q.608. Chapchar Kut festival is predominantly celebrated in _________. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Evening) (a) Nagaland (b) Meghalaya (c) Mizoram (d) Manipur Sol.608.(c) Mizoram. Chapchar kut celebrated every year in the month of March after the completion of the jhum operation (Clearing of the remnants of burning). States and their festivals : Mizoram - Anthurium, Mim Kut, Pawl Kut. Nagaland - Hornbill, Sekrenyi, Aoleang. Meghalaya - Shad Suk Mynsiem, Nongkrem, Behdienkhlam, Wangala. Manipur - Gang-Ngai, Lui-Ngai-Ni, Yaosang.

questions.question: Chad Shukra festival is celebrated by the Jayanti tribe of ______________.
questions.explanation: Meghalaya. Chad Shukra is a sowing festival of Jaintia communities. Other festivals of Meghalaya - Behdienkhlam (Jaintia), Wangala (Garo), Ka Shad Suk Mynsiem (Khasi), Nongkrem (Khasi).

questions.question: ______ is celebrated in Jharkhand immediately after Diwali on the new moon day in the honour of cattle.
questions.explanation: Sohrai - A chief festival of Santhal tribe. It is celebrated on Amavasya (new moon) in the Hindu month of Kartik (October-November). It is known for the care of domestic animals, such as cows and buffaloes. Other festivals of Jharkhand: Sarhul, Karam, Hal Punhya, Bhagat Parab, Rohini, Bandana and Java. Q.611. The sal tree assumes great significance in a number of tribal communities scattered across eastern India. For instance ________ festival is celebrated in honour of the tree , in Jharkhand. SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (1st Shift) (a) Karma (b) Tusu Parab (c) Sarhul (d) Sohrai Sol.611.(c) Sarhul : Celebrated by - Oraon, the Munda and the Ho tribes of Jharkhand. It marks the beginning of New Year. Celebrated - Every year in the first month of the Hindu calendar, on the third day of the moon or the fortnight of 'Chaitra'.

questions.question: Buddha Purnima is marked on a full moon day in the Hindu month of____.
questions.explanation: Vaisakh (2nd month of the Hindu Calendar). Buddha Purnima (Buddha Jayanti) commemorates the birth, enlightenment (nirvana), and death (parinirvana) of Gautama Buddha (founder of Buddhism).

questions.question: Dree Utsav is celebrated in the state of __________.
questions.explanation: Arunachal Pradesh. States and their Festivals: Arunachal Pradesh - Boori Boot, Myoko, Pongtu, Murung, Solang, Mopin, Monpa. Kerala - Snake Boat (Vallam Kali), Theyyam, Onam, Attukal Pongala. Andhra Pradesh: Pongal, Ugadi, Rottela Panduga, Prabhala Theertham, Visakha Utsav, Tirupati Tirumala Brahmotsavam, Lumbini Festival, Rayalaseema Food and Dance Festival, etc.

questions.question: 'Losoong' festival, celebrated by the tribal community in _______ , is usually the time when the farmers rejoice and celebrate their harvest.
questions.explanation: Sikkim. Losoong (Namsoong) is a Sikkimese New Year festival. The festival is celebrated by Bhutia and Lepcha tribes in India, Bhutan and Nepal. Famous Festivals in Sikkim: Drupka Teshi, Bumchu, Saga Dawa, Dassin, Phang Lhabsol, Maghe Sankranti, Sonam Lochar, Tendong Lho Rum Faat, Guru Rimpoche’s Thunkar Tshechu, Indra Jatra, Barahimizong, Sakewa.

questions.question: Which festival brings out the fusion rich culture of Chhattisgarh and Odisha?
questions.explanation: Bastar Goncha (referred to as chariot festival) - Performed by the Bastar tribal people. It is observed during the Rath Yatra (June or July) of Odisha. Other tribal festivals of Chhattisgarh: Bastar Dussehra, Bastar Lokotsav, Koriya Mela, Fagun Wadai, Madai Festival and Pola Festival, Gauri Gaura puja. Himachal Pradesh (Shoolini Fair - Solan). Gujarat (Madhavpur Fair - Porbandar).

questions.question: The Sakraat festival is celebrated with the 'Budigali' or 'Kalasi' dance in _________ , where women take part in this dance, carrying decorative pots on their heads.
questions.explanation: Odisha.

questions.question: The Konark Dance Festival (KDF) has been held at Konark since 1986 between ______ every year.
questions.explanation: 1st and 5th December. The Konark Dance Festival is held at an open-air auditorium in the backdrop of the Sun Temple (Black Pagoda). Dance Festival in India - Bamnia Chhau Dance Festival (West Bengal), Khajuraho Dance Festival (Madhya Pradesh), Mamallapuram Dance Festival and Natyanjali Festival (Tamil Nadu), Nishagandhi Dance Festival (Kerala), Sirpur Music and Dance Festival (Chhattisgarh).

questions.question: Bastar Dussehra is celebrated in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Chattisgarh. Bastar Dussehra (75 days long) started in the 13th Century during the reign of the 4th King of Bastar, King Purshottam Dev. Deity - Goddess Danteshwari Devi.

questions.question: Lui Ngai Ni is a festival that is associated with which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Manipur. Lui Ngai Ni - A festival that is celebrated by the Naga tribes of Manipur (India). It is a seed-sowing festival that marks the beginning of the new year for the Nagas. The festival is celebrated on February 15th every year. Q.620. Indian festival Dussehra is a famous celebration that takes place at which of the following? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (2nd shift) (a) Mysore Palace (b) Nizam Palace (c) Mayurbhanj Palace (d) Jaipur Palace Sol.620.(a) Mysore Palace (Karnataka). Established - 1912, Started construction in 1897. It was the residence of Wodeyars rulers who ruled Mysore for seven centuries. Nizam Palace (Kolkata) - It was constructed in 1933.

questions.question: Pawl Kut is a thanksgiving festival of which Indian state?
questions.explanation: Mizoram. Thanksgiving festivals - Pawl kut (Straw harvest festival), Lyuva Khutla (Mara Tribes) in Mizoram, Uttarayan (Gujarat), Lohri (Punjab), Onam (Kerala), Bhogali Bihu (Assam), Pongal (Tamil Nadu), Gudi Padwa (Maharashtra), Ugadi (Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Karnataka).

questions.question: Of which of the following states is Jallikattu a famous bull-taming festival ?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu. Jallikattu : Part of Pongal celebrations on Mattu Pongal day which occurs annually in January. Some Other Festivals : Natyanjali Dance Festival, Karthigai Deepam, Aadi Perukku.

questions.question: Kajari festival is celebrated in which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Chhattisgarh. Kajari Festival - Celebrated by farmers. Time - Beginning of sowing season for wheat and barley.

questions.question: Tulip Festival is famous in which city ?
questions.explanation: Srinagar. Tulip Festival in Kashmir is celebrated annually to display the vast range of flowers at the Indira Gandhi Memorial Tulip Garden in Srinagar. It is organized during the onset of spring season in Kashmir valley. Other Flower Festivals in India: Rose Festival (Chandigarh), Ooty Flower Show (Tamil Nadu), International Flower Festival (Gangtok, Sikkim), Lalbagh Flower Show (Bangalore), Dasara Flower Show (Mysore), Cherry Blossom Festival (Shillong, Meghalaya).

questions.question: Chaitrual and Phulaich are the festival of which of the following states ?
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh. Chaitrual (festival of pictures) - celebrated in the month of Chaitra (March - April) in Sirmaur area. Phulaich (festival of flowers)- celebrated on the 16th day of the Hindu month of Bhadrapada (August - September). Q.626. Rajini Gabra and Harni Gabra is the cultural festival of which of the following Indian states? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Assam (b) Bihar (c) Mizoram (d) West Bengal Sol.626.(a) Assam. Rajini Gabra and Harni Gabra is an annual festival of the Dimasa tribe. This socio-religious festival is celebrated before starting new cultivation.

questions.question: Nag Panchami is celebrated in which month of Hindu Calendar?
questions.explanation: Shravan. Other festivals in Shravan month - Raksha Bandhan, Hariyali Teej, Narali Purnima. Kartik Month festival - Karwa Chauth, Rama Ekadashi, Dhanteras, Lakshmi Puja (Deewali), Bhaiya Dooj, Chhath Puja. Ashad - Jagannath Rathyatra, Guru Purnima, Yogini Ekadashi. Sharad Purnima is the harvest festival that is celebrated during the holy month of Ashwin in the Hindu lunar calendar.

questions.question: Banganga festival takes place annually at which of the following places in Maharashtra ?
questions.explanation: Mumbai. Banganga festival : A two-day music festival (tribute to Lord Rama) celebrated annually in the month of January in Malabar Hills, Mumbai.

questions.question: In which state is the Chithirai festival celebrated?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu. Chithirai Festival - celebrates the celestial union of Lord Sunderswarar (Lord Shiva) and Goddess Meenakshi, considered to be Lord Vishnu’s sister. Celebrated in Madurai.

questions.question: In which city of Assam is the Tea Festival celebrated every year?
questions.explanation: Jorhat. The Tea Festival in the state of Assam is celebrated every year during the winter season between November and January. Major festivals celebrated (Assam): Bihu, Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Rajini Gabra Harni Gabra, Bohaggiyo Bishu, Ambubashi Mela and Jonbill Mela.

questions.question: Which festival traces its origin to the Tibetan New Year and in Ladakh, it is celebrated every year at the end of the harvesting season?
questions.explanation: Losar festival: It is celebrated in India in various parts such as Arunachal Pradesh, Ladakh, Sikkim, The Lahaul district of Himachal Pradesh. It marks the beginning of the Tibetan new year. It is usually celebrated by the tribes who believe in the Mahayana sect of Buddhism like the Sherdukpens, Khamba, Memba, Monpa tribe, etc. Q.632. The 'Kambala' festival is organised by farming communities in the state of ________. SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (2nd shift) (a) Himachal Pradesh (b) Rajasthan (c) Karnataka (d) Madhya Pradesh Sol.632.(c) Karnataka. The Kambala festival is essentially associated with the Buffalo race. The festival is dedicated to Hindu God Lord Kadri Manjunatha, who is the epitome of Lord Shiva.

questions.question: The Sikhs celebrate Bandi Chhor Divas which coincides with which Hindu festival?
questions.explanation: Diwali. Bandi Chhor Divas - A Sikh celebration that commemorates the day on which, the sixth Guru of Sikhs, Guru Hargobind released 52 prisoners from Gwalior Fort, who had been imprisoned by Mughal Emperor Jahangir. Emperor Jahangir had held 52 Kings at Gwalior. Other Sikh Festivals - Muktsar Mela, Parkash Utsav Dasveh Patshah, Holla Mohalla, Gurpurab. Q.634. Doongri festival of Himachal Pradesh is primarily celebrated by which religious community? SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (4th shift) (a) Buddhist (b) Sikh (c) Muslim (d) Hindu Sol.634.(d) Hindu. Doongri Festival: It is celebrated in Kullu district (Himachal pradesh) in the month of may as the birthday of Hadimba devi (wife of Bhima).

questions.question: Tamladu is a festival celebrated by the Buddhist community of which Indian state?
questions.explanation: Arunachal Pradesh. It is celebrated in the Lohit district by the Digaru Mishmis tribe.

questions.question: Guruvayur Ekadashi is the cultural festival of which Indian state?
questions.explanation: Kerala. Guruvayur Ekadashi is observed in the famous Sri Guruvayur Krishna temple. It is observed in the Vrischikam month as per traditional Malayalam Calendar. Lord Guruvayur is an incarnation of Lord Vishnu.

questions.question: Which country celebrates one of the famous festivals known as Paro Tschechu?
questions.explanation: Bhutan. Paro Tsechu - A mask dance to celebrate the birth anniversary of Padmasambhava (Guru Rimpoche). It is a five-day festival held every year in the month of March or at the beginning of April.

questions.question: Which of the following religious festivals is known as Peerla Panduga in Telangana?
questions.explanation: Muharram (first month of the Islamic Lunar Calendar). It is a sacred festival that commemorates the martyrdom of Hazrat Imam Hussein and is marked by processions. During this occasion, a relic called Alam is taken out as a procession. Q.639. Makaravilakku festival is celebrated in which of the following Indian states ? Graduate Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 3) (a) Andhra Pradesh (b) Tamil Nadu (c) Kerala (d) Karnataka Sol.639.(c) Kerala. It is celebrated annually in the Sabarimala Temple.

questions.question: Which of the following harvest festivals is celebrated in Karnataka in the months of November-December?
questions.explanation: Huthri - The annual rice harvest festival which is celebrated by the communities living in Coorg (Kodagu). Other festivals of Karnataka : Kambala Festival (March and November), Hampi Festival (November), Pattadakal Dance Festival (January), Makar Sankranti (January), Ugadi (April), Vairamudi Festival (March), Karaga Festival (March/April), Vara Mahalakshmi Pooja (August).

questions.question: Which among the following is an agricultural festival of Arunachal Pradesh and celebrated by the Galo tribe?
questions.explanation: Mopin. It is a celebration of the harvesting season held in the months of April in East Siang and West Siang districts. Major tribes (Arunachal Pradesh) - Adi, Aka, Apatani, Nyishi, Tagins, Bori, and Bokar.

questions.question: Which among the following is the famous harvest festival of Meghalaya, India?
questions.explanation: Nongkrem festival. Period - In the month of November, every year. Venue - Smit, the Khasi Hills in Meghalaya. It is celebrated during Autumn at Smit, the cultural centre of the Khasi Hills.

questions.question: Navreh is the lunar new year that is celebrated in which of the following states/union territories?
questions.explanation: Jammu and Kashmir. Navreh - It falls on the first day of the Chaitra Navratri. On this day Kashmiri pandits look at a bowl of rice which is considered as a symbol of riches and fertility. Q.644.__________ is a festival of sowing seeds in the field. It is a major festival celebrated in Jharkhand. SSC MTS 08/05/2023 (Evening) (a) Karam (b) Bandana (c) Jawa (d) Rohini Sol.644.(d) Rohini. Festivals like Rajsawala Ambavati and Chitgomha are also celebrated with Rohini.

questions.question: The Yaoshang festival of Manipur is celebrated for_______days.
questions.explanation: Five. Yaoshang festival (Manipur’s version of Holi) - Celebrated every year on the full moon of Lamta month (February-March) of the Meitei lunar calendar. The highlight of the festival is the ‘ThabalChongba’ (folk dance) . It commemorates the birthday of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. Q.646. Tusu is a harvest festival celebrated in Jharkhand during the winter on the last day of________ month. SSC MTS 11/05/2023 (Afternoon) (a) Phalguna (b) Chaitra (c) Magha (d) Poush Sol.646.(d) Poush. Tusu is mostly seen in the area between Bundu, Tamar, and Raidih areas of Jharkhand. Q.647. Which among the following festivals is the thanksgiving festival, mainly celebrated in Goa? SSC MTS 11/05/2023 (Evening) (a) Hornbill (b) Myoko (c) Bihula (d) Ladainha Sol.647.(d) Ladainha (celebrated by Christians). Other festivals in Goa: Shigmo, Sao Joao, Sunburn, Grape Escapade.

questions.question: Pongal, the four day Harvest festival is generally celebrated in _______.
questions.explanation: South India. Pongal (Thai Pongal) is a four-day harvest festival celebrated in South India and Sri Lanka. It is a major festival of the Tamil people, and is also celebrated by other communities in the region. The festival is dedicated to the sun god, Surya, and marks the end of the winter solstice.

questions.question: Kicheri is a harvest festival and involves ritual bathing, celebrated majorly in _________.
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. Makar Sankranti (Harvest festival): Celebrated in different states with different names - Uttarayan in Gujarat, Maghi in Punjab, Magha Saaji in Himachal Pradesh, Pongal in Tamil Nadu. Celebrated in the month of January. Q.650 ."Solung" is a festival celebrated by the Adi Tribe of which state? SSC MTS 16/06/2023 (Evening) (a) Himachal Pradesh (b) Madhya Pradesh (c) Arunachal Pradesh (d) Andhra Pradesh Sol.650.(c) Arunachal Pradesh. Solung festival is celebrated in the first week of September as an agricultural festival. Q.651. Which among the following festivals marks the birthday of a great Buddhist saint Je Tsongkhapa? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (4th Shift) (a) Sarhul (b) Losar (c) Tusu (d) Galdan Namchot Sol.651.(d) Galdan Namchot is often celebrated in Tibet, Mongolia and Ladakh. This Festival marks the beginning of the New Year in Ladakh.

questions.question: Which among the following is the monsoon mud festival of Goa ?
questions.explanation: Chikal Kalo. It is celebrated on the 12th day of the month of Ashadh that roughly falls in July. The Devaki-Krishna temple grounds of Marcel village in Goa are the venue for the celebration of the festival. Q.653. Ganga Dussehra takes place every year on the ________ day of Shukla Paksha of Jyeshtha month. SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (2nd Shift) (a) 6th (b) 8th (c) 10th (d) 12th Sol.653.(c) 10th. Ganga Dussehra (Gangavataran) - Hindu festival, marks the descendance of river Ganga on Earth. Holi: full moon date (Purnima) of Falgun month (Feb-March).

questions.question: Which of the following festivals in Punjab is celebrated to commemorate the formation of the Khalsa Panth?
questions.explanation: Baisakhi (Sikh New Year) commemorates the formation of Khalsa Panth by Guru Gobind Singh in 1699. It is mainly celebrated in the states of Punjab and Haryana. It is a spring harvest festival usually celebrated on 13 or 14 April every year. Lohri (marks the passing of the winter solstice), Hola Mohalla (three-day long Sikh festival which normally falls in March), Teej (also known as Teeyan, dedicated to the onset of the monsoon).

questions.question: Where is the Sair-E-Gul Faroshan festival held?
questions.explanation: Delhi. Sair-E-Gul Faroshan is a three-day festival, generally held in the month of September, just after the rainy season in the region of Mehrauli. Q.656. Which of the following is celebrated as the New Year in Tamil Nadu? SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (1st Shift) (a) Pongal (b) Puthandu (c) Ugadi (d) Onam Sol.656.(b) Puthandu (Puthuvarudam, Tamil New Year). Chittirai (14 April) on the Tamil calendar, celebrated as a festival by Tamil Hindus of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.

questions.question: Wangala festival is celebrated by which of the following tribes?
questions.explanation: Garo tribe. Wangala Festival (100 drums festival) is a harvest festival held in honor of Saljong, the Sun-god of fertility. It also signifies the onset of winter. Bhil tribe - Bhagoria Festivals (Madhya Pradesh). Tharu tribe (southern Nepal and northern India) - Dashain (Vijayadashami), Tihar (Deepawali), and Jitiya. Bhutia tribe (Sikkim) - Losar festival. Q.658. Kagyed dance, a customary dance festival which is celebrated annually in Sikkim falls in which month? SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (4th Shift) (a) May (b) October (c) December (d) August Sol.658.(c) December. Kagyed dance (celebrated by Buddhists in the name of eight tantrik Gods and Goddesses) - a customary dance festival, celebrated annually in Sikkim falls on the 28th and 29th day of the tenth month according to the Tibetan calendar and December month according to the English calendar.
