questions.question: A Hindu festival celebrated by the Tamil community that falls in the Tamil Solar Month is called?
questions.explanation: Thaipusam (This festival is dedicated to Lord Muruga, celebrated on the full moon in the Tamil month of Thai in January/February).

questions.question: Which of the following festivals is organised by the Government of Karnataka, usually in January, to celebrate the grandeur of temples at a UNESCO heritage site?
questions.explanation: Pattadakal Dance Festival is a three-day affair and a celebration of the temples in the small village (Pattadakal) of Karnataka.

questions.question: Which Indian religious festival has recently been included in the representative list of intangible cultural heritage of humanity by UNESCO, an organisation of the United Nations?
questions.explanation: Durga Puja (Durgotsava or Sharadotsav) is a ten-day Hindu festival. The festival of Durga Puja is observed to celebrate the triumph of goddess Durga over Mahishasura. It is held in September or October in Kolkata (West Bengal). It was included in the UNESCO List of Intangible Cultural Heritage (2021, List was established in 2008). Q.662. Guru Purnima, a festival celebrated by Hindus, Jains and Buddhists in India falls in which month of Hindu calendar? SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (4th Shift) (a) Kartika (b) Vaisakha (c) Sravana (d) Ashadha Sol.662.(d) Ashadha. It is observed on the Full Moon day (Purnima) in the Hindu month of Ashadha (June -July). Guru Purnima (Vyaas Purnima) is celebrated in India, Nepal, and Bhutan by Hindus, Jains, and Buddhists.

questions.question: Thiruvathira is a cultural festival of which of the following Indian states?
questions.explanation: Kerala. The 'Thiruvathira' festival is celebrated to commemorate the plea of Goddess Parvathi who used to regularly observe fast on Thiruvathira day in the name of Lord Shiva.

questions.question: Which festival is celebrated in the month of February by the Angami tribe of Nagaland ?
questions.explanation: Sekrenyi Festival also known as Sokre-n and Phousanyi. Losoong is a Sikkimese New Year festival. The festival is celebrated by Bhutia and Lepcha tribes in India, Bhutan and Nepal. Majuli (biggest river island in the world) festival celebrated in Assam.

questions.question: In which of the following Indian states is Dunnapothula Panduga celebrated?
questions.explanation: Telangana. Dunnapothula Panduga (Sadar) is a buffalo carnival. Some Famous festivals are Pongal (Tamil Nadu), Ganga Sagar Mela, Durga Puja (West Bengal), Bihu (Assam), Kakatiya festival (Telangana).

questions.question: ‘Laru Kaj’ is a festival primarily celebrated by the Gonds of __________
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh. Other festivals - Meghnad parv (Gond tribe), Ratona (Baiga tribe), Bhagoriya (bhil tribe), etc. Q.667. Sammakka-Sarakka Jatara is celebrated in which of the following states of India? Higher Secondary 04/08/2022 (Shift - 3) (a) Odisha (b) Tamil Nadu (c) Telangana (d) Chhattisgarh Sol.667.(c) Telangana. Festivals of Telangana - Bathukamma, Bonalu, Medaram Jatara.

questions.question: The International Sand Art festival is usually held in _______.
questions.explanation: Odisha. Art Festivals of India: Kala Ghoda Arts Festival (Mumbai). Ellora-Ajanta International Festival (Aurangabad). Surajkund Crafts Mela (Haryana). Taj Mahotsav (Agra). Serendipity Arts Festival (Goa). Q.669. The Festival of Salhesh is celebrated in the state of: SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Morning) (a) Tamil Nadu (b) Punjab (c) Gujarat (d) Bihar Sol.669.(d) Bihar. Famous festivals of Bihar - Chhath Puja, Buddha Jayanti, Sonepur Cattle Fair, Rajgir Mahotsav, Sama-Chakeva, Bihula, Madhushravani, Pitrapaksha Mela, and Malmas Mela.

questions.question: Which of the following states celebrates the Float Festival?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu. Float Festival is celebrated at the famous Meenakshi Amman Temple which is dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi who is believed to be the reincarnation of Goddess Parvati.

questions.question: Gochi festival is an Indian festival majorly celebrated in ________.
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh. Festivals & Fairs of Himachal Pradesh :- Halda Festival, Kullu Dussehra Fair, Ice Skating Carnival, Losar Festival, International Himalayan Festival, Doongri Fair, Sazo Festival, Phulaich Festival, Sair Festival, Nuala Festival, Khepa Festival, Minjar Fair, Renuka Fair, Markand Fair, Rali Puja Festival, Deotsidh Fair.

questions.question: ‘Maru Mahotsav’ also known as desert festival is celebrated in ______.
questions.explanation: Maru Mahotsav (Jaisalmer desert festival) is held in the Hindu month of Magh (February), three days prior to the full moon. The festival is celebrated amidst the beautiful dunes of the Thar Desert in the Sam dunes.

questions.question: In which district of Rajasthan is the Elephant festival celebrated every year?
questions.explanation: Jaipur. Elephant Festival, a traditional festival of Rajasthan, held every year at Jaipur Polo Ground on the day of Holi.

questions.question: The Deccan festival is a five-day long festival which reflects the culture of the Deccan. The festival is associated with which state?
questions.explanation: Andhra Pradesh.

questions.question: Soorya Classical Dance Festival is held in ________ for 10 days every year.
questions.explanation: Thiruvananthapuram (Kerala), this festival is organized by Soorya Stage and Film Society.

questions.question: Elephanta Festival is the cultural pride of ________ among the dance and music festivals of India.
questions.explanation: Maharashtra. Elephanta Festival is celebrated in February every year on Elephanta islands in Mumbai, Maharashtra. The Elephanta Caves founded by King Krishnaraja (Kalachuri dynasty) are a collection of cave temples predominantly dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva.

questions.question: Held in the month of __________, the Ellora Ajanta Dance Festival is an interface between the culture and history of India.
questions.explanation: January. Ellora Festival (Ellora Ajanta Festival) organized by Maharashtra Tourism Development (MTDC) is celebrated every year for three days. The paintings and sculptures of Ajanta and Ellora caves have been UNESCO World Heritage Sites since 1983 and are considered masterpieces of Buddhist religious art.

questions.question: Tribes of the Nicobar Islands pay their respects to the departed soul of the head of the family during the ______.
questions.explanation: Ossuary Feast. Goddess Jagadhatri Puja is worshiped in the West Bengal region. Gajan is a Hindu festival, associated with such deities as Shiva-Parvati. Kalpataru Utsav is an annual religious festival observed by monks of the Ramakrishna Math. Q.679. In which Indian state is the ‘Fatorpa Zatra’ celebrated? SSC CGL 19/04/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Madhya Pradesh (b) Goa (c) Kerala (d) Himachal Pradesh Sol.679.(b) Goa. It is celebrated at the temple of Shantadurga Kuncolienkarin at Fatorpa in Quepem taluka. Famous Temple Fairs in India : Odisha - Puri Rath Yatra; Kerala - Thrissur Pooram, Arattu Festival, Attuvela Mahotsavam; Tamil Nadu - Chithirai Thiruvizha Festival; Karnataka- Vairamudi Garuda Utsavam Festival, Karaga Festival; Andhra Pradesh - Kotappakonda Temple Fair; Uttarakhand - Nanda Devi Festival, Vaikunth Chaturdashi Mela.

questions.question: The Kodava community of Coorg worships weapons during the ______ festival.
questions.explanation: Kailpodh. It is celebrated in September. Kail means weapon or armor and Pold means festival. Puttari is the harvest festival of Kodava community.

questions.question: Which of the following festivals is also known as the 'Manipuri New Year' ?
questions.explanation: Cheiraoba. List of festivals in Manipur are - Gang-Ngai, Lui-Ngai-Ni, Yaosang. Kang: The Ratha Yatra of Manipur, Heikru Hitongba, Ningol Chak-Kouba: A social festival of the Manipuris, Kut: Festival of Kuki - Chin- Mizo. Q.682. To which of the following incarnations of Vishnu is Dhanuyatra of Odisha's Bargarh district dedicated? SSC MTS 12/10/2021 (Morning) (a) Lord Rama (b) Lord Vamana (c) Lord Varaha (d) Lord Krishna Sol.682.(d) Lord Krishna. Dhanu Jatra or Dhanu Yatra is an annual drama-based open-air theatrical performance celebrated in Bargarh, Odisha.

questions.question: Kaveri Sankramana is a festival celebrated in____in the month of October.
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Kaveri Sankramana is celebrated at Talakaveri in Kodagu district in Karnataka.

questions.question: Which state in India celebrates the 'Sundareswara Festival' ?
questions.explanation: Kerala. The Sri Sundareswara temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Every year a festival is celebrated where hundreds of devotees attend the festival. Q.685. Drukpa Tsechi, a festival celebrated in Sikkim, is associated with which of the following personalities? SSC MTS 22/10/2021 (Morning) (a) Mahavir Swami (b) Lord Rama (c) Lord Buddha (d)LordKrishna Sol.685.(c) Lord Buddha. This festival celebrates Lord Buddha's first preaching of the Four Noble Truths to his first five disciples at Sarnath.

questions.question: In which of the following months is the ‘Valvil Ori Vizha’ festival of Tamil Nadu celebrated?
questions.explanation: August. It is celebrated in a grand manner in the Kolli Hills of Tamil Nadu.

questions.question: ______ festival in the Bastar region is celebrated along with the worship of the local goddess, Kesharpal Kesharpalin Devi.
questions.explanation: Madai. Festivals of Uttarakhand :- Bhitauli, Harela, Phool Dei, Batsavitri, Ganga Dussehra or Dasar, Dikar Puja, Olgia or Ghee Sankranti, Khatarua, Ghuian Ekadashi, Chhipla Jaat, Kandali, Janopunya, Kumaon Holi (including Khari Holi and Baithaki Holi).

questions.question: Teeyan is a festival celebrated in Punjab, which celebrates the onset of ______.
questions.explanation: Monsoon . A cultural festival observed by and for women, Teeyan or Punjabi. Teeyan begins on the third day of Saawan Maas and ends on Saawan Purnima, spanning a total of thirteen days.

questions.question: In which festival of Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh, are the bullocks and other cattles used for agriculture worshipped?
questions.explanation: Pola is a thanksgiving festival celebrated by farmers in Maharashtra, to acknowledge the importance of bulls and oxen, who are a crucial part of agriculture and farming activities. It falls on the day of the Pithori Amavasya (the new moon day) in the month of Shravana (usually in August).

questions.question: Which of the following festivals is called the month of merits and is celebrated between May and June?
questions.explanation: Saga Dawa. It is the most significant and sacred for the followers of Mahayana Buddhism who, on this auspicious occasion, commemorate Lord Buddha’s birth, his attainment of enlightenment and salvation from this corporeal world. It is celebrated in Sikkim.

questions.question: Arthunkal Feast and Vettukad Festival are church festivals from the state of ______.
questions.explanation: Kerala. Other Church festivals of Kerala : Bharananganam, Edappally Perunal, Edathua, Kadamattom, Kallooppara Perunal, Koratty, Malayattur, Manjinikkara , Maramon Convention, Niranam, Rakkuli Thirunal, St. Dominic Syrian, Thumpoly, Vettukad.

questions.question: In which of the following festivals the meaning is 'merry making of the gods'?
questions.explanation: Lai Haraoba is the ritual ceremonial festival of Manipur which is believed to be the act of re-enactment of the creation of the universe by the gods and goddesses at the sacred site Haraothel of Koubru Hill.

questions.question: Bhavnath Mahadev fair is held every year in which of the following places?
questions.explanation: Junagarh. The Bhavnath Mahadev Fair is held at the Bhavnath Mahadev Temple, situated at the foot of Mount Girnar in the city of Junagadh (Gujarat). A five day fair is held during the festival of Mahashivratri which is a worldwide tourist attraction. Other fairs celebrated in Gujarat: Chitra-Vichitra Fair, Dangs Durbar Fair, Shamlaji Fair, and Tarnetar Fair (Trinetrashwar Mahadev Fair).

questions.question: In which of the following states is the Bhadaravi Poonam Mela organised every year in the Nilkanth Mahadev temple premises in Babra?
questions.explanation: Gujarat. Ambaji Bhadarvi Poonam Fair takes place in the month of Bhadarvo Ambaji, Gujarat. The fair is organized by the Shri Arasuri Ambaji Mata Devasthan Trust and the Banaskantha District Administration. The fair is considered a major religious gathering in western India, with over 25 lakh devotees visiting the temple town. Other Fair of Gujarat - Tarnetar Fair, Kavant Tribal Fair, Chitra Vichitra Tribal Fair, Madhavrai Fair.

questions.question: Madhavpur Fair in Gujarat is a _______ day long event to celebrate Lord Krishna's marriage with Rukmani.
questions.explanation: five. Fair and Festivals of Gujarat: Rann Utsav, International Kite Festival, Tarnetar fair, Megh Malhar Parv Saputara, Vibrant Navratri Festival, Dang Darbar Fair, Kavant Fair.

questions.question: In which of the following states is the groundnut fair, ’Kadalekayi Parishe’ celebrated on the last Monday of the Karthika month of the Hindu calendar?
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Kadalekayi Parishe is an annual groundnut fair held in Basavanagudi, Bangalore, at the Bull Temple, usually in November or December. Dedicated to Lord Ganesha, it marks the harvest season for groundnuts. The fair features prayers, cultural events, and local markets where farmers sell their fresh produce. It is a centuries-old tradition celebrating Karnataka's agricultural heritage.

questions.question: ’Poush Mela’ is a unique festival celebrated in which of the following Indian states?
questions.explanation: West Bengal. Poush Mela is an annual fair and festival that takes place in Santiniketan, in Birbhum District, marking the harvest season. Other Fair of West Bengal - Kenduli Mela, Bhim Mela, Rash Mela, Ganga Sagar Mela, Jalpesh Mela, Kolkata Book Fair.

questions.question: Gangaur Festival, Pushkar Fair, Nagaur Fair and Urs Fair are the popular fairs and festivals of which state?
questions.explanation: Rajasthan. Other fairs and festivals in Rajasthan: Camel Festival, Mahaveerji Fair, Baneshwar Fair , Kolayat Fair, Marwar Festival, and Dhulandi Festival. Fairs and Festivals of India: Tripura - Poush Sankranti, Garia, and Kharchi. Punjab - Chhappar Mela, Lohri, Hola Mohalla, and Baisakhi. Maharashtra - Banganga Festival, and Pola Festival.

questions.question: Sardhana Christian Fair is held in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. Sardhana Christian Fair : Every year on the 1st Sunday of the month of November a large feast is held in honor of Mother Mary. Other Fairs of Uttar Pradesh : Kumbh Mela (the festival of the sacred Pitcher), Gau Charan Fair, Nauchandi Fair, Dewa Sharif Fair, Shakumbhari Fair, Magh Fair (Prayagraj), Rath Fair (Vrindavan), Agra Cattle Fair or Bateshwar Fair (Agra).

questions.question: Ambubachi fair is celebrated in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Assam. Ambubachi Mela is an annual four-day Hindu mela held at Kamakhya Temple in Guwahati, Assam. It symbolizes the fertility cult of Goddess Kamakhya. Other Fair of Assam - Jonbeel Mela.

questions.question: Bahu Mela in_______is the major festival held at the Kali Temple in the Bahu Fort twice a year
questions.explanation: Jammu. Bahu Mela, one of the largest Hindu festivals in Jammu, is a vibrant celebration held at Bahu Fort. Major festivals in Jammu and Kashmir include the Tulip Festival, Shikara Festival, Saffron Festival and Gurez Festival.

questions.question: The Dang Darbar Fair is held every year in which Indian state?
questions.explanation: Gujarat. Dangs Darbar is a fair held during the Holi festival in Ahwa district in Gujarat. Traditionally, tribal people perform dance and music, celebrating it as a festival. Notable festivals in Gujarat include Navratri, Rann Utsav, International Kite Festival (Uttarayan), Modhera Dance Festival, Makar Sankranti, Janmashtami, and Diwali.

questions.question: Identify the cultural festival on the basis of given clues: i) This festival brings together craftsmen like potters, embroiderers, weavers, wood carvers, metal workers, stone smiths and painters from all over India on one platform in Haryana. ii) This crafts mela is held in February every year and provides a glimpse of the state’s cultural heritage and recent achievements.
questions.explanation: Surajkund Mela (Faridabad). This is one of the most celebrated international Craftsmela and is organised by the Haryana Tourism Department. Shamlaji fair (Gujarat). The Kapil Muni Fair is the largest fair of Bikaner (Rajasthan). The Chitra Vichitra Fair (Gujarat).

questions.question: Shri Jagannathji Mela is held at ______.
questions.explanation: Alwar (Rajasthan). The Shri Jagannathji Mela starts with a procession of Lord Jagannath passing through the city. Other Fairs of Rajasthan: Karni Mata Mela (Bikaner); Beneshwar Mela (Dungarpur) and Pushkar Fair (Ajmer).

questions.question: The world's largest camel fair is held in which of the following cities?
questions.explanation: Pushkar (Rajasthan) camel fair held each November at the time of the Kartik Purnima. Fairs/Festivals of Rajasthan : Bikaner camel festival is celebrated in the month of January. Barmer Cattle Fair is held every year in the months of March and April. The Mewar festival Udaipur, is held each year in March-April to welcome spring. The Bundi Festival is celebrated in the month of Kartik (October-November).

questions.question: Kumbh Mela and Sangam are famous in which state?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. This fair starts on the day of Makar Sankranti. This fair is held every 12 years, with the location of the observance rotating among four pilgrimage sites on the four sacred rivers: Ganga at Haridwar, Triveni Sangam at Prayagraj, the Godavari at Nashik, and Shipra at Ujjain. Ardha (half) Kumbh Mela is held at only two places, Haridwar and Allahabad, every sixth year and a Maha Kumbh is held after every years. It is the 13th intangible cultural heritage from India to be listed on UNESCO's list.

questions.question: Simhastha fair is held in Ujjain on the bank of which river?
questions.explanation: Kshipra river. Ujjain Simhastha is a Hindu religious mela held every 12 years in the Ujjain city of Madhya Pradesh.

questions.question: With reference to Sonepur Cattle fair, consider the following statements and select the correct option. a) It is associated with the Hariharnath temple. b) It begins on Purnima (full moon night) and Kartik month. c) It is celebrated in the Madhya Pradesh state.
questions.explanation: Both a and b. Sonepur Cattle Fair is one of Asia's largest cattle fairs, organized at the confluence of two rivers, the Ganga and Gandak in Bihar. Nagaji Fair is celebrated in the tribal area of Madhya Pradesh. Q.709. Sheorinarayan fair is held in which of the following states? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (4th shift) (a) West Bengal (b) Jharkhand (c) Chhattisgarh (d) Madhya Pradesh Sol.709.(c) Chhattisgarh. The fair is held every year in the month of February during the Magh Purnima. The Sherorinarayan Temple which is devoted to Lord Rama is the main venue of this Fair.

questions.question: Ganga Sagar Mela is conducted at the mouth of the river Hooghly in ____.
questions.explanation: West Bengal. Gangasagar fair is held annually on the occasion of Makar Sankranti (January) on Sagar Island's southern tip, where the Ganges river enters the Bay of Bengal. This confluence is Gangasagar. Fairs of West Bengal: Bera Utsav, Orange Festival, Rath Yatra Festival, Jalpesh Festival, Ramkeli Mela, Poush Mela, Raas Mela, Book Fair & Film Festival, etc. Q.711. The Champaran Mela is celebrated every year in which city of Chhattisgarh? Graduate Level 05/08/2022 ( Shift - 3) (a) Bilaspur (b) Raipur (c) Raigarh (d) Korna Sol.711.(b) Raipur. The Annual Fair of Champaran is held with great festivities in the month of Magh every year.

questions.question: Which of the following is a cattle fair celebrated in the state of Himachal Pradesh?
questions.explanation: Nalwari Fair. Doongri Festival also known as Hidimba Devi Fair is celebrated in Kullu on the occasion of Basant Panchami. Ashwin Navratri Mela is celebrated in Himachal Pradesh and Ashwin Amavasya Mela is celebrated in Uttar Pradesh.

questions.question: AR Rehman, Gulzar and _____ won the 52nd annual Grammy Award for the best motion picture song ‘Jai ho’.
questions.explanation: Tanvi Shah. She is the first Indian Woman to win a Grammy Award. Grammy Award is given in the field of Music. It is presented by the Recording Academy of the United States. First Indian who won a grammy award was Pandit Ravi Shankar. A R Rahman won Two Grammy Awards in 2010. The record for the most Grammy Awards won is held by Beyoncé (USA). Q.714. With which of the following states is the Bhatiali folk music, which is mostly sung by the fishermen, associated ? SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (1st shift) (a) Kerala (b) Andhra Pradesh (c) West Bengal (d) Odisha Sol.714.(c) West Bengal. Bhatiali music is a river song characterized by its soulful and melancholic tunes, reflecting the lives and struggles of the fishermen community. Other folk music of West Bengal: Baul, Bhawaia, Kirtan, Gambhira, Shyama Sangeet, Lalon Geeti. Other States and their folk music: Kerala - Kathakali Music, Mappila Pattu, Ottamthullal Songs, Sopanam, Kolkali. Andhra Pradesh - Madiga Dappu, Mala Jamidika. Odisha - Avanti, Panchali, Odramagadhi.

questions.question: The song ‘Teri mitti’ is from which of the following movies?
questions.explanation: Kesari. It is based on the true story of the Battle of Saragarhi in 1897. The film was directed by Anurag Singh. ‘Teri mitti’ song : Writer - Manoj Muntashir. Composer - Arko Pravo Mukherjee. Singer - B Praak.

questions.question: Which folk music is based on the Mahabharata with Bhima portrayed as hero?
questions.explanation: Pandavani. It is a folk music tradition from Chhattisgarh. It narrates the story of the five Pandava brothers (protagonists of the epic Mahabharata). This age-old musical form was kept alive by performers like Teejan Bai, Jhaduram Devangan, Ritu Verma, Usha Barle and Shantibai Chelak. Folk songs of Chhattisgarh : Fag, Karma songs, Danda songs, Sawnahi, Kau-Mau, Sua songs, Chau-Mau Dewar songs, Cher-Chera songs, Sohar song, Khuduwa, Dhankul songs, Bhojali songs, Dandi Pouha, Loriya, Goura songs, Fugdi etc.

questions.question: Who is known as the ‘Father of Carnatic Music’?
questions.explanation: Purandara Dasa. Tamil Nadu is famous for Carnatic music, based on ragas (melodies) and talas (rhythms). Purandara Dasa has contributed significantly to its codification and giving it a clear format for its teaching and performance. The devotional songs composed by Shyama Shastri, Tyagaraja and Muthuswami Dikshitar are very popular. These songs are accompanied by instruments like the mridangam, veena, nadaswaram, and flute. In recognition of its musical heritage, Chennai was included in the UNESCO Creative Cities Network in 2017.

questions.question: Folk songs in _________ are called Raganis.
questions.explanation: Haryana. Raganis are performed by multiple singers and dancers and are sung in the local dialect. State and their Folk songs : Haryana - Gharwa Gayan, Jhoolana, Patka, and Rasia. Uttar Pradesh - khayal, ghazals, Swang, Naqal. Bihar - Sohar, Bidesia, Chhath Geet, Kajri. Madhya Pradesh - Nirguni Bhajans, Fag songs, Pandavani. Q.719. Match List-I (Name of the composition) with List-II (Writer). List-I (Name of the Composition) List-II (Writer) 1. Vande Mataram A. Pradeep 2. Jana Gana Mana B. Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay 3. Ae Mere Watan Ke Logon C. Rabindranath Tagore SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (1st shift) (a) 1-C, 2-A, 3-B (b) 1-B, 2-C, 3-A (c) 1-C, 2-B, 3-A (d) 1-A, 2-B, 3-C Sol.719.(b) 1-B, 2-C, 3-A. "Aye Mere Watan Ke Logo" is a patriotic song written in Hindi by Kavi Pradeep, composed by C. Ramchandra, and sung by singer Lata Mangeshkar. Jana Gana Mana is the national anthem of the Republic of India. It was originally composed as "Bharoto Bhagyo Bidhata" in Bengali by polymath Rabindranath Tagore on 11 December 1911. "Vande Mataram" is a Bengali poem by Bankim Chandra Chatterjee. Q.720. Which folk music does NOT belong to Nagaland? SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Nyioga (b) Heliamleu (c) Hereileu (d) Neuleu Sol.720.(a) Nyioga. It is sung when a marriage ceremony is concluded and the bride's family returns leaving the bride in her home in Arunachal Pradesh. Nagaland's folk music is known for its enchanting melodies and lyrics that tell stories of love, nature, bravery, and cultural identity. Nagaland famous folk dance: Hereileu, Chang Lo, Tetseo Sisters, Tati, Theku, Asem, Kuki dance.

questions.question: The famous folk music ‘Hekialeu’ has its origin in which state?
questions.explanation: Nagaland. The Hekialeu song is known as the war song of Nagaland. This is because the aged people of Nagaland narrate their achievements in past battles through this form of music. Folk music in India : Baul (West Bengal), Mando (Goa), Sohar (Uttar Pradesh and Bihar), Chhakri (Jammu and Kashmir), and Powada (Maharashtra).

questions.question: Khubakeshei is a kind of song accompanied by clapping, sung in the state of _____.
questions.explanation: Manipur. Khubakeshei is a traditional folk song from Manipur, typically sung with clapping and accompanied by traditional instruments like the Pena (a stringed instrument) or the Khartal (a pair of cymbals). Popular folk songs of Manipur : Pena Khongba, Khulang Eshei, Lai Haraoba Eshei.

questions.question: Which of the following musical forms in Carnatic Classical is the simplest composition of raga?
questions.explanation: Gitam. The main traditional forms of improvisation in Carnatic music consist of the following: Alapana, Niraval, Pallavi, Ragam, Swarakalpana, Tanam, Tani, Avartanam. Varnam - A type of composition in Carnatic music that captures the essence of a raga, or scale, in a short piece of music. Padas are scholarly compositions in Telegu and Tamil.

questions.question: Who among the following wrote the popular Telugu patriotic song ‘Desamunu preminchumanna, manchi annadi penchumanna’ meaning ‘Love the nation, grow the goodness’?
questions.explanation: Gurajada Apparao. Gurajada Venkata Apparao was an Indian playwright, dramatist, poet, and writer known for his works in Telugu theatre. Rao wrote the play Kanyasulkam in 1892, which is considered as the greatest play in the Telugu language. He holds the titles Kavisekhara and Abyudaya Kavitha Pithamahudu. In 1910, Rao scripted the widely known Telugu patriotic song "Desamunu Preminchumanna".

questions.question: Which folk music of Jammu and Kashmir is sung in wedding ceremonies?
questions.explanation: Wanawun. It is usually performed by women, who sing and dance together, accompanied by traditional instruments like the tarang (a type of drum) and the tumbaknari (a single-headed drum). Other folk music: Alha - Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh. Panihari - Rajasthan. Baul - West Bengal.

questions.question: Under which Gharana do the composition of the blend of Khayal and Dhrupad-Dhamar styles come?
questions.explanation: Agra Gharana was founded by Haji Sujan Khan. Agra was an important part of Braj Bhumi, the land of Shri Krishna, and home to Bhakti and Sufi saints like Surdas and Raskhan. The Gwalior Gharana, considered the oldest Khayal Gharana in Indian classical music, was founded by Nathan Khan, and Tansen was one of its earliest and most famous vocalists. Q.727. In classical Carnatic music, tempo is called as ________. SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) padam (b) gita (c) laya (d) achala Sol.727.(c) laya. Carnatic music originated in South India whereas Hindustani music originated in North India. Different forms of Carnatic Music: Gitam (simple composition), Swarajathi (devotional or heroic), Varnam (unique to Carnatic music), Kirtanam (focused on devotion), and Kriti (an evolved form of Kirtanam).

questions.question: In Hindustani classical music, according to Vishnu Narayana Bhatkhande, how many thaats are the origins of ragas?
questions.explanation: 10. These 10 thaats are: Bilawal, Khamaj, Kafi, Asavari, Bhairav, Bhairavi, Todi, Purvi, Marwa, Yaman. Each thaat has a specific arrangement of whole and half steps, and ragas are derived from these thaats by using different combinations of notes, ornamentations, and emotional expressions.

questions.question: Which of the following songs did AR Rahman record with Michael Jackson?
questions.explanation: Ekam Satyam. A.R. Rahman collaborated with Michael Jackson on the song "Ekam Satyam" (also known as "The One Truth"), which was recorded in 1999. Michael Jackson ("King of Pop") was an American singer, songwriter, dancer, and record producer.

questions.question: Who composed the music of the patriotic song ‘Maa Tujhe Salaam’ ?
questions.explanation: AR Rahman. Some Patriotic songs and their Singers: ‘Aye mere watan ke logo’ (Lata Mangeshkar), ‘Yeh Desh Hai Veer Jawanon Ka’ (Mohammed Rafi), ‘Bharat Ka Rahnewala Hoon’ (Mahendra Kapoor), ‘Phir Bhi Dil Hai Hindustani’ (Udit Narayan), ‘Aao Bachho Tumhe Dikhaye’ (Kavi Pradeep), ‘Nanha Munna Rahi Hun’ (Shanti Mathur), ‘Ae Watan Tere Liye (Mohammad Aziz & Kavita Krishnamurthy)’, ‘Teri Mitti’ (B Praak), ‘Sandese Aate Hai’ (Sonu Nigam & Roop Kumar Rathod).

questions.question: In which of the following states are the Pai songs accompanied by the Saria dance sung during the rain festivals?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh. Pai song is sung to pray for a good monsoon and a good harvest. The Saira dance is performed by members of the peasant community to seek the blessings of Lord Indra (rain god) for a good harvest. Other festivals of Madhya Pradesh: Lokrang Festival, Akhil Bharatiya Kalidas Samaroh, Lokranjan or Khajuraho Festival, Bhagoria Haat Festival, Nagaji Fair, and Chethiyagiri Vihara Festival. Q.732. The music of traditional _________consists of thumri and other lyrical song forms. SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Kathakali (b) Sattriya (c) Kathak (d) Kuchipudi Sol.732.(c) Kathak. The word "Kathak" is derived from "Katha," meaning story. Kathak has three main schools or gharanas-Lucknow, Jaipur, and Banaras-each with its unique emphasis. The Lucknow Gharana focuses on expressiveness and grace, the Jaipur Gharana is known for its strong footwork, and the Banaras Gharana combines elements of both. Q.733. Ohira folk music is primarily associated with one of the popular festivals of which of the following states? SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Jharkhand (b) Karnataka (c) Assam (d) Kerala Sol.733.(a) Jharkhand. Ohira folk song is dedicated to animals. Folk Music in India: Jharkhand - Domkach, Jhumar. Uttar Pradesh - Rasiya Geet, Kajri, Qawwali. Maharashtra - Lavoni, Pavodas.

questions.question: Community tradition is related to which of the following music streams?
questions.explanation: Hindustani Classical Music is traditionally passed down through oral traditions in a teacher-student (guru-shishya) relationship within Gharanas (musical schools), which preserve unique styles and reflect community traditions across different regions.

questions.question: Which folk music is a mix of Indian and western music and is popular in Goa?

Marwar Festival (originally known as the Maand Festival) is celebrated in memory of the heroes of Rajasthan.

questions.question: Who has written the patriotic song ‘Sandese Aate Hai’?

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a part of Carnatic music ?
questions.explanation: Dhrupad is a genre in Hindustani classical music (HCM). Other vocal forms associated with HCM: Khayal, Ghazal, Dhammar, Tarana and Thumri. Main traditional forms of Carnatic music: Alapana, Niraval, Pallavi, Ragam, Kalpnaswaram, Thana.

questions.question: 'Pankhida' songs are sung by peasants of _____ while working on the fields.
questions.explanation: Rajasthan. 'Pankhida' songs are an integral part of Rajasthani folk culture and are typically sung during agricultural activities like sowing, harvesting, and threshing. The peasants sing and speak while playing algoza and manjira. Indian folk music - Bhavageethe (Karnataka and Maharashtra), Bhangra and Giddha (Punjab), Lavani (Maharashtra), Alha (Madhya Pradesh) and Panihari, Pankhida and Maand (Rajasthan). Q.739. ___________ is a musical composition that expresses devotion through madhura bhakti. SSC CHSL 08/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Tillana (b) Gita (c) Padam (d) Kriti Sol.739.(c) Padam. A musical composition can refer to an original piece, its structure, or the process of creating it. Tillana is a rhythmic Carnatic piece performed at the end of concerts, focusing on rhythm and tempo. Gita is a hymn, often from texts like the Bhagavad Gita. Kriti, another Carnatic composition, expresses various emotions, not limited to devotion.

questions.question: Which of the following types of music is confined to the states of Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu and Kerala?
questions.explanation: Karnataka. It is based on the Sanskrit term Karnataka Sangitam, meaning “traditional” or “codified” music. Gitam: Simple, melodious composition in raga. Suladi: Talamalika with sections in different talas. Jatisavaram: Focuses on rhythmical excellence and Jati patterns. Purandara Dasa (1484-1564) is known as the father of Carnatic music. He was a poet, composer, and mystic from Vijayanagar. He's also known as Karnataka Sangeetha Pitamaha.

questions.question: Which statement about Classical Carnatic Music is correct?

options.d: The compositions are either in Malayalam, Marathi, Tamil or Bengali.

questions.explanation: Carnatic music in the South Indian languages, is a system of music commonly associated with South India, including the modern Indian states of Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and portions of east and south Telangana and southern Odisha. Some Carnatic Singers: Dr. Nithyashree Mahadevan, Sudha Raghunathan, K J Yesudas, P Unni Krishnan, M Balamuralikrishna, Semmangudi Srinivasa Iyer, Bombay Jayashri, Aruna Sairam.

questions.question: Which of the following is a style of Carnatic music?
questions.explanation: Svarajati. It consists of three sections, called Pallavi, Anupallavi and Charanam. The theme is either devotional, heroic or amorous. Dhrupad, Khayal, Tappa, Chaturanga, Tarana, Sargam, Thumri and Ragasagar, Hori and Dhamar are ten main styles of singing in Hindustani music.

questions.question: Which of the following is called the cyclic arrangement of time units in Hindustani Classical music?

A type of lyrical composition that often deals with themes of love, devotion, or emotions. It is known for its expressive and emotive qualities. questions.question: Which statement about Syama Sastri is correct?

questions.explanation: The Trinity of Carnatic Music are also known as the three Jewels of Carnatic Music. They are credited with creating a new era in Carnatic music history by bringing about a noticeable change in the existing tradition. Tyagaraja: A Telugu composer known for his Pancharatna Kritis. Muthuswami Dikshitar: A Sanskrit and Manipravalam composer. Syama Sastri: A Telugu and Sanskrit composer. Q.746. With which Gharana is the famous Tarana singer Pandit Rattan Mohan Sharma associated ? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Patiala Gharana (b) Agra Gharana (c) Talwandi Gharana (d) Mewati Gharana Sol.746.(d) Mewati Gharana. Rattan Mohan Sharma is an Indian classical vocalist. questions.question: How many basic talams are there in Indian Classical Carnatic music?
questions.explanation: 7 talas in Carnatic music: Dhruva, Matya, Jampa, Ata, Triputa, Rupaka, Eka. Carnatic Music: Composed of a system of Ragam (Raga) and Thalam (Tala), it has a rich history and tradition. It developed in states of Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka.

questions.question: Folk music sung on the birth of a child in some Indian states like Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, etc. is called _____.
questions.explanation: Sohar. Kohbar: It is painted on the wall of the bride and groom's room as a decoration for performing the puja ritual. It is the oldest example of wall painting tradition in Bihar, Jharkhand and Eastern Uttar Pradesh. States and their folk music: Bihar- Bidesia, Kajari, and Sukar ki Biah. Uttar Pradesh- Birha, Nauka Jhakkad, Kajri, Rasiya etc. Q.749. What is Miyan ki Todi in Hindustani music ? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (4th shift) (a) Kirtan (b) Tanam (c) Chhand (d) Raag Sol.749.(d) Raag. Miyan ki Todi, often simply referred to as Todi or Darbari Todi is a Hindustani classical raga which gave its name to the Todi thaat, one of the ten types of classical music according to the musicologist Bhatkhande. Ragas from the Todi raganga (class of ragas) include Bilaskhani Todi, Gujari Todi (also called Gurjari Todi), Desi Todi, Hussaini Todi, Asavari Todi and Bahaduri Todi. Q.750. The famous folk music of Rajasthan that was developed in royal courts is known as: SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (1st shift) (a) Maand (b) Lavani (c) Sohar (d) Dandiya Sol.750.(a) Maand. It is similar to the thumri and the ghazal. Folk music and dance styles of Rajasthan: Ghoomar, Bhavai, Kachhi Ghodi, Kalbelia, Kathputli. Other folk dance: Lavani is a folk dance and music genre that originated in Maharashtra. Sohar is sung during Childbirth in Bihar. Dandiya (Dandiya Raas) performed during the Navaratri festival in Gujarat.

questions.question: In which Gharana do singers perform the Khandhar Vani and Gauhar Vani?
questions.explanation: Darbhanga Gharana. It originated in Darbhanga, Bihar in the 17th-century. It is a gharana of the Hindustani classical music dhrupad thought to have been started by Radhakrishna and Kartaram. Gauhar vani developed the raga or unadorned melodic figures. The Dagarvani emphasized melodic curves and graces. The Khandar vani specialised in quick ornamentation of the notes. Q.752. To which Hindustani music Gharana are the Gundecha brothers related? SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Patiala Gharana (b) Agra Gharana (c) Dagari Gharana (d) Indore Gharana Sol.752.(c) Dagari Gharana. Hindustani Music Gharanas and founders: Gwalior (Nanthan Khan); Agra (Hajisujan Khan); Rangeela (Faiyyaz Khan); Jaipur Atrauli (Alladiya Khan); Kirana (Abdul Wahid Khan).

questions.question: In the Hindustani music system, the ________ are allotted to different hours of the day and different seasons.

Varnam is a musical form in Carnatic music. In Hindustani music, there are various singing styles, including Dhrupad, Tappa, Chaturang, Ragasagar, Dhamar, Hori, Khayal, Tarana, Sargam, and Thumri. questions.question: Who was the first female Indian wrestler to win Gold at the Commonwealth Games ?
questions.explanation: Geeta Phogat. She achieved this feat in the 55 kg freestyle category at the 2010 Commonwealth Games held in Delhi, India. Babita Phogat secured silver in 2010. She won her first Commonwealth Games gold in 2014. Sakshi Malik earned a bronze medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics.

questions.question: Who was the first Indian woman wrestler to win a medal at the Olympics ?
questions.explanation: Sakshi Malik. She won the bronze medal in the 58 kg category at the Rio Olympics. In 2010, Geeta Phogat became the first female Indian wrestler to win gold at the Commonwealth Games.

questions.question: Who was the first Indian wrestler to win Gold at the World Championships in 2010?
questions.explanation: Sushil Kumar. He made history in the World Wrestling Championships by winning the top spot in the men's freestyle 66kg category in Moscow, Russia. He also won a silver medal at the London Olympics in 2012.

questions.question: India's first indigenous Aircraft Carrier, _____, conducted its maiden sea travel in August 2021 marking a significant step towards making military equipment in India.
questions.explanation: INS Vikrant. It was designed and built by Cochin Shipyard Limited (CSL) Kochi, Kerala and launched into water in 2013.

questions.question: Which of the following airports is being built as India's first 'carbon-neutral airport'?
questions.explanation: Leh airport. Carbon neutrality means that the amount of carbon released into the atmosphere is equal to the amount of carbon that is absorbed by carbon sinks. Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) in Delhi is the first airport in India to achieve net zero carbon emission status. The Airports Authority of India (AAI) is a statutory body constituted under the Airports Authority of India Act, 1994. Founded - 1 April 1995. Headquarters - Rajiv Gandhi Bhawan (New Delhi).

questions.question: Who was the first Indian wrestler to win a world championship medal?
questions.explanation: Udey Chand. He was awarded the first Arjuna Award in wrestling in 1961. He secured a bronze in the men’s freestyle 67 kg category at the world championships held in Yokohama, Japan. KD Jadhav became India's first individual Olympic medallist post independence.

questions.question: Who was the chief guest at the first Republic Day celebration of India in 1950?
questions.explanation: Sukarno (Indonesian President). Republic Day is a national holiday in India commemorating the adoption of the Constitution of India, and the country's transition to a republic which came into effect on 26 January 1950. Between 1950 and 1954, Republic Day parades were held at Irwin Stadium (now National Stadium), Kingsway, Red Fort and Ramlila Maidan. King Tribhuvan Bir Bikram Shah of Nepal - Second Chief Guest of the Republic Day Parade in 1951.

questions.question: The first train steamed off from Mumbai to ______.
questions.explanation: Thane. The first passenger train in India departed from Mumbai to Thane on April 16, 1853, covering a distance of kilometers. It was operated by three locomotives named Sahib, Sultan, and Sindh, under the Great Indian Peninsula (GIP) Railway company. The concept of laying a railway line between Mumbai and Thane, extending to Kalyan and Bhor Ghat, was proposed by George Clark in 1843. Lord Dalhousie is recognized as the father of Indian Railways, while John Mathai was the first railway minister of India.

questions.question: What is the name of a cycling track?
questions.explanation: Velodrome. It is a specially designed track used for competitive cycling events. Astroturf is a brand name for a type of artificial turf used in sports fields.

questions.question: In which of the following events did India get its first individual Olympic gold medal?
questions.explanation: Shooting. The gold medal was won by Abhinav Bindra in the 2008 Beijing Olympics in the Men's 10 meter Air Rifle event. questions.question: What is the length of the men's kabaddi court?
questions.explanation: 13 m. The Kabaddi court measures 13 × 10 meters for men and 12 × 8 meters for women. It is basically a combative sport, with seven players on each side; played for a period of 40 minutes with a 5 minutes break (20 - 5 - 20).

questions.question: How many chances does a high jumper get for overcoming a certain height?
questions.explanation: Three chances. The high jump is a track and field event in which competitors leap (unaided) from one foot over a four-metre-long horizontal bar. A jump is considered successful if the athlete clears the bar without dislodging it. The length of the high jump bar typically spans 4 metres (13 feet and 1.5 inches). The height of the high jump bar varies during competition. Some Important Terms - Approach, Take-off, Flight, Landing.

questions.question: In badminton, how high above the ground is the net positioned at the centre?
questions.explanation: feet. Badminton is a racquet sport played by either two opposing players (singles) or two opposing pairs (doubles). Badminton court’s dimensions: In singles, a badminton court is 13.41m (44ft) long and 5.18m (17ft) wide. The width extends to 6.1m (20ft) in doubles. The net is 1.55m (5ft 1in) high at the ends and 1.52m high (5ft) where it dips in the middle. The birdie, also referred to as the shuttlecock, is made up of 16 feathers, the birdie is between 62 - 70mm long and weighs between 4.74 and 5.5 g.

questions.question: A three-time Olympian, PT Usha broke the Asian Games record in four events (200 m, 400 m, 400 m hurdles and 4 × 400 m relay) in ____________.
questions.explanation: Seoul, 1986. Pilavullakandi Thekkeraparambil Usha is a bonafide Indian track and field legend.

questions.question: Chip, Condor, Duff and Driver are some of the terms used in ________.
questions.explanation: Golf. A chip is a short golf shot usually made by a player who is near, but not on, the putting surface. A condor is perhaps the rarest shot in all of golf. It refers to a golf score that is 4 shots under par on any individual hole. Duff is used to describe any very poorly struck shot. The driver is the longest of all the woods, incorporates the largest club head, and is used almost exclusively to “drive” the ball from the tee box.

questions.question: In basketball, how many points are awarded when a basket is scored from outside the 6.25-metre line ?
questions.explanation: Three points: Field goals - A field goal is a basket made during regular play from anywhere on the court. A field goal made within the three-point line is worth two points.

questions.question: The rifle (in the shooting sport) is single-loaded in _________-millimetre calibre (the inner diameter of a gun barrel), which is used across all events.
questions.explanation: 5.6. Olympic shooting features three types of guns: Rifle, Pistol, and Shotgun, used at distances of 10m, 25m, or 50m. Rifles and pistols are single-loaded, with rifles using a 5.6mm calibre and pistols using 4.5mm (10m Air Pistol) or 5.6mm (25m Rapid Fire Pistol with a five-shot magazine). Shotguns are 12-gauge with an 18.5mm calibre, where gauge refers to the number of lead balls from a pound that fit the barrel.

questions.question: The ________ Polo Club is the home of the Ezra Cup event, the world’s oldest polo tournament, started in 1880.

questions.question: At which Olympics did Gagan Narang win a bronze medal?

In a basketball game, the frontcourt is the side of the court on which the team with possession of the ball is attempting to score, and is also known as that team's offensive end of the court.

questions.question: In which game/sport is the area of bout called a ring?
questions.explanation: Boxing. Other Facts of Boxing - Clinching refers to the act of leaning excessively on the opponent for support. Parrying refers to the act of blocking a blow from the opponent using the glove. A knock out is an automatic win. Knockdown that happens when a boxer falls to the ground.

questions.question: Asiad is regulated by_________.
questions.explanation: Olympic Council of Asia (OCA). Asiad (Asian Games) - Held every four years. First held in 1951 in New Delhi. Indian Olympic Association - governing body for the Olympic Movement and the Commonwealth Games in India. Commonwealth Games Federation - international organisation responsible for the direction and control of the Commonwealth Games. International Olympic Council - responsible for Olympic games.

questions.question: What is the distance of the penalty mark from the midpoint of the goal post in football?
questions.explanation: 11m. Some Facts - All free kicks and corners are direct and opposition must be metres away. Dribble is keeping control of the ball while running. Q.1109. The first edition of the Commonwealth Youth Games was organised in which of the following years? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (3rd Shift) (a) 2008 (b) 2012 (c) 2000 (d) 2016 Sol.1109.(c) 2000. The first edition of the Commonwealth Youth Games was held in Edinburgh (Scotland) from 10 to 14 August 2000. 2nd edition (December 2004) - Bendigo (Australia). 7th edition (2023) - Trinidad and Tobago.

questions.question: In Tennis, what is the score when the receiver wins the next point after deuce?
questions.explanation: ‘Advantage out’ when the receiver wins the next point after the deuce. Deuce : If a player and his opponent reach 40. The first point scored after the deuce is known as an Advantage. Q.1111. In cricket, if the umpire raises an index finger above the head it means_________ SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (4th Shift) (a) dead ball (b) wide ball (c) no ball (d) batsman is out Sol.1111.(d) Batsman is out. Terminologies : Not out (waving the arms in a sweeping motion out in front of the chest), No ball (One arm fully extended horizontally), Free hit (One hand held above their head and making a circular motion), Wide Ball (Both arms extended horizontally), Six runs (Both arms held high above their head), dead ball (crossing and uncrossing his arms in front of his body) etc. Q.1112. In Triple Jump, white flag indicates: SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (2nd Shift)/ (a) trail is valid (b) trail is failure (c) trail with wind support (d) allow to trial Sol.1112.(a) trail is valid (a fair jump). The Triple jump (the hop, skip and jump) is a track and field event. The triple jump was a part of the inaugural modern Olympics in 1896 in Athens. The first modern Olympic champion was James Connolly (Triple jumper). Red Flag - a foul jump. Q.1113. Yellow card in badminton indicates: SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (3rd Shift) (a) fault for misconduct (b) suspension for misconduct (c) warning for misconduct (d) disqualified for misconduct Sol.1113.(c) Warning for misconduct. Red Card - Fault for misconduct, Black Card - Disqualified for misconduct. The first badminton competition (All England Open Badminton Championships), for gentlemen's doubles, ladies' doubles, and mixed doubles, was in 1899. Q.1114. Which of the following countries hosted the inaugural FIVB Volleyball Men's World Cup? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning) (a) 1965, Poland (b) 1977, Japan (c) 1969, East Germany (d) 1981, Japan Sol.1114.(a) 1965, Poland. The 1965 FIVB Men's World Cup was held from 13 to 19 September. Eleven nations were involved in the first edition of the competition also known as the "Tournament of the Continents". The International Volleyball Federation (FIVB) 2023 World Cup (Host - Brazil, China and Japan). Q.1115. When and where was the maiden Athletics World Cup organised, that was discontinued after its first edition? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning) (a) London, 2018 (b) Seoul, 2019 (c) Tokyo, 2020 (d) Beijing, 2018 Sol.1115.(a) London 2018. Eight teams participated in the maiden Athletics World Cup (China, France, Great Britain, Jamaica, Poland, South Africa and the United States). The 2022 World Athletics Championships held at Eugene, Oregon, United States. The World Athletics headquarters are situated at Quai Antoine , Monaco.

questions.question: Which was the first city in the world to have hosted both the summer and winter editions of the Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: Beijing. The United States has hosted the most (eight) Olympic Games, followed by France (five) and Japan (four) editions.

questions.question: In which of the following places was the first edition of the World Para Table Tennis Championships held in 1990 ?
questions.explanation: Assen, Netherlands. 2nd edition (France, 1998). 2022 - Spain. 2023 - Durban, South Africa. Bhavina Patel - - Birmingham Commonwealth Games, Gold, Tokyo 2020 paralympic - Silver, Arjuna Award (2021).

questions.question: In case of first false start in a running event, the athlete(s) shall be:
questions.explanation: Can restart. Track and Field Terminology : Annual Plan, Curb, Discus, Toe board, Dashes, Anchor Leg, Distance runs, Middle Distance runs, Hurdling, Relays, Pole vaulting, High jump, Long Jump, Steeplechase, Baton, Throwing Sector, Trial, False start, Crossbar. The rule states that only one false start per race is allowed without the disqualification of the athlete(s) making the false start. Any athlete(s) making further false starts in the race shall be disqualified. Q.1119. In which of the following countries was the 1979 Asian Wrestling Championships organised by the Asian Associated Wrestling Committee (AAWC) for the first time? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Morning) (a) Lahore, Pakistan (b) Oarai, Japan (c) Jalandhar, India (d) Tehran, Iran Sol.1119.(c) Jalandhar, India.

questions.question: A FIBA sanctioned game of basketball typically consists of ______.
questions.explanation: FIBA (Federation Internationale de Basket-ball) : Playing time (4 quarters of 10 minutes each, 5 minutes over-time). FIBA : Founded (18 June 1932), Headquarters (Mies, Switzerland). National Basketball Association (playing time - 4 quarters of 12 minutes each, 5 minutes over-time), National Men’s Collegiate Athletic Association (2 quarters of 20 minutes each, 5 minutes over-time).

questions.question: The first ICC Women's Cricket World Cup was held in the year_____
questions.explanation: 1973. India hosted the women's world cup (1997). The first Men’s Cricket World Cup was held in England in 1975. India has never won the Women's Cricket World Cup.

questions.question: ‘Trump’ is a sports term used in __________
questions.explanation: Bridge (Contract bridge) is a trick-taking card game using a standard 52-card deck. Other Terminologies - Chicane (a hand with no trumps), Deadwood (unmatched cards remaining in the hand), Deck (may refer either to the pack), Flush (Cards of the same suit), Kibitzer (Onlooker at a card game), Prial (a set of 3 cards of the same rank) etc. Q.1123. In which of the following grounds did Yuvraj Singh hit 6 sixes in an over of a T20 International match? SSC MTS 08/07/2022 (Morning) (a) Wanderers Stadium (b) Kingsmead Stadium (c) Mabhida Stadium (d) Newlands Cricket Ground Sol.1123.(b) Yuvraj Singh hit 6 sixes in Stuart Broad's over in the 21st match of the first T20 world cup between India and England at Kingsmead Cricket Ground in Durban, South Africa.

questions.question: In basketball, a free-throw is worth how many points?
questions.explanation: point. A traditional basketball team has 12 players, with five basketball players on the court at any given time.

questions.question: Who among the following is the first Indian Grandmaster to become Women's Chess World Rapid Champion?
questions.explanation: Koneru Humpy is the first Indian Grandmaster to become women Chess World rapid champion.

questions.question: What is the height of the goal - post according to FIFA?
questions.explanation: ft. The standard soccer/football goal dimensions are 24ft (7.32 metres) wide and 8 ft (2.44 metres) high. Both goalposts and the crossbar have the same width and depth of 12cm.

questions.question: In basketball, what can be the maximum number of points that can be scored in a shot?
questions.explanation: points. Some terms related to basketball include Slam dunk, Full-court press, Alley-oop, Jump shot, Playmaker, Point guard, Hoopster, Sixth man, etc.

questions.question: What is the distance between the stumps and the popping crease at the same end of a Cricket pitch?
questions.explanation: 1.22m. The dimensions of a turf pitch are 20.12m long (from stump to stump) plus a minimum of 1.22m behind the stumps to accommodate the return crease and bowler approach area. The width of a turf pitch is 3.05m.

questions.question: Who among the following Indian players is also known as 'Dhing Express'?
questions.explanation: Hima Das, is an Indian sprinter from the state of Assam. She holds the current Indian national record in 400 metres with a timing of 50.79 s that she clocked at the 2018 Asian Games in Jakarta, Indonesia.

questions.question: How many number of players are permitted to be substituted in a game of field hockey?
questions.explanation: no limit . All five skaters and the goalie can be substituted at any time during a hockey game.

questions.question: The equipment bolt is used in which sport?
questions.explanation: Mountaineering. More equipment used in Mountaineering are Climbing pack, Rope(s) (dry preferred), Helmet, Harness (with adjustable leg loops), Crampons, Ice axe (with leash), Belay/rappel device, Pulley. Q.1132. What is the name of the traditional Indian sports shown in the picture below? SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (Morning) (a) Chaupar (b) Gilli Danda (c) Malkhamb (d) Kho Kho Sol.1132.(c) Mallakhamb is the state game of Madhya Pradesh. The first national mallakhamb championships were held in 1962 at Gwalior. The name mallakhamb derives from the terms Malla, meaning wrestler, and khamb which means pole.

questions.question: Which of the following is an adventure sport?
questions.explanation: Paragliding. Adventure Sports - Air Based : Powered Hang gliding, Parasailing, SkyDiving / Parachuting and Hot Air Ballooning. Land Based : Mountaineering, Trekking, Rock Climbing, Sport Climbing, Camping, Snow Skiing, Mountain Biking and Zipline.

questions.question: In which sport does the score depend on putting the ball in a hole?
questions.explanation: Golf is a club-and-ball sport in which players use various clubs to hit balls into a series of holes on a course in as few strokes as possible. Trophies associated with Golf are FedEx Cup, Walker cup, Ryder Cup, Augusta Masters, British open, Canada cup.

questions.question: In which track and field event is the baton used?
questions.explanation: A relay race is an event where a team of four athletes runs equal predetermined distances in a sprint race, each passing a rod-like object called the 'baton' to the next person to continue the race. The last runner in a relay is called the 'anchor'.

questions.question: In running events who counts the laps ?
questions.explanation: Lap scorer counts the lap in the running events. Running events include : Sprints (100m, 200m, 400m), Middle distance (800m, 1500m), Long distance (3000m Steeplechase, 5000m, 10,000m), Hurdles (110/100m, 400m), Relays (4 x100m, 4 x 400m).

questions.question: What is the other name of trap shooting?
questions.explanation: Clay-pigeon shooting is the other name of trap shooting. The other disciplines are skeet shooting and sporting clays.

questions.question: Which kind of sport is bungee jumping?
questions.explanation: Adventure sports - Skiing, Dirt biking, Scuba diving, Zorbing, etc. Recreational sport - swimming, cycling, football, yoga, etc. Para sport - Archery, Badminton, Equestrian, Goalball, etc. Special sports are not usually related to competitions, ex- Run for Cause Marathon competitions.

questions.question: In which sport is the term LONA used?
questions.explanation: In Kabaddi When a team knocks out all the players of the other team, it gets a "Lona". Some other terms used in the game are Cant, Raid, Successful raid, Struggle, To put out an anti, etc. Q.1140. The World Badminton Championship event will be organised by__________. SSC CHSL 03/06/2022 (Evening) (a) Australia (b) India (c) China (d) Indonesia Sol.1140.(b) India. World Badminton Championships, is a tournament sanctioned by Badminton World Federation (BWF), founded in 1977. 2021 : Host City- Huelva (Spain); Winner- Japan, 2022 : Tokyo (Japan), 2023 : Copenhagen (Denmark), 2025 : Paris (France), 2026 : India.

questions.question: Which gymnastic event takes place on a large floor mat?
questions.explanation: A floor exercise is a gymnastics event in which movements are performed on the floor in an area of metres (40 feet) square. Uneven parallel Bar is an Olympic gymnastics event performed only by women. Vaulting is a gymnastics exercise in which the athlete leaps over a form that was originally intended to mimic a horse. The balance beam is one of the events that comprise a total artistic gymnastics program.

questions.question: Where is the JRD Tata Sports Complex located ?
questions.explanation: Jamshedpur, Jharkhand. It is used mostly for association football matches and athletics competitions. Cricket stadium in Jamshedpur is Keenan Stadium.

questions.question: What is the width of the tennis court for Doubles?
questions.explanation: 10.97 m. A competitive tennis court is rectangular in shape, measuring 23.77 m long. The width, however, differs for doubles (10.97 m) and singles (8.23 m). There are four main types of surface for tennis courts: Grass, clay, hard and artificial grass.

questions.question: In which year was the Indian Football Association established?
questions.explanation: 1893. The Indian Football Association (IFA) : Headquarters - Kolkata. Calcutta FC was the first club to be established in 1872. The All India Football Federation (AIFF) was formed in 1937. Q.1145. Which of the following equipment is used in throwing events ? SSC CHSL 10/06/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Iron rod (b) Indian club (c) Shot (d) Iron ring Sol.1145.(c) Shot. The four standard throwing events - Shot put, discus, hammer, and javelin.

questions.question: ______ is the first woman hockey player to receive the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award.
questions.explanation: Rani Rampal. The new name of Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award is Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award. Q.1147. Los Angeles Clippers and Portland Trail Blazers are ______ teams. SSC CGL 18/04/2022(Morning) (a) Women’s Tennis (b) Men’s Basketball (c) Women’s Hockey (d) Men’s Volleyball Sol.1147.(b) Men’s Basketball. It is a game played between two teams of five players each on a rectangular court. Basketball is the national game of Serbia, Lithuania and Estonia.

questions.question: Participation in which of the following activities is NOT recommended for the motor development of a student?
questions.explanation: Examples of Motor Development of students include being able to run, hop, balance on one foot, throw and kick a ball, climb up stairs or playground equipment, ride a tricycle, pushing, climbing, bending, throwing, scooping, crawling, kicking, bouncing, dancing.

questions.question: The European Champions Cup or Heineken Cup is associated with Which sport?
questions.explanation: Rugby. It is the top-tier competition for clubs whose countries' national teams compete in the Six Nations Championship.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an Olympic event?
questions.explanation: Acrobatic gymnastics. Acro is not yet an Olympic sport. However, acro is included in the World Games, the European Games, and has its own Acrobatic World Championships held in even-numbered years.

questions.question: Who among the following was India's first world champion in any sport after independence?
questions.explanation: Wilson Jones. He won both the national billiards and snooker titles in 1952 and 1954. In London, he played his first World Billiards Championship in 1951. Q.1152. The La Liga Trophy is associated with which sport? SSC MTS 12/10/2021 (Afternoon) (a) Tennis (b) Football (c) Weightlifting (d) Cricket Sol.1152.(b) Football. Football trophies - The FIFA World Cup, The UEFA Champions League, UEFA European Championship, Copa America, The English Premier League , etc.

questions.question: The gymnast Dipa Karmakar belongs to the state of ______.
questions.explanation: Tripura. Dipa Karmakar is an Indian artistic gymnast. She won a bronze medal at the Commonwealth Games in Glasgow.

questions.question: Produnova is related to which of the following sports?
questions.explanation: Gymnastics. Produnova is related to women's artistic Gymnastics vault consisting of a front handspring onto the vaulting horse and two front somersaults in a tucked position off it. Dipa Karmakar is one of five women gymnasts in the world to have successfully executed the highly-difficult Produnova vault. Dipa Karmakar finished in fourth place at the Rio 2016 Olympics.

questions.question: Which state in India houses The National Institute of Water Sports?
questions.explanation: Goa. The National Institute of Water Sports was established in July 1990. Q.1156. Which Indian cricketer has featured in the most number of international cricket matches? SSC MTS 18/10/2021 (Afternoon) (a) Mohammad Azharuddin (b) Sachin Tendulkar (c) Sourav Ganguly (d) Mahendra Singh Dhoni Sol.1156.(b) Sachin Tendulkar played 664 international cricket matches in total, scoring 34,357 runs. He is the youngest to receive Bharat Ratna Award in 2014.

questions.question: Which soccer player holds the distinction of having the most wins of the FIFA World Cup by any player?
questions.explanation: Pele (Brazil) is known as ‘The Black Pearl’, ‘The King of Football’. Brazil won FIFA five times. Its headquarters is in Zurich, Switzerland.

questions.question: Who among the following was the first Indian swimmer to swim across the English Channel in 1958 ?
questions.explanation: Mihir Sen. Arati Saha the first Asian woman to swim across the English Channel. Gertrude Ederle becomes the first woman to swim across the English Channel. Matthew Webb was the first swimmer to swim across the English Channel.

questions.question: Who is known as the ‘Wizard of Hockey’ ?
questions.explanation: Major Dhyan Chand.

questions.question: With which of the following sports is the Ruia Gold Cup associated ?
questions.explanation: Bridge. Other trophies associated with Bridge include Basalat Jha Trophy, Holkar Trophy and Singhania Trophy.

questions.question: In cricket, which of the following fielding positions is behind the batsman?
questions.explanation: A slip fielder is placed behind the batsman on the off side of the field. A first slip is alongside the wicketkeeper, with second slip, third slip etc following in the same direction. First slip is normally about a foot or so behind the wicketkeeper.

questions.question: With which of the following sports is the term ‘Chinaman’ associated?
questions.explanation: Cricket. Chinaman bowling is a left-arm unorthodox spin, where the bowler spins the ball into a right-handed batsman.

questions.question: With which of the following sports do you associate the term '16-yard hit'?
questions.explanation: Field hockey. A 16-yard hit is awarded to the defence when a foul is committed inside their striking circle by the opposition or when the ball is hit over the backline by the opposing team.

questions.question: In which of the following sports is the shakehand grip used?
questions.explanation: Table tennis. It is the typical European type grip where the head of the racket faces up, and your hand looks like it's ready to shake a person's hand. ‘Penhold grip’, ‘Common grip’ and ‘Forehand’ grip are some of the other grips used in Table tennis.

questions.question: Birdie, eagle and albatross are all terms used in ______.
questions.explanation: Golf. Some Terms used in Golf - par, bogey, double bogey, triple bogey, ace, handicap, etc. terms used in Baseball- strikeout, base, walk, home run hit, bat, batter, etc. Q.1166. With which sport are Vijay Amritraj and Anand Amritraj associated? SSC CHSL 12/04/2021 (Afternoon) (a) Table tennis (b) Cricket (c) Lawn tennis (d) Football Sol.1166.(c) Lawn tennis.

questions.question: Which of the following animals is made to race in the traditional sport called 'Kambala' in Karnataka?
questions.explanation: Kambala is an annual buffalo race held in the southwestern Indian state of Karnataka.

questions.question: In which of the following cities is the headquarters of the All India Chess Federation situated?
questions.explanation: New Delhi. AICF is the central administrative body for the game of chess in India, founded in 1951 which is affiliated with Fédération Internationale des Échecs (FIDE), the world body for chess. The organisation is also in charge of managing women's chess in India.

questions.question: Who among the following was the first para-athlete to receive the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna?
questions.explanation: Devendra Jhajharia is the first para-athlete to be honoured with the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna - the highest sports award in the country. He is an Indian Paralympic javelin thrower competing in F46 events.

questions.question: ______ was the first Test cricket captain of an independent Indian team.
questions.explanation: Lala Amarnath Bharadwaj, known as the father figure of Indian Cricket, captained India in the first Test series and won against Pakistan in 1952. He was the first batsman to score a century for India in Test cricket.

questions.question: Which two Indians became the first pair to reach the finals of all Grand Slams in a year in the Open era, winning the French Open and Wimbledon as top seeds?
questions.explanation: Leander Paes and Mahesh Bhupathi. In 1999, the duo reached the finals of all four Grand Slams, winning Wimbledon and the French, thus becoming the first Indians to win a doubles event at a Grand Slam.

questions.question: At the 1992 Summer Olympics, ______ became the first woman to carry the flag of India at the opening ceremony of any Olympics.
questions.explanation: Shiny Abraham Wilson. She is an Asian Games gold medal winner and the first Indian woman to reach the semi-finals of an Olympic event.

questions.question: Who among the following was a World War II veteran, also associated with cricket?
questions.explanation: Alan Burgess, New Zealand first-class cricketer, and World War II veteran. He was a tank driver in World War II. In June 2020, Burgess became the world’s oldest living first-class cricketer.

questions.question: In which Olympic Games did Shabana Akhtar, the first female athlete to represent Pakistan, participate?
questions.explanation: Shabana Akhtar was Pakistan's first woman to compete at the Olympics when she took part in the women's long jump at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta, United States.

questions.question: Who among the following won a bronze medal at the World Athletics Championship in Paris in 2003?
questions.explanation: Anju Bobby George is a retired Indian athlete. She made history when she won the bronze medal in the long jump at the World Championships in Athletics in Paris and became the first Indian athlete ever to win a medal in a World Championships in Athletics jumping 6.70 m.

questions.question: Where were the first Winter Paralympics Games held ?
questions.explanation: In 1976, the first Winter Games in Paralympics history were held in Sweden.

questions.question: Who had proposed the motto of Olympics?
questions.explanation: Pierre de Coubertin. The Olympic motto is made up of three Latin words: CITIUS, ALTIUS, FORTIUS - COMMUNITER (FASTER, HIGHER, STRONGER - TOGETHER).

questions.question: ‘Tenpins’ refers to the game of ______.
questions.explanation: bowling.

questions.question: To which of the following Indian states does Mardani Khel, one of the famous martial art forms in India belong?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra. It is particularly known for its use of the uniquely Indian patta (sword) and vita (corded lance).

questions.question: Who among the following is the author of the book 'The House of Blue Mangoes'?
questions.explanation: David Davidar. His Other Books: “The solitude of emperors”, “Ithaca”, and “Nila amera kuṭhi”.

questions.question: Who among the following is the author of the book ‘The Glassblower’s Breath’?
questions.explanation: Sunetra Gupta. Her Other Books: “Memories of Rain”, and “A Sin of Color”. Authors and their books: Shobha De - “Starry Nights”, “Speedpost”. Bharati Mukherjee - “Desirable Daughters”, “Miss New India”. Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni - “The Palace of Illusions”, “The Last Queen”.

questions.question: Who among the following is the author of the book 'The Thousand Faces of Night'?
questions.explanation: Githa Hariharan. Authors and their books: Githa Hariharan - “When Dreams Travel”, “Ghosts of Vasu Master”. Urvashi Butalia - “The other side of silence”, “The Persistence of Memory”. Meena Alexander - “Fault lines”, “Illiterate heart”. Namita Gokhale - “Things to Leave Behind”, “The Book of Shadows”.

questions.question: The historical fiction ‘The Glory of Patan’ by KM Munshi was originally written in which Indian language?
questions.explanation: Gujarati. Kanhaiyalal Maneklal Munshi, popularly known by his pen name Ghanshyam Vyas, was an Indian independence movement activist, politician, writer from Gujarat state. Books by him: ‘’Krishnavatara II The Wrath Of An Emperor’’, ‘’Atta Ke Svapna’’, ‘’Gaurava K Pratka’’, ‘’Lopamudra’’, ‘‘Pratiodha’’, ‘’Akhand Hindustan’’, ‘’Gujarat and Its Literature’’, ‘’The Book of Satyabhama’’, ‘’The Ruin That Britain Wrought’’, ‘’Kakani Raashi Ane Chiye Tej Thik’’.

questions.question: Who among the following is the author of the book named 'Streepurushtulna'?
questions.explanation: Tarabai Shinde was a feminist activist who protested patriarchy and caste in 19th century India. She is known for her published work, Stri Purush Tulana, originally published in Marathi in 1882. Pandita Ramabai wrote the Stree Dharma-Neeti (1882) book on the duties and moral obligations of women in India. Rassundari Devi wrote the autobiography 'Amar Jibon' (1876). Sarojini Naidu (first Governor of United Provinces) - The Village Song, The Golden Threshold, The Sceptred Flute.

questions.question: Which of the following fictional towns is mentioned in the English novel ‘In Custody’ written by Anita Desai?
questions.explanation: Mirpore. In Custody (1984) is a novel set in Delhi by Anita Desai. Her other novels include “Journey to Ithaca”, “Clear Light of Day”, “Fasting, Feasting”, “The Zigzag Way”, and “The Peacock Garden”. Malgudi is a fictional town located in south India in the novels and short stories of R.K. Narayan. Lilliput fictional island nations that appear in the novel Gulliver's Travels by Jonathan Swift. Q.1186. Who wrote the novel 'The Catcher in the Rye'? SSC MTS 22/10/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) HG Wells (b) Ernest Hemingway (c) Mark Twain (d) JD Salinger Sol.1186.(d) JD Salinger was an American author. His other works include “Nine Stories”, “Franny and Zooey”, “Raise High the Roof Beam”. HG Wells - “The War of the Worlds”, “The Time Machine”, “The Invisible Man”. Ernest Hemingway - “The Old Man and the Sea”, “The Sun Also Rises”. Mark Twain - “Adventures of Huckleberry Finn”, “The Innocents Abroad”.

questions.question: Epic Poem, Savitri, described by its author as ‘A Legend and a Symbol’, was written by _____.
questions.explanation: Aurobindo Ghosh. Savitri poem was based on the legend of Savitri and Satyavan in the Mahabharata. questions.question: The famous novel ‘The house of blue mangoes’ is written by:
questions.explanation: David Davidar is an Indian novelist his other books include “The solitude of emperors” and “Ithaca”. Romila Thapar - “Somanatha”, “The Past Before Us”. Shashi Tharoor - “The Paradoxical Prime Minister”, “Riot: A Love Story”. Anees Salim - “The Blind Lady’s Descendants”, “Fly, Hasina, Fly” and “Vanity Bagh”. Q.1190. ‘Running for My Life: One Lost Boy’s Journey from the Killing Fields of Sudan to the Olympic Games’ an autobiography depicting the struggle for life to success in life is written by who among the following personalities? SSC MTS 23/10/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) Noah Lyles (b) Jesse Owens (c) Lopez Lomong (d) Arnold Palmer Sol.1190.(c) Lopez Lomong is an American track and field athlete. Autobiographies and sport person: “No Spin” - Shane Warne (Cricketer); “Faster than Lightning: My Autobiography” - Usain Bolt (sprinter); “Ace against Odds” - Sania Mirza (Tennis); “A Shot at History” - Abhinav Bindra (Shooter); “Controversially Yours” - Shoaib Akhtar (Cricketer).

questions.question: Yashodhara Dalmia is the author of which famous book?

options.c: The Painted World of the Warlis

questions.explanation: The Painted World of the Warlis. Her Other Books include “Amrita Sher-Gil: A Life”, “Sayed Haider Raza”. Other Authors: Vijay Sharma - “Painting in the Kangra Valley”. Walter M. Spink - “Ajanta, A Brief History and Guide”, “The axis of Eros”.

questions.question: Which book has been authored by Rabindra Bharali?
