questions.question: Who among the following was a poet who won the Nobel Prize for literature in 1913 ?
questions.explanation: Rabindranath Tagore. He was also referred to as ‘Gurudev’, ‘Kabiguru’, and ‘Biswakabi’. He got Nobel Prize for his work Gitanjali. He was a Bengali poet, novelist, and painter, who was highly influential in introducing Indian culture to the west. He was the first non-European to receive the Nobel Prize.

questions.question: Which Indian political leader was called as Lok Nayak?
questions.explanation: Jai Prakash Narayan. He received the Ramon Magsaysay Award (1965) and Bharat Ratna (1998, posthumously). Famous Personalities & their Nicknames: Bihar Kesri - Sri Krishna Sinha, Bihar Vibhuti - Dr. Anurag Narayan Singh, Iron Man of India - Vallabhai Patel, Biswa Kavi - Rabindranath Tagore, Netaji - Subhash Chandra Bose. Lokmanya Tilak - Bal Gangadhar Tilak.

questions.question: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, who was the first Home Minister of India, is known by which sobriquet?
questions.explanation: Iron man of India. Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel is popularly known as the "Iron Man of India" due to his crucial role in the unification and integration of Indian princely states such as Travancore, Hyderabad, Junagadh, Bhopal into the Indian Union. Other sobriquet personalities: Father of Indian Unrest - Bal Gangadhar Tilak, Grand old man of India - Dadabhai Naoroji, Morning star of Indian Renaissance - Raja Ram Mohan Roy.

questions.question: Which of the following is an autobiography of a Bengali illiterate woman who secretly acquired literacy skills to read sacred texts in an age when girls and women were denied education and deemed fit only for household chores ?
questions.explanation: Amar Jiban by Rassundari Devi. She was the first Indian woman to write an autobiography and the first Bengali to write an autobiography. Authors and Books: Baby Kamble - ‘’The Prisons We Broke’’. Lakshmibai Tilak - ‘’Smritichitre’’. Kamala Suraiyya - ‘’The Old Playhouse And Other Poems’’, ‘’Padmavati the Harlot and Other Stories’’. Q.1385. Who became the first Vice-Chancellor of Jawaharlal Nehru University in 1969 ? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (4th shift) (a) BD Nagchaudhuri (b) G Parthasarathi (c) Y Nayudamma (d) KR Narayanan Sol.1385.(b) G Parthasarathi. Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU): A public major research university located in New Delhi, India. It was established in 1969 and named after Jawaharlal Nehru, India's first Prime Minister. Other Central Universities : Aligarh Muslim University (1875), Assam University, Banaras Hindu University (1916), Central University of Gujarat (2009). Q.1386. Who was the first woman graduate of Calcutta University ? SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (1st shift) (a) Sarojini Naidu (b) Annie Besant (c) Kadambini Ganguly (d) Rajkumari Amritkaur Sol.1386.(c) Kadambini Ganguly and Chandramukhi Basu were the first BA graduates in the British empire in India. She was the South Asia's first female surgeon. Rajkumari Amritkaur - The first Health Minister of India (1947). Q.1387. Who among the following advocated the ideology of "oru jati, oru matam, oru daivam manushyanu" (one caste, one religion, one god for humankind)? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (1st shift) (a) Birsa Munda (b) Narayana Guru (c) Swami Shraddhanand (d) Keshub Chunder Sen Sol.1387.(b) Narayana Guru. He belongs to Ezhava caste and was considered ‘avarna’. He built a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva at Aruvippuram which was against the caste based restrictions of the time. He established the Sree Narayana Dharma Paripalana Yogam (SNDP), a charitable society. His Books: “Advaitha Deepika”, “Asrama”and “Thevarappathinkangal”. He became the proponent of Advaita Vedanta (Principle of non-duality) put forward by Adi Shankara.

questions.question: Which of the following persons has been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize ?
questions.explanation: Kailash Satyarthi was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2014 "for the struggle against the suppression of children and young people and the right of all children to education". He founded the Bachpan Bachao Andolan (Save the Childhood Movement) in 1980.

questions.question: In 2019, a minor planet between Mars and Jupiter was named after whom among the following Indian musicians by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) ?
questions.explanation: Pt Jasraj. The International Astronomical Union (IAU) has named minor planet VP32 (number - 300128), discovered on November 11, 2006, as 'Pandit Jasraj'. He became the first Indian musician to get honored with this unique recognition. Q.1390. Which of the following architects designed the Gateway of India? Higher Secondary 27/06/2023 (Shift - 3) (a) Herbert Baker (b) George Wittet (c) Henry Irwin (d) Lauri Baker Sol.1390.(b) George Wittet. Gateway of India (1924). The foundation stone was placed in in Bombay. The monument was erected to commemorate the landing of King George V and Queen Mary at Apollo Bunder in India. Other Architects and their works: Henry Irwin - Ambas Vilas Palace (Mysore). Lauri Baker - The Indian Coffee House, Central for Development Studies (Kerala). He was known as the “Brick Master of Kerala” and “Gandhi of Architecture”.

questions.question: To which state of India did Fathima Beevi, the first woman Supreme Court Judge of India, belong ?
questions.explanation: Kerala. Padma Bhushan (2024). First female judge of India - Justice Anna Chandy.

questions.question: Giorgia Meloni recently became the first Woman Prime Minister of which country ?
questions.explanation: Italy. First Female Prime Minister of Some Countries: Austria - Brigitte Bierlein. Spain - María Teresa Fernández de la Vega. Ukraine - Tymoshenko. India - Indira Gandhi. SSC MTS 12/05/2023 (Morning) (a) India's First Female Muslim Entrepreneur (b) India's First Female Doctor (c) India's First Female Muslim Teacher (d) India's First Female Engineer Sol.1393.(c) India's First Female Muslim Teacher. First Indian female doctor of western medicine - Anandi Gopal Joshi.

questions.question: Shiv Dayal Saheb, a banker from Agra founded the Radha Soami Satsang in _________.
questions.explanation: 1861. Shiva Dayal Saheb founded the sect ‘Radha Soami Satsang’ on Basant Panchami. The sole purpose of this satsang is to experience the divinity of God who resides in all of us.

questions.question: Satyajit Ray was honoured with Bharat Ratna in 1992. He was a famous ________ .
questions.explanation: Filmmaker. Other Awards of Satyajit Ray: Padam Shri (1958), Padam Bhushan (1965), Dada Saheb Phalke award (1985), Ramon Magsaysay Award (1967) and Bharat Ratna (1992).

questions.question: Who is famously known as Bihar Kesari ?
questions.explanation: Shri Krishna Sinha was also known as Bihar Kesari and Shri Babu. He served as the first Chief Minister of Bihar from 1946 to 1961. Nicknames of other personalities - Rajendra Prasad (Desh Ratna, Ajatshatru), Karpuri Thakur (Jana Nayak), Spacing -Lala Lajpat Rai (Punjab Kesari).

questions.question: Who is famously known as the father of the Indian nuclear programme?
questions.explanation: Homi J. Bhabha. Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (Mumbai - 1954), Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (Mumbai - 1945), ISRO (Bangalore - 1969), DRDO (New Delhi - 1958). Vikram Sarabhai - Father of Indian Space Programme. APJ Abdul Kalam - Missile Man of India.

questions.question: Who among the following was the architect of the Integrated Guided Missile Development Program (IGMDP) in India?
questions.explanation: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam. IGMDP was an Indian Ministry of Defence programme to research and develop a comprehensive range of missiles. The project started in 1982 - (completed in 2008) under the leadership of Dr APJ Abdul Kalam (missile man of India). Prithvi, Agni, Trishul, Akash, Nag missiles have been developed under this.

questions.question: Who among the following is famously called the Iron Lady of India?
questions.explanation: Indira Gandhi. She was the third prime minister of India from 1966 to and from until her assassination in 1984. She was India's first and, to date, only female prime minister of India. Awards - Bharat Ratna (1971), and Bangladesh Freedom Honour (2011). Mary Kom - The first Indian woman boxer to win an olympic medal and a gold at Asian Games.

questions.question: Who among the following was famously known as the "The parrot of India"?
questions.explanation: Amir Khusro: He was a poet in Delhi Sultanate. He is sometimes referred to as the "voice of India" or "Parrot of India" (Tuti-e-Hind), and has been called the "Father of Urdu literature”. He was a mystic and a spiritual disciple of Nizamuddin Auliya of Delhi.

questions.question: Which Indian cricketer is also known as Little Master ?
questions.explanation: Sunil Gavasker. Haryana Hurricane - Kapil Dev, Captain Cool - Mahendra Singh Dhoni, The Wall - Rahul Dravid, Jumbo - Anil Kumble, Turbanator - Harbhajan Singh, Master Blaster - Sachin Tendulkar, Hit - Man - Rohit Sharma, Nawab of Nazafgarh - Virendra Sehwag.

questions.question: Who among the following is referred to as ‘Prince of Bhangra’, due to his Bhangra music?
questions.explanation: Sukhbir Singh. He was nominated and won the 1996 Channel V Awards in three categories: Best Debut Album, Best Male Vocalist and Best Music Video (for "Punjabi Munde") for his first album ‘New Style’.

questions.question: The Open Hand Monument in Chandigarh was designed by ______.
questions.explanation: Le Corbusier. Chandigarh city was designed by Le Corbusier . Matthew Nowicki was chief architect of the new Indian city of Chandigarh. Albert Mayer known for plan of Chandigarh.

questions.question: Who among the following was the prime minister of India in 1978 ?
questions.explanation: Morarji Desai. He was leading the government formed by the Janata Party. He is the oldest person to hold the office of prime minister, at the age of 81, in the history of Indian politics.

questions.question: How is Dhanpat Rai Srivastava better known?
questions.explanation: Premchand was an Indian writer known for his modern Hindustani literature.

questions.question: With which of the following literary magazines was poet and writer Amrita Pritam associated?
questions.explanation: Nagmani. Amrita Pritam was an Indian novelist, essayist and poet, who wrote in Punjabi and Hindi. She edited Nagmani, a monthly literary magazine in Punjabi for several years.

questions.question: Mario de Miranda was a ______ from the state of Goa.
questions.explanation: Cartoonist. Mario de Miranda : Awards - Padma Shri (1988), Padma Bhushan (2002), Padma Vibhushan (2012).

questions.question: Lal Bahadur Shastri was born on ______.
questions.explanation: 2 October 1904. He was born in Mughalsarai, UP. He served as the second Prime Minister of India. The Iconic slogan “Jai Jawan Jai Kisaan” was given by him.

questions.question: Veteran freedom fighter, social reformer and feminist Savithribai Phule hailed from which of the following states of India?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra. She was the first female teacher of India.

questions.question: On which of the following dates does India celebrate its Constitution Day?
questions.explanation: 26th November. The Constitution of India was adopted on November 1949, that is why Constitution Day is celebrated on 26 November. 15th August : Independence Day (commemorating India’s independence from British rule in 1947). 2nd October : Gandhi Jayanti (the birthday of Mahatma Gandhi, celebrated as a national holiday and also observed as International Day of Non-Violence). 26th January : Republic Day (the Constitution of India came into force on 26 January 1950). Q.1411. The birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi is celebrated as the national festival of India. In which of the following years was Gandhi ji born ? questions.question: In which state is the Maski inscription located at present?
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Maski inscription : Ashoka's minor rock edict. It is situated on the banks of the Muski River, a tributary of the Tungabhadra River. The inscription is written in the Brahmi script. The edict was the first of Emperor Ashoka to include the name Ashoka and not by his usual title ‘Devanampiya Piyadasi’. Discovered by - C. Beadon in 1915.

questions.question: Which of the following states used EVMs for the first time in the general elections held in May 1982 ?
questions.explanation: Kerala (Ernakulam, Parvur Vidhan Sabha). Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) - In 1989, the Parliament amended the Representation of the People Act, 1951 to create a provision for the use of EVMs in the elections. EVM consists of two units - Control Unit (CU) and Balloting Unit (BU).

questions.question: The Ravan Phadi cave in is an example of the early Chalukya style architecture which is known for its distinct sculptural style.
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Ravana Phadi Cave Temple is one of the jewels in the Aihole monuments. Other Historic Caves: Maharashtra - Ajanta Caves, Ellora Caves, Elephanta Caves. Kerala - Edakkal caves, Maniyoor caves, Ezhuthupara cave. Andhra Pradesh - Erravaram Caves, Belum Caves, Akkanna Madanna Caves.

questions.question: The famous Dhamek Stupa is located in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. Dhamek Stupa - It is located at Sarnath, in Varanasi. It was built in 249 B.C. by Ashoka the Great. It was made to commemorate the event of Lord Buddha giving the first sermon to his first five disciples. Other stupas: Swayambhunath Stupa - Kathmandu (Nepal), Bharhut Stupa - Satna District (Madhya Pradesh), Kesariya Stupa - East Champaran District (Bihar), Sanchi Stupa - Raisen District (Madhya Pradesh), Chaukhandi Stupa - Varanasi (Uttar Pradesh). Q.1488. Which among the following Buddhist Universities is located in Bihar, India? SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Morning) (a) Vallabhi University (b) Somapuri University (c) Nalanda University (d) Nabadwip University Sol.1488.(c) Nalanda University (The world’s first residential University) - Built by Kumaragupta (Gupta dynasty). Prominent rulers - Harshavardhana of Kannauj, Pala Rulers, and many scholars patronized Nalanda.

questions.question: The head office of National Bank for Agricultural and Rural Development is located in ________.
questions.explanation: Mumbai. NABARD (National Bank for Agricultural and Rural Development) is administered by the Government of India. It was instituted on the recommendations of B.Sivaraman Committee on July by implementing the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development Act 1981. Q.1490. Bagh Caves, which has Buddhist caves, was developed around the 6th Century AD situated on the Bagh river in_________. SSC MTS 11/05/2023 (Afternoon) (a) Uttar Pradesh (b) Madhya Pradesh (c) Maharashtra (d) Gujarat Sol.1490.(b) Madhya Pradesh. Bagh Caves - These are a group of nine Buddhist caves, first discovered in 1818, located on the bank of the Baghani River in Dhar district, Madhya Pradesh. Other caves: Madhya Pradesh - Udayagiri Caves (Vidisha), Pandav Caves (Pachmarhi), Dharmrajeshwar Caves (Mandsaur), Bhimbetka Caves (Bhojpur Raisen), Lohani Caves (Mandu) etc.

questions.question: Which Indian state is home to the Buddhist cave temples known as Barabar Caves?
questions.explanation: Bihar. The Barabar Hill Caves are the oldest surviving rock-cut caves in India. These are supposed to have been constructed by emperor Ashoka for the use of Ajivaka ascetics. These caves are situated in the twin hills of Barabar (four caves) and Nagarjuni (three caves). Most caves at Barabar consist of two chambers, carved entirely out of granite. Q.1492. The rock - cave temple of _______ is the largest monolithic structure in the world. SSC MTS 16/05/2023 (Afternoon) (a) Udaygiri (b) Ajanta (c) Ellora (d) Badami Sol.1492.(c) Ellora. The caves are dedicated to Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism. The Kailasa Temple (Ellora): It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is located in the Aurangabad district of Maharashtra, India. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is the largest and most impressive cave in the Ellora complex. It is a monolithic structure (carved out of a single rock).

questions.question: The Elephanta Caves are located in which state?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra. Elephanta Caves: Declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1987.

questions.question: Which city in India is associated with the tea industry?
questions.explanation: Darjeeling, West Bengal. Darjeeling Tea was the first product to get the Geographical Indication (GI) tag in India, in October 2004. Kangra Tea from Himachal Pradesh also has GI tag status. GI tag is regulated by the Geographical Indications of Goods (Registration and Protection) Act of 1999.

questions.question: The Ganesh-rath is one of the finest monolithic temples located in ______.
questions.explanation: Mahabalipuram. The Ganesh - rath - It is one of ten rathas ("chariots") carved out of pink granite within the group of monuments of the Pallava Period at Mahabalipuram, a UNESCO-inscribed World Heritage Site since 1984.

questions.question: Which state became the first to implement "New Education Policy" at pre - primary level?
questions.explanation: Uttarakhand. National Education Policy (NEP) was announced by the Ministry of Education. It was based on the recommendation of the ‘Kasturiranjan committee’. Aim - Transform the Indian education system to meet the needs of the 21st Century. Karnataka became the first state to adopt NEP in higher education.

questions.question: The famous Pandav Leni Caves is located in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra. Pandavleni Caves - These are built on the Tri Rashmi hill about 3004 feet above sea level. These caves are a group of old Buddhist caves (250 B.C. - 600 A.D.).

questions.question: Dhuska is the most popular food item of state of __________ .
questions.explanation: Jharkhand. Other Foods of Jharkhand- Handia, Litti Chokha, Mirchi Ka Salan, Mitha Khaja, Rugra. Punjab: Sarso ka saag and Makki di Roti, Lassi, Gobhi - Shalgam- Gajar Pickle, Pinni. Kerala: Erissery, Sadya, Appam With Ishtu, Idli Sambar, Nadan Kozhi Varuthathu. Andhra Pradesh: Pulihora, Gutti vankaya kura, Chepa Pulusu, Gongura Pickle Ambadi, Pesarattu, Gutti Vankaya Koora, Punugulu, Bobbatlu, Medu Vada, Uppindi.

questions.question: Kye Gompa, the largest centre of Buddhist learning in the Western Himalayas, is situated in the state/union territory of___________.
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh. questions.question: Aga Khan Palace is located in _______ city of Maharashtra.
questions.explanation: Pune. This Palace was built in 1892 by Sultan Muhammed Shah Aga Khan III in the district of Pune (Maharashtra).

questions.question: Which Indian city is also known as Queen of Deccan?
questions.explanation: Pune. Some Indian Cities and Sobriquets : City of Taj - Agra (Uttar Pradesh), Boston/Manchester of India - Ahmedabad (Gujarat), Sangam City - Allahabad (Uttar Pradesh), Land of Black Diamond - Asansol (West Bengal), City of Peace - Bardhaman (West Bengal), Temple City of India - Bhubaneswar (Odisha), The Venice of the East - Alappuzha (Kerala), Garden City of India - Bengaluru (Karnataka), Detroit of Asia - Chennai (Tamil Nadu), Manchester of South India - Coimbatore (Tamil Nadu), Scotland of India - Coorg (Karnataka), School Capital of India - Dehradun (Uttarakhand), Queen of the Hills - Darjeeling (West Bengal).

questions.question: Which among the following is an Indian martial art from Manipur ?
questions.explanation: Thang-Tai (sword and spear) - It is dedicated to fighting skill and worship. The Meitei creation of Thang-ga goes back to antiquity.

questions.question: India's First open Rock Museum is located in which city ?
questions.explanation: Hyderabad. Other Famous monuments : Char- Minar, Makka Masjid both built by Quli Qutub Shah.

questions.question: Nasik is also known as _____ capital of India.
questions.explanation: Wine. Nashik ("Wine Capital of India") holds almost half of the wineries in India. Wine is composed of ethanol (12%). Nashik is situated on the banks of river Godavari. The Godavari starts from Trimbakeshwar, Maharashtra and flows to the Bay of Bengal. It is also known for hosting the Kumbh Mela every 12 years.

questions.question: Which among the following is the official sport of Maharashtra, as of 2022?
questions.explanation: Dahi - Handi. It is an entertainment and competitive event celebrated with Hindu festival Krishna Janmashtami (birth of God Krishna). Madhya Pradesh (Mallakhamb), Kerala (Kalaripayattu). Puri Beach (Odisha) - Here, Sudarsan Pattnaik showcases his sand arts. Mysore Sand Sculpture Museum - It is home to several sand models and was founded by M N Gowri.

questions.question: "Living root bridges" is an iconic structure found in which state?
questions.explanation: Meghalaya. Living root bridges (Jing Kieng Jri) - The aerial bridges, built by weaving and adjusting the roots of the Indian rubber tree. Other Famous root bridges - Riwai Root Bridge and Umshiang Double Decker Bridge. Properties - Elastic, easily combined, grows in rough and rocky soils. Grown by Khasi and Jaintia tribes of Meghalaya.

questions.question: Surat is also known as ________ of India.
questions.explanation: Diamond city. It is also known as “The silk city”, and “The green city”. Surat (located on the River Tapi) has been called “The gateway to Mecca”. Old name of Surat - Suryapur.

questions.question: Which of the following sites do "Not" have nuclear power plants?
questions.explanation: Vijayawada. Nuclear power plants in India: Kakrapar Atomic Power Station (1993, Gujarat), Kalpakkam, Madras (1984, Tamil Nadu), Narora (1991, Uttar Pradesh), Kaiga (2000 ; Karnataka), Rawatbhata (1973, Rajasthan), Tarapur (1969, Maharashtra), Kudankulam (2013, Tamil Nadu). Under Construction: Chutka (Madhya Pradesh), Gorakhpur (Haryana), Bhimpur (Madhya Pradesh), Mahi Banswara (Rajasthan), Haripur (West Bengal), etc.

questions.question: In which of the following states was 'Kudumbashree,' women-oriented, community-- based, poverty-reduction programme implemented ?
questions.explanation: Kerala. The name Kudumbashree in Malayalam language means 'prosperity of the family'. The 'Kudumbashree' SHG (Self Help Groups) was started in 1998.

questions.question: India’s First AI-powered, end - to - end digital Lok Adalat was launched in ________.
questions.explanation: Rajasthan. Launched by National Legal Services Authority Chairman, Uday Umesh Lalit. About Rajasthan (northwest) - Capital: Jaipur.

questions.question: Which of the following is the first 'smoke-free state' in India?
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh. This was achieved due to the Ujjwala Scheme (2016, by centre) and Grahini Suvidha Yojana (2018, by Himachal Pradesh Government). SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (1st Shift) (a) Kerala (b) Assam (c) Tripura (d) Andhra Pradesh Sol.1512.(c) Tripura (5th largest tea producing State in India). Assam is the largest tea-producing state in India followed by West Bengal. Jorhat has the world famous Tocklai Experimental Centre. China (1st) and India (2nd) are the largest tea producing countries in the world.

questions.question: The Kashi Yatra Scheme was introduced by the government of ……
questions.explanation: Karnataka government has launched the Kashi Yatra scheme. It offers cash assistance of Rs 5,000 to pilgrims who visit the Kashi Vishwanath Temple (Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh). The Kashi Vishwanath Temple (Jyotirlingas) is dedicated to Lord Shiva. The current structure was built by the Ahilyabai Holkar of Indore (Maratha ruler) in the year 1780. Q.1514. The Olympic Values Education Programme (OVEP) of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) was launched in Odisha by Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik, in collaboration with the Abhinav Bindra Foundation Trust (ABFT). IOC - Headquarters: Lausanne (Switzerland), Founded: 23 June 1894 (Paris, France).

questions.question: In which district of Maharashtra is Ralegan Siddhi, a small village that has become an example for watershed development, situated?

questions.question: Which state of India has set up District Investment Promotion Agencies (DIPA) ?

questions.question: The Janjira Fort is situated on a small island in the Arabian sea, off the coast of______.
questions.explanation: Maharashtra. Janjira fort is situated on an oval-shaped rock off the Arabian Sea coast near the port town of Murud, km south of Mumbai, Maharashtra. Some other forts in Maharashtra: Lohagad fort, Daulatabad fort, Raigad fort, Shaniwarwada fort pune, Sindhu Garh fort, Pratapgarh fort, Rajmachi fort, Korigad fort, Sinhagad fort etc.

questions.question: Which of the following is a limestone cave in India?
questions.explanation: Borra Caves is a limestone cave located in the Ananthagiri hills of the Araku Valley of the Alluri Sitharama Raju district in Andhra Pradesh. Agumbe, a biodiversity-rich region that receives 7640 mm of average annual rainfall in South India, is located in which state? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Morning) (a) Andhra Pradesh (b) Karnataka (c) Tamil Nadu (d) Kerala Sol.1520.(b) Karnataka. Agumbe ( 'Cobra Capital' of India) is registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is famous for its rich biodiversity, waterfalls (Onake Abbi, Bakarna, and Jogi Gundi fall), and red-hazy sun-set over the Arabian Sea.

questions.question: In which of the following Indian states will you find the Buxa Fort?
questions.explanation: Buxa Fort is located in the Buxa Tiger Reserve, Alipurduar district, in West Bengal. Kurumbera Fort is located at Gagneswar, West Bengal. Fort William, Kolkata, West Bengal.

questions.question: In which city of Gujarat will you find the Uparkot Buddhist Caves ?
questions.explanation: Junagadh. Some of the famous Buddhist Caves in India are Ajanta Caves, Ellora Caves, Kanheri Caves, Bhaja Caves, Junnar Caves, Karla Caves in Maharashtra, Barabar Caves in Bihar, Nagarjunakonda Caves in Andhra Pradesh, Dhauli Caves, Lalitgiri Caves, Ratnagiri Caves in Orissa. Q.1523. What is located inside the premises of Akhal Takht Sahib? SSC CGL 21/04/2022(Morning) (a) Golden Temple (b) Paonta Sahib (c) Patna Sahib (d) Gurudwara Bangla Sahib Sol.1523.(a) Golden Temple. Patna Sahib was built by Maharaja Ranjit Singh. Gurudwara Bangla Sahib is known for its association with the eighth Sikh Guru, Guru Har Krishan.

questions.question: Litti Chokha is a famous cuisine of which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Bihar. Litti Chokha basically consists of wheat and sattu. It originated centuries ago as a staple food in the court of Magadha.

questions.question: In the context of the culture of Uttarakhand, 'Kafuli' is the name of a:
questions.explanation: cuisine. Kafuli is a delicacy of Uttarakhand prepared out of leafy greens such as palak (spinach) and methi (fenugreek) leaves. It is also known as Dhapdi in Garhwal.

questions.question: In which of the following states of India is the buffalo breed named 'Banni' mainly reared?
questions.explanation: Gujarat. Banni buffalo is also known as "Kutchi" or "Kundi". It is a breed of buffalo found primarily in the Kutch district of Gujarat, India.

questions.question: Which of the following palaces is located in Thiruvananthapuram ?
questions.explanation: Kanakakunnu Palace is situated in Thiruvananthapuram near the Napier museum, India. Chowmahalla Palace is the palace of the Nizams of Hyderabad. Amber Fort is a fort located in Amber, Rajasthan. The Ujjayanta Palace is a museum and the former palace of the Kingdom of Tripura situated in Agartala.

questions.question: Janapada Geete, which includes the vachanas of Basavanna, is associated with the state of ______.
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Janapada Geete, Jana means people or tribe and pada means verse/rhyme.

questions.question: Pochampally Ikat sarees and dress materials, famous for their traditional geometric patterns belong to the state of ______.
questions.explanation: Telangana. Traditional Sarees and States: Banarasi Saree - Uttar Pradesh, Kanjivaram Silk Saree - Tamil Nadu, Nauvari Saree - Maharashtra, Tant Saree - West Bengal.

questions.question: 'Muya Awandru' is a traditional food of this Indian state.
questions.explanation: Tripura. Muya awandru is a dish prepared with bamboo shoots, berma (fermented fish), parsley, and green chilies. It is a rice flour-based gravy.

questions.question: Bombay state was split along linguistic lines, forming Maharashtra and ______, in the year 1960.
questions.explanation: Gujarat. The States Reorganisation Committee report was to be implemented in 1956.

questions.question: In which of the following states is the Stanley Reservoir located?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu. Stanley Reservoir (Mettur dam) is one of the largest fishing reservoirs in South India. Its main source of water is the River Kaveri.

questions.question: In which Indian state is the 'Pookode Lake' located?
questions.explanation: Kerala. 10 Famous Lakes in Kerala : Ashtamudi Lake, Periyar Lake, Vembanad Lake, Pookode Lake, Vellayani Lake, Paravur Lake, Punnamada Lake, Sasthamkotta Lake, Mananchira Lake, Veeran Puzhal Lake.

questions.question: In which state of India does the 'Weinia Falls' lie?
questions.explanation: Meghalaya. Weinia Falls is also known as Kshaid Weinia. Kunchikal Falls in Shimoga District of Karnataka is the highest waterfall in India and the second biggest waterfall in Asia.

questions.question: Churahi, Mandeali and Keonthali are dialects spoken in the state of:
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh. Other Pahari dialects spoken here - Chambiali, Churahi, Mandeli, Himachali and Kuluhi.

questions.question: Which of the following is the State Tree of Maharashtra ?

State Animal: Chinkara and Camel. State Dance- Ghoomer, State tree- Khejri (Prosopis Cineraria), State Flower- Rohida (Tecomella Undulata).

questions.question: Which state among the following is the largest producer of coffee?
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Kodagu Chikmagalur and Hassan districts are major coffee producer regions of the state.

questions.question: ‘Balchao’ and ‘Sorpotel' are the traditional culinary dishes of:

questions.question: Which of the following is a site of archaeological importance in Jammu and Kashmir?

questions.question: Chutka Atomic Power Plant is situated in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh (in Mandla district). Presently, India has 22 nuclear power reactors. Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant is the largest nuclear power station in India, situated in Kudankulam Tamil Nadu. questions.question: 'Panche' is a traditional sarong worn by the men in the state of ______.
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Panche (Dhoti) - This unstitched cloth is wrapped around the legs and knotted around the waist.

questions.question: In which present-day state will you find the Meguti temple?
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Megudii Jain temple is a monument in Aihole, constructed in 634 AD in Dravidian style of architecture.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most literate district in India as per Census 2011?
questions.explanation: Serchhip (Mizoram, 97.91%). As per Census 2011 : State with highest literacy rate - Kerala. State with lowest literacy rate - Bihar.

questions.question: Which of the following Indian states has the famous tourist destination called Pamban Island?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu. Pamban Island or Rameswaram Island is an island located between peninsular India and Sri Lanka, on the Adam's Bridge archipelago.

questions.question: In which state is India’s least densely populated district Dibang Valley located as per Census 2011 ?
questions.explanation: Arunachal Pradesh. Dibang is named after the Dibang River or the Talon as the Mishmis. It has an area of 9,129 square kilometers (3,525 sq mi).

questions.question: Where is the Kudremukh iron ore mine located?
questions.explanation: Karnataka (Panambur, Mangalore). Other Iron Ore mine states - Orissa, Chhattisgarh and Jharkhand. Q.1549. questions.question: In which of the following states is the famous Chitradurga Fort located?
questions.explanation: Karnataka (In Chitradurga District). The fort was built in stages between the 11th and 13th centuries by the dynastic rulers of the region, including the Chalukyas and Hoysalas, later the Nayakas of Chitradurga of the Vijayanagar Empire.

questions.question: In which of the following states is Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Temple located?
questions.explanation: Andhra Pradesh. Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Temple is located in Srisailam, district Kurnool, in Andhra Pradesh. Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Temple, Srisailam Temple is a historic temple dedicated to Shiva and Parvati.

questions.question: The Sufi shrine Charar-e-Sharief (or Sharif) is located near ______ city.

questions.question: Which of the following is the state flower of Manipur?
questions.explanation: Shirui Lily (Lilium mackliniae). Foxtail Orchids (Rhynchostylis retusa) or Kopou Flower is a flower of Assam. Pink Rhododendron is a flower of Himachal.

questions.question: Which of the following states emerged as a separate state in 1963 ?
questions.explanation: Nagaland became the 16th state of India on 1 December 1963. Other states were conferred statehood on Mizoram (20 February 1987), Arunachal Pradesh (20 February 1987), Tripura (21 January 1972).

questions.question: Which present day Indian state came into existence as the Mysore state in 1953?
questions.explanation: Karnataka (renamed in 1973). Karnataka is the largest state in South India and the sixth-largest (area wise) in India. Mysore was formed on 1 November 1956.

questions.question: Which modern-day Indian state was created on 1 April 1937 as the United Provinces by the Britishers?

questions.question: In which year did the state of Himachal Pradesh come into existence?
questions.explanation: 25th January 1971. The State of Himachal Pradesh Act was passed by Parliament on 18th December 1970. Thus it emerged as the eighteenth state of the Indian Union.

questions.question: 'Sandalwood' is the state tree of ______.
questions.explanation: Karnataka. Mysore city (Karnataka) is also known as ‘Sandalwood city of India’ .

questions.question: Dogri language is mainly spoken in which of the following states/union territories?

questions.question: ‘Ramoji Film City’ is located close to which of the following cities?

questions.question: Vailankanni (Velankanni) is a pilgrim centre located in the ______ district of Tamil Nadu.

questions.question: The longest continuous wall in India, the second longest in the world, is at ______ Fort.

questions.question: Salsette Island is situated in which state of India ?

questions.question: What is the function of the CPU after the DMA transfer starts?

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the primary difference between broadband and dial-up Internet connections?

options.a: Dial-up requires a cable connection, while broadband does not.
options.b: Broadband is only available in urban areas, while dial-up is available everywhere.
options.c: Dial-up uses a telephone line, while broadband uses various technologies for higher speeds.

questions.explanation: Dial-up: Uses a traditional telephone line to connect to the internet. This method is slow and can be interrupted by phone calls. Broadband: Uses various technologies like cable, fiber optic, or DSL to provide high-speed internet access. It offers significantly faster speeds than dial-up and is not interrupted by phone calls. questions.question: What is the primary purpose of RAM (Random Access Memory) in a computer?

questions.explanation: RAM is a computer or laptop’s short-term memory. It’s where the data is stored that the computer processor needs to run applications and open files. BIOS is the program a computer's microprocessor uses to start the computer system after it is powered on. RAM is volatile in nature, which means the data is lost when the device is switched off.

questions.question: What is the function of the cache memory in a computer’s memory hierarchy?

options.b: To store frequently used data for faster access by the CPU.
options.c: To control the flow of data between the CPU and memory.

questions.explanation: Cache memory is a chip - based computer component that makes retrieving data from the computer's memory more efficient. It is an extremely fast memory type that acts as a buffer between RAM and the CPU. It holds frequently requested data and instructions so that they are immediately available to the CPU when needed. It is costlier than main memory or disk memory but more economical than CPU registers.

Memory Data Registers: It contains data to be written into or to be read out from the addressed location. questions.question: In a star network, how many lines are required for connecting N nodes to the host node?

There are 6 types of topology, Bus Topology - Every computer is connected to a common bus (single cable), Ring Topology - Every node is connected to two other nodes, forming a loop. Tree Topology - A central root node from which all other nodes branch out, Star Topology - Each device on the network is connected to a central hub, Mesh Topology ({n(n-1)/2})- Each node is connected to every other node in the network, Hybrid Topology - It is a combination of two or more network topologies.

questions.question: In the context of the banking sector, what does ‘F’ stand for in IFSC?

Rashtrakuta dynasty built the Hindu and Buddhist caves during their reign. The Kailasa Temple (dedicated to Lord Shiva) was built by Krishna I of the Rashtrakuta dynasty. It is the largest single-rock excavation in the world. Yadava dynasty built many of the Jain caves. The Ellora Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The caves include 12 Buddhist caves, 17 Hindu caves, and 5 Jain caves. Q.1789. Brihadiswara Temple which exhibits Dravidian temple architecture is located in__________. SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (1st shift) (a) Dharmapuri (b) Thiruvananthapuram (c) Madurai (d) Thanjavur Sol.1789.(d) Thanjavur (Tamil Nadu). Brihadeshwara Temple (also known as Thanjai Periya Kovil and Rajarajeswaram) is a Hindu temple dedicated to Shiva. It was built by Tamil King Raja Raja Chola I. The temple is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site known as the “Great Living Chola Temples”, with the other two being Gangaikonda Cholapuram and Airavatesvara temple.

questions.question: The Sun Temple at Konark was built under the rule of which dynasty?

This temple is attributed to King Narasimhadeva I of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty.Temple is a classic illustration of Great Kalinga Architecture. It is dedicated to the God Surya. The famous Chandrabhaga Mela takes place here every year in the month of February. This temple is also called "Black Pagoda". The temple was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1984. Q.1791. Lad Khan Temple at Aihole in Karnataka is an example of which of the following styles of temple architecture? Higher Secondary 25/06/2024 (Shift - 4) (a) Dravida (b) Nagara (c) Vesara (d) Pagoda Sol.1791.(c) Vesara style of temples is a combination of both Nagara (North India) and Dravida (South India), its superstructure is bell-shaped. Examples of Vesara Style temples in Karnataka: Mahadeva temple (Ittagi); Kasivisvesvara temple (Lakkundi); Kallesvara Temple (Kukkanur).

questions.question: The Trimbakeshwar Temple, which is situated in Nashik, Maharashtra, was built by :
questions.explanation: Balaji Baji Rao. Trimbakeshwar Temple, a renowned religious center, houses one of the twelve Jyotirlingas and is located at the foot of Brahmagiri Hill in the city of Trimbak. Other notable temples and their builders include the Brihadeeswara Temple (Raja Raja Chola I of the Chola dynasty), Konark Sun Temple (King Narasimhadeva I of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty), and the Kailasa Temple at Ellora (Krishna I of the Rashtrakuta dynasty).

questions.question: Select the correct combination of the temple and the state in which it is located.
questions.explanation: Kamakhya Temple - Assam. Other temples and locations : Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga - Madhya Pradesh, Somnath Jyotirlinga Temple - Gujarat, Jagannath Temple - Odisha, Badrinath Temple - Uttarakhand, Golden Temple - Punjab, Meenakshi Temple - Tamil Nadu. Hoysaleswara Temple - Karnataka.

questions.question: In which state is the Bhitari temple situated?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. The Victory of Skandagupta over the Huns is mentioned in Bhitari Inscription. Other Religious Sites of Uttar Pradesh: Sarnath, Kashi Vishwanath Temple, Banke Bihari Temple, ISKCON Vrindavan, Banaras Ghats.

questions.question: Where is the Mahabodhi temple situated?
questions.explanation: Bodh Gaya (Bihar). The Mahabodhi Temple (located on the banks of the Niranjana River) is one of the four holy sites related to the life of the Lord Buddha, and particularly to the attainment of Enlightenment. First temple was established in the 3rd century BC by Mauryan emperor Ashoka. Famous Temples in Bihar: Vishnupad Mandir and Mangala Gowri Temple (Gaya), Pawapuri Jal Mandir (Nalanda) and Mithila Shakti Peeth (Darbhanga).

questions.question: Bhitargaon Brick temple is a good example of architecture of which of the following periods?
questions.explanation: Gupta Period. Bhitargaon Temple: It is situated in Kanpur (Uttar Pradesh) and is one of the earliest surviving brick temples of India. It was built during the 5th century AD. Other Gupta period Architectures: Ajanta, Ellora, Sarnath. Temples built during Gupta Period: Dashavatara Temple (Deogarh), Bhitari Temple (Ghazipur).

questions.question: The ‘Mukteshwar’ dance festival is held from 14th to 16th January at the Mukteswar temple in the state of _______.
questions.explanation: Odisha. Temples in Odisha: Jagannath Temple (Puri), Sun Temple (Konark), Maa Tara Tarini Temple (Purusottampur), Lingaraj Temple (Bhubaneswar), Brahmeswara Temple (Bhubaneswar).

questions.question: The most famous of all Jain festivals, Mahamastakabhisheka is performed every 12 years at the Digambara sacred complex at _______ in Karnataka.
questions.explanation: Shravanabelagola (Hassan district of Karnataka) - Gomateshwara statue located in this place and built under the Ganga dynasty. Karuppanna Swamy Temple (Keelakuilkudi, Madurai), Shantinatha Basadi temple (Jinanathapura), Puliyarmala Jain Temple (Kalpetta Wayanad - Kerala). Q.1799. The famous 'Pashupatinath Temple' is located in which country from the following? SSC MTS 08/09/2023 (1st Shift) (a) Nepal (b) Bhutan (c) Maldives (d) Sri Lanka Sol.1799.(a) Nepal. Pashupatinath Temple (Dedicated to Lord Shiva): Stretches on both sides of the Bagmati River. It was conferred the status of a World Heritage Site in 1979 by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).

questions.question: The Sirpur Shrine is situated in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Chhattisgarh. Temples in Chhattisgarh: Maa Bamleshwari Devi Temple, Mahamaya Temple, Chandrahasini Devi temple, BhoramdeoTemple, Danteshwari Temple.

questions.question: The lofty gates erected in the courtyard of the temples in south India were called ____________ .
questions.explanation: Gopuram - A monumental entrance tower, built in the Dravidian Style. Tallest Gopuram - Ranganathaswamy Temple (Tamil Nadu). Southern Indian temples : Shikhara - crowning element at the top of the temple. Vimana - shape of the main temple tower. Q.1802. Builders of which of the following temples had constructed a 4 km long incline for placing 90 tonnes of stone on top of the tallest shikhara amongst temples of its time? Graduate Level 05/08/2022 (Shift - 3) (a) The Sun Temple (b) Rajarajeshvara Temple (c) Kandhariya Mahadeva Temple (d) Gangadikondha Temple Sol.1802.(b) Rajarajeshvara Temple. It was built by Rajaraja Chola I, in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva.

questions.question: The Jagannath Temple in Puri depicts which Indian classical dance form?
questions.explanation: Odissi. Lord Jagannath is worshipped as Vishnu or Narayana or Krishna and deity Balabhadra as Shesha. Q.1804. In which of the following countries is the Hindu religious place 'Chandranath Hill' located? Graduate Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 1) (a) Bhutan (b) Nepal (c) Bangladesh (d) Sri Lanka Sol.1804.(c) Bangladesh. Chandranath Temple :- It is located on top of the Chandranath Hill, is a famous Shakti Peeth located near Sitakunda in Bangladesh. Q.1805. In North Indian temple architecture , which element denotes the superstructure or tower above the sanctum and the pillared mandapas? Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 1) (a) Kalasha (b) Amalaka (c) Shikhara (d) Antarala Sol.1805.(c) Shikhara - A tower, in elevation, which is progressively inclined in a convex curve. The three most common temple architecture are: Nagara in the north (between the Himalayas and Vindhyas), and Dravidian in the south. The Vesara style of temples is an admixture of Nagara and Dravidian styles.

questions.question: Which of the following temples is built in the style of the Rekha Deula or the one with a curvilinear superstructure?

options.d: Kandariya Mahadev Temple in Madhya Pradesh

questions.explanation: Sri Jagannath Temple in Odisha. It was built by Anantavarman Chodaganga Deva In Kalinga - Style architecture. The temple was called the “White Pagoda” and is a part of Char Dham pilgrimages (Badrinath, Dwaraka, Puri, Rameswaram).

questions.question: Ramappa Temple is dedicated to which God?
questions.explanation: Lord Shiva. Ramappa Temple (Rudreshwara Temple or Ramalingeswara Temple) - Situated in Palampet in (Warangal) Telangana. It is a masterpiece of the Kakatiyan style of temple architecture. In July 2021, Ramappa Temple was declared as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Other famous temples (Telangana) - Chilkur Balaji Temple, Sanghi Temple, Gnana Saraswathi Temple, Surendrapuri Temple, Karmanghat Hanuman Temple, Beechupally Anjaneya Swamy Temple.

questions.question: Dilwara Temples at Mount Abu, Rajasthan is an example of _______ temple architecture.
questions.explanation: Jain. Dilwara Temple (Nagara Style of Architecture): Built by Vimal Shah and designed by Vastupala. Other Jain Architecture: Ellora Caves (Maharashtra), Hathi Gumpha.

questions.question: ______ was considered as the most important part of some of the earliest Hindu temples.
questions.explanation: Garbhagriha - Inner chamber of the temple where the main deity was placed. It is also known as Sanctum Sanctorium. Other parts of Hindu Temple : Mandapa - Incorporates space for a large number of worshippers, Shikhar - Mountain-like spire, Vahan - Vehicle of the temple’s main deity, Amalak and Kalash - Crowning elements. Q.1810. The Virupaksha Temple is situated at _______. SSC MTS 16/06/2023 (Evening) (a) Surat (b) Sanchi (c) Hampi (d)Jaipur Sol.1810.(c) Hampi. Virupaksha Temple (Pampapathi Temple) was built by Lakhan Dandesha in Dravidian style on the south bank of the river Tungabhadra at Hampi (Capital of Vijayanagara). Dedicated to Lord Siva. It is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site (1986). Other Monuments at Hampi - Vittala Temple, Ganigatti Jain temple, Krishna Temple and Lotus Mahal.

questions.question: Lingaraja Temple is situated in which of the following states of India?
questions.explanation: Odisha (Bhubaneswar): Dedicated to Lord Shiva. Karnataka: The Chalukya Shiva Temple (LadKhan Temple) in Aihole. Maharashtra: Ter Temple, is a temple of Vamana (an incarnation of Vishnu), Trimbakeshwar Temple of Lord Shiva in Nashik. Tamil Nadu: Murugan Temple at Saluvankuppam, Brihadeeswarar Temple (Thanjavur), Iravatanesvara temple.

questions.question: Which of the following temple is situated in Tamil Nadu ?
questions.explanation: The Shore Temple (Dravidian style). It is located in Mahabalipuram (Tamil Nadu). It was designated a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1984. It was built in the reign of Narasimhavarman II.

questions.question: Which among the following is NOT a component of Lion Capital at Sarnath, India?
questions.explanation: Carved cow representing South direction. The top of the column—the capital—has three parts. First, a base of a lotus flower (ubiquitous symbol of Buddhism). Then, a drum on which four animals are carved represents the four cardinal directions: a horse (west), an ox (east), an elephant (south), and a lion (north). Four lions stand at top of the drum, each facing in the four cardinal directions. Q.1814. In the Kandariya Mahadeva Temple, _______ was the place of ritual worship, where only the king, his family members and the priests used to gather. SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Evening) (a) sanctum sanctorum (b) Mahamandap (c) antraal (d) Amalak Sol.1814.(a) sanctum sanctorum. Garbha griha (Temple's innermost part where the Murti of the deity is kept). Temple Other Part - Mahamaṇḍapa (greater hall). Antarala (small antechamber or foyer between garbhagriha and mandapa). Amalaka (notched stone disk, usually with ridges on the rim, that sits on the top temple's shikhara. Kandariya Mahadeva temple (Nagara Style of Architecture) (Madhya Pradesh) was constructed by king Dhaṇgadeva (Chandela dynasty) in 999 CE.

questions.question: In which state of India is the Sri Brahmapureeswarar temple situated?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu . Other famous temples of Tamil Nadu: Meenakshi Temple, Rameshwaram Temple, Kumari Amman Temple, Nagannathaswamy Temple, Brihadeeswarar Temple, Kapaleeshwarar Temple, Nataraja Temple, Arunachaleswarar Temple, Ekambareswarar, Mahabalipuram Shore, etc.

questions.question: Kardang Monastery which is a Buddhist Pilgrimage is situated in which state of India?
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh. It is situated on the left bank of River Bhaga. It was renovated in 1912 CE by Lama Norbu Rinpoche.

questions.question: What is the stone-like disc seen at the top of the temple in Odisha and nearby district's Temple architecture called?
questions.explanation: ‘Amalaka’ is one of the important elements of Temple Shikhara (Tower) in Nagara Shaili usually found in Uttara Bharatha. A mandir ‘kalash’ is a metal or stone spire used to top the domes of Hindu temples. In Hindu temple architecture, the ‘jagati' is the raised surface of the platform or terrace upon which some Buddhist or Hindu temples are built.

questions.question: Khajuraho temple in Madhya Pradesh is an example of ___________ style of temple architecture.
questions.explanation: Nagara. The Khajuraho Group of Monuments is a group of Hindu temples and Jain temples in Chhatarpur district, Madhya Pradesh, India. They are a UNESCO World Heritage Site (1986). Q.1819. Madan Mohan temple is a centrally protected monument. It is situated in which state of India? SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Morning) (a) Himachal Pradesh (b) Uttarakhand (c) Uttar Pradesh (d) Karnataka Sol.1819.(c) Uttar Pradesh (in Vrindavan). Madan Mohan temple was built by Sanatana Gosvami in 1580 AD. Some other famous temples of Uttar Pradesh are Ram Janmabhoomi Temple, Shri Krishna Janmabhoomi Mandir, Gorakhnath Math Temple, Kashi Vishwanath Temple, Banke Bihari Temple, Vrindavan, Sarnath temple, etc.

questions.question: Which of the following is correct about Nagara or North Indian Temple Style Architecture?

options.a: There were no tower or shikhara
options.c: There was no Kalasha, the topmost part of the temple
options.d: The garbhagriha is always located directly under the tallest tower.

questions.explanation: Features of Nagara style temple: It is built on a stone platform with steps leading up to it, It does not usually have elaborate boundary walls or gateways, Amalaka or Kalash which is installed on Shikhara, etc. Sub divisions : Rekha-Prasad or Latina, Shekari, Bhumija, Valabhi , and Phamsana.

questions.question: Harmandir Sahib is situated in which city of Punjab?
questions.explanation: Amritsar, Punjab. Golden Temple (Sri Harmandar Sahib) is the preeminent spiritual site of Sikhism. Some other spiritual sites of Sikhism are the Gurdwara Darbar Sahib Kartarpur in Kartarpur (Pakistan), and Gurdwara Janam Asthan in Nankana Sahib (Pakistan), etc.

questions.question: A 7 meter high sculpture known as 'Sadashiva', representing three aspects of Lord Shiva is found at ______ Caves.
questions.explanation: Elephanta Caves. The sculpture represents three aspects of Shiva: identified as the Creator, the Preserver, and the Destroyer, respectively, along with Aghora or Bhairava (left half), Taptapurusha or Mahadeva (central full face), and Vamadeva or Uma (right half). Q.1823. Who established the International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON)? SSC MTS 14/10/2021 (Morning) (a) Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada (b) Sri Chaitanya (c) Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati (d) Sri Ramakrishna Sol.1823.(a) Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. ISKCON was founded in in New York City by A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. Its core beliefs are based on Hindu scriptures, particularly the Bhagavad Gita and the Bhagavata Purana, and the Gaudiya Vaishnava tradition.

questions.question: Phodong Monastery is located in ______.
questions.explanation: Sikkim. Phodong Monastery (or Phodang) is a Buddhist monastery. Hemis Monastery is situated 45 Kms away from Leh in Ladakh. Q.1825. Shaikh Muinuddin Sijzi (Moinuddin Chishti) dargah is situated in which of the following cities? SSC CHSL 15/04/2021 (Morning) (a) Jalandhar (b) Ajmer (c) Panipat (d) Patna Sol.1825.(b) Ajmer. Dargah Sharif of Ajmer Sharif is a Sufi tomb (dargah) of the revered Sufi saint, Moinuddin Chishti, located at Ajmer, Rajasthan. The shrine has Chishti's grave (Maqbara).

questions.question: In which of the following states is Sabarimala Sree Dharma Sastha Temple located?
questions.explanation: Kerala. The temple is dedicated to Lord Ayyappa Swamy. Kerala's renowned Sabarimala Temple is to be renamed Sabarimala Sree Ayyappa Swamy Temple.

questions.question: Kadam Rasul Mosque, whose construction is characterized by the use of bricks and black marble, is situated at ______.
questions.explanation: Gaur, Malda (West Bengal). Kadam Rasool Mosque was built by Sultan Nasseruddin Nusrat Shah in the year 1530-31.

questions.question: In which of the following places is the Govardhan Math located?
questions.explanation: Puri (Orissa). Govardhan Math or Govardhan Peetham is one amongst the four cardinal peethams established by the 8th century philosopher-saint Adi Shankara to preserve and propagate Sanatana Dharma.

questions.question: Which of the following temples has Panchayatana Style of architecture?
questions.explanation: Dashavatara Temple. Panchayatana is an architectural style where the main shrine is built on a rectangular plinth with four smaller subsidiary shrines at the four corners, making it a total of five shrines.

questions.question: Where is Bishnupur, which is famous for terracotta temples, located?
questions.explanation: West Bengal. Terracotta temples are known for their Hindu temples made from local terracotta, such as the pyramid-shaped Rasmancha, established around 1600.

questions.question: Which of the following cities is home to one of the famous Swaminarayan Akshardham temples in India?
questions.explanation: New Delhi. Swaminarayan Akshardham is the world's largest comprehensive Hindu temple. It measures 356 ft (109 m) in length, 141 ft high and ft in width. It was inaugurated on 6 November 2005. Q.1832. Kartarpur Sahib corridor connects Dera Baba Nanak Shrine in Gurdaspur, India to Kartarpur Gurudwara in Pakistan, which is located near the banks of the river _____. SSC CHSL 19/10/2020 (Morning) (a) Ravi (b) Jhelum (c) Sutlej (d) Chenab Sol.1832.(a) Ravi. Kartarpur Corridor was first proposed in early 1999 by Atal Bihari Vajpayee and Nawaz Sharif, the Prime Ministers of India and Pakistan respectively at that time. Q.1833. Birthplace of Guru Nanak, known as Nankana Sahib today, was earlier called. SSC CHSL 16/10/2020 (Morning) (a) Roda (b) Umarkot (c) Rai Bhoi di Talwandi (d) Luni Sol.1833.(c) Rai Bhoi di Talvandi. Guru Nanak was the founder of the Sikh religion and was born on 15th April 1469 in Pakistan.

questions.question: The Biraja Temple, the Rajarani Temple and the Samaleswari Temple are all located in ?
questions.explanation: Odisha.

questions.question: ‘Dharmaraja (Yudhishthir) Ratha’, ‘Bhima Ratha’, ‘Arjuna Ratha’ and ‘Nakula Sahadeva Ratha’ are four of the Panch Rathas at Mahabalipuram. What is the name of the fifth Ratha?
questions.explanation: Draupadi Ratha.

questions.question: Which tales are related with the painting and sculptures of the Ajanta caves?
questions.explanation: Jataka tales. These are Buddhist legends describing the previous births of the Buddha. These fables embed ancient morals and cultural lores that are also found in the fables and legends of Hindu and Jain texts. Awards Q.1837. Identify the correct statement with reference to the Padma awards. SSC MTS 22/10/2024 (1st Shift) (a) The Padma award can be used as a suffix or prefix to the awardees’ name (b) The total number of Padma awards to be given in a year should not more than 150. (c) The Padma Awards are given annually. (d) The names of the awardees are never published in the Gazette of India. Sol.1837.(c) Padma Awards, which were instituted in the year 1954, are announced every year on the occasion of Republic Day. The award is given in 3 categories, namely, Padma Vibhushan for exceptional and distinguished service; Padma Bhushan for distinguished service of a high order; and Padma Shri for distinguished service. The total number of awards to be given in a year (excluding posthumous awards and to NRI/foreigners/OCIs) should not be more than 120. The award does not amount to a title and cannot be used as a suffix or prefix to the awardees’ name. Q.1838. Which television channel presents the IMMIES Awards every year with an aim to reward the best talent in the Indian music industry? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) B4U Music (b) MTV (c) Channel V (d) 9XM Sol.1838.(b) MTV. The MTV Immies are held every year with an aim to award the best talents in the Indian music industry. The Mirchi Music Awards, or IMMIES, are presented annually by Radio Mirchi to honor the best in Hindi film music. The first ceremony took place on March 28, 2009, at Taj Lands End, Mumbai, hosted by Shaan and Tulip Joshi. Q.1839. Norman Ernest Borlaug was awarded the _____ in for his contributions to the green revolution. SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (4th shift) (a) Nobel Prize in Physics (b) Nobel Peace Prize (c) Nobel Prize in Chemistry (d) Nobel Prize in Physiology Sol.1839.(b) Nobel Peace Prize. Norman Borlaug was a renowned American agronomist and humanitarian, often referred to as the Father of the Green Revolution. Norman E Borlaug Award : recognizes exceptional scientists under 40 and someone who works in the field of food and nutrition security and hunger eradication. It is given in the honor of Norman Borlaug. Q.1840. In which year was the first Arjuna Award given to a woman hockey player? SSC CHSL 08/07/2024 (3rd shift) (a) 1963 (b) 1964 (c) 1962 (d) 1961 Sol.1840.(d) 1961. Arjuna Award: Awarded for consistent good performance in sports over 4 years. The winners of the Arjuna Award receive a statuette of Arjuna, a certificate and a cash prize 15 lakhs. First woman hockey player awarded - Anne Lumsden. Football Olympian PK Banerjee was the first footballer to win the prestigious accolade.

questions.question: In which year was MS Dhoni awarded Padma Shri Award?
questions.explanation: 2009. The Padma Shri, is the fourth-highest civilian award of the Republic of India, after the Bharat Ratna, the Padma Vibhushan and the Padma Bhushan. Established - 1954. Mahendra Singh Dhoni: Awards - Padma bhushan (2018), Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award (2007).

questions.question: Which of the following awards is presented for lifetime achievement in sports and games? It was instituted to honour those sportspersons who have contributed to sports by their performance and continue to contribute to the promotion of sports even after their retirement from an active sporting career.
questions.explanation: Dhyan Chand Award. It is awarded annually by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports. Instituted in 2002. The first recipients - Shahuraj Birajdar (Boxing), Ashok Diwan (Hockey), and Aparna Ghosh (Basketball). Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna (previous name - Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award): Instituted in 1991-1992.

questions.question: Most major sports awards are accompanied by a cash reward. Which of the following is the only national sports award that does NOT include a cash reward?
questions.explanation: Rashtriya Khel Protsahan Puruskar. An honour given by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports. The award was launched in 2009. Awards and their cash prize: Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna - 25 lakh; Dronacharya Award Regular -10 lakh; Dronacharya Award Lifetime - 15 lakh; Arjuna Award - 15 lakh. Q.1844. In which year was the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna award renamed as Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award, which is the highest sporting honour in the nation? SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) 1991 (b) 2019 (c) 2021 (d) 2014 Sol.1844.(c) 2021. Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award : It is awarded annually by the “Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports”. The award comprises a medallion, a certificate, and a cash prize of Rs. 25 lakh. First recipient (1991-92) - Viswanathan Anand (Chess). Rani Rampal is the first woman Hockey Player to receive the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award in 2020. Winner (2022) - Achanta Sharath Kamal (Table Tennis). Q.1845. The government of India recently changed the name of Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award to Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award, Dhyan Chand served in the Indian army as a : SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (1st shift) (a) Major General (b) Major (c) General (d) Field Marshal Sol.1845.(b) Major. The Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award is India's highest sporting honor, awarded annually by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports. Dhyan Chand, a legendary hockey player, received the Padma Bhushan, India's third highest civilian award, in 1956. His birthday, August 29, is celebrated as National Sports Day. The Khel Ratna award comes with a prize of ₹25 lakh, recognizing outstanding achievements in sports.

questions.question: Prof M Yunus won the Nobel peace prize in which year ?
questions.explanation: 2006. Prof M Yunus won the Nobel Peace Prize for founding the Grameen Bank and pioneering the concepts of microcredit and microfinance. The Prathama Bank of Moradabad, Uttar Pradesh, was the first Regional Rural Bank established on 2 October 1975.

questions.question: Who among the following was awarded the Bharat Ratna for his contribution to the Green Revolution in India?
questions.explanation: C Subramaniam. He received Bharat Ratna award in 1998. The first Bharat Ratna was given to the three members in 1954: Shri Chakravarti Rajagopalachari, Dr. Sarvapalli Radhakrishnan, Dr. Chandrasekhara Venkata Raman. Other awardee: GovindBallabh Pant (1957), Pandurang Vaman Kane (1963), Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam (1997).

questions.question: The _________ is/are given for outstanding performance in sports and games over a period of the previous four years and for showing qualities of leadership, sportsmanship and a sense of discipline.
questions.explanation: Arjuna Awards : Instituted in 1961; Cash prize - ₹15 lakh; First awarded to football Olympian PK Banerjee; First woman awardee - Anna Lumsden (Hockey). Arjuna Awards 2023 : Aditi Gopichand Swami (archery), Mohammed Shami (cricket), Aishwary Pratap Singh Tomar (shooting), among others. MAKA (The Maulana Abul Kalam Azad) Trophy : Given to an institution or university for top performance in inter-university tournaments. Dronacharya Award : India's highest sports honor for coaches. Rashtriya Khel Protsahan Puraskar : Awarded to organizations and individuals for sports promotion and development. Q.1849. Which Indian award was established in the year 1982, to promote and encourage scientific efforts in the field of environment and ecology ? Higher Secondary 20/06/2024 (Shift - 2) (a) Pitambar Pant National Environment Fellowship Award (b) Sanjay Gandhi Award for Environment and Ecology (c) B P Pal National Environment Fellowship Award for Biodiversity (d) Indira Gandhi Paryavaran Puraskar Sol.1849.(b) The Sanjay Gandhi Award for Environment and Ecology is awarded annually to an individual citizen of India engaged in scientific work in the field. It includes a cash prize of ₹100,000, with the announcement made in May or June of the following year. Eligibility is open to all Indian citizens.

questions.question: Who among the following wrote the novel ‘Kitne Pakistan’, which won the Sahitya Akademi Award ?
questions.explanation: Kamleshwar. He was awarded the Sahitya Akademi Award. Other novels: “Pati Patni Aur Woh”,, “Samagra Upanyas”.

questions.question: Dronacharya Award was started in _______.
questions.explanation: 1985. Dronacharya Award: The award comprises a bronze statuette of Dronacharya, a certificate, ceremonial dress, and a money prize of Rs 15 lakh (lifetime) and 10 Lakh (regular). The first recipients of the award were Bhalchandra Bhaskar Bhagwat (Wrestling), Om Prakash Bhardwaj (Boxing), and O. M. Nambiar (Athletics), who were honored in 1985.

questions.question: When was Kapil Dev awarded with Padma Shri Award?
questions.explanation: 1982. Kapil Dev (The Haryana Hurricane) : He was the captain of the Indian cricket team when India lifted a World Cup trophy (1983). Awards - Padma Bhushan (1991), Arjuna Award for Cricket (1979), C. K. Nayudu Lifetime Achievement Award (2013).

questions.question: Who received the Nobel Prize in 1901 for 'recognition of the extraordinary services rendered by the discovery of the laws of chemical dynamics and osmotic pressure in solutions'?
questions.explanation: Jacobus Henricus van't Hoff. Nobel Prize - 1902 - Hermann Emil Fischer “in recognition of the extraordinary services he has rendered by his work on sugar and purine synthesis’”. - Svante August Arrhenius “in recognition of the extraordinary services he has rendered to the advancement of chemistry by his electrolytic theory of dissociation”. 1906 - Henri Moissan “in recognition of the great services rendered by him in his investigation and isolation of the element fluorine, and for the adoption in the service of science of the electric furnace called after him”.

questions.question: When did Linus Carl Pauling receive the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for 'his research into the nature of the chemical bond and its applications to the elucidation of the structure of complex substances'?
questions.explanation: 1954. Linus Carl Pauling was also awarded with the Nobel Peace Prize (1962). Some Scientists who won Nobel Prize in Chemistry :- Otto Paul Hermann Diels and Kurt Alder (1950) - “for their discovery and development of the diene synthesis”. Sir Cyril Norman Hinshelwood and Nikolay Semenov (1956) - “for their research into the mechanism of chemical reactions”. Frederick Sanger (1958)- “for his work on the structure of proteins, especially that of insulin”.

questions.question: For which discovery did William Bradford Shockley, John Bardeen and Walter Houser Brattain jointly receive the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1956?

options.d: Discovery of receptors for temperature and touch

questions.explanation: Discovery of transistor effect. Nobel Prize: Started in 1901, Alfred Nobel (discovered the Dynamite in 1867). questions.question: Who takes the salute during the Republic Day parade at New Delhi?

A beating retreat ceremony signifies the end of the parade.
