questions.question: In which year was the MPLADS scheme implemented?
questions.explanation: 1993. Objective : The Member of Parliament Local Area Development Scheme (MPLADS) aims to empower MPs to recommend developmental projects that focus on creating durable community assets in areas such as drinking water, primary education, public health, sanitation, and road infrastructure, primarily within their constituencies. Each year, MPs receive ₹5 crore in two installments of ₹2.5 crore each. Notably, the funds allocated under MPLADS are non-lapsable. Q.1939. Under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana, the maximum premium payable by the farmers will be _________ for all kharif food and oilseeds crops. SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) 4% (b) 2% (c) 6% (d) 8% Sol.1939.(b) 2%. The Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY), launched on 18 February 2016 by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, is an insurance service for farmers' crops. It follows the "One Nation–One Scheme" concept, replacing the earlier National Agriculture Insurance Scheme and Modified National Agricultural Insurance Scheme.

questions.question: What is the primary objective of the 'Standup India' initiative?

options.c: To facilitate bank loans for SC/ST and women entrepreneurs
options.d: To support all types of startups

questions.explanation: Stand-Up India, launched on April 5, 2016, promotes entrepreneurship among women and SC/ST communities. It offers bank loans from ₹10 lakh to ₹1 crore for setting up greenfield enterprises in manufacturing, trading, or services sectors. The initiative aims to foster economic growth and create jobs by supporting marginalized groups in business ventures.

questions.question: Which is the joint digital skills initiative for employability through digital skills by National Career Service and Microsoft India?
questions.explanation: Digisaksham. The DigiSaksham program was launched in 2021. The program was a collaboration between the Ministry of Labour and Employment (MoLE) and Microsoft India. Goal : To help job seekers become more employable by teaching them digital skills. Other Initiatives for Youth Employment : Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY), National Career Service, and Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana 3.0.

questions.question: Name the pension scheme that seeks to ensure old age protection for unorganised workers.
questions.explanation: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan. This scheme was launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2019 to support unorganized sector workers. It offers a monthly pension of ₹3,000 after the age of 60. Workers aged 18 to 40 years, with a monthly income of ₹15,000 or less, and who are not members of EPFO, ESIC, or NPS (government-funded), can enroll in the PM-SYM scheme. Q.1943. Which of the following ministries launched the PM Daksh scheme? SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Ministry of Education (b) Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (c) Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment (d) Ministry of Food Processing Industries Sol.1943.(c) Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. The "Pradhan Mantri Dakshta Aur Kushalta Sampann Hitgrahi" (PM-DAKSH) scheme was launched in 2020-21, and is designed to uplift the marginalized sections of society by offering skill development programs. It targets SC (Scheduled Caste), OBC (Other Backward Classes), Economically Backward Classes, Denotified tribes, and Safai Mitras, providing upskilling, reskilling, short-term training, and entrepreneurial development courses. Q.1944. Under which scheme are collateral free loans of up to ₹10 Lakh extended by the Member Lending Institutions (MLIs) in India? SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) National Strategy for Financial Inclusion (b) Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (c) Stand Up India scheme (d) Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana Sol.1944.(b) Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana: Launched on April 8, 2015, by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, this flagship scheme aims to provide affordable credit to micro and small enterprises, integrating small entrepreneurs into the formal financial system. The scheme offers three loan products: Shishu (Loans up to ₹50,000), Kishore (Loans ranging from ₹50,000 to ₹500,000), Tarun (Loans from ₹500,000 to ₹1,000,000). Q.1945. The _________ portal is a platform provided by the Govt. of India for farmers to attain any information related to agriculture. SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (3rd Shift) (a) Cropland (b) Farmer’s (c) Agricultural (d) Cultivation Sol.1945.(b) Farmer’s. The Farmers' Portal is a one-stop platform where farmers can access information on seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, credit, best practices, dealer networks, input availability, beneficiary lists, and weather advisories. Other government portals include the mKisan Portal, Crop Insurance Portal, and Participatory Guarantee System (PGS) Portal of India.

questions.question: The Atal Innovation Mission was launched in the year ________.
questions.explanation: 2016. The Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) objective is to create and promote an ecosystem of innovation and entrepreneurship across the country at school, university, research institution, MSME, and industry levels, with NITI Aayog as the implementing agency. Atal Tinkering Labs, a component of AIM, are state-of-the-art spaces established in schools to foster curiosity and innovation among students from grades 6 to 12. Q.1947. In Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awaas Yojana, the cost of unit assistance is shared between Central and State Governments the ratio ____________ for the North-Eastern and the Himalayan states. SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) 90 : 10 (b) 60 : 40 (c) 45 : 55 (d) 50 : 50 Sol.1947.(a) 90 : 10. Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana : Launched - Urban (25th June 2015) and Gramin (1st April 2016). It is a social welfare programme under the Ministry of Rural Development. Aim - Provide housing for the rural poor in India. The cost of unit assistance is to be shared between Central and State Governments in the ratio 60:40 in plain area.

questions.question: In which year was Ujala Yojana launched?
questions.explanation: 2015. Unnat Jyoti by Affordable LEDs for All (UJALA) : It aims to replace 77 crore incandescent lamps with LED bulbs through phase-wise distribution across India.

questions.question: Which of the following schemes of the Government of India is a part of the ‘Target Group’ approach?

options.d: Command Area Development & Water Management Programme (CADP)

questions.explanation: Marginal Farmers Development Agency (MFDA) supports small and marginal farmers through credit, training, and technology. The Small Farmers Development Agency (SFDA) was established in 1971 by the All India Rural Credit Review Committee, which was formed in 1969. Additionally, the Marginal Farmers and Agricultural Laborers Development Agency (MAFALDA) was established in 1971-72.

questions.question: The National Youth Policy 2014 defines youth as population between the ages of______ and______.
questions.explanation: 15; 29. The National Youth Policy was first formulated in 1988, revised in 2003, and again in 2014. Changes in the socio-economic and other conditions of the country require periodic reformulation to address contemporary issues and promote youth well-being. India has the highest youth population in the world.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the main pillars of the ‘Namami Gange Programme’, launched by the Government of India in 2014?
questions.explanation: River Linkage Development. The 'Namami Gange Programme' is an integrated conservation mission approved as a flagship program by the Union Government in June 2014.

questions.question: When was the Swarnajayanti Gram Swarozgar Yojana (SGSY) launched by the Government of India?
questions.explanation: 1999. The objective of the SGSY is to bring the assisted Swarozgaris above the poverty line by providing them income generating assets through bank credit and Government subsidy.

questions.question: How might ICT enhance the openness of e-land records?

options.a: Enabling quick search and retrieval of land records
options.b: Facilitating manual record updates and amendments
options.c: Enforcing strict regulations on land transactions
options.d: Reducing the need for land surveys and assessments

questions.explanation: Information and Communication Technology (ICT) facilitates the digitization and online availability of land records, making it easier for stakeholders to access information efficiently. ICT systems can provide real-time updates and tracking of land records, reducing delays and increasing the reliability of information. Digital India Land Records Modernization Programme was launched in 2008 by the Ministry of Rural Development to digitize and modernize land records and develop a centralized land record management system. Q.1954. By which ministry of Government of India was the Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana started? SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (1st shift) (a) Ministry of Corporate affairs (b) Ministry of Rural Development (c) Ministry of Home affairs (d) Ministry of Labour and Employment Sol.1954.(b) Ministry of Rural Development. Deen Dayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY - NRLM) was launched as ‘Aajeevika - National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM)' in the year 2011. It was renamed as DAY-NRLM in 2015. It aims at creating effective and efficient institutional platforms to enable the rural poor to increase their household income by means of sustainable livelihood enhancements and better access to financial services.

questions.question: When was the Bharat Nirman Programme launched by the Government of India?
questions.explanation: 2005. The Bharat Nirman program was a Union Government program launched to improve rural infrastructure. The program's objectives included: Developing rural roads, Building rural housing, Improving rural telephony, Electrifying rural areas, and Providing rural water supply and irrigation.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a poverty alleviation programme in India?
questions.explanation: Rashtriya Ucchatar Shiksha Abhiyan. It is a holistic scheme of development for higher education in India initiated in 2013 by the Ministry of Education. Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rozgar Yojana in India is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme which came into effect on 1 December 1997. The Prime Minister Rozgar Yojna (PMRY) scheme is to provide assistance to the educated unemployed persons. Q.1957. Who among the following launched the digital platform 'FASTER'? SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Finance Minister (b) President (c) Chief Justice of India (d) Prime Minister Sol.1957.(c) Chief Justice of India. FASTER, which stands for 'Fast and Secured Transmission of Electronic Records', is a digital platform used by court officials. It enables instant transmission of electronic copies of court orders. This secure electronic communication channel ensures swift delivery of documents to the intended parties. Portals Launched by Government of India : “ROSHNI” - IIT Ropar, Shiksha Vani - CBSE, Diksha - Ministry of Human Resource Development, e-Sahaj - Ministry of Home Affairs. Q.1958. In which year was the ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat Rojgar’ Yojana launched by the Government of India? SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (3rd shift) (a) 2020 (b) 2022 (c) 2010 (d) 2015 Sol.1958.(a) 2020. The 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat Rojgar' Yojana has been launched with effect from 1st October, 2020 as part of Atmanirbhar Bharat package 3.0 to incentivize employers for creation of new employment along with social security benefits and restoration of loss of employment during Covid-19 pandemic.

questions.question: __________ is one of the well - known schemes sponsored by the Union Government of India. It was launched in November 2015 with the aim of rescuing the country’s ailing electricity distribution companies.
questions.explanation: Ujwal DISCOM Assurance Yojana. Key Features of UDAY: Financial Turnaround: Allows state governments to take over 75% of DISCOM debt and pay back lenders by selling bonds. Energy Efficiency: Promotes the use of energy-efficient LED bulbs, agricultural pumps, fans, and air conditioners. Other Scheme: One Nation, One Grid refers to the unified national power grid. Integrated Power Development Scheme (IPDS) focuses on strengthening sub-transmission and distribution infrastructure. Deendayal Upadhyaya Gram Jyoti Yojana (DDUGJY) aims to provide 24/7 electricity to rural areas.

questions.question: The approach driven by seven engines, which is powered by Clean Energy and 'Sabka Prayas' is related to which scheme?
questions.explanation: PM Gati Shakti Master Plan. Launched on October 13, 2021, the PM Gati Shakti plan is aimed at integrating and speeding up infrastructure projects across sectors. It focuses on seven key engines: roads, railways, airports, ports, mass transport, waterways, and logistics infrastructure.

questions.question: Match the columns. List I List II i. National Manufacturing Policy a. 2014 ii. Make in India initiative b. 2016 iii. Startup India scheme c. 2011 iv. Smart City Project d. 2015

options.a: i - d, ii - c, iii - a, iv - b
options.b: i - c, ii - d, iii - b, iv - a
options.c: i - b, ii - a, iii - d, iv - c
options.d: i - c, ii - a, iii - b, iv - d

questions.explanation: i-c, ii-a, iii-b, iv-d. National Manufacturing Policy: Objective - Enhancing the share of manufacturing in GDP to 25% within a decade and creating 100 million jobs. Make in India initiative: Objective - To promote India as the most preferred global manufacturing destination. Startup India scheme: Aim - To empower startups to grow through innovation and design. Smart City Project: Objective: To promote sustainable and inclusive cities with core infrastructure, a high quality of life, a clean environment, and smart solutions.

questions.question: When was the Prime Minister’s Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) launched?
questions.explanation: 2008. The Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) is a government scheme that aims to create employment opportunities in rural and urban areas. The scheme provides financial assistance for setting up self-employment ventures, including for artisans and unemployed youth.

questions.question: In which year was the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act passed?
questions.explanation: 2005. The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) was enacted in September 2005, with the primary objective of ensuring 100 days of wage employment per year for rural households. Originally proposed by P.V. Narasimha Rao in 1991, it was implemented across 625 districts in India before its nomenclature was amended from NREGA to MGNREGA on 2nd October 2009 . Q.1964. The ___________ project has been organised by the Central government for the villagers, to conserve water for drinking, irrigation, fisheries and afforestation. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Haryali (b) Chipko andolan (c) Neeru-Meeru (d) Arvary Pani Sansad Sol.1964.(a) Haryali : Launched in 2003. Chipko movement (1973) was a nonviolent protest to prevent felling of trees in Himalayas that began in Chamoli (Uttarakhand) under the leadership of Sundarlal Bahuguna, Gaura Devi, etc. The Neeru-Meeru (Water and You) programme was launched in Andhra Pradesh in 2000. Arvary Pani Sansad (in Alwar, Rajasthan) program was launched in 1999. Q.1965. Which Ministry of the Government of India launched South Asia Distribution Utility Network (SADUN) which aims to modernise distribution of utilities in South Asia? Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 1) (a) Information and Broadcasting ministry (b) Power ministry (c) Railways ministry (d) Civil Aviation ministry Sol.1965.(b) Power Ministry. SADUN is a joint initiative of the Ministry of Power, United States Agency for International Development (USAID) and Power Finance Corp. This initiative aims to promote knowledge sharing among distribution companies (discoms) in the region.

questions.question: In which year was the 'Prime Minister Street Vendor's AtmaNirbhar Nidhi' (PM SVANidhi) scheme launched by the Government of India with the objective of providing an affordable working capital loan to street vendors to resume their livelihoods ?
questions.explanation: 2020. Prime Minister Street Vendor’s AtmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM-SVANidhi) fully funded by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. The scheme facilitates a working capital collateral-free loan of ₹10,000, with subsequent loans of ₹20,000 and ₹50,000 with a 7% interest subsidy.

questions.question: The 'National Food for Work Programme' was launched in the year 2004 by the Government of India in _____ most backward districts of India
questions.explanation: 150. The National Food for Work Programme (NFWP), launched on November 14, 2004, by the Ministry of Rural Development, aimed to provide supplementary wage employment in 150 of India's most backward districts. Q.1968. Pradhan Mantri Virasat Ka Samvardhan (PM VIKAS) Scheme is a scheme of which Ministry of the Government of India? Higher Secondary 25/06/2024 (Shift - 4) (a) Ministry of Tourism (b) Ministry of Tribal Affairs (c) Ministry of Minority Affairs (d) Ministry of Culture Sol.1968.(c) Ministry of Minority Affairs. Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Ko Kaam Karyakram (PMKKK) renamed as Pradhan Mantri Virasat Ka Samvardhan (PM VIKAS) Scheme. This integrated scheme converges five erstwhile schemes of the Ministry viz. Seekho aur Kamao, USTTAD, Hamari Dharohar, Nai Roshni and Nai Manzil.

questions.question: In October 2020, which of the following Ministries launched the Ayushman Sahakar Scheme, to assist cooperatives in the creation of healthcare infrastructure?

options.b: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
options.c: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

questions.explanation: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare. The scheme is implemented by the National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC). Other related schemes include Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB-PMJAY), launched by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare in September 2018, and the National Rural Health Mission (NRHM), initiated by the same ministry in 2005.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a poverty alleviation programme in India?
questions.explanation: Namami Gange. India has implemented several poverty alleviation programs aimed at reducing poverty and improving living standards. Poverty alleviation programme in India: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (2005), Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (2015), National Rural Livelihood Mission (2011), Public Distribution System (PDS), Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana (2016).

questions.question: What is the duration of Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana?
questions.explanation: years. The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) was launched in 2020, by the Department of Fisheries, Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry, and Dairying. Q.1972. Which of the following government schemes was launched to provide financial assistance to start-ups for proof of concept, prototype development, product trials, market entry and commercialisation on 19 April 2021? Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 3) (a) Start-up India Seed Fund Scheme (SISFS) (b) Pradhan Mantri Rozgar Yojana (PMRY) (c) Procurement and Marketing Support (PMS) Scheme (d) Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY) Sol.1972.(a) Start-up India Seed Fund Scheme (SISFS) aims to provide seed funding to startups at the initial stages. Pradhan Mantri Rozgar Yojana (1993) focuses on self-employment opportunities for unemployed youth. Procurement and Marketing Support (PMS) Scheme provides marketing assistance to micro and small enterprises. Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (2015) provides loans to micro-enterprises. Q.1973. Which ministry started the Pradhan Mantri Rojgar Protsahan Yojana? Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 3) (a) Ministry of Labour and Employment (b) Ministry of Home Affairs (c) Ministry of Corporate Affairs (d) Ministry of Rural Development Sol.1973.(a) Ministry of Labour and Employment. Pradhan Mantri Rojgar Protsahan Yojana (PMRPY) was launched on 9th August, 2016 with the objective to incentivise employers for creation of employment. Under the scheme, Government of India is paying Employer’s full contribution i.e. 12% towards Employees' Provident Funds (EPF) and Employees' Pension Scheme (EPS) both.

questions.question: The Swadesh Darshan Scheme (SDS) which was launched in 2014-15 by the Ministry of Tourism, Government of India, has been revamped as ___ in 2023.
questions.explanation: Swadesh Darshan 2.0 (SD2.0). It seeks to attain “Aatmanirbhar Bharat” with the mantra of ‘vocal for local’. Q.1975. Which age group of the population are covered under the Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY) scheme of the Government of India ? SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift) (a) 25 to 60 years (b) 30 to 60 years (c) 15 to 35 years (d) 14 to 40 years Sol.1975.(c) 15 to 35 years. Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalyaya Yojana (Launch - 2014) : It is a demand-driven placement linked skill training initiative working under the National Rural Livelihood Mission (NRLM). Scheme was announced by the Ministry of Rural Development on Antyodaya Divas.

questions.question: In which year was the Training of Rural Youth for Self Employment (TRYSEM) scheme launched by the Government of India?
questions.explanation: 1979. Objectives of TRYSEM : To provide rural youth (18-35 years) from families below the poverty line with training and technical skills to enable them to take up self-employment in agriculture, industry, services and business activities. Q.1977. The Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rojgar Yojana (SJSRY) was launched in the year ____ by the Government of India. SSC MTS 08/09/2023 (2nd Shift) (a) 1990 (b) 1997 (c) 2010 (d) 2004 Sol.1977.(b) 1997. SJSRY : The Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rozgar Yojana (SJSRY) shall seek to provide gainful employment to the urban unemployed. Ministry - Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. Q.1978. The Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Rojgar Abhiyaan (PMGKRA) was launched in the year 2020 by which Ministry of Government of India? SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (2nd Shift) (a) Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways (b) Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment (c) Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (d) Ministry of Rural Development Sol.1978.(d) Ministry of Rural Development. It was for a period of 125 days with a resource envelope of Rs.50,000 crore, to boost employment and livelihood opportunities for returnee migrant workers and similarly affected workers in the rural area, in the wake of COVID-19 pandemic. It will run for 125 days in 116 districts across six states - Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, Odisha and Rajasthan.

questions.question: In which year was the Pradhan Mantri Rojgar Protsahan Yojana (PMRPY) launched?
questions.explanation: 2016. PMRPY : a scheme to incentivise employers registered with the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) for job creation. Administered by - The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). Nodal Ministry - Ministry of Labour and Employment.

questions.question: Which of the following options best describes the purpose of Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Mann-Dhan (PM-SYM) scheme, 2019 ?

options.a: Provide healthcare services to pregnant women
options.b: Provide education loans to financially weak students
options.c: Provide pension to unorganized sector workers
options.d: Provide financial assistance to small and marginal farmers

questions.explanation: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maan Dhan (PM-SYM) scheme - The scheme provides a monthly pension of Rs. 3000/- to subscribers after they attain the age of 60 years. The scheme is for the age group of 18-40 years. Q.1981. Which of the following government schemes provides subsidised food grains to poor households in India? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (4th shift) (a) Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (b) Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (c) Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (d) Atal Pension Yojana Sol.1981.(b) Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (2020). The scheme aims to provide 5 kg of grains (wheat or rice) for free to each individual who is covered under National Food Security Act, 2013.

questions.question: Which of the following initiatives of the Government of India is aimed at developing and rejuvenating 75 water bodies in each district of the country as a part of the celebration of Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav?
questions.explanation: Mission Amrit Sarovar. With a view to conserve water for the future this Mission launched on 24th April, 2022.

questions.question: Which of the following is the largest pan-India scheme to strengthen health care infrastructure across the country with focus on primary, secondary and tertiary care services?
questions.explanation: PM-ABHIM (Prime Minister Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission): Ministry ( Ministry of Health and Family Welfare), launched (October 2021).

questions.question: The 'Right to Work' plan, under the National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, 2005, was implemented in how many districts in the first phase?
questions.explanation: 200. National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, (NREGA) : It is under the Ministry of Rural development. In (2009), the NREGA scheme was renamed as the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) scheme. Aim - to ensure that if any adult member of a rural household is willing to do unskilled manual work, that household gets at least 100 days of jobs in a financial year.

questions.question: What is the priority zone of the AMRUT (Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation) mission, which was launched by the Government of India in 2015 ?
questions.explanation: Water supply followed by sewerage. AMRUT: Launched on 25th June 2015 and selected 500 cities and towns to focus on development of basic infrastructure. National Heritage City Development And Augmentation Yojana (HRIDAY) started on 21 January 2015.

questions.question: What is the name of the flagship program that was launched in 2005 to address the lack of infrastructure in urban India ?

options.b: Integrated Development of Small & Medium Towns
options.c: Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation
options.d: Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission

questions.explanation: Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission (JNNURM) - A massive city-modernization scheme launched by the Government of India under the Ministry of Urban Development. Launched - December 2005. Closed - 2014.

questions.question: When was the National Urban Health Mission approved by the Government of India ?
questions.explanation: 2013. The National Urban Health Mission (NUHM): Launched by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

questions.question: In which year was the 'Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana' launched?
questions.explanation: 2015. Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana: promotes skill development in the country by providing free short-duration skill training and incentivizes this by providing monetary rewards to youth for skill certification. Ministry - Skill Development and Entrepreneurship.

questions.question: The 'Jal Kranti Abhiyan' was launched by which government during the financial year 2015 - 2016 ?
questions.explanation: Government of India. The Abhiyan was inaugurated by the Union Minister of Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation in Rajasthan in June 2015. Objective: Strengthening grass-root involvement of all stakeholders including Panchayati Raj institutions and local bodies for Participatory Irrigation Management. Q.1990. 'Swachh Bharat Mission' is associated with which public figure? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (2nd shift) (a) Mahatma Gandhi (b) Jawaharlal Nehru (c) Vallabhbhai Patel (d) Lal Bahadur Shastri Sol.1990.(a) Mahatma Gandhi. Swachh Bharat Mission (SBM) is a country-wide campaign initiated by the Government of India at Rajpath (New Delhi) on October 2, 2014 to eliminate open defecation and improve solid waste management.

questions.question: How many engines drive 'PM Gati Shakti', a project launched by the central government with an aim to revolutionise infrastructure in India?
questions.explanation: Seven. Gati Shakti scheme (2021) or National Master Plan for multi-modal connectivity plan comes under the Ministry of Commerce. Q.1992. What is the aim of the Annapurna Yojana of the Government of India? Higher Secondary 27/06/2023 (Shift - 3) (a) To provide food grains to children (b) To provide food grains to women (c) To provide food to all (d) To provide food grains to senior citizens Sol.1992.(d). Annapurna Yojana - Launched by the Ministry of Rural Development. It is a part of the National Social Assistance Programme (1995). Objective - It provides Food Security to Senior Citizens above 60 years of age and to those eligible old-aged persons who remained uncovered under Indira Gandhi NOAPS (National Old Age Pension Scheme). Eligible beneficiaries will receive 10 kg (Every month) of grains free of charge.

questions.question: Karmayogi Bharat owns and operates the digital assets and platforms for the online training of _____________
questions.explanation: Civil servants. Karmayogi Bharat : A Special Purpose Vehicle (set up under section 8 of Companies Act, as a 100% government-owned entity) which shall own, manage, maintain and improve the digital platform, IGOT (Integrated Govt. Online training) to implement Mission Karmayogi (2020) - the National Programme for Civil Services Capacity Building.

questions.question: The National Rural Employment Programme was merged with ____ in 1989.
questions.explanation: Jawahar Rozgar Yojana - It was launched in April 1989 by merging National Rural Employment Program (NREP) and Rural Landless Employment Guarantee Programme (RLEGP). It was replaced by Jawahar Gram Samridhi Yojna on April and on September 2001, merged with Sampoorna Grameen Rozgar Yojana. Indira Awaas Yojana (IAY) - 1985-86 (Now replaced by Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awas Yojana). Q.1995. Pradhan Mantri Gramodaya Yojana was launched in ___________. SSC MTS 04/05/2023 (Morning) (a) 2000 (b) 2010 (c) 2005 (d) 1998 Sol.1995.(a) 2000. Pradhan Mantri Gramodaya Yojana - It was started to improve the lives of the rural poor population. Other important government scheme: National Social Assistance Programme (Launched on 15th August, 1995). Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (Launched on 25th December, 2000). Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (October 2014). Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (launched in 2016).

questions.question: PM Street Vendor’s AtmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi) Scheme was launched by which ministry?

options.d: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

questions.explanation: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. The PM Street Vendor’s Atma Nirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi) - launched on June 01, 2020. Aim - Providing affordable Working Capital loans to street vendors to resume their livelihoods that have been adversely affected due to Covid-19 lockdown.

questions.question: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana- Urban was launched by which Union Ministry?

options.b: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

questions.explanation: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. It was launched on 25th June 2015. Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G) - It was launched in June with the aim to provide ‘Housing for All’ by 2022 in rural areas.

questions.question: The Union Government's "PAHAL Scheme" is related to _______ .
questions.explanation: LPG Subsidy. PAHAL (Pratyaksh Hanstantrit Labh) entered into Guinness Book of World Records (largest Direct Benefit Transfer of LPG), was launched on June by the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas.

questions.question: The National Literacy Mission (NLM) was set up in _____ .
questions.explanation: 1988. The National Literacy Mission - It aimed to educate people in the age group of 15 - 35. The major aim of the programme is on the promotion of literacy among women, scheduled castes and tribes and backward classes. Q.2000. “PM POSHAN” Scheme is implemented by which ministry? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Morning) (a) Ministry of Women & Child Development (b) Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare (c) Ministry of Education (d) Ministry of Social Justice Sol.2000.(c) Ministry of Education. In 2021, the Union Cabinet approved the PM-POSHAN (Pradhan Mantri Poshan Shakti Nirman) for providing one hot cooked meal in Government and Government-aided schools. The scheme replaced the Mid-day Meal Scheme. The Mid Day Meal Scheme was started in India on 15th August 1995.

questions.question: Which road plan in India was the first attempt for the Road Development Programme between 1943-1963 ?
questions.explanation: Nagpur Road plan (1943 - 1963). Bombay road plan (1961- 1981, Lucknow road plan (1981 – 2001).

questions.question: In which of the following years was the Fit India Movement launched by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, GoI?
questions.explanation: 2019. Fit India Movement was launched on the occasion of National Sports Day to make fitness an integral part of the daily lives of the people of India. Q.2003. Smart cities and Academia Towards Action and Research (SAAR) scheme was launched by the ______. SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Afternoon) (a) Ministry of Commerce and Industry (b) Ministry of Culture (c) Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (d) Ministry of External Affairs Sol.2003.(c) The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA) launched the SAAR program under the Smart Cities Mission.

questions.question: In which year was Soil Health Card launched in India to enable the farmers to apply appropriate recommended dosages of nutrients for crop production and improving soil health and its fertility?
questions.explanation: (Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare). Soil Health Card (SHC) is a printed report which contains nutrient status of soil with respect to nutrients: pH, Electrical Conductivity (EC), Organic Carbon (OC), Nitrogen (N), Phosphorus (P), Potassium (K), Sulphur (S), Zinc (Zn), Boron (B), Iron (Fe), Manganese (Mn) and Copper (Cu) of farm holdings.

questions.question: When was the Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission launched?
questions.explanation: September 2021. Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission aims to provide digital health IDs for all Indian citizens to help hospitals, insurance firms, and citizens access health records electronically when required. Q.2006. ‘Surakshit Hum Surakshit Tum Abhiyan’ was launched by which of the following institutions? Graduate Level 04/08/2022 (Shift - 2) (a) NITI Aayog and bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (b) Ministry of Women and Child Development and Piramal Foundation (c) Ministry of Women and Child Development and Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (d) NITI Aayog and Piramal Foundation Sol.2006.(d) NITI Aayog and Piramal Foundation. NITI stands for “National Institution for Transforming India” (2015). Its initiatives include "15-year road map", "7-year vision, strategy, and action plan", AMRUT, Digital India, Atal Innovation Mission. Q.2007. In which year was the Immunization Programme introduced in India as ‘Expanded Programme of Immunization’ (EPI) by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare? SSC CGL 13/04/2022 (Evening) (a) 1982 (b) 1974 (c) 1978 (d) 1980 Sol.2007.(c) 1978. The Expanded Programme on Immunization (EPI) was started in India in 1978 with the objective to reduce morbidity and mortality from tetanus, poliomyelitis, diphtheria, pertussis, and childhood tuberculosis by providing immunization services to all eligible children and pregnant women by 1990. Q.2008. Realizing the importance of maintaining the cleanliness of the water bodies, the Government of India passed the Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, ________, to safeguard our water resources. SSC CGL 21/04/2022 (Evening) (a) 1974 (b) 1973 (c) 1971 (d) 1969 Sol.2008.(a) 1974.

questions.question: In which year was the ‘Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay Sanrakshan Abhiyan’ (PM AASHA) launched by the Government of India?
questions.explanation: 2018. The ‘Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay Sanrakshan Abhiyan’ (PM AASHA) was launched by the Government of India. Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay SanraksHan Abhiyan (PM-AASHA) is an umbrella scheme aimed at ensuring remunerative prices to the farmers for their produce.

questions.question: ‘Mission Antyodaya’ is a mission mode project envisaged by the:
questions.explanation: Ministry of Rural Development. Mission Antyodaya is a convergence and accountability framework aiming to bring optimum use and management of resources. It was adopted in the Union Budget 2017-18.

questions.question: In which year was the ‘Target Olympic Podium Scheme’ (‘TOPS’) formulated by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports?
questions.explanation: 2014. TOPS facilitates selected athletes with support staff and training personnel, sports psychologists, physiotherapists etc including direct financial support of 50,000 rupees per month. Q.2012. In which year was National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) registered as a society under the Societies Registration Act 1860? SSC CHSL 15/04/2021 (Evening) (a) 2018 (b) 2014 (c) 2011 (d) 2009 Sol.2012.(c) 2011. National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) is the implementation wing of the National Ganga River Basin Authority (NGRBA).

questions.question: Chand Minar at Daulatabad is a 210-feet-high tapering tower divided into _____ storeys.
questions.explanation: four. Chand Minar (2nd largest minaret in India) was built in 1435 by Ala-ud-din Bahmani to commemorate the victory over the Daulatabad Fort. It has 24 chambers, spread over four floors and a small mosque. Q.2014. Theravada is known as the official religion of which of the following neighbouring countries of India? SSC MTS 04/11/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) Afghanistan (b) Bangladesh (c) Pakistan (d) Sri Lanka Sol.2014.(d) Sri Lanka. Theravāda is one of the major branches of Buddhism, and it is considered the oldest and most traditional form. It is predominantly practiced in Southeast Asian countries such as Sri Lanka, Thailand, Myanmar (Burma), Laos, and Cambodia. Official religion of India’s Neighbouring Countries: Pakistan (Islam), Bangladesh (Islam), Bhutan (Mahayana Buddhism), Afghanistan (Islam). Q.2015. The Kamakshi Saunsthan temple of Goa is crowned with the ________ two-storied tower and with a golden Kalash perched on its Shikhar. SSC MTS 12/11/2024 (2nd Shift) (a) pentagonal (b) circular (c) hexagonal (d) octagonal Sol.2015.(d) octagonal. The Kamakshi Saunsthan temple, built in the late 16th century, is located in the village of Shiroda, Goa. The temple complex, known as 'Sthal' or 'Thal', is accessed through a grand Mahadwar (temple gate) and includes key features like Sabha Mandap (entrance hall), Deepasthambh (lamp tower), a holy water tank, and a square-shaped chowk for Prasad rituals. Q.2016. Consider the following statements related to the Online Dispute Resolution (ODR) handbook. 1. It will be launched by the Ministry of Science and Technology. 2. ODR is the resolution for cases outside courts using digital technology and techniques of Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR), such as negotiation, mediation and arbitration. 3. The development of ICT and increased use of internet has played a major role for ODR. Which of the given statements is/are correct? SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (1st Shift) (a) Only 1 and 3 (b) Only 2 and 3 (c) Only 1 (d) Only 2 Sol.2016.(b) Only and 3. Online Dispute Resolution handbook is launched by NITI Ayog. It is developed by Agami and Omidyar India, in association with NITI Aayog and with the support of ICICI Bank, Ashoka Innovators for the Public, Trilegal, Dalberg, Dvara and NIPFP.

questions.question: How is the structure of health infrastructure and health care system in India?
questions.explanation: Three-tier system. The healthcare system in India is a three-tier structure, with Sub Health Centres, Primary Health Centres, and Community Health Centres, both in urban and rural areas, serving as the pillars of the primary health care system.

questions.question: Which language is known as ‘Italian of the East’ ?
questions.explanation: Telugu. Telugu Language Day is celebrated every year on August 29. In 2008, Telugu was granted the status of a classical language. Nicolo di Conti, who visited the Vijayanagara Empire, found that the words in the Telugu language end with vowels, just like those in Italian, and hence referred to it as "The Italian of the East”.

questions.question: To enhance the interoperability between the Indian and Russian Armies, a joint training exercise called _________ commenced at Prudboy Ranges, Volgograd in the year 2021.
questions.explanation: INDRA 2021. 12th Edition of Indo-Russia Joint Military Exercise INDRA : Objective - Conduct counter-terror operations under UN mandate. Participation - 250 personnel from India and Russia. Indian Army Contingent - Mechanised Infantry Battalion. The 13th edition of the Indra naval exercise was hosted by India in the Bay of Bengal in November 2023.

questions.question: What kind of technology is most frequently used to manage and digitise e-land records?
questions.explanation: Geographic Information System (GIS) allows for the effective mapping, analysis, and management of land data by integrating spatial and attribute information. It provides tools for creating detailed maps, analyzing land use patterns, and managing land records efficiently. Blockchain technology can enhance security and transparency, and VR and AR have potential applications.

questions.question: On 12 September 2002, ISRO launched the Kalpana-1 satellite using the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle. What is the application of this satellite?
questions.explanation: Climate & environment communication. Kalpana-1 satellite was originally known as MetSat-1. Launched by vehicle PSLV - C4. On February 5, 2003 it was renamed to Kalpana-1 by the Indian Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee in memory of Kalpana Chawla (NASA astronaut who perished in the Space Shuttle Columbia disaster).

questions.question: In whose ashram did the Beatles compose rock music in 1968 influenced by classical music?
questions.explanation: Maharshi Mahesh Yogi Ashram. In February 1968, the English rock band the Beatles traveled to Rishikesh (Uttarakhand) to take part in a Transcendental Meditation (TM) training course at Maharshi Mahesh Yogi's Ashram. Maharshi Mahesh Yogi is the founder of the Transcendental Meditation technique. Q.2023. The institute established by Kaka Hathrasi in 1932 is: SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Sangeet Karyalaya (b) Music Art Centre (c) Music Art Kendra (d) Swar Sangam Kendra Sol.2023.(a) Sangeet Karyalaya: Located - Hathras (Uttar Pradesh). The institute was founded with the aim of promoting Indian classical music and preserving the cultural heritage of India. Kaka Hathrasi published the monthly magazine "SANGEET" in 1935. Q.2024. Marathi language is in the_______language family SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Indo Aryan (b) Austric (c) Sino-India (d) Austro Sol.2024.(a) Indo Aryan. Marathi is a language spoken in the Indian state of Maharashtra and belongs to the Indo-Aryan branch of the Indo-European language family. It is closely related to languages such as Hindi, Gujarati, and Punjabi. Austric: These are the languages spoken by the Munda or Kol group and spoken in central, eastern, and northeastern India. Q.2025. With which of the following communities is the word 'Langar' (community kitchen) mainly associated? SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (3rd shift) (a) Sikhism (b) Hinduism (c) Jainism (d) Buddhism Sol.2025.(a) Sikhism. The concept of “Langar” is an integral part of Sikh culture, symbolizing equality, service, and community bonding. It is commonly served at Gurdwaras (Sikh temples) and was introduced by Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Similar tradition of Annadanam (food donation) exist in Hinduism.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the classical languages of India?
questions.explanation: Magahi (Magadhi) is an Indo-Aryan language spoken in Bihar, Jharkhand and West Bengal states of eastern India, and in the Terai of Nepal. All the Classical Languages are listed in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution. Six languages that enjoy the ‘Classical’ status in India: Tamil (declared in 2004), Sanskrit (2005), Kannada (2008), Telugu (2008), Malayalam (2013), and Odia (2014).

questions.question: Oil India Limited (OIL) is under the administrative structure of:

options.c: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
options.d: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural . Gas

questions.explanation: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas. Oil India Limited (OIL) is a Maharatna company. Headquarter - Noida. Established - 1959. For a company to be categorized as a Maharatna status, It should be listed on an Indian stock exchange and have an average annual turnover of over ₹25,000 crore during the previous three years. India now has Maharatna, Navratna and 62 Miniratna CPSEs.

questions.question: In which year was the National Human Rights Commission established in India?
questions.explanation: 1993. The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) was established on October 12, 1993. Its statute is contained in the Protection of Human Rights Act, 1993, and is in conformity with the Paris Principles, adopted for promoting and protecting human rights. Section (d) of the Protection of Human Rights Act, 1993 defines human rights as rights relating to life, liberty, equality and dignity of the individual, guaranteed by the Constitution. Q.2029. Annamacharya was a Telugu musician, composer, and a Hindu saint. The Sri Venkateswara Swami Temple is a Hindu temple situated in the hills of Tirumala at Tirupati in Andhra Pradesh. Q.2030. Which is the only surviving specimen of the ancient Sanskrit theatre recognised by UNESCO as a Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (4th shift) (a) Bhavai (b) Kutiyattam (c) Kathakali (d) Yakshagana Sol.2030.(b) Kutiyattam. It blends Sanskrit classicism with Kerala's local traditions, featuring expressive eye movements (neta abhinaya) and gestures (hasta abhinaya). Traditionally, it is performed in Kuttampalams, theaters found in Hindu temples. Q.2031. The UIDAI is under the jurisdiction of which of the following ministries? SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (b) Ministry of Home Affairs (c) Ministry of Education (d) Ministry of Finance Sol.2031.(a) Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology. Aadhaar card is a 12-digit unique identification number issued by the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) to every individual resident of India. It serves as proof of identity, which is linked to the individual's biometric and demographic information. The Aadhaar programme was launched in 2009 by the UIDAI with the goal of providing a unique and verifiable identity for every resident of India. Q.2032. Which of the following statements is/are correct? I- Radio broadcasting started in India in 1923 by the Radio Club of Bombay. II- All India Radio came into being in 1936. III - In 1976, TV was delinked from All India Radio (AIR) and got a separate identity as Door darshan (DD). SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (2nd shift) (a) I, II and III are correct (b) Both I and II are correct. (c) Both II and III are correct. (d) Only III is correct. Sol.2032.(a) I, II and III are correct. Radio broadcasting was changed to All India Radio (AIR) in and to Akashwani in 1957. AIR (Akashvani) is India's national public radio broadcaster. It was owned by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting. AIR originated programming in 23 languages and 179 dialects.

questions.question: Who was the Indian Buddhist monk who is credited with the development of many ancient martial art forms in the 5th century?
questions.explanation: Bodhidharma. He was a semi-legendary Buddhist monk who lived during the 5th or 6th century CE. In Indian philosophy, he is commonly considered the founder of Chan Buddhism in China. It was later known as Zen in Japan. Bodhidharma is also credited with founding the famous Shaolin school of Chinese martial arts. He is known as a Tripitaka Dharma Master.

questions.question: In which of the following regions of India is the Mundari language spoken?
questions.explanation: Chota-Nagpur plateau. This plateau covers parts of Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, and West Bengal. Mundari is a Munda language, belonging to the Austroasiatic language family. Chhota Nagpur plateau is called the “Heart of industrial India” because it is rich in minerals and power fuels. The highest mountain peak of Chota Nagpur Plateau is Parasnath.

questions.question: Which is an advanced weather satellite of India configured with improved imaging system and atmospheric sounder ?
questions.explanation: INSAT - 3D: Launched - 2013; Launch Vehicle - Ariane-5 VA-214. Important Satellites: SARAL (2013): Climate & Environment, Earth Observation. RISAT-1 (2012): Earth Observation. RISAT-2 (2009): Earth Observation. Bhaskara-I (1979): Earth Observation, Experimental. GSAT-7A (2018): Communication. Rohini Satellite RS-D1 (1981): Earth Observation.

questions.question: Rajasthani architecture is also known as:
questions.explanation: Maru-Gurjara architecture. This style of architecture evolved in the region of Rajasthan and Gujarat, blending regional traditions with elements of Hindu, Jain, and Mughal architecture. The term "Maru" refers to the desert region (Marwar) of Rajasthan, and "Gurjara" refers to the region of Gujarat, highlighting the cultural influence from both areas.

questions.question: Sashastra Seema Bal is the lead intelligence unit for the_________and Bhutan borders and the coordinating agency for national security activities
questions.explanation: Nepal. Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) was established as the Special Service Bureau in May 1963. Headquarter - New Delhi. Motto - Service, Security and Brotherhood. The Border Security Force (BSF) is responsible for the Bangladesh and Pakistan borders, while the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) oversees the border with China. Q.2038. Which geostationary weather satellite launched by the European Space Agency in 1977 that provides weather imaging of Earth at both visible light and infrared wavelengths? Higher Secondary 26/06/2024 (Shift - 2) (a) Himawari (b) Meteosat (c) QuikSCAT (d) Landsat Sol.2038.(b) Meteosat - The first European geostationary weather satellite, launched in November 1977 by the European Space Agency (ESA). Himawari is a Japanese weather satellite series. QuikSCAT was a NASA satellite that measured ocean winds. Landsat is a series of Earth observation satellites focused on land use, geology, and natural resources, not specifically weather imaging. Q.2039. ________ is a mode of communication in itself, and it also regulates the use of other means of communication. Graduate Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 3) (a) Television (b) Phone (c) Satellite (d) Radio Sol.2039.(c) Satellite. On the basis of configuration and purposes, satellite systems in India can be grouped into two: Indian National Satellite System (INSAT, established in 1983) and Indian Remote Sensing Satellite System (IRS, established in 1988). A communication satellite is an artificial satellite that amplifies and relays radio signals between a transmitter and receiver on Earth. Notable communication satellites: GSAT-31; GSAT-7A; GSAT-11; EDUSAT. Q.2040. Who among the following designed the India Gate ? SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (3rd Shift) (a) Lord Wavell (b) Lord Dalhousie (c) Edwin Lutyens (d) John Nash Sol.2040.(c) Edwin Lutyens. India Gate was constructed in 1931. The India Gate is a war memorial located astride the Kartavya path (formerly Raj path) on the eastern edge of the ‘ceremonial axis’ of New Delhi.

questions.question: The Rajgir Zoo is located in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: Bihar. Zoos in India : Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens (Karnataka), Nandankanan Zoological Park (Odisha), Rajiv Gandhi Zoological Park (Maharashtra). Q.2042. What was the style of architecture used in Laxmi Vilas Palace of Vadodara, Gujarat ? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 2) (a) Indo-Islamic (b) Hindu Temple (c) Indo-Saracenic (d) Mughal Sol.2042.(c) Indo-Saracenic. Laxmi Vilas Palace of Vadodara was built by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in 1890.

questions.explanation: Saraswati. Rani-ki-Vav (UNESCO World Heritage Site) - Its construction is attributed to Udayamati (the spouse of the 11th-century Chaulukya king Bhima - 1) in Patan (Gujarat). It is on the new 100 rupee note (coloured Lavender).

questions.question: The famous Sheesh Mahal in Punjab was built by which of the following rulers?
questions.explanation: Maharaja Narinder Singh. Sheesh Mahal - It is located in Patiala (Punjab). Q.2045. How many UNESCO Natural World Heritage sites are there in India? SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Morning) (a) Seven (b) Four (c) Six (d) Five Sol.2045.(a) Seven. UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) World Heritage Convention which was established in 1972.

questions.question: Lomas Rishi cave is situated in which of the following Hills?
questions.explanation: Barabar Hills (Bihar). It was constructed by emperor Ashoka for the use of Ajivaka. Buddhist, Hindu and Jain sculptures are also found there. It includes four caves - Lomas Rishi Caves, Sudama caves, Vishwakarma Caves, and Karan Chaupar caves. The Barabar Hill Caves are the oldest surviving rock-cut caves in India.

People of India speak a large number of languages which are broadly divided into the following four families: Indo-European Family (Arya), Dravidian Family (Dravida), Austric Family (Nishada), and Sino Tibetan Family (Kirata).

questions.question: Who hosted the first meeting of India-Central Asia Summit?

Submarine Launched Ballistic Missiles - Ashwin, Sagarika, K-4 and K-5. Surface -to-surface Missiles - Prithvi I, Prithvi II, Agni (I - V), Dhanush, Prahar and Shaurya (Medium-Range Ballistic Missile). Q.2051. The Electricity Act, - An Act to consolidate the laws relating to generation, transmission, distribution, trading and use of electricity. Q.2053. questions.question: Which among the following is a surface-to-surface missile of India?

questions.question: The S-400 Triumf (Russian for Triumph) Missile System is _____ missile defence system designed in Russia.

questions.question: “Statue of Equality” has been inaugurated in Hyderabad in the memory of ________ .

Ambedkar International Airport (Nagpur, Maharashtra).

questions.question: When was the None of the Above (NOTA) ballot option first implemented in India?

questions.question: The railway system connecting St - Petersburg to Vladivostok is _________.

questions.question: At present, the Grand Trunk Road extends from___________ in India.

Visakhapatnam - City of Destiny,. Jaipur - Pink City. Surat - Silk City of India, Diamond City of India. Akola - Cotton City of India. Coorg (Karnataka) - Scotland of India.

Doordarshan got a separate identity in 1976. SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Morning) (a) Only C (b) Both A and B (c) Both A and C (d) Both B and C Sol.2064.(d) Both B and C. questions.question: Air transport was launched in India in the year 1911 between which two places?
